string.text:
Messages: from: Zhukov
 to: Lebedev
 subject: Foundling after the blowout
 location: 51.241463, 30.294957
 message: Today at 21:20 a group of scientists was discovered. Judging by the tags, Yakovlev and company. All dead, except the guide (unconscious). Could not identify the guide. Bulakhtin, Sychevnik and Avas are transporting the body to base. No other incidents detected. Mutant population unchanged.

from: Zaitsev
 to: Kalancha
 subject: Data for August 7
 location: 51.230269,30.290165
 message: As usual, Mikhail, sending you the daily statistics. Please ask Gleb to throw us a couple of fuses for the sensors. Today the last spare set burned out. And let him finally negotiate with Sakharov about normal filters. He's been promising for two months already.

from: Ibragimov
 to: Kalancha
 subject: Test results for anomalous protection preparations
 location: 51.21683,30.309134
 message: Three out of five test subjects from group A survived the so-called blowout without visible damage. Group B has vision dysfunction, partial destruction of skin cover. Group C disappeared. We ourselves don't understand what happened. Detailed report in the attached file. Copy carried by stalker Bubble. Mikhail, don't give him vodka this time! And forbid him from hanging around the base. Let him take what's needed from the list and get back.

from: Ibragimov
 to: Mironov
 subject: How much longer?
 location: 51.21683,30.309134
 message: Miron, where are the filters? Zaitsev's been chewing my ear off already.

from: Mironov
 to: Ibragimov
 subject: Re: How much longer?
 message: Arthur, don't bug me, you know how many of you freeloaders are hanging on me? And everyone always needs something. You'll get your filters, God willing the helicopter makes it to the bunker. Sakharov, by the way, was asking if you found him a specimen of something or other?

from: Lebedev
 to: Kalancha
 subject: empty
 message: Mikhail, come see me, urgent. We have an emergency.

from: Lebedev (former military)
 to:group: military_lider
 subject: Threat analysis from western direction
 location: 51.203474, 30.331850
 message: Conducted operations (visual observation, radio monitoring, stalker network scanning) indicate that army units under Major Haletsky have practically expelled stalkers from Cordon. Military control of the area will reduce the number of unwelcome visitors. Probability that military will advance on Swamp on their own initiative is extremely low. Trofimov's group retains Bykov and Leontiev. The rest are transferred to population control group.

from: Novikov
 to: Lebedev
 subject: Network breach
 message: Artyom Petrovich, yesterday someone tried to hack us. Signal probably came from the north. Could not determine source. I suggest strengthening security measures. Specifically switching from RSA to QKD encryption. Take the onboard computer offline.

from: Bulakhtin
 to: Lebedev
 subject: Guide
 messaqe: The unknown person never regained consciousness, but from fragments of his delirium it appears that Yakovlev's group was conducting research on a space-time anomaly, the peculiarity of which is human teleportation. Something similar is observed in the area of the Fisher's village, where several people mysteriously disappeared.

from: Zaitsev
 to: Kalancha
 subject: Data for August 7
 location: 51.230269,30.290165
 message: As usual, Mikhail, sending you the daily statistics. Please ask Gleb to throw us a couple of fuses for the sensors. Today the last spare set burned out. And let him finally negotiate with Sakharov about normal filters. He's been promising for two months already.
To Swamp
To the Gut
ATP "Zavety Ilyicha"
To ATP "Zavety Ilyicha"
To Forgotten Village
To Red Forest
To Limansk
To Foggy Thicket
Quiet Grove
To Quiet Grove
To Sanatorium
To Tesla Zone
To Tesla Bunker
To Catacombs
To Digger's Underground
Entrance to laboratory X-18
To underground laboratory
To laboratory X-16
To laboratory X-18
To laboratory X-12
To Sarcophagus
To laboratory X6
To laboratory X8
To laboratory X10
Slow down there, buddy, put away that gun...
What, secret facility?
Secret or not secret, don't wave your piece around for nothing. A respected man lives here. Does good for all stalkers...
Santa Claus or something?
You could say that... Mikhalych! He knows and can do a lot. Who are you anyway? What brings you here?
They call me Marked One, heard of me maybe?
Marked One? No, haven't heard... I'm Vovan! Some call me Hammer, 'cause I hit twice - second time on the coffin lid!
I heard that somewhere before... Also - "Drop! Push-ups!" Not related, are you?
Got the joke... Funny... Joke like that again and nobody will find you anymore...
Had our laugh... Open up, I need to see your Santa Claus.
Come in, Marked One...
Night time... Come in the morning.
Is that you, buddy? What do you want?
To see Mikhalych, got business with him...
I'm just dropping by to admire you.
If it's business, come in.
Wha-a-at!? What if something hits you by accident? Huh? Joker...
Why are you running back and forth... Settle down.
Hey, Marked One, time to wrap it up.
What's with the sudden change?
Night time... Time to rest...
Well I'll be...
Greetings, kozak. Haven't seen you 'round before... Newbie?
Don't think so... Can't remember exactly, but I'm surviving so far.
How's that - "can't remember"? Ah! That's what Sidor was talkin' about? You're that... Marked One, or whatever they call you?
Yes, that's me. I'm looking for a way to get my memory back.

That's the thing. Without memory, you ain't a man, just a bucket with a hole... But a remedy might be found. I told my friend there's an interesting construction not far from here, some kind of installation... And people said it helps with that... with amnesia.
Amnesia?.. interesting. And where is this installation?
For amnesia, yes... And not too far... Ahem...
I sense I won't hear this for free?

See, smart guy - you guessed! This is information, and information is money. Here's the deal: you help me with one business, and I'll tell you everything like you're family - with all the details. Deal?
So, made up your mind? Shall we do business?
First tell me the details... of the business.

Oh, now that's business talk. So listen here... There's this stalker, they call him Sparrow. Flies here and there... very fast. So he let slip once that he has this potion that keeps him from getting tired. Something like energy drink, only much better. He probably doesn't know you, so try asking our little sparrow - what's he drinking? This ain't just for me, this would help all stalkers.
And where am I supposed to look for him? Run around the whole Zone?
Tsk tsk. I thought you were experienced. In Bar there's a guy, Docent, he can find anyone for you.
Deal.
Maybe later.
Well, good man! Made the old guy happy.
Well, suit yourself... if you want to walk around with an empty skull, then walk around.
So what about our business?
Mikhalych, you should open the door.
Why were you banging so hard! The lock jammed.
What's wrong with you, old man! I didn't even touch your door with a finger.
Oh, can't even joke around anymore... Go on, kozak.
Sidrych! How do I open the door?
Same way you closed it!
What's wrong with you, old man! I didn't even touch your door with a finger...
Can't even joke around... Go on then.
Greetings, shake hands? They call me Sparrow. And what's your name?
I'm Marked One, call me that for now.
Marked One, so Marked One. One more acquaintance. If you feel like chatting, come by, we'll have a talk.
Hey there, Marked One, what brings you here?
Sparrow
Can you tell me about known stalkers?
I can tell you, but you know that's mainly how I earn my daily bread and treatment for my nerves... So... Generally speaking, pour!
More? Get out a bottle, maybe I'll remember someone else...
Alright... Well! Let's drink...
No, I'll pass for now... Going into the Zone...
Ah! That went down smooth!
Interesting, who else do you know about?
Alright, see you later...
Information about stalkers
Hi! Don't know how to get to the Base?
Why wouldn't I know, I know.
Can you show me the way?
Can't show you. But I can guide you there, if you please. I'll blindfold you and lead you. Agree?
Of course, let's go.
Hi! Can I get out of here?
You can... I'll lead you out from the Base.
Well then let's go. I need to leave anyway.
You know the rules, I hope? Blindfold yourself and let's go.
Oh, these rules.
Well-well, hello there, boy. Who, from where, where to?
I'm Marked One. Haven't heard?
Rumors rarely reach us, we live too isolated. Call me Pakhom, though it's not on my passport, but that's how it goes.
Pakhom, then. You trade here?

Not really, actually. I manage some equipment and gear. I was a supply manager at our research institute, so Ivan Sergeich suggested I come along with him here, to the Zone... I make sure we have everything for life here, but also that nothing extra goes to waste.
So, you won't help with anything?
Why not. Sergeich says, if stalkers help us, then we should help them too. So, we can exchange some useful things for Zone "gifts".
Exchange... What about selling?

Boy, this ain't a shop! What do you mean sell? For what money? You got currency? Hide it away, might be someone crazy sees it - decides to grab it for free. And I don't need that kind of trouble. I got small stuff here, food, some medicine. Sergeich has interest in all kinds of mutants, so we exchange their parts for what we have. Well, artifacts too will do, gotta pay for our expedition somehow... But no money! No-no.
And Sergeich, is he your boss?

In scientific matters Professor Grigorovich, Ivan Sergeevich, is the head. He came up with the idea to study all kinds of mutants right in the Zone. Got funding, some equipment, attracted young graduate students... And for security and order Demian keeps watch.
Got it. Alright, see you later.
Marked One, is that you? What do you want?
Came to see what you have for trade.
Just wanted to chat about life.
Looking costs nothing. Everything's in front of you.
We can chat. I'm not in a hurry, and you don't seem to be either.
Ah... it's you. What do you need?
Pakhom, I talked with Ivan Sergeevich about papers. He advised me to come to you. Says you're in the know.
Good man Sergeich, just not of this world... Thinks too much about these monsters, this and that... What did he tell you?
He said he gave some notes to the guide who brought you here. Says you talked with him more.

Yes, had to. They called him Ghost, strange guy... Nothing specific, but I didn't like him. Always some secrets, sudden disappearances. When he left for good, I think it became somehow calmer. He went north of the Zone, but left the notes here, in Swamp. Didn't take them with him, I'm telling you for sure. In his last days he let slip that he dumped the junk in the old tunnel at Tuzla. Hunters said it's somewhere near the old railway bridge, north of the swamps.
North, then? Need to pay a visit.
Pakhom, don't you take guns for trade?

What would I need them for? Newbies, who could be traded them for something useful, practically never come. Those stalkers who sometimes make it to us already have decent weapons and don't need the worn-out junk brought from the Zone.
Hm, where to put all this iron then?
Offer them to Sylvester, our cook... He's a stalker himself, and can transfer some dough, well your virtual ones, to an account. Won't give much, of course, but still...
Sylvester? Alright, I'll ask him...
I was told you upgrade armor here?
Upgrade? Ah!.. That's temporary... Our brainiacs got to some properties in mutants, well and...
Temporary? So what needs to be done?
Well yes, several days, as I heard. You go talk with Demian, he seems to have coordinated this issue with Ivan Sergeich. He'll tell you the details...
Demian? What about payment?
Yes, talk to him... I don't stick my nose in this business. It's none of my concern...
I'll go see him, what are you getting worked up about.
What's this - you trading three-liter jars?
Well this isn't ordinary glass, some kind of special crystal... Ivan Sergeich specially ordered it from Sweden. This glass withstands the effects of the "Fruit Punch" acid anomaly!
Wow! And why do you need "Fruit Punch" in jars?

Don't you know? This substance preserves flesh! So we use "Fruit Punch" from jars to preserve monsters for study... Well and some westerners pay good money for the opportunity to research this anomaly in laboratory conditions. So, when possible, we ship full jars overseas, and we get the needed equipment... That's how it works.
Maybe I should take a couple jars with me?
Your choice...
What brings you to our swamp?
Looking for... Myself...

Cool, we haven't had those yet... Everyone tries to find riches, answers to Zone mysteries, wish fulfillment... Nobody looks for themselves. Though, maybe that's wrong. I'm Sylvester, I feed people here. This job is just right for me - quiet, peaceful, no need to shoot... Rest for the soul. What should I call you?
Marked One for now, and then... we'll see.
Well then, Marked One, if you need anything, come by. You never know...
If I need something, I'll come by... See you...
Come over, let's talk, it's getting gloomy somehow...
How about my request, Marked One?
Haven't had time yet.
About the revolver? I managed to get it...
That sounds meaningful. Don't drag it out...
Always glad to see you. Come over.
They say you really let down one graduate student. Not good, Marked One, not good...
Sylvester, you buying guns?
I take them, building a mini-arsenal here. I think the time will come - very useful. Won't give much money, don't have much need, but still better than throwing away...
That's right! How about ammo?
Little ammo. If you share - I'll be grateful. But generally, if you rummage around the villages and swamps properly, you can find something... There were serious battles here a year ago.
Got it, well alright, I'll give you what I find nearby then...
I need to charge this battery.

No problem. Let me charge it. Often have to. The path through Swamp isn't short, and artifacts sometimes help shorten it. Our scientific workers constantly need mutant parts, so stalkers in exchange for battery charging offer what they managed to get by hunting. A couple dog tails or good boar hooves. I'll take tushkano heads too, four at a time. Or other acceptable creature parts... Got anything?
Got a couple blind dog tails.
Got two good boar hocks here.
Got a good cat tail.
Got a pseudodog tail.
Will a flesh eye work?
Lucky to get a bloodsucker jaw.
Killed a burer, got his appendage.
Ran into a giant, got a piece of him.
Encountered a controller, was lucky to kill it.
Clashed with a chimera, took a claw as a souvenir.
Sea of tushkanos here, got their heads...
That'll work. Here, take this already charged battery. Come by if you need anything.
Don't have mutant parts, maybe money after all?
What do we need those papers for? Sorry, friend, can't help you then.
Yeah, too bad. Well see you, mutant lovers...
I need to charge this battery.
No problem. Let me charge it. We don't mind...
You, Marked One, come in the evening, or better at night. During the day the load on the network is already high.
Here, take it.
Got it.
Well and you take this already charged battery. Come by if you need anything.
Hm... Alright, no need...
Thanks. Well see you, brainiacs...
I need to charge this battery.
No problem, if you got a bottle. If no bottle - then problem...
That's it, shop's closed. Lukash's orders.
Such matters can't be solved without a bottle, but... Cook put in a good word for you, so you just leave me this battery, I give you mine, already charged.
Here, take it, just don't drink it all at once.
Hm... Really - a problem.
Excellent. Take it.
Don't worry, I do this thing even faster! And what's to do here? You leave me this battery, I give you mine, already charged. Such magic...
Voil…! Came with empty, left with full.
You're quite the magician...
Why's that?

You not in the know? After turning off the Brain Scorcher people rushed north. Everyone gone crazy. Cap left the barrier, they say went to Pripyat itself. Cook ran off to Radar, now no one to drink with. Lots of people left. Lukash is furious. Gathering a team from the old guard. Preparing, food there, medicine, repair kits, fuel for generators, and other junk. So the base has strict economy mode, considering current situation. Our suppliers got stuck somehow. Waiting... So sorry, no magic tricks.
Got it, I'll go.
Marked One, you drop by. Maybe the situation will change.
What do you want, stalker? Who are you?
Just looking around... They call me Marked One.
What's to look at here... Do you understand about biopsy?
Mmmm... No... What's that?
Well... like removal from a living organism of tissues, cells... for study.
You suggesting to kill someone and cut off their head? Did you mix something up?!
I meant monster body parts, we need them for research.
Ah-h-h... you should have said that right away. I manage with monsters so far, cut off tails, hooves and other stuff easily. Gotta live somehow, have to. Can bring some.
That's great. No need right now, but later, when they deliver the necessary equipment, can I count on you?
If I'm still alive... Is it possible to somehow remove and study the cells responsible for memory?
There are no such cells. Generally, the question of what exactly in the central nervous system is responsible for memory still remains open in the scientific world.
What if we try to study what's responsible for memory there... well at least on me. I don't mind, as long as it helps.
I understand your enthusiasm, but this isn't serious. Listen, don't interfere, my head's already swelling.
Marked One? Want to help?
I want to, but can't right now... I need someone to help me. Don't you know, is there such a doctor who can restore memory? Who deals with this... well... what kind of doctor ...ologist?
Memory? Mmm... maybe a psychiatrist? They work with consciousness and memory disorders.
No... I definitely don't need a psychiatrist... forget it.
Marked One, wanted something?
What do you want, stalker? Who are you?
Just looking around. They call me Marked One.
What's to look at here? Don't interfere, Marked One! My head's already swelling.
Alright, calm down...
Marked One? Healthy. What do you need again?
Nothing. Just passing by.
Ah, Marked One! Showed up, then? Ivan Sergeevich sent me a message over the network that we need to read the psycho-matrix of your consciousness. How did you manage to convince him?
If you add material motivation to persuasion, you can't imagine what people sometimes become ready for.
Speaking of material motivation. The professor first ordered me to accept some biological samples from you. Unusual find, as I understand?
Yeah. Here, take it. Ugh, what nastiness!
Uh... yes, only I don't have it with me - left it out so the backpack wouldn't stink. Wait a bit, I'll bring it soon.

Yeah... Alright, the professor gave permission for the procedure. So listen carefully. See the scanning device to the right of the door? Take off all your things, put them in your backpack or wherever you want. Then sit right under the stand with the emitter, facing me, and sit motionless like that for half a minute. I'll control everything from the tablet. When I put it away, you can get up and dress. Everything clear?
What's not to understand? I'm ready.
Then let's not waste time. I still have a pile of work today.
As if I'm the only one loafing around here...
Marked One, don't dawdle. We already discussed everything. Take off your junk and get under the emitter.
Yes-yes, right now...
How are you, everything normal? Some people after the procedure can have dizziness, spatial disorientation, drowsiness and... a number of other side effects.
Thanks for warning me in advance...

Come on, what's with you? Like if I told you right away, you would have refused the scanning. Here, drink some water - you'll feel better.\nAnd on this flash drive are recorded the obtained results. Don't know though why you need them, since only a specialist can understand them.
That's not your concern anymore. I'll find someone to show them to. See you... Doctor Mengele.
Marked One, if you don't have anything urgent, please don't distract me. I'm very busy.
Whatever you say. Just passing by...
Well-well... New face? Well, come in, let's talk.
Good afternoon, I'm Marked One.
I'm Demian, keep order here. Want something?
I heard there used to be a stalker group base here?

Yes, about a year ago Clear Sky members lived here. What exactly they were doing, I don't know, but probably like everyone else - trying to profit from various wonders... Why do you need to know about them?
I lost my memory, don't remember who I am or where I'm from... There's one thread that, if I pull it, might help me pull myself out from inside.
What kind of thread?
When I woke up, I had a PDA with me that mentioned Strelok. And it seems Clear Sky was interested in Strelok. Maybe some records survived?

Strelok? Yes, I heard about such a stalker. He disappeared, long ago already. Well, about records... We haven't been here long, since the end of winter. Before that no one was here for more than half a year, just... beasts roaming around. So I don't know if any records remained. Generally, I haven't seen anything like that...
Were you here from the beginning?
Ivan Sergeevich found this place, he was here first. He, and one stalker. Only I don't remember what the stalker's name was. Talk with Ivan Sergeevich himself. Maybe he can help you.
Marked One... Did you want something else?
Nothing really. Thinking what to do and where to go next.

Usually stalkers try to go deeper into the Zone, there's higher chances to find good artifacts. As for "what to do"... If you're fishing for work, there's something for you. But don't expect big profit. You see yourself, the scientific brotherhood isn't rich.
What kind of work? And why are you always poking at the map with your finger, looking for something?
Two groups of scientists went missing. One left several days ago with a guide to the north of the swamps, toward Tuzla. Quite some time has passed, no news.
Yeah, the Zone. Easy to disappear here. What kind of guide was with them?

Frol Trickster, experienced stalker. He knows these places well. Couldn't have gotten lost. There's an old fishing village there where our people often set up camp. If you're in the area, take a look. I feel something happened to them.
If I'm in those parts, I'll take a look. What about the second group?

These disappeared earlier in the central part of the swamps. Equipment detected a fifth-class anomalous signature in the area of Burnt Village, whatever that means... Generally, we sent several people to check. There are a couple reliable guides we regularly work with, but as bad luck would have it, none of them agreed to go on this expedition. Had to bring in people from outside. One army guy provided several soldiers for security. In the end they all vanished into thin air. Don't respond to contact, can't track their equipment by radio channel. Honestly, almost no hope left they'll be found alive...
Bad news. I somehow thought it wasn't so dangerous on the outskirts of the Zone. What about this army guy? Did you shake him down? Who is he anyway?

There's one guy here. One Captain Kalinin. Commands a combined squad watching over an oil well. They also do refining there. Pakhom mainly deals with them. Throws them some food, alcoholic drinks, in exchange we get fuel, sometimes they provide security for expeditions.\nWe contacted the captain, of course. He swears he also has no information about the missing scientists or his fighters. Meanwhile the bosses already picked Sergeich's brain clean. And he - mine.
Really no traces at all? And nobody saw anything?

I asked the hunters - no traces, they say.\nThinking, maybe announce a reward for information?! This uncertainty is getting to me! Will you try poking around there? Fresh head, unbiased look and all that...
I'm not much of a tracker, but I'll keep your story in mind. We'll see each other again.
Met Ivan Sergeich? He's our head here.
Haven't gotten to him yet.
Marked One, glad to see you.
Marked One, you're only tolerated here for past merits.

Found your botanists who were drowning at the northern fishing village. One of them, Gluzov, asked me to accompany him to a giant's lair, to observe its behavior or something like that. Anyway, they've already returned safe and sound.
Yes, I was informed. Thank you. Eh, should soap these blockheads' necks and send them home... We have enough problems as it is.
Come on now. As I understand it, your Sergeich sent them there, so the guys didn't get into trouble through their own stupidity. Besides, they went with an experienced guide.

Experienced... He was damn lucky to stay alive. And lucky that a Duty squad was patrolling that area, and their leader agreed to help carry unconscious Frol to our camp.\nHowever, everything ended well and that's the main thing. I warned that I couldn't give a good reward, but still, rummaging through Sylvester's stores, I managed to find a decent automatic. Some junkie traded it to him yesterday for half a liter. A bit banged up, but quite fixable. Here you go.
Well... not so beaten up. Could have been worse. Thanks.
I learned something about your scientists. The ones who disappeared in the center of the swamps.
Really?! I had already given up hope. Where are they? What happened to them?

Don't know where, and what happened to them is also unclear. I met those soldiers who were guarding them. They're talking nonsense, about hell, apocalypse. As if those botanists got sucked into a bubble. There's one like that, at Burnt Village. The scientists apparently conducted an experiment, got close to that bubble, turned something on... and disappeared. The soldiers stood aside, they only got their brains rattled. I've heard about "Bungees" before. Maybe those scientists got thrown to the other end of the Zone?
And who up THERE would believe this? They, in their capital offices, have no idea what kind of devilry happens here sometimes. Maybe the soldiers are lying, maybe everything's much simpler?
Doesn't look like they're lying. They're scared themselves, sitting in a basement at Forgotten Village, shaking with fear. You can go and ask them yourself.
Maybe it's true... Here, for your efforts.
About the devilry - you were right.
Marked One, what are you talking about?
I found the bodies... at Burnt Village, whole, not even touched by monsters. In scientific suits. Looks like they're exactly the ones who... disappeared.
You're joking?! How's that... I went through everything there with a fine-tooth comb, didn't find a single clue.
That's the thing. They weren't there before, I looked myself. But today... They had papers on them. Look for yourself, there are some surnames here. Yours?
Maybe not yours...

Yes, ours, from those... But how? Where did they come from? We already reported up that they fell into an anomaly, and their white bones were scattered across the entire Zone. Everything had just settled down... And now what, how to explain? Again commissions, investigations, reviews... Nobody needs this anymore.
You asking me? Your bosses - you deal with them.
So maybe... throw them into an anomaly, and that's the end of it?
As our brainiacs like to say - a dilemma...

Are you serious?! This... would... really solve the problem. True, can't trust our people with such a thing. Questions would start immediately. Maybe you? I have one nice artifact - "Mica". Do the job - it's yours.
I was joking. Solve your own problems.
I'll see what can be done.
I was joking too. Let's laugh together.
It would be better for everyone... Just don't take too long, what if someone finds them first.
No more of your dead people, they fell into an anomaly. The Zone took them.
Nobody saw?
No, seems not... Everything's clean. What were you offering?
Here's the artifact. I used it though... just a little bit.
It's not that great.
About armor upgrade.
No problem, if you have spare artifacts.
Wait, when the installations are free, then we'll talk.
Got a couple simple artifacts. Can you soak the suit?
Got second level ones. Enough to soak the suit?
I wanted to clarify, just in case.
We'll do it. You walk around for a couple hours. I'll signal when everything's ready.
Then I'll take a walk.
Then I'll wait.
You said everything's ready?

Yes, the equipment worked without failures, the material structure accepted the anomalous quarks. So... See how long the effect lasts. But our research almost guarantees three days, maybe more. Here you go.

Ready... No, not quite. Generally, as a result of some malfunction the material structure was completely destabilized. Simply put - evaporated. Sorry, the methodology is too unrefined. Here's the... result.
Thanks. Three days guarantee, then. Can it be irradiated again?
Too bad. But can it be repeated?
Yes, absolutely possible. Bring more if you have spare artifacts.
No problem, if you have spare artifacts.
I see you're armed? Maybe help defend this little island?
Defend? From whom? Even a mouse couldn't get through to you guys.

A mouse maybe wouldn't get through, but rabid dogs, boars or other creatures - sometimes they do crawl in. You see yourself, there are almost no real fighters here. Me, Demian... and a couple stalkers.
I can't stay for now, I need to find out something first.
If you can't, then so be it. If you have spare ammo - bring it to Sylvester.
Deal.
Marked One, maybe you'll change your mind after all? There's practically no risk, and money drips into the account.
Money doesn't interest me.
What then?
What, what... artifacts, medicine.
Artifacts?! That's quite ambitious.
I feel there'll be real work soon.
Yeah right, he feels it.
When's your "soon" gonna be?

Already arrived, only this work ain't for weaklings. New mutants showed up in Swamp. What if they break through to base? Experienced stalkers told they saw such monsters only far north, closer to Zone center. They call them fractures. Very rare and hardy creatures. Usually come in packs, up to 10 individuals. With a leader at the head. Very hard to kill, but possible.
Fractures?! Haven't heard of those. What about local hunters? Look how many are hanging around here. They could gather a team and restore order.
Fractures? Had to deal with them. Even picked out a spleen from one, had to... What about local hunters? Look how many are hanging around here. They could gather a team and restore order.
They'd rather chase dogs and tushkanos. Sometimes, of course, they gather courage and go after boars or flesh, then sit for a week, wagging tongues, exchanging impressions. Damn them...
You suggesting I go after fractures?

If you agree, you'll have respect from all of us. Sorry, no artifacts, but there's information on how to cook a good artifact from various junk - "Crystal Thorn". Or I'll throw in local medicine. This ain't Sidorovich's lousy medkits.
Where to look for them? Swamp is big.
Won't go alone. Let the hunters deal with it.
Saw them in northern part of swamps, near the railway halt. I sent the mark to your PDA. Main thing is destroy the leader, the rest will scatter on their own. So they say.
I told you - work's not for weaklings.
What do you say, Marked One. Seen the new monsters?
Haven't gotten there yet.
Not only saw them, even said hello. They don't have hands, but long claws. They can reach you even from Pakhom's storage roof. Half a dozen individuals there were. But I managed.
Consider you've earned honor and respect of our community.
You might as well give me a diploma... Where's the medicine?
You might as well give me a pennant... Where's the recipe?
Ah, right now. Medkits, bandages, anti-rads.
Ah, right now, I'll send it to your PDA.
Marked One, always glad to see you.
Let me pass... weakling.
Guard from Swamp suggested clearing the area of new monsters - fractures. Offers as reward a recipe for "Crystal Thorn" artifact or medicine
Sh-h-h! Quiet! Hear that - someone's sneaking around?!
Seems quiet...
No, they're always trying to get through! But you won't fool me! Oh! And who are you?
I'm Marked One, a stalker...
Marked One! Hide! They'll come for you! And then you won't have a single chance!
What nonsense! Who?
Maybe you're one of them?... Got in here... I won't give in to you!
Damn it!
YOU again! I don't have it! I lost it!
What did you lose? Calm down... I'll help...
What do you mean what! IT! The MONOLITH sprout... It told me: protect me...
Who talked to you? Don't shake... Tell me properly...
You won't understand... You're like all the others... Blind...
Oh! I'll go crazy with you soon myself... I don't understand anything.
You have the "mark"! So YOU too! One of them!
What "mark"? What are you talking about?
Later, they'll tell you themselves... Leave me alone, Marked One...
A-a-a-ah! Get away!!!
Hello, young man. I see life has been harsh to you.
Hello... Unfortunately, or maybe fortunately, I don't remember all my life. Trying to find at least some thread from the past.
Judging by the scars on your face, you've had a hard life... How should I address you?
For now my name is Marked One.
Well, Marked One, I hope you manage to recover all your memories. Can I help you with anything?
I'd like that... You are, I believe, a biologist. Maybe you could explain to me why a person loses memory and how he can get it back?

Complex question... Nobody really can properly explain yet how and where memory recording happens. And various memory phenomena like "super memory" or conversely - partial amnesia with complete consciousness preservation, are even harder to explain. There are, of course, theories and established opinions, but you're interested in specifics, namely your case, as I understand?
Yes.
That's exactly specifically how it was and what to do in your case, I can't tell you anything, and general reasoning won't help.
Well, clear... that nothing about memory is clear... even to you. Another question: as far as I heard, there used to be a secret stalker group base here?

It was a project to study Zone properties. Led by one Professor Lebedev. I learned about this place from him. He and his assistants apparently died... There was some desperate attempt to break through to the very heart of the Zone. Wouldn't want to speak ill of a fellow scientist, but such an adventure couldn't have succeeded... Yes... Well, colleague Sakharov takes a more cautious position, and I tend to approve of it.
Sorry to bother you, but are there any records left from previous inhabitants?

Records? Er, there were some papers. But they couldn't be useful to us, we have a somewhat different research direction. We study natural mutations manifesting in Zone conditions that lead to telepathic phenomena! As preliminary research shows, there's some radiation in whose field it's maintained...
Sorry, I... I need to go.
Young man... Marked One? Yes? How can I be useful to you?
Ivan Sergeevich, where are the records?

Records? What records? Ah! Lebedev's records... I thought it right to give them to my guide. He showed some interest in them, as he said: some information might help stalkers with the problem of finding a safe path to the center...
Where is this guide? And what's his name?

Where? I don't know, he left a couple weeks after we settled. Said he was going north... His name is... Slipped my mind... Phantom? No... Such light eyes... Ask our supply manager, he mainly dealt with him.
I'll ask. And another question: You mentioned Zone center. I've heard this not once. What's so important there that everyone so persistently seeks a way there?

If I had been there, I could answer you. There's a supposition that some super-artifact may be located there - the MONOLITH. There's also indirect data that some people protect this Monolith. From whom or what, unclear. And whether they're people, also unclear. Generally, Zone center is an area shrouded in mysteries, speculation and rumors. And like everything mysterious, it simultaneously attracts and frightens. Obviously, that's why such interest.
Yes... Mysteries, rumors... Would like to know why Strelok wanted to get there. Thank you, Ivan Sergeevich.
Marked One, how are your affairs?
Ivan Sergeevich, I received a letter from your now probably former graduate student, Sergey Gluzov. He asked me to let you read it too.
Really? Curious. Seryozha and I corresponded by email the other day and he didn't mention sending me a message on paper. Let me see.
Here, please. There, on the back side, look...
Wait... where is it?! Sorry, professor, seems I left it somewhere... I'll be right back!

So, what do we have here? Ah, we already discussed this over the network. Apparently the paper letter took a long time. My prot‚g‚ asks to provide you scientific assistance if you need it. Considering our long productive cooperation, I'm gladly ready to personally consult you on any questions and provide access to our research resources. Within reasonable limits, of course. In short, don't hesitate to ask. We'll do what we can.
Thank you, I'll definitely ask.

Ivan Sergeevich, I really need your help. I want you to conduct a scan of my consciousness psi-matrix. Professor Sakharov said the only place in the Zone where this procedure can be done is your camp.
Hm. This is... a very unexpected request. May I ask why you need it?

Long story. And I don't fully understand it myself, honestly. Professor Sakharov wants to conduct an experiment... with my participation. You'd probably better ask him for details yourself. So will you help me?

You see, young man, the scanner's working resource is almost completely exhausted and, properly speaking, it should have been sent for maintenance long ago, if not scrapped, but... Considering that Sergey Gluzov asked for you, I think we can conduct one more procedure. Only I'll have a counter-request for you.\nA few days ago I spoke with my friend who was about to leave the Zone after a three-month shift in the area that stalkers usually call Ivankovsky District Center. And he told me an interesting story...

You see, young man, the scanner's working resource is almost completely exhausted and, properly speaking, it should have been sent for maintenance long ago, if not scrapped, but... I'm ready to meet you halfway if you agree to do us a return favor.\nA few days ago I spoke with my friend who was about to leave the Zone after a three-month shift in the area that stalkers usually call Ivankovsky District Center. And he told me an interesting story...

You know, Ivan Sergeevich, every time I hear about an unprecedented, incredible, most curious story told to someone, then, as a rule, I'm later asked to go to hell and back to check how true that story was. Uh... sorry for interrupting. Please continue.

Ahem... yes, so I'll continue.\nThe scientific expedition camp there is set up practically within city limits and located on a hill from which all surroundings are perfectly visible, including the sports ground at the former school. For some time now a strange creature has begun appearing on it at night. My colleague repeatedly observed it through night vision when standing guard. At first glance, it's an ordinary bloodsucker, but its behavior is completely atypical for this species...
And what's so unusual about its behavior? Does it sing drunk old pop songs and dance naked under the moon?

What? Ah! You're joking. No. It just stands, frozen motionless. And it can remain in this position for hours, usually until dawn. One might assume the creature sleeps or fell into some kind of anabiosis, but there are two substantial objections. Ordinary bloodsuckers always prefer to arrange lairs for sleeping in sheltered, dark and humid places. Most often in basements, abandoned outbuildings or caves, but certainly not under open sky. And the second point - during sleep they almost always activate the camouflaging properties of their skin to avoid being caught off guard by a larger predator or human who accidentally wanders into their lair.

Hm. Indeed, ordinary bloodsuckers don't behave like that. These cunning creatures are always cautious, but here... Don't even know. How can I help? Go observe it personally? And what will that give? I don't understand your affairs at all. Especially since there, in the district center, you have scientific personnel, let them deal with this strange case.

Who has "you"? Our institute has no relation to the group working in Ivankovsky District Center. Apparently you misunderstood me. But even if I had the right to give orders to colleagues there, I have no moral right to send them on such a risky enterprise. You, I assume, know that the research camp in the district center is protected by special installations that repel various evil? Expedition members try not to leave the radius of these installations without extreme necessity. You understand yourself - places there are extremely dangerous.

Well, yes. And therefore you'll have no moral anguish if you contract this job to an outsider, namely me. Yes, yes, I know I'm experienced, prepared, have danger sense and good equipment... and so on. Heard it many times. I'm used to the fact that we stalkers are like expendable material for scientists, no big loss if something happens.
But listen, Marked One, you just listed the most significant arguments that push scientists in such cases to choose stalkers rather than, say, military. Don't you find them convincing?
I do, I do... Just leaves a bad taste, as they say. Alright, tell me specifically what you want me to do?

Thank you for understanding. So, as you've already guessed, I'd like you to observe that strange creature from as close distance as possible. If you're convinced it shows no activity, doesn't react to external stimuli, for example, noise or bright flashlight light, generally poses no danger, then try to approach closely and examine it carefully. I have no idea what might happen and how the creature will react to your approach, so I ask you to be extremely careful and act according to circumstances. The most ideal outcome would be to get some biological tissue sample from this creature, but I don't even dare hope for that, so I'm ready to be satisfied with just a verbal description of what you see. That's essentially it.
Hope it doesn't end with the creature attacking me and having to shoot it. Can't give any guarantees, don't take offense.

Well, reasonable. If it turns out this creature is an ordinary bloodsucker, just with deviant behavior, and it attacks you, then I'd be quite satisfied if you kill it and cut off its tentacles, whatever condition they're in.

Well, reasonable. If it turns out this creature is an ordinary bloodsucker, just with deviant behavior, and it attacks you, then I'd be quite satisfied if you kill it and cut off its tentacles, whatever condition they're in.\nBut in this case I'd like to conduct a series of comparative tests, for which I'll need tissue samples from ordinary bloodsuckers - the same tentacles will do fine. I think three will be enough. Only I earnestly ask you to deliver them in condition suitable for further work, without signs of rot.
Deal. I'll go pack for the trip, and you prepare your machinery.
Had a chance to observe that creature that settled on the sports ground in Ivankovsky District Center...
Excellent news! Tell me quickly what you saw! Did you manage to get something... material?

What's to tell... At first everything was as you described: a bloodsucker stands near the basketball hoop, looks mature, but nothing unusual, just doesn't move, like rooted to the ground. So I started getting closer - zero reaction. Then I approached closely, started examining more carefully, touched it... And it suddenly roared and collapsed to the ground like it was cut down. After a few seconds something like dark haze gathered over the body. When it dispersed, only a strange jaw remained on the ground, like from a bloodsucker but not quite, a bit different. I took it with me as you asked. Oh, here's more: a couple of its kin came running to the death roar, quite ordinary ones. But that's nothing, I'm alive as you see.

Pure mysticism - no other way to put it. Glad you're whole and that you managed to get biological material, we'll have something to work on. Go down to the first floor and give your find to graduate student Gusko. He'll instruct you about the scanning, I'll warn him now.

Pure mysticism - no other way to put it. Glad you're whole and that you managed to get biological material, we'll have something to work on. By the way, you didn't forget about the second part of our agreement? Did you bring tentacles from ordinary bloodsuckers? If yes, then go down to the first floor and give your finds to graduate student Gusko. He'll instruct you about the scanning, I'll warn him now.
I understand, professor. All the best.

Head of the scientific expedition from Swamp asks to observe a strange creature that recently began appearing at night on the sports ground at the former school in Ivankovsky District Center, and tell about what was seen. It would also be highly desirable to get tissue samples from this creature. In return, the scientists will conduct a psi-matrix scan of my consciousness, which should help Professor Sakharov find a way to erase the Monolith psycho-coding imposed on my personality.

In addition to the scientists' request to observe the strange creature in Ivankovsky District Center, I also need to bring them 3 bloodsucker jaws for some comparative tests in "condition suitable for further work". Not too rotten, in other words.
Do you know about anyone?
Well, not without that... Got something to wet the throat? My tongue's dried out... Well, don't keep me waiting... pour...
More? Get out a bottle, pour, maybe I'll remember someone else...
Pour, pour... Like you agreed... Alright, let's go...
Don't have any with me... Talk later...
Well now, words won't get stuck in my throat...
Interesting, who else do you know about?
Well alright, I'm off...
Greetings. Heard about your exploits. Cool, nothing to say.
Not so cool... Why are you running circles?
On duty... Watching our generator so it doesn't stall. Add oil, fuel... Also charging batteries, if needed - bring them over. A few rubles and your battery's like new energizer...
Where do you get fuel?

There are places... In the Gut you can try to pump some. In Swamp there's a small refinery, right on an oil well. And how many old gas stations are left in the Zone. Guys sometimes bring fuel canisters, we thank them accordingly with what we have. True, lately it's been tight. In the Gut, at the gas station, monsters settled. They say they even saw a bloodsucker there. In Swamp the military set up a post at the old refinery. Generally, if there's opportunity, drag some gasoline, we'll reward you. In the Gut, at the gas station, middle pump. Stalkers said you can still get 76-octane gas from there.
How to bring it? In my palms?

I have empty canisters, if needed, take them... Only... You understand, anything could happen... You're gone - canister's gone, and Sidor constantly nags that canisters are unprofitable to haul from the mainland... So preferably leave a deposit, couple thousand rubles.
Alright, I'll think, maybe I can help somehow...
Marked One! What brings you here?
I got some fuel...
Thank you... Choose a present. Got ammo, grenades, food, vodka, medicine...
Need 9x18 ammo.
Need 5.45x39 ammo.
Need 7.62x39 ammo.
Need 12K ammo.
Need VOG-25 grenades.
Could use some food.
Give me vodka!
Need medkits.
Give me anti-rads.
And here's money from us. Not much, of course, but something... Your gasoline will last us a day. So bring more tomorrow.
Yeah, not much... I'll think next time if it's worth getting involved.
Uh... We haven't run out of gas you brought last time. And the small rewards finished. Come back later... Yeah?
Where do I put this stuff now? They'll dump it, and carrying it around... Damn!
Going somewhere, give me a little canister, maybe I'll get lucky with fuel.
Wouldn't want to remind, but the deposit... Couple thousand...
No problem, here...
Screw that, figure it out yourselves...
Yeah, I'll return it... Here's the canister... In Dark Valley, I think, the last pump still works.
I'll figure it out...
Just decided to check on you slackers.
Ah... Well suit yourself...
Need to get water, got any?
Yeah, still some in the washbasin, filled it recently. Got money? For our needs?
Listen, you're getting on my nerves! I said - pay! Got money or not?
Yeah I got it, here's your rubles...
Got a bottle of vodka, will you take it?
Give it! After yesterday can't clear my head... At least I'll fix my health!
Take it! Well what about clean water? You understand - can't clean your peepers with vodka...
Got an energy drink here, take it...
Alright! Give me your energy drink, my mouth's dried out...
What, partied yesterday? Here...
Uh... I need it myself.
Choke on your energy drink! Give me cash...
What a cheapskate...
For money I'd rather use vodka!
That's right... You can fill up, washbasin's in the basement.
In the basement, you say? Well alright...
Go to hell! After yesterday can't stand looking at it, head's splitting, and you...
Well you should fix your health then!..
My battery died...
No problem! Your money, our electricity. I got fully charged ones!
No problem! Your money, our electricity. I got fully charged ones! Like I said: can give a charged one for two dead ones or pay coin!
Our gasoline's running low, only emergency reserve left. Boss ordered to save electricity, so either bring a fuel canister or wait for others to bring some.
Oh, like that! Got you...
What comedians! Joker on joker! Here's the money...
Don't have money! Spent it on repairs...
Where'd I get that much! Can't save up enough money!
Let's do it for two batteries. Here they are.
Not a joker, just a cheerful person. Here's a fully charged one. Safe travels...
Everything's normal. Here's a fully charged one. Safe travels...
Alright, see you...

You should understand - you're a lucky, experienced stalker. Look how much you've collected. These rubles are like paper to you. But there are newbies... They have fewer opportunities, so we don't ask so much from them. Remember yourself - you weren't charged much at first either. Don't think only about yourself.\nBut if it seems like a lot, let's agree like this: you give me two dead batteries - I give you one charged. All fair and square.
Fair and square... I'd say... I'll think about it.
Greetings... What wind brings you? Don't think we know each other?
Hello... Shame we don't know each other, I'm Marked One, heard of me?
Marked One? Don't think I heard... If you have business at the bar, then move along. I'm busy right now.
Marked One?! I heard you helped Bes at Garbage?
Aren't there too many guards, poking gun barrels in your face at every step.
Yes, that happened...

I'm not really a guard, I watch the power. Month ago flew into an anomaly, a "Burner". Almost burned all my guts, now can't run three steps. Made a deal with Barkeep: I ensure uninterrupted generator operation, charge batteries for stalkers, trade clean water by the glass, and he supplies me everything for normal life. Whoever brings gasoline, I pay them.
Bes pulled me out of "Burner" and carried me on his back to Bar. So I owe him my life. Accept this small token of gratitude for your help to him.
Didn't expect that, thanks. How are you? What do you do?

I watch the power. After getting into an anomaly and almost burning all my guts, can't run three steps. Made a deal with Barkeep: I ensure uninterrupted generator operation, charge batteries for stalkers, trade clean water by the glass, and he supplies me everything for normal life. Whoever brings gasoline, I pay them.
I see... Where's the nearest gas station?

In Dark Valley, heard of it. There, at the old gas station, mostly those who are on good terms with the local brotherhood fill up. Need a canister once a day. If you bring one, you can get medicine, various ammo... even grenades available now. So hurry up.
Hi, Marked One! How's life?
I managed to get some gasoline.
Oh! Thank you... What would you like from society? Got ammo, grenades, food, medicine...
Need 9x19 ammo.
Need 5.45x39 ammo.
Need 7.62x39 ammo.
Need 12K ammo.
Need RGD-5 grenades.
Could use some food.
Give me M406 grenades.
Need medkits.
Give me anti-rads.
Well here you go... This gasoline will last us a day. So bring more tomorrow, you're welcome.
Heh, alright, maybe I'll bring more...
Sorry, we don't need fuel right now. We haven't run out of gasoline you brought last time. So bring some later...
Later? Well... We'll see what happens later.
Got any empty canisters?
Actually I do, but better leave a deposit... Three thousand...
Three? Alright, no problem, here...
Three thousand?! I changed my mind...
Don't worry, bring back the canister and I'll return your thousands... Here you go...
Yeah, don't worry, everything will be fine.
Fine, heading to Bar...
Got charged batteries?
Of course I do,

Sorry, tight situation with fuel for generator right now. Nobody's brought gasoline for a while, so temporarily not charging batteries. You'll have to wait, or go to that gas station in Valley yourself.
Damn... I'll think about it.
I'll drop by a bit later.
Alright, agreed, here's an old battery and I'm paying cash.
I'm tight on cash, later...
Everything's fine. Here, take the battery. Don't mind that it's a bit scratched, but fully charged. Come by again if you need anything.
Good. See you.
Can I get some water?
Why not... You can
Alright, money's not much, here...
Hm... For a flask of water? I'd rather fill up from a puddle.
You can fill up. Only I don't recommend drinking this water.
Huntsman
Greetings, wanderer, seeking happiness or running from misfortune?
And health to you. Probably running from happiness.
Is that so? Happens... What should I call you, runaway.
They call me Marked One. Can I ask you something?
Ask away, of course.
What do you do?

Me? Wanted to check on grandpa, he was a forest ranger here in his time. Watched over this reserve and refused to leave. My father, when he was dying, asked me to find out what happened to him. I was just a bit too late, grandpa died not long ago. While I was getting here, I saw all kinds of things and decided to continue grandpa's work - watching over this forest. I make sure too many beasts don't breed, shoot the most violent and fierce ones.
Hm... What do you live on?
I trade my hunting trophies to passing stalkers. I don't need much, a bottle of vodka for warmth, and some ammo in reserve.
Want something else?
Haven't heard about Strelok?

Strelok? I didn't meet him, but people talked about such a guy. All kinds of rumors go around. Some say he's a hero among heroes, others that he was a scumbag. Who to believe? Don't know... One very persistent rumor went around for a while that he, Strelok, was here and hid some very unusual artifact nearby. Eccentrics rushed into the forest. Practically nobody returned. That's probably all I know about Strelok.
Well, I see. Then, farewell.
Eternal wanderer? From good or for good?
Want to acquire some monster parts.
Just dropped by for a visit.
Thanks for dropping by, rest, warm up.\nMaybe you need some beast parts?
Well, I got plenty of that stuff.
Can you be more specific? What exact parts, and for how much.

See for yourself, got tails from ordinary mutts, got pseudodog ones, bloodsucker tentacles, flesh eyes. Not even mentioning boar legs - three bunches for a ruble. Only sometimes they're not first freshness, nowhere to store them. Heh-heh... As for payment - vodka and ammo. Ammo better for shotgun, buckshot there, bullets or canister shot... In short, tell me what you need, and we'll agree on price.
You know my assortment... What else do you need?
Interested in a blind dog tail.
I'll take a pseudodog tail.
Need a boar hoof.
Need a flesh eye.
What will you take for a bloodsucker tentacle?
Mutt's little tail? Two packs of buckshot for one, bottle of vodka - two...
I got buckshot.
Here's a bottle of forty-proof.
I'll probably come back later...
Well, here's this tail, need anything else?
You made me happy... Take a couple... Maybe need something else?
No, nothing else needed.
I'm thinking... Let's take another look.
Pseudodog? Good tails from them are rare and accordingly harder to get... For each tail I'll ask either five packs of buckshot, or three canister shots, or three bottles.
I got buckshot.
I'll pour canister shot.
Here are your bottles.
Ammo is good! Here's this tail, need anything else?
Well, here's this tail, need anything else?
You made me happy... Maybe need something else?

Boar leg? They're heavily hit by radiation... Boars are hard to kill, tough bastards and dangerous. Let's do this: for one hoof you give me three packs of buckshot or two canister shots... Or couple bottles for couple hooves. Tit for tat sort of.
I got buckshot.
Giving canister shot.
Here's a couple forty-proof.
Thanks for buckshot! Here's the hoof, need anything else?
Well, here's the boar leg, need anything else?
You made me happy... Maybe need something else?

There's been few flesh lately, they're tasty - so they get killed as soon as spotted. Their eyes, they say, help with many ailments... Let's do this: for each eye of these pseudo-pigs you give me five packs of canister shot, or three bullets... Or three bottles of "Cossacks".
I got canister shot.
Giving bullets.
Here they are, forty-proof.
Thanks for canister shot! Here's the eye, need anything else?
Well, here's the flesh eye, need anything else?
You made me happy... Maybe need something else?

Bloodsuckers, in my opinion, are the most dangerous creatures in the Zone. While you kill one, you can become dinner for them 10 times yourself. Let's do this: for a tentacle of these monsters you give me 100 canister shots or 50 bullets... Or half a crate of vodka.
I got plenty of canister shot.
Take the bullets.
Here, take the vodka.
Thanks for bullets! Here it is - tentacle, need anything else?
Well, here's the bloodsucker appendage, need anything else?
You made me happy... Maybe need something else?
So what, pal, don't mind your health?
Your pals in the ravine are finishing off a horse... My health is my business...
Chill, bro, I'm with all respect... Our crew set up a den here, so you ain't in charge here. You come to us nice - and we're cool... Get it?
Don't try to intimidate me, what's this all about anyway?
Feisty... Who are you anyway? I see - experienced guy, if you made it this far...
Yeah, experienced... Marked One, if anyone doesn't know...

I get it, can do business with you, Marked One... So, wanna get respect from our bros, show you ain't a cheapskate - give a good artifact to the common fund, a good one, you can keep the crap for yourself... You get it?

Oh! Damn... You're Marked One? That very one? You're the one who helped the bros with that job in the Gut? Well... You're really... Anyway, I'd let you through anyway, but Bold might bust my face for such a thing... Maybe you got some artifact? Give it and pass through. You get it?
Now you'll get it from me... Nine grams in the gut.
Is that so? We-e-ell... Here. Second level artifact.
Got a third level artifact. Take it.
Feel sorry for you, weirdo... Here, take this dummy.
Hm... Alright, got a simple artifact.
What if I don't have artifacts?
Business talk! Go down the road, our guys sit near the bridge... Drop by Bold, let him take a look at you.
You gotta understand. Can't just let you through. That's what I'm posted for. So you turn around then.
Interesting, what kind of Bold is that?
A-a-ah! It's you again, Marked One... Gonna negotiate or what?
Ain't you tired of sitting like a dog on a chain yet?
Listen, let's do this: either you pay, or you get lost.
You better remind me what you wanted?
Seems they speak truth that you got a draft in your head. Artifact no lower than second level and walk around without looking back. Got it?
Seems they speak truth that you got a draft in your head. Any artifact you don't mind, and walk around without looking back. Got it?
Hey there, man! Walk around calmly, since you didn't mind respecting the bros.
So you, judging by your mug, are Marked One?
And you, judging by your boldness, are Bold?
Easy, man, no offense. We ain't measuring dicks here, trying to survive. Well and earn some, of course. You also crawled into this asshole for money, right?
I'm looking for a person, called Strelok.
Strelok? None of my business, of course, but he disappeared long ago. True, his buddy was here not long ago, Ghost...
Why'd you go silent meaningfully? Finish what you started.

Don't rush. You know yourself, slower you go - further you'll be. Ghost - that's one hell of a fruit. Suspicious, secretive, can't get a word out of him. Shady in general. I sent a couple my eagles to tail him. Got curious what he's snooping around for.
What's to snoop around for? Probably just went on a hunt for artifacts.

Like hell! I've seen enough ordinary stalker-workers, can tell in a second who's going for loot and who's already returning with profit. Who can be pressured and who's better not to mess with. But with Ghost my instinct stayed quiet. Only one thing I understood about him - better not get involved with such a guy.
Well, what did your "eagles" manage to find out?
Hold your horses. Help me with one thing, I'll tell you. And even throw in something for your poverty.
Maybe I should tell you to get lost right away? What does your instinct say about that, huh, Bold?

Come on, don't get feisty. I can see the topic interested you. And my business is right here, in this little forest, won't take much time. I'll pay with an unusual artifact. How's that for an argument?
Don't feel like going into this forest unnecessarily. Let me think.
So what, thinker, made up your mind?
Outline your business, just shorter, without all the sayings.
I refuse. I didn't sign up to be your errand boy.

Our crew has one... patron. Gives tips on fat geese who trudge from Limansk this way on a secret path. Then I send guys to intercept. For this service we give back part of the taken loot. Our benefactor is even more secretive than Ghost in terms of conspiracy. Only contacts by shortwave radio, and only his own, left in a pre-prepared stash, always in different forest areas. Sends messages only by telegraph code.
Then get out of here. And I advise looking over your shoulder often.
Some spy detective. His call sign isn't "007" by any chance? You ain't bullshitting me, Bold?
Ha! That's not all. He changes these radios once a week, drops us coordinates of roughly where to look for the stash, and where to leave loot for him.
Let's say I believe this story. What do you need from me? Can't find another stash by tip or what?

Worse. A family of mature bloodsuckers settled in the area. We tried to poke around, barely got away. They slashed Zhora Frozen so bad he came to the next day. And you seem like a pro in this area. Heard you supposedly eat mutants by the pack for breakfast...
He heard... Generally, I take care of the bloodsuckers, you give me the story about Ghost and artifact. Deal?

Almost. Main thing for me is you bring the radio, everything else - your discretion. And one more thing, forgot to warn right away: time's tight, need to manage in half a day. If we miss the next communication session, our partner backs out of the deal.
That's how it always is. Such "details" are always saved for dessert. Ah, to hell with you! Tell me where to look for the stash.
Honestly, was ready for you to back out at the last moment. Let me mark the search area on your PDA map. Got it, where that is?
Yeah. Moving out, since you say time's tight.
In exchange for a story about Ghost and a rare artifact, Bold asks me to bring him a radio from a stash, whose approximate location he marked on the map in my PDA.
Is that you... "hero"? Get moving, don't show yourself.
Don't get agitated, I'm not asking you to put me up here.
Marked One, did you manage to find the radio?
Hold on, gotta scout the situation first.
Managed, managed. Hidden really well, of course. Here you go.
Excellent! So the rumors about you ain't lies...
Let's skip the sentiment. I'm interested in specific information about Ghost and the promised payment.
No problem. Here's the artifact. Knowledgeable wanderers say it's a big rarity. Satisfied?\nBy the way, you interested in PDAs? Can throw in some quantity for currency checks.
Hm... Really, curious specimen. About PDA I'll keep in mind, not the time for it now.
As you wish, our job is to offer.
Our regards with a brush. How's life?
Here you should look for the stash with the radio for Bold
Everything's fine. I came to you on business, to deliver a message from Borov.

Oh really? What, was he embarrassed to send his own bulls this time, decided to send an outside stalker? Anyone else I'd have plucked and beaten down to a child's voice, but you, Marked One, are a decent guy. You come to us with respect, we treat you the same. Borov guessed right with this. Alright, let's talk.

Here's the thing: Borov offers one last time to peacefully resolve your disagreements with him. What specifically it's about, I don't know, but I think you understand. In case of refusal... generally, he guarantees troubles for you personally. You can send an answer through me, or send one of your own, but first option is preferable for Borov. And better not to drag it out, Borov doesn't intend to wait long.
You say he didn't outline the essence of our "disagreements" to you, right?
Well... From his words I concluded that your crew interferes with Borov's "business", and you don't rush to recognize him as boss either.
That's all? Well, well...
Deep in thought, I see. What should I pass back? Maybe come later, or you'll figure it out yourselves, without me?

Yeah, probably what to do with you. You know what, Marked One... Now I'll explain the whole layout to you step by step, you listen, and then we'll decide what's next.\nYou think Borov's just being reckless because we're his competitors? Hell no! About a week ago, as I managed to find out, they tipped him off that a group of scientists with a rare artifact was planning to move from Yantar to Tesla through Limansk, to conduct some experiment. He got busy fast and arranged to trade this artifact for something he really needs, after robbing the eggheads first, of course. The scientists never showed up in Limansk, and now they're demanding penalty from the pig, and threatening to put him on a counter, as I heard. Those people he contacted are serious. So Borov calculated the odds and decided to make us the fall guys. Like we cut the valuable artifact from the scientists, so they returned to their camp at Yantar, nothing left to catch. Generally, Borov sent his torpedoes. Apparently thought he'd load me like a sucker, would work out with half a kick, but he opened his mouth on the wrong guy...

And what are you getting at? Let me guess. Now you'll say that you're actually not involved and the scientists with the artifact never appeared here, right? How do you even know such details about Borov's plans?

What, don't believe? Bold answers for his words! How... Where, where?! I got a loyal guy in Borov's crew, he signaled it. And I'm getting at this: no matter how Borov puffs up, no matter how he inflates his cheeks, we won't go under him. On the other hand, starting fights is also pointless. We need quiet here. It's easier for stalkers to part with some loot than to look for detours in this area. But shooting starts, and they'll quickly figure out that taking this road to Limansk costs more than it's worth.
And therefore...

And therefore I want to smooth things over, appease Borov. Get the same artifact that the scientists were supposed to carry to Tesla, and pass it through you... as a surprise. Along with assurances of eternal friendship and all that. Ha-ha! Nothing, we're not proud. And he'll get his anyway, sooner or later.

Don't get it, why are you so cheerful?! It's a direct loss for you, and anyway... Alright, not my business. Finding an artifact, as I understand, you want to offer to me? What kind of artifact and "what will I get from this besides nothing", as they say in Odessa?
Ever heard of "Snow"? I managed to inquire: finding it in the Zone is practically impossible. Looks like ordinary "Moonlight", but has a special property - creates some anomaly, imagine that?

"Snow"... something familiar. Ah yes, I came across a way to transform... one artifact into this very "Snow". And even about activation there was something. Well, about how to make it create an anomaly.
"Snow"... no, don't recall. Where do you want me to look for it? You just said yourself that finding such in the Zone is almost impossible.
Sweet! So you won't have problems bringing me a couple "Snows"?

Use your brain! You're a stalker, should know: can't find it, make it. Or how do you guys say it? Ah, exactly - cook it. Who trades recipes, tell me? Or figure it out yourself? By the way, Toothy is hanging around Limansk right now at some guys' place. We better not show ourselves in the city now, you understand, or I'd have paid him a visit already. In short, I think you shouldn't have special problems finding out the recipe, cooking and bringing me a couple "Snows". Well, and you gotta figure out how they create anomalies.
What? Just now we were talking about one artifact! Why do you need two? And I still haven't heard anything about reward.

This is... Don't take offense, but I gotta be sure you brought exactly "Snow", not "Moonlight". Who knows, maybe you mixed up... Generally, on one you'll demonstrate how an anomaly is created, the second... The second will be a surprise for Borov. If you handle it, I'll tell the guys to let you pass from Limansk without payment from now on and personally throw in a dozen PDAs. Sound good?

Doesn't work. More hassle and costs than benefit. And anyway... Not sure it makes sense for me to continue playing peacemaker. Might end up between hammer and anvil, so let's you also not take offense. I delivered the message as asked, figure out the rest without me. And about what you told me, I won't say a word to anyone, of course, rest assured.
Seems fine, but on the other hand... I have doubts whether dragging your "surprise" to Borov is such a good idea. Better let me pass the answer in words, as originally intended.

Fine. I often travel through you guys to Limansk, so potential expenses will pay off quickly, and PDAs won't be extra, they can always be traded for something useful. Consider we have a deal. I'll return when I get the artifacts.
Then... Alright, then tell him this: let him go to hell with his offers. Tell him exactly that. And if any of his mutts shows up here again - we'll waste them. Got it all?
Uh... I thought... Got it, as you say.

Bold wants to make a surprise by passing Borov a rare and very important artifact "Snow" as a sign of peaceful intentions. Getting two pieces of said artifact (one for testing by demonstrating hidden properties) is offered to me. In return I get free passage through Bold's gang territory and a dozen PDAs as bonus.

Greetings, Bold! I brought you a couple "Snows", as we agreed. Everything still stands, I hope? Would be unpleasant to learn at the last moment that you changed your mind. I spent quite a bit getting these artifacts, you see...
What, you bullshitting? I ain't some backyard mutt to spout empty words. What's paid for should be swallowed. Well, let's see, show me.
Don't get so worked up. Here...\nOnly what's to look at? You know yourself they look like ordinary "Moonlight". And for "Snow" to create an anomaly, you need to perform certain actions on it.
For real. Then follow me. There's something like an abandoned bunker or whatever they call it in the military nearby... We'll watch your tricks there.
Lead the way.
What now?
Stand over there, by the "Prepare Documents" sign. Then slowly, so I can see everything, start your "sorcery". When you finish, come over, we'll continue talking.

Well, what, everything went exactly as Mitrokha told me. Didn't bullshit me, the bastard. And how you waved your hands, I remembered, can repeat it... I mean, if I needed to... In short, I'm satisfied. Let's go back, we'll finish talking there.
Got it.
Let's go.
Well, how did you like the demonstration? I got the impression you were more interested in how to activate "Snow" than the artifact itself.

You know what they do when something "seems"? I warned you I want to be sure this is the right artifact. That's it, don't fuck with my brain. Give me the second artifact here, now I'll... pack it carefully, attach a note for Borov, seal it good... from the too curious, and pass it to the delivery service. That is, to you, heh-heh.

Listen, Bold, this all looks... painfully suspicious somehow. Don't want to be the fall guy if something happens... I mean, I'm not accusing you of anything, of course, but how about you send someone else to Borov. And we'll renegotiate about the artifact and my payment differently...
Fine, here's the artifact. Deal with it.
So you'd rush to Borov right away and spill your suspicions to him? Won't work. Eh, should've acted more subtly. Nothing personal, as they say, but you signed your own death warrant, Marked One.
Go get some air for twenty minutes. Don't interfere with the creative process.
Ah, you bastard!

Bold wants me to personally deliver a box with the "Snow" artifact, obtained by me, along with a cover note, to Borov in Limansk. It's supposed to be a surprise... Just not sure if it'll be a pleasant one.
So, what about the package for Borov? Did you get it ready?

Yeah. Stuff this box in your backpack. See how it's sealed? Don't you dare open it. Borov will know if it was opened and won't be happy about it, trust me. I scribbled him a couple lines about this in the note. That's it, move out to Limansk. Then come back, I'll settle up as agreed.
Hold on. This ain't sending pickles from grandma to a beloved grandson. Here you need to show thoroughness so the client gets the full meaning... of the message.
I'll be quick. And you meanwhile pick out those PDAs for me that don't look completely dead.
Can't figure out what there is to fuss over so much...
Well, hi there, Bold. I delivered your package to Borov.
Excellent! And how did it go... did he open it in front of you?

Didn't open it. Asked if I knew what was inside. I answered that an artifact and a note. He said he'd look later, without extra eyes. I left, and when I checked on Borov's place later, turned out some unpleasantness happened, because of which his whole crew now dreams of stringing me up on the nearest lamppost. You were probably counting on such an outcome, right? I sensed a trick in this whole story from the beginning...
Everything's fine. Didn't open it. Asked if I knew what was inside. I answered that an artifact and a note. He said he'd look later, without extra eyes. That's all.

Sweet! Even better that way... I mean... Ah, don't worry about it, in short. Job's done. You got respect from my crew. Walk to Limansk and back freely whenever you want. And take the PDAs, you earned them. Go on, see you later.

Come on, don't whine. Did a good deed, consider it. Don't be mad I used you in the dark, but you turned up too conveniently. You got respect from my crew. Walk to Limansk and back freely whenever you want. And take the PDAs, you earned them. Go on, see you later.
Psi-field measurement location
Scanning oscillator installation area
Listen, brainiac, got a little problem.
Well I'm listening, what's the little problem? Can't carry artifacts? Too heavy?

Well yeah, something like that... I helped one Duty guy in Dark Valley. He says that thugs took his PDA, and there's information needed for everyone... Can you check if this PDA's frequency shows up anywhere? Here's the access code.

Not hard for me, but... Ah, alright! I'll help... One minute, let's see... There's a mark, but very weak, apparently batteries are almost dead. Near Research Institute "Agroprom", here by the swamp, see?
You're great... I'll repay you with loot somehow...
Man, help me, I beg you by Christ and God...
Die, you scum!
Oh! Looks like my "client". You pocketed the Duty guy's PDA after their group got taken in the Valley? Think carefully. Say "no" - and I'll just stand aside and watch which beast gets to you first.
No, I didn't take it, cross my heart! Stop! I know who has it... Help me, I'm in real bad shape... I'll tell you everything then, whatever you want!
So be it, I'll believe you. Here's a medkit.
I'm tight on medicine. I'll go look for some. Don't you dare croak while I'm gone!
I warned you? I warned you. Farewell.
Oh... I'll never forget, pal, damn right I will... Thought that was it, Kirpich had run his last. But nah, we'll live some more. And for you, bro, I'll now do whatever you want.
Yeah, yeah. I know the price of such vows of eternal friendship. Alright, not about that. I need the Duty guy's PDA, where did you put it?

My partner's got it, Mikola Hornet. Left me here, the bastard. I'll kill the scumbag! We actually wanted to pass through here quietly along the ravine edge, but it didn't work out. A whole pack of cats came running, immediately tore my side, and my buddy ran for it. Then a pack of dogs showed up from somewhere and the beasts didn't care about me - they fought each other. And soon you showed up.
Your adventures don't worry me much. Get to the point. Where to look for your Hornet?

So this... I'm tellin' ya - he probably rushed to the eggheads at Swamp, not even an hour passed. Probably approaching their camp now, if he didn't get stuck boozing somewhere. And he planned to trade the device for booze with the scientists - that's the whole story. What else to do with this crap? I took it to look, thought there might be games or something, but it asks for password. Tried this way and that, entered passwords and all kinds of crap - won't let me in.
Yeah right... Real genius. Will keep telling me here: an hour to Swamp. Yeah, sure!
Yeah right... Real genius. What else useful do you have to say?

What, you really don't know about the path from here to Swamp? You walk straight south to the wire. Better not go over the hill, go around. That way you won't have to flash in front of the soldiers. Then along the wire turn right until you see a hole in it. Climb right there, and there's only one road. How to look for Hornet later - hell knows. Though... there's one idea actually.
What you wanna find out? How to look for Hornet in Swamp - hell knows. Though... there's one idea actually.
Speak up, I'll listen.

So... I know the approximate place where part of our crew's common fund lies in Swamp. And Hornet knows, but exactly. I got a feeling he might rush there first and grab the loot for himself. And then tell the guys that I took everything. Why not? Convenient - a corpse won't tell the truth. But I'm alive! Generally, you go check our stash. If you're lucky, you'll catch Hornet there. Well, and if you don't run into him but the loot's there - take it all yourself. Better you get it than that bastard.\nYou know where the railway is in Swamp? And you seen the old destroyed platform? That's about where the cherished backpack is hidden.

So... I know the approximate place where part of our crew's common fund lies in Swamp. And Hornet knows, but exactly. I got a feeling he might rush there first and grab the loot for himself. And then tell the guys that I took everything. Why not? Convenient - a corpse won't tell the truth. But I'm alive! Generally, you go check our stash. If you're lucky, you'll catch Hornet there.
