Well, and if you don't run into him but the loot's there - take it all yourself. Better you get it than that bastard.\nYou know where the railway is in Swamp? And you seen the old freight train? That's about where the cherished backpack is hidden.

So... I know the approximate place where part of our crew's common fund lies in Swamp. And Hornet knows, but exactly. I got a feeling he might rush there first and grab the loot for himself. And then tell the guys that I took everything. Why not? Convenient - a corpse won't tell the truth. But I'm alive! Generally, you go check our stash. If you're lucky, you'll catch Hornet there. Well, and if you don't run into him but the loot's there - take it all yourself. Better you get it than that bastard.\nYou know where the railway is in Swamp? And you seen the old freight train? In the lowland nearby there's a huge cistern with all kinds of pipes. That's about where the cherished backpack is hidden.
Sounds smart. You can do it when you want to. My advice: quit the "big road" and get smart. See you later, lucky one.
Bro, from the heart! Thought that was it, Kirpich had run his last. But nah, we'll live some more. You're my first pal now. I'll do whatever you want for you.
Be well, respected one!
Go to hell!
I'll go, but you'll stay as monster food.
Listen, friend... Where's Petrenko?
What do you need him for?
Wanted to stock up, he's got decent ammo.
He went to Yantar, to Sakharov... Dragging another batch of artifacts for the scientists. He'll be back in a day or two...
I see... Well, see you...
Our old soldier passed away... ZONE, brother...
Yeah... ZONE...
Max Luber's PDA signal detected from here
Ryaboi Vasyan's PDA signal detected from here
Signal from beacon in Vergas's notebook
Help! Please, help...
Damn... What the hell wind brought you to this godforsaken place?
I need to. I'm looking for a person, a relative...
Such a girl can only find death in this Zone. What's your name, seeker?
What an idiot you are! You got yourself into shit - get yourself out!
Oksana. Who are you? I... I really need to find a person... His name is Vladislav. Here's a photo, maybe you've met him?
Well to hell with you! I'll manage myself...
Eh, Oksana. They call me Marked One. No, I haven't seen such a guy.
Let me see... I think I met him, and the name seems to match - he called himself Vlad.

Where is he?! He's my husband... We got married a year ago, had a daughter, Mashenka. She was sick, doctors said right away - she won't survive. And Vlad said he'd turn the earth upside down but he'd cure her. So he came here. They said there's a miracle artifact here, cures everything...\nAnd Masha died. Two weeks ago... I was left alone, so I decided to find him...

Where is he?! He's my husband... We got married a year ago, had a daughter, Mashenka. She was sick, doctors said right away - she won't survive. And Vlad said he'd turn the earth upside down but he'd cure her. So he came here. They said there's a miracle artifact here, cures everything...\nAnd Masha died. Two weeks ago... I was left alone, so I decided to find him...
You came here for nothing, you'll die for nothing. So many men lost their heads, where's a woman to...
You came here for nothing, you'll die for nothing. So many men lost their heads, where's a woman to...
Marked One, may I ask you?
Ask? Leave the Zone. You won't find him, and you'll die yourself.

No! I'll keep looking anyway! I have nobody left but him. Won't you help? I asked one good man, paid him. And these... transparent beasts attacked us... He just shouted: "Run!" Didn't even manage to get his weapon out... Horror!\nVlad sent me a letter, wrote that he's at Cordon, but there's no needed artifact there, and he's planning to go further to the center to search...\nHelp me get to this Cordon, and I'll manage from there myself. I'll pay, don't doubt it. I still have some money left...
Just tell me where Vlad is! I'll find him!
Where I saw him, there's nobody there anymore. Leave the Zone. You won't find him, and you'll die yourself.

No! I'll keep looking anyway! I have nobody left but him. Won't you help? I asked one good man, paid him. And these... transparent beasts attacked us... He just shouted: "Run!" Didn't even manage to get his weapon out... Horror!\nVlad sent me a letter, wrote that he's at Cordon, but there's no needed artifact there, and he's planning to go further to the center to search...\nHelp me get to this Cordon, and I'll manage from there myself. I'll pay, don't doubt it. I still have some money left...
What do I need your money for? Alright, come what may. Can you run well?
Listen, girl... I have my road, you have yours.
Run? I don't know, but I'll try... Where to run?
To Cordon, you asked for it yourself.
Alright, I understand. Should I follow you?

Yes, stay behind me, a bit apart, but don't fall behind too much. If something happens to me... Look here, here's a map. You and I will now move along the road east, reach the old mechyard and go south to the church. From there east again to the southern hamlet. And there's Cordon, understand?
Wait, I'll remember the way... So, from here east... then to the church... then... Got it, I understand.
Good girl. Let's move.
I didn't call you... go away...
Yeah, yeah...
Greetings, stalker. Can we have a word? How should I address you, by the way?
Hello. Marked One is my name. What did you want?
We have a problem here, our guide is unconscious...
What happened to him?

We work with Ivan Sergeevich. He equipped a scientific expedition to study some peculiarities of Zone wildlife. According to some sources, a very unusual mutant appeared nearby. Stalkers call it a giant. Ivan Sergeevich was very interested and sent us to observe this specimen in natural, so to speak, conditions...
Seems to me the opportunity didn't present itself.

Well... Generally, yes. Frol, our guide, undertook to lead us to where the giant was seen. When we reached here, he expressed the opinion that it was necessary to first scout the exact location of the lair independently. But something apparently happened there... How he managed to return, we don't know, but thirty meters from here we found him unconscious. We called for help, they'll come soon. But... Now we have a dilemma: time is passing, and the object of our interest might leave the operational zone where we conduct field research. When else will such a specimen wander into these parts...
What do you need from me?

Won't you agree to temporarily take on the functions of guide-guard? Of course, I don't promise special rewards, but I'm sure our expedition base has something that could ease the hard life of a stalker. And when help arrives, then we'll evacuate our permanent guide from here.
You convinced me, smooth talker. Where do I need to lead you?
Let's do it later, I have unfinished business.
I'll mark it on your PDA map rather than explain in words where to go.
Smart thinking. Stay behind me and don't lag. Let's move.
So what, Marked One, will you help?
With what?
Did you forget? I asked you to guide me to the giant's lair.
Ah, right! So where do you say I need to lead you?
I'm not ready for heroics. You manage without me.
We going or what?
Yeah. Watch your sides. Plenty of mutants here.
Thanks for the help! I'll manage on my own from here. Drop by our base sometime when you get a chance. We'll find something to thank you with.
Alright, be more careful here...
Go on, stalker. We'll manage somehow.
Hello, stalker. How's life?
Fine, what's this - sunbathing?
If only. We have a little problem, my colleague will explain in detail.
Alright, I'll talk to him.
My colleague needs help. Talk to him, please.
Yeah, yeah, yeah...
Thank you for agreeing to help! When you're at our base, come by, we'll chat.
Alright, see you again, I think.
Greetings! What brings you to us?
I have business here.

I remember your service, Marked One. A debt should be repaid. I talked with Ivan Sergeevich, and he told Pakhom to express gratitude to you on behalf of all of us in material, so to speak, form.\nSo you can talk to our supply manager.
Well, go... about your business.
Greetings, Marked One, how's life?
Marked One, finally! I was waiting for you.
Oh, Marked One! I was just thinking about you. Any news on finding natural artifacts?
Well, hello. What brings you here?
Oh, Marked One! I was just thinking about you. Any news on finding natural artifacts? Time's pressing, you know.
Hi, buddy, glad to see you!
Gluzov told me to have a word with you about some "material gratitude".

Gluzov - that's the one who went to admire the giant? And I told Ivan Sergeevich, no need to let these boys work independently "in the field". They'll die - then we'll get dragged through courts... These students have no sense of self-preservation at all, they climb everywhere.
That's true... Well, good that it ended well!

Ah, youth, youth... Alright, you did a good deed. I'll try to provide you with what's in stock at minimal prices... Won't even spare ammo, though we have a shortage. Come by in a day or so, I need to do inventory and agree on discount prices for you with Ivan Sergeevich.
Well, thank you.
Pakhom, I got your message. News came from Gluzov, as I understand?
Yeah. I heard our Seryoga made a sensation at some prestigious scientific conference. And you apparently helped him with materials for the report, right?
That happened. Nothing special really. Scientific materials for some, stalker routine for others. Plus or minus, of course.

Come on, don't be modest. Your adventures for the sake of science are known to every idler among the scholarly community.\nHere's your letter. Ah, even makes me a bit envious. I got my last one about 5 years ago... and that was from my ex-wife's lawyer... Yeah.
What's to envy? Be glad that at least bailiffs or tax people don't bother you with "letters of happiness". You have to find positive sides in everything.
Hello, stalker.
Hi. Returned to base, then? I see your guide recovered too. Well, glad for you.
Hi. Returned to base, then? How's your guide? What happened to him?
And you take care too.

Yeah, so I'd agree to work in the field again. And the guide, Frol, the Duty guys pulled him out from that hamlet. Their patrol happened to be nearby, well, they didn't refuse to help. By the way, talk to Frol, he has some business with you.

Yeah, so I'd agree to work in the field again. And the guide, Frol, the Duty guys pulled him out from that hamlet. Their patrol happened to be nearby, well, they didn't refuse to help. Generally, Frol is resting for now, but should be back on his feet soon. By the way, talk to him later when you see him, he has some business with you.
We already discussed his proposal. Alright, I'll go. See you, science.
Good, I'll talk to him. See you, science.
Sorry, stalker, I'm busy right now.
Alright. Just tell me why everyone's looking at me with such hostility - Pakhom, Demyan, the others?
As if you don't guess yourself. You let down our Seryoga, Gluzov - people already know. So trust stalkers with something more serious than getting a couple dog tails after this.
Greetings, Frol, how's your health?
You know me? How?
Saw you lying unconscious at the northern hamlet. I'm Marked One.

Ah! Marked One! Sorry, didn't recognize you. The graduate slackers told me about you. You seem like a decent guy, not like some others. Wanted to talk to you about one thing.\nWhen I went to scout the road to the giant's lair, I stumbled upon a stalker's corpse on the way. He had some documents, and among them a map with one marked place. I think it's a reserve stash of the group that was here before. They called themselves "Clear Sky". The stash isn't far, but... I'm not much of a Zone walker yet - the Duty guys dragged me here, thanks to them.\nHow about you? Don't want to take a look at what's there?
I can take a look, why not. What's your interest?

Judging by the papers, there should be some foreign weapon there. And a stalker came to the camp the other day who was just interested in Western samples. He needs a spare barrel, specifically for 5.56. Promised big money to both Pakhom and Sylvester if they'd agree to sell him something in this caliber. But where would such weapons be here? Tomorrow he should visit us again, to trade provisions for monster guts. Seems like he's preparing for a long expedition. So I thought, if the stash really exists and there's a suitable barrel in it... Why not try to sell it if it's not too late. And I'll have something to pay you with too. You won't be left empty-handed, I promise!
I see. Good, tell me where to look for that place.
No, Frol, I have more important things to do.

Let me show you on the PDA map. It should be west of the mechyard, there's also a small pond, approximately in this place... Just try to manage within a day, or the potential buyer will go on a raid. Oh, one more thing: if there's a weapon there, please make sure it's in sellable condition. Time has passed after all. Clean it, oil it if needed. Otherwise it'll be awkward...

Frol asked to find a Clear Sky stash in the northwestern part of Swamp and bring him a Western weapon sample that should be lying there. If the weapon turns out to be in poor condition, it should be fixed up
Hi, Frol! I found the stash we talked about.
Really? And what was there?
Nothing special: papers, ammo and a Swiss assault rifle - "SIG SG 552 Commando". Interested?
"SIG SG 552 Commando"? That's 5.56 caliber, right? Will you give it to me? The "buyer" should come soon - he just contacted Pakhom through his palmtop.
Take it, don't mind.
You know, Frol, I thought about it... I could use this weapon myself.
Thank you! Now it's my turn to give out favors. You know the way to Forgotten Village?
Well, as you wish... To hell with that rifle.
Forgotten Village? Don't know... Why Forgotten?
Forgotten Village? Yeah, I know how to get there.

Because nobody knows what it used to be called... Someone said "forgotten" once, and it stuck among stalkers. Generally, beyond the farthest hamlet from here, the northern one, there's a gap in the wire, that's where the path starts. I'm putting a mark on your PDA here.
Northern hamlet, hole in the wire, path... yeah, got it.

So listen further! When you get to Forgotten Village, look around the abandoned store, I dropped a backpack somewhere there. Hid an artifact and hunting carbine in it - was too heavy to carry. You can take it, for your good deed. Oh, and this artifact isn't ordinary. When you wear it on your belt, cats don't bother you at all with their purring that brings on drowsiness.

So listen further! When you get to Forgotten Village, head to the part that stands on high ground. Look there in one of the buildings - don't remember exactly which one, I was drunk - there should be a backpack. I hid an artifact and hunting carbine in it - was too heavy to carry. You can take it, for your good deed. Oh, and this artifact isn't ordinary. When you wear it on your belt, cats don't bother you at all with their purring that brings on drowsiness.
Thanks! When I'm there - I'll definitely check your tip.
Stalker... here I sit...
Yeah, I see, what are you doing here, soldier?

Met a friend here, dead... We were in training together, came here together... And now he lies there and nothing surprises him anymore. What, leave him? For dogs to eat? Eh, Kostyan... We thought after the army we'd go to Kiev together, enter university.
Eh, boys, why do they send you here... Alright, what's your name?
Sanya, Private Ryzhov... Was... I ran away from the unit, wanted to get out of the Zone with one guy. Who are you?
I'm a stalker, Marked One. Right, this Zone is no place for people... Leave while you're still alive...
I'm a stalker, Marked One. Listen, was it you who was hanging around the swamp with that rat catcher?
Marked One... And I'm here...
Yeah, I see... Listen, was it you who was hanging around the swamp with that rat catcher? Sanya, right?
Enough already, I'm telling you: get out of here while you're alive...
Well yeah, so what?
I can't leave Kostyan here. I think he needs to be buried, not like a dog, but properly...
How's that?
There's an old church nearby, with a cemetery... Need to take the body there... Will you help me? It's hard alone - too many creatures around...
Carry him? Alright, I'll help. How do we do this?
Let's do it like this, I'll cover and show the way, and you carry Kostyan... It's not far, we'll manage in a couple hours.
Well then, let's move...
Sorry, friend, I'll go about my business.
E-eh, go then, I'll manage myself...
See you...
I saw him at the Agroprom swamp, he's waiting, has no food... And you sit here...
He says you know the patrol scheme at Research Institute "Agroprom"?
I can't leave Kostyan here. I think he needs to be buried, not like a dog, but properly... And Kolyan can wait a bit...
Properly? How's that?
I know, I wrote them down. I can help you, of course, but you help me too... I can't leave Kostyan here. I think he needs to be buried, not like a dog, but properly...
Properly? How's that?
There's an old church nearby, with a cemetery... Need to take the body there... Help me, it's hard alone - too many creatures around...
Carry him? Alright, I'll help. How do we do this?
Don't try to confuse me, speak up!
Go to hell! You scared me...
Let's do it like this, I'll cover and show the way, and you carry Kostyan... It's not far, we'll manage in a couple hours...
Now along the path to Swamp... Ready? Where's Kostik's body?
Here he is... Come on, let's move...
Here it is... Let me rest a bit...
I'll carry it now, didn't have enough strength...
What body? Get lost...
Go away, Marked One. I don't respect you...
Well? Shall we go further?
Come on, go ahead, I'll follow you.
Let me rest... I'm tired.
Alright, I'll slowly go south... Don't fall behind...
Alright, move, move...
Well, here we are. Marked One, where's Kostyan?
Got tired of carrying, needed to rest. Left him not far. Wait, I'll go get him now.
Here he is, lying nearby.
Sorry, that's how it happened... didn't carry him all the way...
Yeah... Here, this is a suitable place for a grave. Eh, Kostyan...\nThank you, Marked One, for the help. Honestly, I don't even know how to thank you.
Damn! How could this happen?! Eh...
Alright, don't worry, we're even.
You... Alright. See you...

Wait. Here... take Kostik's rifle, some ammo and medicine.\nYou'll probably go further to the center? I heard there was a priest somewhere near Bar. If you meet him, ask him to come here. Even if I'm not here, let him pray for Kostyan.
I'll ask. Farewell, Sanya.
I'll ask. Listen, got a question for you. How did you get from the Agroprom base to the hamlet where I met you?

Don't know about the path? If you follow the power line from the base southeast, you'll soon see iron gates in a razor wire fence. Climb over them, then go straight, don't turn anywhere. Radiation, of course, plenty there, but I threw empty cans along the safe path. They should be clearly visible even at dusk.
Got it. Farewell, Sanya.
Huh? What? You... sorry. Don't want to talk...
Yeah, I understand...
Whatcha want, man... What you need?
Now I'll show you "what I need"! Scumbag...
You're Hornet? Got business with you.
Listen, who are you? Get lost, I wanna sleep...
Wake up, you'll sleep through your trial... Spill it, where'd you put the PDA that you and Kirpich snatched from the Duty guy in Dark Valley?
What are you, prosecutor? Got business - then speak up... Not this "spill-confess" crap... Pour me something to cure hangover, then maybe I'll remember somethin'...
What a weirdo you are. Here, take it... Try not to choke.
I got no vodka for you!

You're the one... That starts with M. My soul hurts... I seen such things you never dreamed of... Alright, you give me - I give you. I sold this mobile to the eggheads. Not far from here, at the old Clear Sky base. What's his name... Ah! Pakhom! Yeah! In short, I don't have it...
Well, figure it out yourself. Then I don't remember where this mobile is...
Damn... Couldn't say right away...
What a backyard drunk...
You again! What you want?
Where's the PDA, Hornet?
Where's the booze?
You're getting on my nerves with your booze!
What else you need from me, nutcase?
Oh! Damn! Will you leave me alone?
Pakhomych, I need to find one item.
You could at least say hello, Marked One. What item, and why to me?
Sorry... Hello, Pakhom... One thug, Hornet, said he gave you a PDA that I'm looking for.
That Mikola guy... Was here recently, yeah... Alcoholic, drags everything he finds for a bottle... Wait, where is it... Ah! Here! Take it...
Thanks.
Hello, Pakhom! I brought "Jelly" here.
Excellent! Sergeich was just asking about it.
Where should I put it? No need right now, bring it later.
Here they are, the jars. Take them, just be careful.
I want to check something with them, I'll give them back later.

Don't worry, I'm experienced. You wouldn't believe the crap people bring. How about you, should I throw in some medicine and food or will you take pills with sleeping aid? I know many in the Zone complain about bad sleep. Sergeich recently ordered a batch of pills for our people, seems to help. Told me to reward stalkers for services to science with them too, if there's a need. So what do you choose?
Don't complain about sleep, but always want to eat. And dogs, the bastards, bite painfully. Radiation everywhere too...
Sleeping pills would be very handy. Sometimes have to specifically look for local kitties to purr me a lullaby...
You're right. Here you go.
The things stalkers think up... Here you go.
Can't understand you - first you need it, then later...
Yeah. Thanks.

The corpse I found in laboratory X-16 - this is not Ghost! Don't know where such certainty comes from, but some sixth sense tells me I'm not wrong about this. Apparently, Guide has a photo with Strelok. Need to visit Cordon and find this stalker, about whom, as I know, strange rumors circulate.
I heard you're holding Duty guys prisoner?
Those blabbermouths! Well... there was that... What the hell were they doing poking around?! We warned them a thousand times - don't stick your nose in... But no! The law ain't written for fools!
Hm... Maybe let them go? I'll talk to who I need to, maybe they'll count it as a good deed for you...
I don't give a shit about good deeds! Want it nice? Then get those goats to release my pal...
What goats?

Don't know goats? Those horned, stupid and belligerent ones... Called Duty guys... They got a little basement in Bar, keeping one of my pals there. Thought he'd sell out the bros... They won't live to see it!
So what do you want?
Tell their... Chief... Wants to see his guys alive - let Poker go! Won't release him by day after tomorrow - we'll gut all the goat-beards!
I'll talk... We'll see...
Greetings, man! Come over, sit down, let's get acquainted...
Alright, let's get acquainted... Marked One. And you?
They call me Rod. I've been in the Zone for a long time, know a lot... If you're interested, ask away.
Marked One! Come over, have a seat...
Tell me about those you know...
Tell, you say? Alright, just pour me something, my tongue gets tied when dry...
More? Get out a bottle, maybe I'll remember someone else.
Well, let's lubricate... Cheers...
No, I won't drink now, need a clear head.
Excellent! Went down smooth!
Interesting, who else do you know about?
Alright, see you later...
I found some weird stuff here, take a look.

Let me see, let me see... You're lucky, Marked One. This "stuff" is called a capsule. Inside is a very good artifact. But the capsule shell is very durable, you can't just break it with anything. Need to use a lot of electricity to clean the artifact. I could probably help... Not for free, of course...
I found some weird stuff here, take a look.

Let me see, let me see... You're lucky, Marked One. This "stuff" is called a capsule. Inside is a very good artifact. But the capsule shell is very durable, you can't just break it with anything. Need to use a lot of electricity to clean the artifact. I could probably help... Not for free, of course...
Professor, I came across an unusual item.

Show me... You're a lucky man, Marked One. Stalkers call such a thing a capsule. We haven't figured out exactly why some artifacts are enclosed in super-strong shells. We have to place this capsule inside an installation that creates a polarized magnetic field with intensity over three thousand Gauss. Sometimes even the generator can't handle the load... And spare parts for it are hard to deliver here...
Let's open the artifact capsule.
Phew, alright... Gas is expensive nowadays, you understand.
What am I, a factory? The previous one isn't ready yet!
Well alright, got it. Here, take your thousands.
I got a simple little artifact, take it.
Listen, Sidorovich, you need to be kinder to people.
Yeah. Come back in an hour, should crack open by then.
I'm already kind, if you haven't noticed... So no profit - no talk...
How's my capsule doing?
You're too fast, Marked One, wait a bit more.
Your artifact is ready, here, take it, use it... Maybe you'll sell it? I give good prices... What? No? Well, suit yourself.
Alright, I'll wait...
Shall we make a deal about the capsule? Will you open it?
Only out of respect for your services, Marked One.
Boiler's busy! Come later...
Money, artifacts... Here, take the rubles...
I got a simple little artifact, take it.
I'll better go to Sidor, he's kinder.
So. Come back in an hour, should cook by then.
I'm already kind, if you haven't noticed... So no profit - no talk...
Well, how's my capsule?
You're too fast, Marked One, good artifacts take time to cook...
Your artifact is cooked, here, take it, use it... I got a client for such, maybe you'll sell?
Alright, I'll wait...
Will you help me open the capsule?

Why not help? Only you know, Marked One, certain circles that help us with funding are interested in studying Zone gifts not only in field conditions, but also within certain state... hm... and not only, laboratories. So I ask you to help us too. In the form of an artifact - first level...
You know, my dear fellow, the installation is busy now, let's try a bit later.
An artifact? Will this one do?
Well, professor, unfortunately I don't have such a thing.
Yes-yes. Of course! Please wait about fifteen minutes. I think no more will be needed...
Very unfortunate... We can't afford charity yet.
Well? What kind of artifact is in there?
Need to wait more, the coating is very resistant, needs time...
Managed to open it, here's this artifact. Not the rarest, but doesn't lie on the road either... Maybe you'll donate it to science?
Alright, I'll wait...
I've been wanting to ask about that underground place where Vasiliev disappeared.
You mean object 16? The underground complex?
Don't know, maybe 16. I somehow didn't immediately think about what's actually there.

M-m-m... Apparently, it's a laboratory. I can't say for sure, of course, but probably some experiments were conducted there to create a device that could explain or, say, affect this phenomenon called by everyone with one word - ZONE...
I don't understand this. I turned off several switches and what? What happened? Did this radiation disappear completely or what? I also saw a huge brain! Where did it come from?

Marked One, unfortunately, I don't have exact answers to your questions. From the scraps of information we managed to collect, an attempt was made in this place to grow a biological computer. With the help of genetic engineering and nanotechnology, the first encouraging results were obtained. Then a "breakthrough", "emission" or whatever happened... Generally, under external stimulation, or maybe in response to it, the biological component - that very Brain you saw - began generating a new type of radiation, PSI - as we call it now... We haven't reliably established more than that yet.
Was I really the only one who managed to break through?

Heh-heh... You flatter yourself, Marked One. From time to time the radiation loses strength, and some stalkers manage to penetrate inside. Few return, if you can say "return". The shell returns. But the mind... The mind stays somewhere there. Besides - the time when you can get closer is very variable, and what's most unpleasant - after this lull the radiation changes form and supposedly previously effective protective devices don't ensure the safety of our gray matter.
What about the switches? I turned them off!

As far as we could determine, these switches only change the radiation mode, some time will pass and the radiation will again strike the careless... M-m-yes! If only we could find where the power for this whole system comes from and turn it off. So far nobody has succeeded.
Don't hover around here, boy, I'm busy...
U-uh...
Come in, stalker. Here on business or just to chat?
Greetings! I see the light's on. Thought I'd drop by. Why are you alone here, not with everyone by the fire?
I'm too old to sit on the ground with the boys getting hemorrhoids. I prefer to be near a warm stove. What's your name, boy?

Recently - Marked One. And I don't know my real name. Or rather, don't remember. Woke up recently in this camp. What's in my pockets, what's in my memory - everywhere's empty. What should I call you? And what do you do here?

Well, Marked One, glad to meet you. Call me Vergas. I'm, you could say, to some degree your fellow sufferer. After the first emission I woke up on a cot in the sanatorium. Was like a small child - could only moo. Thanks to the local guys - they pulled me out. And on the cot was a piece of nameplate with surname: "Vergas...". Either Vergasyuk, or Vergasilidze, maybe even Vergasyan. But judging by my Ryazan mug, most likely - Vergasov. And the local dimwits aren't rich in brain convolutions so they left it as: Vergas... They bring me their junk for repair, weapons, suits. I won't take especially beat up stuff, of course, I'm not a factory, but I can fix up a bit, clean... So if your gun starts jamming or jacket falls apart at the seams, come to me, I'll help.
I see. Fix, solder, repair, right? I'll drop by sometime.
Marked One? Come in, be my guest. Or here on business?
Yeah, need to repair something.
Come on, show me this "something" of yours.
Thanks. I just dropped in to warm up.
Well, go ahead. Warm up... Or let's chat.
How's the repair going?
What? Speak louder, started hearing poorly...
Listen, were you also doing stalker work here before? You're rather old for these things. And you mentioned some Sanatorium, that was before the Zone formed, so it turns out?

Well, yes. Too late for me to learn jumping around anomalies, you're right there. But my hands grow from the right place, so I'm useful and have respect from stalkers. I've been here long, from the very beginning, almost.
A native, what? I mean, local?

I wish I knew myself... I, like you, also don't remember much about myself. My life "began" a couple years before the Zone appeared. I was lying in the local Sanatorium. Was paralyzed, memory knocked out... And when it hit, I remember, everything in our ward turned upside down. Those who could, ran for it, and some croaked right away. Some staff helped carry people out...
And what about you?
I got hit hard too. Came to - lying on the floor. Reached out my hand and got up...
But you said you were paralyzed!

That's the thing! After the emission I started moving! Slowly, slowly, but I got up, started walking. Not like a young man, of course, but still. So the Zone raised me up, now it feeds me. Though if it wasn't for the emission, maybe the doctors would've managed to restore my memory...
How so?

Three days before it all went to hell, a group of medics from some Asian country came to us. They brought their new drugs, were looking for volunteers for trials. Well, I had nothing to lose, so I volunteered. They assured me that one of their mixtures could help restore memory. But I didn't get to try it. Maybe it's for the best...
What kind of drug was it?

How the hell should I know?! I only saw - in a small bottle, with a red label, and inscriptions in their scribbles. I wasn't interested further. I think now I wouldn't risk drinking that chemistry... But you, if you want, try looking for it yourself in the Sanatorium.
And how do I get there?
The Sanatorium... well, thanks, I'll keep it in mind.
Not far from here, but I won't say exactly where, I was a bit out of it when I got out. Ask around the folk, those with more experience, they surely know where and what...

I can make marks in your PDA, but I'm not sure they're accurate. The local young ones showed me maps, but I haven't been to those parts myself. Maybe there are other paths and routes. Ask around the folk, those with more experience, they surely know exactly where and what...

Wait. I have a request for you in case you do decide to visit the Sanatorium. Look around, maybe you'll come across one little thing of mine - a tea cup. Or not a cup... a mug, maybe?! Eh, I can't remember exactly anymore, but something like that for sure! For me it's the only, albeit ghostly, memory from the past. If only I could hold it in my hands again, who knows, maybe something else would surface in my memory.
A tea cup? Come on, old man! I can take a look when I get there, of course, but can such things really survive in today's ruins?

I'm not insisting, but what if. I'd throw in some useful present. Though, considering that I've already asked several stalker acquaintances about the same thing, and there's still no result, I don't think you'll have luck either. But still, I ask you to look. It's very important to me.
So... This will need
This will cost... Probably,
For repairing this peashooter I'll ask
Repairing this piece will cost you
will have to tinker... Agreed?
So, by preliminary estimate the cost of armor repair will be:
Here, my suit got worn out. See?
Let me take a look. Uh... Yeah...
I can see it, but I'm busy right now. Come back later.
Well?
Later it is then.
Can make it decent, add a couple patches, change some plates...
Look how beat up you are... No, brother, I can't help you here. Only a specialist can fix such damage.
This is a cloak made of flesh hide! I'm no help in this matter. Special skill is needed here. I don't know who could make it decent.
Your suit is kind of strange, I don't get it... No, I won't take it on. I'm afraid I'll only make it worse. If you have a tool kit, better try it yourself.
Alright, agreed, here's the cash.
The money's not much, but I'm tight right now.
Pity...
You disappointed me...
Well, you go take a walk for now. I don't like it when people nudge my elbow...
Alright, I'll take a walk.
Will you look at the mask on my suit?
Come on, put it here... Now, what's the problem, dear fellow?
No time right now, I'm working. Come back later.
You're joking. Look, there are chips, but seems like it's not leaking yet, holding the seal.
You're joking. Look for yourself, the glass is broken... In general, no point mentioning the seal.
Later it is then.

Yeah... You see, whether the seal is broken or not, there's no big difference. If I can patch holes and tears in the armored part, the glass can only be replaced entirely. I'll also have to keep the suit to check if it's leaking harmful atmosphere anywhere.
And how much will this replacement cost me? And how long?
Let me estimate... About an hour of work, I think, and money-wise - from you
Agreed, take the payment.
Seems cheap, but I don't have that much right now.
Yeah, good. Now don't stand over my shoulder. Go take a walk for an hour.
No problem.
Can I patch up armor myself? What's needed for that?
If the damage is minor, then yes. I, and other repairmen, collect repair kits for such purposes.
How do you use repair kits?

Need to explain everything... To use a repair kit, you need to put a special repair box on the ground, open it and take one of the kits. If armor or weapons are heavily damaged, then a repair kit won't help. If there's a vise nearby, you can fix even more serious damage. That's all...
What's a repair box?

A repair box is a case for repair kits. You can't use a kit without it. You can trade the box for artifacts with Sidorovich, and I can assemble armor and weapon repair kits myself. I'll sell them for local currency if needed.
Yeah, got it...
Put together several repair kits for me.
Sorry, friend. Don't have any more ready ones. Come by tomorrow.
Well, let me assemble some. Which ones do you need?
Armor ones.
I'll take the weapon one.
Bit pricey though.
Deal!
Agreed!
Here, my peashooter jams often, take a look.
Let me take a look. Uh... Yeah...
I'm busy right now. Come back later.
Well? What do you say?
Later it is then.
In general, nothing terrible, I'll replace a couple parts...
Who brings weapons to such condition! There's nothing to help with here! Easier to buy a new one.
Alright, deal, here's the cash.
For a couple parts? I don't have that much!
Pity...
I'll tinker for a while, and you don't stand over my shoulder, go on...
As you say.
My barrel jams, and there's big spread. Will you take a look?
Let me take a look. Uh... Yeah...
Let's do this a bit later. I'm working on another order right now.
Well? To the morgue?
Alright, I'll come back later...
You need to clean your weapon on time, Marked One. Then it won't let you down. Alright, I'll fix it up a bit.
This is scrap metal, not a weapon! Throw it away or give it to Sidorovich. Though not sure he'll want it. Even for pennies.
Alright, here's the cash.
You're something! I don't have that kind of money.
Pity...
I'm used to working without supervision! Take a walk for now, alright?
As you say.
Vergas, what about my repair?
Huh? Can't hear, speak louder!
What about the repair, I'm asking? I asked you to fix the mask...
What about the repair, I'm asking? I left you my armor...
What about the repair, I'm asking? I left you my weapon...
All done already! Here, take it, not a fly sat on it.
You're too hasty. I still need time...
Well thanks, old man. I owe you!
Well, I'll wait...
By the way, did you see that the whole mask on this suit is broken? Need to change the glass if you don't want to breathe all kinds of crap in the next contaminated area.

By the way, are you aware that this suit is full of holes and tears, which means it'll let in poisonous atmosphere? Need to patch it up. You don't want to breathe all kinds of crap in the next contaminated area, do you?
Come on, what's the big deal... Already paid properly after all.
Thanks for the warning. I'll think about it.
Hey there, friend. Name's Vitaly, and you?
I'm Marked One. Just Vitaly? Stalkers usually have nicknames, but you, it seems, just go by name...
I'm not a stalker. But I got a nickname too - go by Lanky. Me and Docent work here quietly. He's more into electronics and such, and I fix suits.
Ah, I see. Because of the rack behind you I first thought you were trading them.
Nah, I display the repaired ones there. Waiting for their owners.
So you repair, eh? How is it, profitable business?

Can't complain. You know what places these are, so my craft is very much in demand. Especially among our protectors from "Duty". Their command constantly sends them on raids against mutants. So the guys bring their holey suits after such trips. You bring yours too if you need it.
Hello, Marked One. About repair or what?
Yeah, this weapon often lets me down...
Well, let me take a look... Wow! Well...
I'm busy right now. Put your weapon away for now. Come back later...
Later? Well, see...
So what do you say?
Can fix it, I'll clean it, replace a couple parts...
I agree, here's the money...
You ask too much, I don't have that kind of money...
I'll work on the repair, and you can have a couple drinks at the Bar...
Suit yourself...
Who brings weapons to such condition! There's nothing to help with here! Easier to buy a new one...
Pity...
Wow! Holy shit! What the hell is this? No, I can't repair such materials, you do it yourself...
Well damn!
Look here, it jams, and big spread too. Will you take a look?
Let me take a look... Uh... Yeah...
Let's do this a bit later... I have another order that's not ready yet.
Alright, I'll go have a couple drinks at the Bar.
Well? Will it live?

Marked One, you don't take care of your weapon at all? That's why it lets you down! A weapon saves your life, and you treat it like... Not good. Alright, I'll fix it up a bit, oil it, maybe change the firing pin.
Well alright, I agree, here's the money.
You're something! I don't have that kind of money.
Listen, take a walk around the Bar for now... Can't stand it when people hover over my shoulder...
Alright, I'll take a walk...
Yeah... This is scrap metal, not a weapon! Throw it away! You can't bring a weapon to such condition, how you treat it, that's how it treats you...
Eh, and I was hoping...
No... This isn't for amateur repairs at all. Here, brother, that's it! In short - no, won't take it on. You go clean it yourself, oil it, but I don't want to mess with this...
Well damn! Hell.
Yurko, what about my order?
All done already! Here, take it, like new...
Well thanks... I owe you!
Only cats are born fast, Marked One... I still need time...
Well, I'll wait...
For repairing this junk of yours I'll take
Repairing this weapon will cost you
So, another one... Well? Broke your own weapon?
Broke it? No, I take care of my weapon! Why do you think that?
Well of course! I repair all kinds of weapon junk, you came here, that is, to me. Conclusion: you need to repair a weapon... All logical, isn't it?
Well yes, logical... I'm Marked One, and you?

Huh? Well yes, you don't know me yet... Name's Yurko. The local dimwits nicknamed me Lisaped... Can't even say the word bicycle right, and yet... I used to be into bicycle tourism before the Zone, and under "this business" I happened to mention it. Well, that's it, done! The nickname stuck - can't tear it off!\nWell anyway, in general, if you need a weapon repaired, you're welcome.
Thanks, really useful business...
Come in, Marked One, on business or what?
Listen, look at my weapon...
Let me take a look, pistol or what?
Just like that, my weapon seems to be fine...
Suit yourself, maybe you need something else...
Hey! I'm about the order...
What? Can't hear...

Help me out, Sidorovich, trouble happened! I got a strange artifact lying in my backpack, but I clearly remember I didn't pick it up. Can't throw it away - after some time it somehow ends up there again. Ever since this artifact appeared, I've been having health problems and constantly getting hungry...

Yeah, Marked One, it's always either diarrhea or scrofula with you. This is bad business, I'll say right away. By all signs, you caught the "Black Mark" - the nastiest artifact in the Zone. And is it even an artifact? One word - parasite. Pretends to be any harmless thing, just so someone picks it up, and then, having latched onto its victim, never lets go until it drains all life force drop by drop. Horror!
But how... You mean to say I'm doomed and there's no chance of salvation, right? That's what you want to say? Really no way at all to get rid of this crap?

Don't yell like that... If I'm honest, God knows. I know little about this, just rumors. And you can't tell where's truth and where's empty chatter. In your place I'd ask old experienced stalkers. Wolf, for example, or your savior - Redhead.\nAh! Here's another, I remember, one of the young ones, returning after his first trip to the Bar about two weeks ago, told me that there's one "Duty guy" there, called Brome. So this Brome was chatting over a bottle by the fire that some buddy of his managed to survive the "Black Mark". Who knows, maybe he wasn't lying.
Brome... Thanks, I'll try to find him and have a chat. And I'll definitely ask the experienced ones for advice. Anything else?
Take more food supplies for the road and don't forget medicine - you complained about health and being ravenous yourself. Good luck!
Help me out, Raven! I'm in trouble with the "Black Mark". I was told you know a way to get rid of it.

You understand that such secrets aren't laid out for the first person you meet? Sorry, buddy, we barely know each other. Who knows, maybe you're planning some scam with this knowledge, leading honest stalkers astray. No offense.
Yes, you're in deep trouble, guy. But you understand that such secrets aren't laid out for just anyone?
I'm "just anyone"? And who got you the Artist's album? And who searched for various unusual things for your collectors?

Alright, alright. You shamed me. Losing a good business partner due to excessive caution would be short-sighted on my part.\nI warn you in advance: I can't give any guarantees that the method will actually work. Haven't personally tested it, as you understand. Source of information - one of my trusted assistants who had contacts with a representative of the "Monolith" group. From his words. There's a special place in the west of Foggy Thicket. There in a hollow between hills stands a huge crystal, which is either a broken-off part or a projection of that very "Monolith" that these fanatics worship. The "Black Mark" is also somehow connected to it and serves as something like an identification sign. Sometimes by mistake the mark gets to someone completely different from who it should have, and then there's a possibility to "return" it to the real owner. I don't get how it works myself, but the practical side looks like this: at the foot of the crystal you need to lay out one brand new artifact each of first, second and third category. This will be a sacrifice or payment for the "Monolith" to turn its gaze upon you. Then you throw out the mark. If the trick worked, it should disappear completely and never return. Sounds like nonsense, but I bought it for what I'm selling it for. That's all, good luck!

Well, yes, you brought some things from the list, but I settled with you fairly as agreed. No, Marked One, while we have business relations, not friendly ones, let's continue following established rules of commerce. A thousand bucks from you for information.

Searched and found - not the same thing, isn't it? No, Marked One, while we have business relations, not friendly ones, let's continue following established rules of commerce. Two thousand bucks from you for information.
Here's the money. Don't keep me waiting...
That's not commerce anymore, that's robbery! However, the dead have no use for money. Start talking.
And good people warned that I'd have to overcome my own toad first, and only then turn to you...

I warn you in advance: I can't give any guarantees that the method will actually work. Haven't personally tested it, as you understand. Source of information - one of my trusted assistants who had contacts with a representative of the "Monolith" group. From his words. There's a special place in the west of Foggy Thicket. There in a hollow between hills stands a huge crystal, which is either a broken-off part or a projection of that very "Monolith" that these fanatics worship. The "Black Mark" is also somehow connected to it and serves as something like an identification sign. Sometimes by mistake the mark gets to someone completely different from who it should have, and then there's a possibility to "return" it to the real owner. I don't get how it works myself, but the practical side looks like this: at the foot of the crystal you need to lay out one brand new artifact each of first, second and third category. This will be a sacrifice or payment for the "Monolith" to turn its gaze upon you. Then you throw out the mark. If the trick worked, it should disappear completely and never return. Sounds like nonsense, but I bought it for what I'm selling it for. That's all, good luck!
I'm here again about the "Black Mark"...
We already discussed everything. What else?
Maybe you'll still give a discount for old times' sake? I did help you with some things too...
No, Marked One, while we have business relations, not friendly ones, let's continue following established rules of commerce. A thousand bucks for the information you're interested in.
No, Marked One, while we have business relations, not friendly ones, let's continue following established rules of commerce. Two thousand bucks for the information you're interested in.
I want to ask a question. "Black Mark" - doesn't that tell you anything?
Holy, holy... Cross yourself! I've heard of such misfortune, and who hasn't... God forbid it happens!
They say there's a way to survive this trouble. Maybe you'll advise something? Don't think wrong, this is me... asking for a friend.

Sorry for your friend, of course, but... Wait, let me remember what the guys said about it. Well, first, you need to stock up on lots of food - victims of the "Black Mark" often die from banal hunger. Though, probably, you could try to get by with a "Pizza" artifact. Second, I remember, they said that drinking an energy drink helps against catching episodes with the mark, and artifacts that increase resistance to psi-seizures save from its paralyzing strikes. And so your breathing doesn't get knocked out often, you need to carry something on your belt that adds more endurance to the body.\nBut it's all empty talk... A person can't survive the "Black Mark". It'll take all his luck drop by drop, so there's only one end: if he doesn't die from hunger or pain shock, he'll end up in an "Electra", or meet a bloodsucker on a dark night, stepping away from camp to relieve himself.
I understand you. Thanks for sharing. Hope it helps... the friend.

According to Sidorovich, somewhere south of Cordon, before the embankment, a stalker nicknamed Butterfingers lost a container with an artifact. Need to find it and deliver it to the trader. First should have a chat with the unlucky courier.

Vergas, the repairman from Cordon, asked to look for a forgotten mug, cup, or some other dish he left in the Sanatorium once. I won't dig the ground with my nose, of course, but why not really take a look, since this thing is dear to him.
Listen, do you speak Chinese?
Well, what a question! And why do you need it?
You see. I found this medicine, supposedly should restore memory. But the instructions are in some hieroglyphs...
No way. I don't understand Chinese. Especially since everything here is handwritten, even a scanner won't take such thing. You need a translator here, some Chinese guy. Or Japanese.
But where to find such people...
Excuse me, could you help with translating hieroglyphs?
Hieroglyphs? Strange request. What hieroglyphs?

I was told that there's experimental medicine in the sanatorium that helps restore memory. I found it, but I'm afraid to take it without knowing what and how. And the instructions are either in Chinese or Japanese, and handwritten at that.

I see, I see. Unfortunately, we can't help with this. This requires special translator programs and a certain amount of machine time. We definitely don't have the first, and the second isn't great either, computers are almost always busy with important calculations. Unless we send your "manuscript" to the mainland, but that would take a lot of time and money... So, sorry.
Pity. What to do then...
Hey, Stalker! You look pretty lost. You here for me or looking for the repairman?
Just looking around. What do you have here? By the way, name's Marked One.
And I'm Arnie. I run something like an exchange here. Got a small stock of ammo, can swap some for others. Mutual benefit, so to speak.
I see. I don't need it right now, but I'll keep it in mind. You mentioned a repairman...
That's further ahead, walk through the hangar, you won't miss it. They call him Lisaped, handy guy. Or maybe you'll still take a look at what I have for exchange?
Alright, show me what you have.
Nah, I don't have spare ammo right now anyway. See ya!
Marked One, right? On exchange business?
Yeah, I need certain ammo...
No, just dropped by to say hello.
Look around, check the prices...
Well, what do you want? Don't you see I'm resting? No exchanges...
Uh... What exchange?
What, you new here? I'm Arnie. I exchange some ammo for others, with a small commission. Come by later, during the day, to the hangar, if you want to see the assortment.
Got it. By the way, I'm Marked One. Nice to meet you.
Marked One, so Marked One... Now let me relax quietly with a bottle... No offense.
Still alive? Marked One... Seems like I wanted something from you... Slipped my mind.
Look, I'm here often, when you remember - tell me...
Uh-huh... You better eat something...
Hold up, stalker, don't twitch. Got business to discuss.
What business here? I already settled everything with Borov.
Borov's got authority, sure, but he's far away, and we're close. So don't get uppity. Let's see what you got. Then you can see what's here.
Screw off, scum! I'll smash your heads!
Yeah right... Take a look.

Yo! Bro, come on, share the artifacts. Keep the junk to yourself, we don't give a shit about those "Jellyfish"... But the good stuff, I'll take. Don't worry, not everything. We're reasonable people. You don't mind, I hope? 'Cause you know, stiffs don't object...
Guys, this place is cleaned out! Shit... Give us the dough then! Ten grand each. Forty total from you, in short.
Look, you'll regret this... Take it!
Choke on it...
I don't have that much.
Your faces will crack from my goodies!
That's what I'm talkin' about! Walk on, for now.
Gimme your mobile, I'll check it.
I'll take a walk... For now...
Here, check all you want.

Fo' real, ain't got that much. Well, looks like you landed on the meter, so to speak. Now you owe us two decent artifacts, like "Gravi" or "Flash". If you find sumthin' cooler, fine, you can get away with one. And your mobile will stay with me for now. Get it? And make it quick, three days you got.\nAnd this... We don't need to show ourselves here too much, so we'll be waitin' for you in the backyard. Try to sneak in quietly - we'll waste you, just so you know.
Alright, alright. I got it all.
So how's it goin'? Brought the artifacts? Look, the clock's tickin'.
Choke on it... Give back the PDA.
Not yet. Wait... and you'll definitely get it.
Now you're talkin'! Here's your device. And stop starin' at me like a wolf. Everyone hustles as best they can. Here's a small compensation for you.

Now you're talkin'! I see you already got yourself a new mobile? That's good, 'cause I accidentally dropped your old one, bye-bye to it, see what crap... I even thought of compensatin' at first, wouldn't be right otherwise, but since you're such a rich guy that you're already showin' off with a new one, then you'll manage, I guess. Maybe I can give you such a hookup.
What? Where'd you get this?

The guys spotted how an electric chimera flew into a "Burner" on the hill earlier. Got fried instantly, but we managed to cut a trophy off it. I know stalkers use this crap somehow, so I decided to unload it on you. If you're up for it, drop by later sometime, we'll have a chat. Maybe some opportunity will show up.
We'll see.
Benefactor! Wanna share more?
Yeah, I wanna! Give each one the maximum...

Don't make noise, cripple. You can see yourself, we're sittin' here without opportunities. Borov, the bastard, won't let us make much dough... Don't smirk. You're alive, and didn't lose that much loot. Rasp has a conscience too. And fo' real, maybe you'll still get a pile of loot. You'll have dough, booze and everything else plenty!
First you robbed me, now you're offerin' your "deals"? No thanks, I think I'll pass.
You lay it out first, then we'll see.
Business talk. In short, here's the deal: got a tip on a stash with fat loot, on the Garbage. If we make a deal - everything goes to you.
And in return from me you want...
I want you to get me a piece. No bullshit, so I don't become a punk!
What kind of gun?

Ever heard of the "MP-153"? Real cool peashooter, can't just find it in the Zone. They say the barkeep at the Bar deals those. I had one, but drunkenly dropped it in an anomaly - and bye-bye... So, can you dig up one like that? Just make sure it ain't some busted junk, but new stuff. So, we gonna shake on it?
Nah, I didn't sign up to be your errand boy here.
I'll think about it, maybe I'll get you that gun.
Then get the hell outta here, punk. Eh, should give you a good pluckin' "for the road", but the guys already poured the vodka, they're callin'.
Take it easy, I'm already leavin'.
Maybe we should have a few drops?
Ah, you again. Get lost... Goody-two-shoes.
Yeah, I'm goin', I'm goin'.
Well, hello again. So how about the deal, made up your mind?
So? Everything good?
Rasp asked to get him a cool peashooter - "MP-153", definitely in excellent condition. For this he promised to tell about a stash with "fat loot".
Rasp, you know Rodent?
The rat? Of course! That bastard owes me two bottles! Lost a bet.
He hinted that you know a lot and can help me with something.
No doubt, I know a lot. About what?
I'm looking for Strelok. Heard of such a stalker?

Strelok? Yeah, familiar handle. Seems like one buddy clashed with him about half a year ago. Like that one wanted to take some crap from a nerd, but the nerd refused. So this Strelok decided to discuss with his bros about robbin' the nerd... What came of it, I ain't in the know.
What about the buddy? Where is he now?
And where's my gun? You're too crafty, as I see it. Even a cat won't meow for free...

You ask too many questions. Even a cat won't meow for free... Ah, whatever! You hooked me up with a piece, I'll answer for old friendship. Crowbar - that's his handle, heard of such? Duty guys took him in, he's chillin' on their turf now.
Damn you all! Everyone wants me to drag some crap! Maybe I'll just give you some dough instead?
Some buddies you got... Should've guessed right away.

What, you shell-shocked? I already told ya - need the "MP-153", same as I had. And money... money won't cover your ass from a pack of pseudodogs. There'll be a gun - there'll be talk about the buddy, and if not... I'll get one myself somehow if I need to, but you'll be left out in the cold, get it?

Hey, don't rush it! You should know, Crowbar before he started lootin' with the bros, was a known stalker. There was even talk among ours that he nailed the main Duty boss. That's why that one's messin' with him now. Bastard!\nAnyway, Crowbar should know about your Strelok.
Yeah, I get it, I get it. I'll think about your peashooter.
Still actin' tough? Gangsters...
So what's up, brought the piece? Where's the "MP-153"?
You talking about this one?
Yeah, that one. Give it here...
Don't drag your feet... What about your buddy who knew Strelok?
Here! Now tell about the stash.
I'll think more about whether to give it up.
Ah... so that's it, Duty guys nabbed him. Crowbar, heard of him probably.

In short, on Garbage some dude stashed a backpack with decent loot. Swore by Christ. But didn't say the exact spot, wanted to lead and show himself. Hoarse tapped him lightly on the noggin, just for sense, so he wouldn't be stubborn, and he kicked the bucket. Was sick with sumthin', seems. But me and the guys roughly figured out where to look.\nThe backpack's lying in the crane cabin, on the radioactive pile, near the hangar.\nListen, I see you're a business guy. Got another deal for me, need to discuss... Just between us though.

In short, on Garbage some dude stashed a backpack with decent loot. Swore by Christ. But didn't say the exact spot, wanted to lead and show himself. Hoarse tapped him lightly on the noggin, just for sense, so he wouldn't be stubborn, and he kicked the bucket. Was sick with sumthin', seems. But me and the guys roughly figured out where to look.\nThe backpack's lying in the woods with the hungry ones and other critters, where the path to Dark Valley starts.\nListen, I see you're a business guy. Got another deal for me, need to discuss... Just between us though.

In short, on Garbage some dude stashed a backpack with decent loot. Swore by Christ. But didn't say the exact spot, wanted to lead and show himself. Hoarse tapped him lightly on the noggin, just for sense, so he wouldn't be stubborn, and he kicked the bucket. Was sick with sumthin', seems. But me and the guys roughly figured out where to look.\nThe backpack's sunk in the swamp that starts behind the concrete blocks.\nListen, I see you're a business guy. Got another deal for me, need to discuss... Just between us though.
Some buddies you got... Should've guessed right away. Nice little gun though. Think I'll keep it for myself.
Hold up with your deal. Let me check out that stash first, then decide if it's worth dealin' with you at all.

Well what can I do? You shoulda asked earlier... But he definitely had dealings with Strelok, no doubt... So where's my gun? Don't worry, I'll tell you about the stash, it's legit, you won't be at a loss.
After our first "meeting" I don't really believe I'll find your stash, and if I do, it won't turn out empty. And the road to Garbage, though close, has plenty monsters along the way...

Why bring up old stuff. Gotta live somehow. Who were you then? Just a pimple outta nowhere. Unclear who and from where. But now I see you're a right guy. So everything's honest. Want me to give you an artifact for the "MP-153"? My guys took it off some sucker earlier. Good artifact, used a bit though.
A worn artifact? I dunno, I dunno...

Well... Then I can tell about another stash, it's in the Gut. And here the tip's solid, may I drop dead. In short, like my buddy stashed some valuable thing there, long time ago. And a month ago he lost this stash of his to me in dice. In the Gut there's plenty critters too, of course, but you're a seasoned guy, probably, won't get scared. So? What you thinkin'?
Alright, mark your buddy's stash in my PDA.
Hell with you, I'll take your word... Tell me where the stash on Garbage is. It's closer to go.
I'd rather get mine here and now, 'cause lookin' for these stashes - hell if you'll find 'em. Give me the artifact and let's split.
No good, staying with our own then.
A-alright, now. Hold your mobile steady. Well, like here...\nListen, I see you're a business guy. Got another deal for me, need to discuss... Just between us though.
Here, take it. Good artifact, though slightly... worn. Anyway, it'll be useful to ya.\nListen, I see you're a business guy. Got another deal for me, need to discuss... Just between us though.
Hold up with your deals. I need to dash somewhere on business.
What did you want? Just keep in mind, I ain't lookin' for your junk. Make your slackers work, I ain't a bloodhound.

Nah... Different deal here. We should get movin' from here already, past the Bar, closer to Limansk. 'Cause here Borov's grabbin' everything for himself and the soldiers got all stirred up... No opportunities at all.
So, made up your mind?
Wait a bit. I'm waitin' for word from one bro. When it works out, then we'll decide.
A bit? Uh-huh...
I'm here with greetings from one of yours.
Ours? From who?
So get movin'. Or you need me to hold your hand?
Wait... Why you so jumpy? Need someone in the Bar to put in a good word for me and the guys, so they let us through, don't mess with us. We'd like to pass, just quietly, no fuss, and that's all...
Me?! Put in a word for you? Who's gonna listen to me? You're all the same... face to Duty guys. They won't even bother with ceremonies with you.

Don't say that. Someone vouched for Rat, now they say he sits in the Bar like one of their own, and he had dealings with Borov too. Must've paid someone well for protection. That's what I'm talkin' about: you go to the Bar and ain't at odds with Borov either. You walk both there and here. I suggest you pass something to the deputy of the Duty boss.
Who's that?
Yeah there's one... Ivantsov - bastard if there ever was one, would strangle him given the chance. But we got no choice... Need to discuss with him and so their boss don't find out.
Some secrets. What's all this to me?

I told you about Crowbar, that he was in business with Strelok. Got an idea how to pull him from Duty turf. He won't bother us there past the Bar, and we'll screw Borov at the same time. So you'll discuss everything about Strelok after, and maybe he'll even hook you up with him if things go well... Well, ain't that enough for ya? I'll give you sumthin' else after, when the deal works out... All you gotta do is make an agreement.
Yeah... "all you gotta do". They'll nab me along with you guys. No way.
Too bad. Think about it, I won't hurt ya.
I'll think about it.
So what exactly do you need?
In short, I got somethin' on Borov... Duty guys are real mad at him, got their teeth in him.
And what's Ivantsov got to do with it and how's Crowbar involved? Well they're mad at Borov, but why should they let you through? I don't get somethin'...

What's there for you to get? They already figured it all out for ya... You just gotta pass it on, make a deal. Here's how it is: I can give up Borov's connections with the Duty leader. One of the Duty guys is Borov's man, a contact, get it? That's why we gotta discuss only with his deputy, understand? And also Borov keeps some Duty dude at his place, for some reason he needs him. Through my guys I can pull him out and hand him over to Duty in exchange for Crowbar. But only after we pass through, then we'll let him go.
So I'll be a hostage at Ivantsov's until you deign to let him go? I don't like somethin'.
You talk to him first, then we'll decide how to do it right so it's good for ours, yours, and you. I need guarantees too that they'll let us through.

What are my words to him? Someone, somewhere, about someone to someone said somethin'... You write on paper what you want from him, what you're offerin'. I'll pass it along when I get the chance. That'll be more reliable. And even better seal it, so he understands I'm not in the know, just a simple messenger...
What you pissin' yourself for? Alright. Here... pass him my note. You'll tell me later what and how.
That's different. But I'm not promisin' anything. Still unclear how he'll react.
Here's the deal... One guy from Dark Valley asked me to pass a note.
"One guy"? You're being shady, Marked One. Well, what's in there?
I'm not being shady. Everything's as it is, that's what I'm saying. Read this.
I-i-i see...\nBlah-blah-blah and all that... The gist: Someone from Borov's crew wants to split off. Writes that our man is held captive by Borov. You know about this?
No. I'm just a messenger, your conflicts don't concern me.
I only know from Liuber's words: someone from his group really got captured. That's all.
I thought you were already aware. Saw one there. Hairy, I think, is his nickname.
I knew about one, Hairy. But they killed him, I think.
Alright, we'll find out. Don't talk much about this. Or you know yourself, who knows what people might think... Take this small present from me and forget about this business. Deal?

So someone from Liuber's group, right? That's good... I mean - good that there's a chance to get our comrade out. Good news.\nDon't talk much about this. Or you know yourself, who knows what people might think about you, having dealings with scumbags and all that... Take this small present from me and forget about this business. Deal?

So Seryoga Hairy is alive? We'll definitely pull him out...\nDon't talk much about this. Or you know yourself, who knows what people might think about you, having dealings with scumbags and all that... Take this small present from me and forget about this business. Deal?

They killed Seryoga? Bastards! I'll make inquiries through my channels. Maybe there's someone else there.\nDon't talk much about this. Or you know yourself, who knows what people might think about you, having dealings with scumbags and all that... Take this small present from me and forget about this business. Deal?
Sort it out yourselves. My hut's on the edge.
You coming to me, dove?
Mmm... Yeah, just looking around.
Looking around? Well-well... I'm Sultan, I can hook you up with very, very rare guns. If you're interested, of course. Who are you?
Marked One. In principle, wouldn't hurt to have something unique for these parts. Got such a thing?

Know the saying about Greece? Well, almost about me. Got some models that not only don't lie around on the road, but you'll only find at my place in the whole Zone. Both Russian and Western. Everything comes down to your desire... and your capabilities. Keep in mind, blue-wing, payment is strictly in fresh artifacts. Which ones exactly - depends on the chosen goods. Get it?
Alright, I'll think about it... See ya for now.
Marked One! Still interested in guns?
Sultan, let's be specific, what can you offer?
No, just dropped by...
You're something! We already agreed! Don't wiggle your ass like a waitress... Be a man! Said it - do it.
Alright, don't grumble... Said it, so it'll be that way.

What exactly do you want to get?
Submachine gun?
Shotgun or carbine?
Assault rifle or machine gun?
Large-caliber sniper and automatic weapons?
Optics?
Submachine gun? Those small automatics? For pistol ammo?
Well show me, what shotguns and carbines you're offering.
I want to look at assault rifles and machine guns.
Large-caliber? Wow! Well, let's see...
Let's look at the optics...
Exactly! Small automatics... Here, look:\nHK UMP45\nTDI KRISS Vector
Currently in stock:\nSaiga-12M Carbine\nRemington 870 (FD) Shotgun

So, here's the list, choose:
AK-103
FN F2000 Tactical (FDE) Assault Rifle
RPK-74(P) Machine Gun
PKM Tactical Machine Gun
MG36 Machine Gun

Got NATO and ours, see for yourself:
SV-98 Rifle
AWM-F Rifle
SVD Rifle
FN SCAR-H Rifle
SVU-A Rifle
SR-3M "Vykhr" Assault Rifle

Got NATO and ours, see for yourself:
1P78 "Kashtan" Shooting Scope
Aimpoint Micro T-1 Collimator
Barska ELECTRO SIGHT AC10632
HK Schmidt Bender Optical Scope
ELCAN DR Optical Scope
PSO-1 Optical Scope (4x magnification)
What's the Vykhr like?
UMP? How's it performed in the Zone?
TDI KRISS Vector? Something new...
Maybe take the "Bizon"? What do you advise?
Saiga-12M Carbine? How are the reviews?
Saiga? How are the reviews?
What's this Remington 870 (FD)?
SVU-A? How's it performed?
Maybe take the AK-103? What do you advise?
FN F2000 Tactical (FDE) Assault Rifle? Interesting for stalkers?
What's this RPK-74(P)? Interesting for stalkers?
Let me look at the PKM Tactical, maybe I'll take it.
SV-98M? What kind of beast is that?
AWM-F? How's it performed in the Zone?
Our weapons seem the most reliable. SVD is a famous gun...
MG36 Machine Gun? What do they say about it?
SCAR-H? Probably finds the target itself?
Good gun! Look what the specialists write about it:
None of those I got it for complained. Look for yourself:
Excellent gun! You definitely won't regret it.
Advising ain't my business... You look at the characteristics:
Of course you've heard! Such a carbine protects its owner itself, but the price for it...
Saiga - it's Saiga even in Africa!
Kidding? Excellent peashooter! I got a description here too:
Good gun! Reliable, but see for yourself:
I'd advise taking it, nobody's complained yet...
Take it, take it... New development! A miracle, not a weapon:
If you've piled up a bunch of ammo, then it's perfect!
Take it, you won't regret it. Good gun:
Latest development. I got a description here too:
For special tasks it's indispensable! Our specialists always take it:
SVD - it's SVD even in Africa. New model! Read what's written:
Everyone would want one, but not everyone can get it... Look at the parameters:
Take it, newest development! A miracle, not a weapon:
Alright, agreed! I'll take it, what do you want for it?
Good, deal! What do you want for it?
Eh, agreed. What you asking for it?
I agree. How much will it cost me?
Nice parameters, you convinced me... How to get it?
Yeah, won't regret it... And what exactly won't I regret?
Apparently really good! How to get it?
Would be useful to me too, how much does it cost?
I'll take it! When and with what should I come?
I want one! What are you taking for it?
Nobody died? What will it cost me?
Alright, agreed! I'll take it, what do you want for it?
Good, deal! What do you want for it?
I agree. How much will it cost me?
Nice parameters, you convinced me... How to get it?
Yeah, won't regret it... And what exactly won't I regret?
You convinced me! Wrap it up.
Alright, agreed! I'll take it, what do you want for it?
Good, deal! What do you want for it?
I agree. How much will it cost me?
Nice parameters, you convinced me... How to get it?
Yeah, won't regret it... And what exactly won't I regret?
So, let me look some more...
Not bad, but I'll go for now...

Business talk! In general, you should understand yourself: no point dragging such guns to the Zone for ordinary artifacts. So special ones are needed, from modificates. For this specific gun any from the series:
Got it, I'll find an artifact - I'll bring it. Get the gun ready.
Uh, where to get such a thing... I'll think about it more.

Don't rush, you're too hasty. You think I like dragging rare artifacts through half-zones? I'll inform who needs to know about your agreement. Take the artifact to my people - they've stopped at Forgotten Village for now, I think you'll find the way. Make arrangements with them about the process of getting it... Yes, and keep in mind: the artifact must be in excellent condition, so that a fly, as they say... does nothing. Got it? And let's also make sure there's no confusion like: "I want, I don't want, I changed my mind..." You agreed - I ordered! Period.
And where will I look for the path to this Village?
Why look for it. On Garbage, beyond the vehicle graveyard there's a gully, that's where the path to the Village starts in the woods. Don't forget about the deal.
Everything will be fine...
I'll come another time, tight on artifacts...
No, I'll manage for now...
"Kashtan"? I'll take it......
ELCAN? I'll take it of course...
PSO-1? I'll take it I suppose...
March Tactical? I'll take it...
Oh, Aimpoint Micro T-1, come on...
Barska ELECTRO SIGHT AC10632? What a name... Come on!
HK Schmidt Bender - this, judging by the name, is for a Heckler rifle? Just what I need.
1P78 shooting scope, for any modificate... Agreed?
This scope for any mezomodificate... Agreed?
This scope for any two 2nd level artifacts... Agreed?
Come on, what can you do...
ELCAN DR optical scope, I'll give for any mezomodificate... Will you take it?
Come on, why not...
PSO-1 optical scope, only for any of the mezomodificates... Well, taking it?
Hand it over of course.....
March Tactical optical scope, if you have a hypermodificate in stock... Deal?
And my heart stopped beating, you convinced me....
Hi! Bro... Haven't seen you before. What's your name?
What's with this "hi-ing"... Can't you talk normally?
Listen, do you need this? I came and I'm leaving...
Come on, why so angry? You'd have a drink, relax... We're being friendly to you, and you...
Well-well... The Zone's small... Today you turn your back on me, tomorrow I won't help.
Not in the mood... Death all around, and you're "hi-ing" here. I'm Marked One.
Alright, I'm Marked One. I'll manage somehow on my own.
Well there, now I know...
Instead of all this "Hi-no-hi".
Marked One, what brings you to us? Notice! Not "hi-ing"...
That's right! Just dropped in to look around.
You better tell me this - haven't you met any soldiers here... deserters?

No, haven't seen any... The Village is generally small, maybe they're sitting in some basement or attic, not showing their noses. But without water and food they wouldn't last long. They'd have shown up already, if monsters didn't eat them first.
That's true... There's plenty small critters here.
Ah! It's you, Marked One! Sultan contacted us, said you need a decent gun...
Yeah, that's why I dragged myself here to you guys. So what? How do I get the order?
So, Sultan informed about what you ordered. Did you bring the needed artifact? You were warned that we're only interested in fresh artifacts, right? Keep the worn ones for yourself.
Haven't gotten it yet...
I have a modificate. Here, take it... Where's my gun?
I got a mezomodificate, take it... Where's the weapon?
See? Hypermodificate! Well? Deal?
I cooked up an Absolute! Cool? Take it... Give me the weapon!
You should understand yourself - ZONE! Few dare to venture far. Anyway, your order is completed, but you need to pick it up yourself. Take a little walk...

What the hell, guys, have you completely lost it! What kind of scam is this? I walked here from Sultan, now you're sending me even further. You took the artifact, so provide the goods. Otherwise while I'm walking around you'll manage to disappear, try finding you later...
To Cordon! That's how much walking! Three days to get there...
Why three days? You'll get there in three-four hours... Go out through the ravine by the pole and head straight east... There's your Cordon... Easy!
In the Swamp? How to get there faster? Walking around - couple days will pass!
Why walk around? Go out and head south immediately, pass through the old gates, then along the path, and you'll come out right to the village... There they are - the Swamp...
In the Swamp? How to get there faster? Walking around - couple days will pass!
Why walk around? Go out and head south immediately, pass through the old gates, then along the path, and you'll come out right to the village... There they are - the Swamp...

Don't yell, this ain't a toy store with home delivery. We can't keep all the goods on ourselves, isn't it clear what we explained? Don't worry - everything's taken care of and arranged, we're a solid outfit, nobody complained. You'll find your order where indicated, and you'll thank us for hiding it so reliably. So that's it, topic closed. Payment received - pick up the goods anytime.
Hello, Marked One. How are you? Sorry I dragged out our meeting for so long. Believe me, I had good reasons.

Well, hello. I was already planning to go to you myself, thankfully they told me where to find you. I have a ton of questions. But let's go in order.\nI read your note in the Agroprom underground. You were there and said something to me, right?
Yes, I visited, but... You were badly shell-shocked, Marked One. You were delirious. And said strange things. Strelok once said very similar things...
So you knew Strelok? Why didn't you say anything before?
We were never friends. Met a few times, no more than that. So I couldn't tell you much about Strelok anyway. Where he is now - I don't know. Nobody's seen him in the Zone for a long time.
Suppose so. And what did I say in delirium?

Mostly all kinds of incoherent stuff... about the Monolith. Very strange. Right before trouble happened to Fang, he told me that Strelok talked to him about the Monolith and also about some fragment of the Monolith. I didn't understand him then. And Ghost said that Strelok met with some Ivar and asked him about cases of psychosis and hallucinations connected to the Monolith or its fragment. He said that Strelok got this idea that the Monolith is just an illusion or it creates some kind of illusion itself... something like that.

Speaking of Ivar. You recently visited him at the Bar, as I understand? He's gotten a bit better, if you're interested. From his words, he gave you some of Strelok's notes and other papers, right? I need them.

I'm glad Ivar is recovering. And the notes... That's saying a lot, perhaps. More like excerpts from something. Probably part was lost, or Strelok himself didn't give everything, only what he considered necessary. Ivar couldn't explain it well. Or why he decided to give me these papers at all. Possibly he feared his consciousness would completely leave him or someone would take them while he was unconscious. You must read them.
I'll read them, of course. And in a nutshell - is there anything about Dark Valley and the laboratory beneath it?

Seems like that was in a separate folder. It had papers right from some laboratory. Can't say more precisely, too complicated for me.
