Have no idea where Strelok could have gotten it, but it came to Ivar along with other notes from him specifically.\nAnd you know... Strange things, to put it mildly, are described there. But it becomes clear why Ivar decided he was wrong to turn off the "Scorcher". If he took these fragments of information as truth, then his desire to return everything as it was is quite understandable.
What do you mean?

I get the impression that these aren't Strelok's notes, but rather excerpts from some newspaper, or scientific report, or his conversation with someone. I initially thought it was drafts of a fantasy story. Such... unusual things are described there. But if you compare what's written there with various information we have about the Zone now, everything looks quite plausible. One could assume it's someone's hypothesis and only that. And not necessarily Strelok's own.

Yeah... And how do you think Strelok could have gotten all these plans, blueprints, schemes and other stuff concerning the "Scorcher"? One nerd told me it was a secret facility before, and information about it can only be found in special archives. And there it might lie classified for half a century. Wait... What if Strelok is some kind of agent? That would explain a lot...

Yeah... And how do you think Strelok could have gotten all these plans, blueprints, schemes and other stuff concerning the "Scorcher"? I think you can't find information about such facilities in open access. It's surely secret and all that. Wait... What if Strelok is some kind of agent? That would explain a lot...
Come on, what kind of security agent is he? Of course, he had various oddities about him, but believe me, he doesn't look like a special service operative. He was too... not of this world, somehow.

You said it yourself! What if Strelok is just a regular psycho? Or not quite regular, but nonetheless, one of the same patients as Ivar. Made up all kinds of nonsense and leads people by the nose... Although no. I don't believe this version myself.
Stop it! Don't get worked up. Though we rarely saw each other with Strelok, he always seemed like a very reasonable person to me. Instead of building empty hypotheses, better do something practical.

You're probably right. Alright, we'll solve problems as they come. First need to figure out the papers you gave me and find a way to start the "Scorcher" again. I have a good consultant in mind at the Bar who can help with this.
Right approach, constructive. Good luck!
Hello, Marked One... Come in, we'll have some tea.
Good to see you.
There, on Agroprom, you wrote that you need to "lay low", what does that mean?

Yes... You were in bad shape, and I thought it was better to write. But I wouldn't have left you if I hadn't seen that everything would be fine with you. That's why I described how to get out of there quickly and unnoticed. And I really needed to meet with Ghost, then urgently disappear for a while.
I don't understand what kind of urgencies these are?
The Zone, it's all the Zone... Sometimes we learn more about what's happening in it than someone would like. So I accidentally learned what I shouldn't have, as the "leaders" considered.
What leaders? Duty leadership? They seem to accept you normally at the Bar.

No. I don't want to drag you into this either... You see, the Zone for some people isn't a mystery of nature, but an ordinary raw material resource. And a resource that's apparently limitless. After all, the "raw materials" - artifacts - are constantly born in it out of nowhere, nothing needs to be done for development, just collect and get crazy profits, paying crumbs to collectors. But as always in this world, where big money smells, big problems begin. Of course, a limitless resource can't remain uncontrolled. Division of spheres of influence happens, contracts, pacts, agreements, force solutions finally. And so on. Everything as usual in our world. And as usual, you can't see the forest for the trees, and from below you don't see who's pulling the strings up there. And while you remain a cog and don't see how and why the whole mechanism works, they don't notice you either.
And you, it seems, learned something about those who wind these clocks and don't let them stop?

If I had learned about that, I think we wouldn't have met for a long time. I just accidentally found out something about certain "scientists" and relationships between supposedly "factions" that are actually all the same springs in a well-oiled mechanism for collecting raw resources. But... Thank God, everything settled down already, and I wouldn't want to raise this topic again. For your and my safety.
Yeah, things... I was thinking myself that not everything's clean here. Well, to hell with all of them, I have my own problems up to my neck.
The artifact you left for Fang to move through the teleport, what can you tell me about it?

Any artifact, even completely useless at first glance, has some properties. The main property of "Compasses" is that many teleport bubbles respond to them, including the one I wrote to you about in the note.
Uh... Remind me how it was.

Well... Seems like the whole Zone is covered with some "wormholes", subspace tunnels. Some can be used. For this you need to "tune" the artifact and activate it on your belt. Then you enter the beginning of the tunnel - it's usually visible - sort of a translucent sphere - and it transports you to the end of the tunnel. True, the artifact itself "discharges" in the process, but the "charge" is enough for several transitions.
Yes, that's clear. And how to tune the artifact? And how to "recharge" it again, you mentioned this?

I know little about this. Ghost said that any arrangement of "Compass" crystals works for teleporting from here to the stash under Agroprom. But for other teleports it might not work.\nAs for "charging", this can be done at a special place in Red Forest. "Charging" - that's just how I put it. After all, I don't understand what happens to it and why this "wormhole" responds to it afterwards. Many mysteries in the Zone.
What kind of place for "charging"? And what needs to be done?
You need to place the artifact in the center of a former anomaly, something like a circle with mangled edges remained from it. I think an hour is enough.
Hmm. I see. I'll try it sometime.
I greet you, stalker... What do you seek in this world of evil and mercy?
Uh... Why are you being so grandiose?

I mourn for the innocently slain... For immature souls that have fallen into the temptation of evil and greed. But I also rejoice for those who feel the strength within themselves to overcome this earthly pain and reach a new level of understanding unity with the mind of the universe...\nWho are you? Are you capable of accepting and knowing revelation?
I-I don't know! I remember nothing from my past life. They called me Marked One. Here's the mark on my hand, because of it... And who are you?

Don't grieve over absent memories! The time will come - everything will return... Call me Diodor. Some say Father Diodor! But I don't think names mean anything to one who sees with inner vision...\nI will pray for you, Marked One. For there is strength in you!\nGo and find what you seek, and do what you must! This is my blessing to you...
Listen... father. What does your... uh... religion say about a person who has lost their memory? Maybe there's some prayer for such a case that would help?

I understand what you're talking about... In any difficulty a person faces - whether spiritual or physical - sincere prayer with true faith in the heart will provide help and do its work. But you must not forget that a person doesn't fall into difficult circumstances simply by someone's evil whim, he himself is the cause of his difficulties. His sins, his evil deeds lead to this. But this also instills hope and confidence, for if you got yourself into it, then you yourself will find the way out... There are many ways to fall, but there is one sure path to salvation...
Alright, alright, I already understood that there is salvation... How these religious figures love to explain everything so confusingly... I'll go. Farewell.
Father Diodor, then. I think there's no other priest in these parts?
I'm not a priest, I just worry about human souls... What do you need a priest for? Church rituals aren't dogma, the holy spirit is within everyone, you just need to see it...
There's this guy. He buried a friend recently. Says maybe you'll meet someone who can pray for his soul, asks to come to the church in the Swamp...
Well then... Care for the deceased is a good deed. I will direct my steps to where I'm needed. May you also have the strength to see wisdom beneath the surface grime. Go in peace...
Alright, I'm going. Farewell...
Be well, my son... What need leads you through these dreary places? There's no good here... Only injustice...
Hello, hello, still preaching? Don't see particularly many followers?

Man is blind... And too vain... The time will come - they will see clearly! But for some it will be too late! No one will even remember those who have departed. Souls and hearts grow callous! They don't feel the divine breath.
They will see clearly, you say... How can one feel it, this breath?
Everyone feels it differently. But the great Deity breathes. And its breath is the cycles of life and death. Everything in the world is subject to them. You will feel His exhale.
Uh-huh. And with it my last breath? *knock on wood*... Alright, maybe something will be revealed to me too.
I think there's no other priest in these parts?
I'm not a priest, I just worry about human souls... What do you need a priest for? Church rituals aren't dogma, the holy spirit is within everyone, you just need to see it...
There's this guy. He buried a friend recently. Says maybe you'll meet someone who can pray for his soul, asks to come to the church in the Swamp...
Well then... Care for the deceased is a good deed. I will direct my steps to where I'm needed. May you also have the strength to see wisdom beneath the surface grime. Go in peace...
Alright, I'm going. Farewell...
Mind of the universe, be with you! Marked One!
Thanks for the kind word...
I greet you, stalker... What do you seek in this world of evil and injustice?
Uh... Why are you being so grandiose? And what happened here?

I mourn for the innocently slain... For immature souls that have fallen into the temptation of evil and greed. But I also rejoice for those who feel the strength within themselves to overcome this earthly pain and reach a new level of understanding unity with the mind of the universe...\nWho are you? Are you capable of accepting and knowing revelation?
I-I don't know! I remember nothing from my past life. They called me Marked One. Here's the mark on my hand, because of it... And who are You?

Don't grieve over absent memories! The time will come - everything will return... Call me Diodor. Some say Father Diodor! But I don't think names mean anything to one who sees with inner vision...\nI will pray for you, Marked One. For there is strength in you!\nGo and find what you seek, and do what you must! This is my blessing to you...
Listen... father. What does your... uh... religion say about a person who has lost their memory? Maybe there's some prayer for such a case that would help?

I understand what you're talking about... In any difficulty a person faces - whether spiritual or physical - sincere prayer with true faith in the heart will provide help and do its work. But you must not forget that a person doesn't fall into difficult circumstances simply by someone's evil whim, he himself is the cause of his difficulties. His sins, his evil deeds lead to this. But this also instills hope and confidence, for if you got yourself into it, then you yourself will find the way out... There are many ways to fall, but there is one sure path to salvation...
Alright, alright, I already understood that there is salvation... How these religious figures love to explain everything so confusingly... I'll go. Farewell.
Peace to you, Marked One... May light touch your soul...
Light? What light? I'm looking for Strelok...
Strelok made peace with himself, and now he is no longer the same. And you too are not the same... And therefore we all go toward awareness of our chosen nature... Go and seek...
Mmm-yeah... Alright, I'll go.
Good to you, Marked One, and may your soul not desire evil.
Good... I don't see any good yet, just evil all around.

There's much evil, yes. But what people call good also grows in human souls as a tender shoot... Here you did good - helped calm the restless shade of a beardless youth who left this world before his time. This is small good. But! Good nonetheless! And from such seeds will grow and ripen the field of human happiness. Maybe not immediately, maybe we won't live to see the fruits, but it will be and it will be boundless... It simply cannot be otherwise...
So why do good if there's no benefit from it?

There is benefit, it's just that a person cannot see all the consequences that follow his choice as he follows his path. Life doesn't consist of momentary acts of retribution. Every string of being that you touch creates its chord, which weaves into the symphony of the great mystery of existence. And the sum of these chords can be so beautiful that a person will be given a sense of belonging to a universe of blessings. A universe from which one can take infinitely...
Well yeah, like "I will repay all" and all that... But where is it?
Right here... Look around, ask yourself: what do I want?
Uh... I want? Probably to find myself.

There. You expressed what your small good deed rewards you with. You found a piece of yourself. The sum of these pieces will give you complete finding... Or would it be better to receive "thirty pieces of silver" for good? Think about it...
I'll think about it, alright...
Peace to you, Marked One... I remember, you wanted to find Strelok?
Well yes. I wanted. Rather - I want. Any information?

Strelok went through a portal. The one that opens only to the chosen. This portal is right there - in the very heart of the apocalypse... The Entity opens it. This Entity is not from our world. Stalkers call it - MONOLITH. If you want to understand yourself - turn to the Entity...
Mmm-yeah... Those are just rumors...
Rumors are never born from nothing. Believe and accept. There is someone who came from there. And who told me this truth. Just don't ask - who. That cannot be the right path.
Monolith? Oh, father... Alright, I'll go.
When you're "there" - you'll get what you seek. And whether "Marked One" remains - only you will decide.
Yes. Me. To decide.
Listen, what's this truck? Looks like it arrived recently?
Yeah, appeared quite recently. With these trucks it's generally unclear what... they appear, disappear.
How so?

Yeah, it happened before. About a month or two ago another truck appeared, came whistling from somewhere near Radar, passed the checkpoint and almost drove to the warehouses. Stopped right at the gates, suddenly stopped just like that... and silence. Our guys went to see what kind of weirdo it was, but there was nobody behind the wheel. What a thing! They wanted to use it, brought gasoline, looked, but there was nowhere to pour it. That is, it's like a toy, only big - outside it's a truck, but inside it's solid... not metal, but sort of like... can't even explain. Unclear how it even drove. Miracles... They say there's such an anomaly - called "Labyrinth". That's where such "miracles" sometimes appear from... Anyway, go to our Cook, he was saying something about those "Labyrinths". While drunk, true, but still... Sometimes even he has bright thoughts.
And then what?

Nothing. It just stood there, for about a week probably. And one morning everyone rubbed their eyes, looked, and the truck was gone... vanished, as if it dissolved, only some slime remained in that spot... took a long time to dry. And who could have taken it away? Or maybe it vanished by itself. Came by itself - left by itself. So we're waiting now to see what happens with this truck.
I didn't understand about "like a toy", no motor at all?

Well yeah... Why are you pestering me about your truck anyway! Don't you have anything else to do?\nIf you're bored, then go check one place. It's not far... on Radar. If you go by road, you'll come to a fork. There aren't many beasts there, they mainly live in the forest. At the crossroads turn north, there the road leads to an old tunnel. The "Brain Scorcher", with its radiation, doesn't reach there, you can pass freely. That's where you need to visit.
What do I need it for? You could go yourself.
If I could go myself, I wouldn't ask you. So how about it?
On Radar?! No way. I'm not ready for such heroics.
And what to look for there? Can you be more specific.

Several days ago, our fighters went that way. They should have returned by now, but they're still not here. Hope that they're alive is slim, of course, but still. Would like to know what happened there. They took a PKM with them, if you happen to find it, bring it back. I won't forget the favor. It's tough here without it. You can see yourself how many beasts come from Radar.
Deal. If I find out or find something, I'll drop by.

Cap, the Freedom commander at the Barrier, asks to check the old tunnel in the northern part of Radar where their fighters went. Need to find out what happened there. If I happen to find the PKM, need to return it to the Barrier.
I'm here about your request, about the radar tunnel.
And what's there? Did you see anything?
Nothing there. Just mutants and radiation.
I saw your fighters. They had bad luck, all dead. A family of burers made that tunnel their home.
Pity, great pity. Wanted to commemorate them, like humans. But so... we'll consider - the Zone took them.
Did you find anything or just bodies?
Everything can be blamed on it. See ya.

Found... PKM machine gun, couple boxes for it, grenades, medicine, provisions... Looks like a military depot. Seems it wasn't their first time there. Don't you want to say anything? Very interesting what they were looking for there.

What do you want to know? Yes, they went, and not once. But I didn't send them there. Why they went - I can only guess. And the one who knows won't tell you. Better not to ask. Remember what happened to curious Varvara. So understood?\nAnd that little machine gun was good support for us. Return it... I ask as a brother.
Nasty organization you have, as I see it.

Oh, a moralist showed up. We're not like that, life is like that. Especially here, where you and I stand. And we're part of this nasty life.\nAlright, no lectures. For the machine gun I can give a recipe how to get the "Crystal Soul" modificate. If you don't need it, then I offer an artifact, rather a capsule... found it in the swamp yesterday. Decide.
Take your machine gun and give me the recipe. I'll see what comes of it.
Give me the capsule and take your iron, it's pulled down all my shoulders.
You'll manage without the machine gun. Freedom, damn you...
Don't get too ambitious. After all, I didn't drive you beyond the Barrier... Sent the recipe to your PDA. And don't be offended.
Don't get too ambitious. After all, I didn't drive you beyond the Barrier... Take the capsule. I sense there's an excellent artifact inside. And don't be offended.
I'll go, "getting ambitious"... he says.
I'm here about that matter you talked about.
Made up your mind? I already went myself.
Went yourself?! So maybe there was something there after all, eh?
Maybe there was... what's it to you? You didn't go when I asked.
Well yeah, but still...
I need to reload my flamethrower.
What, your hands withered away? Can't change the canister yourself?
I don't have a canister. That's why I came to you. Prapor said you can help with this.

Well, say so right away then. Canisters with mixture, as you probably guess, aren't bought often, and it's dangerous stuff, this hellchemistry, so I don't keep more than one at my place. If they buy one, I make an order and within a day they bring me a new one. Right now I happen to have a canister in stock. Will you take it?
Well, what to do with you, sickly? I already explained about the canisters.
I came for the canister. Just expressed myself poorly.
However you express yourself, I can't help - there's been no "delivery" yet.
And I was thinking - hello again. Alright, I have the goods.
Got it. I'll come by later then.
Here, take your thousands.
I have a simple little artifact, take it.
Turns out expensive. Maybe you'll give a discount for old friendship?
Yeah, alright. Take the canister with fire mixture, and watch it, be careful, don't shake it, or it'll blow right here...
If I start giving discounts to everyone like this, I'll very soon be left with a bare ass. In short, no profit - no talk.
My PDA croaked...
So? Such trouble happens. And you really need it?
Yes, I'm used to it. Convenient money calculations, has a map, and I wrote down some things for memory... Maybe it can be... repaired?
Repaired? That, brother, is not for me. If you really need it - I'll get you a new one, not a fly sat on it! And just a couple simple artifacts. No? Then no...
Alright, here's a couple little artifacts.
I'd better look for someone to repair it...

Well, that's right. Here, take this. Don't mind that it's a bit scratched, and there's a stain on the back.
Blood, or what?
Come on, it's not for showing off! It works - that's fine!
I entered you in the database, now this will be your identifier.
Well, take it...
I need a new PDA. I... lost my old one.
It happens. To newcomers I give them free, of course, but you already got one. The second will cost you just a couple simple artifacts.
No problem. Here, take these.
Wow! I'll think about whether I need it for such a price...
Wait... This one won't turn on, let's try another... So, yeah. Done, I entered you in the database, now this will be your identifier.
Listen, old man, here's the thing: I'm looking for one item, seems like your work.
Yeah? And what is it?
A notebook, electronic. I was told you apparently made such things.

Ahem... Didn't think anyone would still be interested in them. About a month and a half ago one stalker somewhere found a bunch of non-working old model smartphones, brought them to me, so I converted several into electronic notepads with expanded memory. But who needs such things? Text information is easier to store in PDA. Everything you need is at hand there.
Well, consider that I needed such a device. Maybe you'll sell one?
Are you kidding? In all this time I only managed to sell one, gave away the rest. First to acquaintances, then just to whoever wanted them.
Damn! Really not one left? Got my hopes up, turns out...

You need it that badly? Actually, there's one option. In that single gadget I managed to sell, number eight if memory serves, by the buyer's request I installed a special beacon for geolocation. Sort of like, so it could be found in case of loss. But it seemed to me it was for some other purpose. Be that as it may, I know the working frequency. I even took coordinates several times out of curiosity. I can try to get current ones now. If it works out, you can use them to find the buyer and talk him into reselling the notepad to you.
Nothing else left anyway, so go ahead, act. What will I owe?

I have some conscience, such as it is. I said I gave away these notepads for free, so I won't take anything from you. Now wait a bit while I catch the signal...\nAha, found it! You're lucky, it's quite close to our village. Now I'll drop the coordinates. Done.

I have some conscience, such as it is. I said I gave away these notepads for free, so I won't take anything from you. Now wait a bit while I catch the signal...\nHmm... No signal. Maybe the battery just died, or maybe something worse happened. Wait... I'm dropping the last tracked coordinates. The chance is small, of course, that you'll catch the buyer at this location, since several days have passed, but it's near our village. I'd take a walk if I were you. If you do manage to get the notepad but in non-working condition, bring it over. Maybe I'll revive it.
Thanks! Stay healthy, Vergas!
I found that electronic notepad by your tip. Only it doesn't work, as expected. Will you take a look?
Let's have a look. So you made a deal with the owner? How is he?
No deal whatsoever. I took the device off a dead bandit's body. Here it is, take it.\nSomething tells me this ain't the buyer you were talking about at all.

A bandit? No, the buyer looked like a regular stalker. Let's hope he just got robbed and is still alive.\nSo, what do we have here? As I thought, the battery is damaged. Flooded with something. And it's specific here, won't fit one from, say, a PDA.\nI know that several smartphones from which I cooked up these notepads ended up with Sidorovich. Maybe he still hasn't pawned them off on anyone or tossed them. Go ask him. I'll only need the battery.
Got it. I'll have words with that cheapskate.
Vergas said some stalker brought you smartphones about a month and a half ago. I need a battery from one of those smartphones.
What do you need it for? Got the same thing and it croaked? Want a replacement? Regular phones don't work in the Zone anyway. Practically. Or are you running games on it?
Why is my business. Just tell me - you got one or not?
Gimme any artifact like a Jellyfish, Wrenched, or same class, and you'll have your battery. Still lying around in the storeroom.
Hold on, let me check what I got for artifacts.
I'm here for that smartphone battery. Remember, we had a talk?
I remember. And do you remember the price?
Wouldn't have come otherwise. Take the artifact.
We agreed on a simple artifact, I think... Wait, let me double-check what I got.
A king's word is harder than peas! Take it.
I made a deal with Sidor, got a new battery for repairing the notepad. Here.

Yes, exactly the one I need. Good thing that old scammer didn't con you by slipping something bogus. You don't know much about this stuff, as I understand.\nAlright, now give me about 15 minutes to quietly replace the battery and run tests.
No problem, I'll go get some fresh air.
What about that electronic notepad? Did you test it? Working?
I'm not done yet, wait a bit.
Yes, the device is in perfect order, only all the memory got wiped, so now it's completely clean. All yours.
Waiting.
Thanks, you saved me.
Greetings, respected... You've wandered quite far, we haven't seen a new face for several days. What should we call you?
Greetings. They call me Marked One. Yeah, didn't expect to meet so many people here. What are you researching?

Pleased to meet you. Valentin Nikolayevich, head of the monitoring group. Trying to get reliable data on mass-transportation anomalous phenomena. Also gathering additional statistics on the side. We're always short on working hands, so if you'd like to earn some money...
Ah! It's you, Marked One... What did you want?
Marked One, how good that you stopped by! We have strange things happening here. Perhaps you, as an experienced stalker, could help us...
So, did you manage to clarify the situation?
Good to see you, Marked One. Everything successful? Can I help you with anything?
Greetings, good man. Sit down... Maybe some tea?
Thank you. Won't refuse, I guess... What are you doing here?
Me? Well, this... I guide the youth who want to risk and find something that'll make life sweet as honey... I live nearby, beyond the Cordon. I'm Stepanych. Everyone here knows me!
So you're a guide? And know the reliable paths?

I know some things... can smell some things out, but there are places that even I don't go... And wouldn't let others either. This is the edge of that damned Zone, and all the dangers are known... Well, boars, dogs, those pigs... Of course they're not like normal ones anymore, but with a decent rifle and some skill - no problem taking them down... But there, further... Who knows...\nAnd what's your name?
Marked One... Something like that...
I see... Could've not asked, there's your name - written all over your face... You drink tea... Well, sorry, it'll get cold.
Greetings again... Still wandering around? Looking for something?
Still wandering around? Looking for something?
I need to get to the Cordon, could you show me?

Cough... I would, of course, show you just like that, I like you... But I got an old wife, daughter with two little ones - alone, without a man... I gotta help them. You give me some artifact, and I'll show you how to get to the Cordon safely... A good artifact... Got enough junk already...
Well I got one. Will third level do?
I got this dummy here...

There, that's just it. Don't be mad, son... Life's hard for us. Look here, you'll leave the hamlet this way, and go along this path... I put markers there. If it's red - go around to the left, and green - to the right... Remember that. Well, good luck...
Cunning, old man... Well alright, maybe we'll see each other again...
Greetings, son... Still can't find peace, I see? What are you looking for?
There should be a path to the military base, at Agroprom?
Dropped by to say hello. Still smoking, Stepanych...

Yes, there's such a path. I guided boys there... Only no one came back. So... I'll tell you straight - life's gotten hard. There are almost no artifacts left that you can get decent money for, and I gotta help my grandchildren... Their father ain't around... I ask you to give me an artifact for a safe path. A good artifact, expensive...
Got third level, will it do?
I got this dummy here.
Maybe you'll take a couple second levels?

Good. Wait! Now we can rest a bit... And the path... Look here - you know where that locomotive stands on the rails? Well, to the north... Pass it, and there, when there's a red marker, you take a bit to the right from it and go, and if it's green - go around to the left. If you see a blue one, be especially careful - some stalker died there... Well, God be with you...
I'll remember, farewell, Stepanych...
Come through, son... Have some tea... Good tea...
Thanks... I'll go further, maybe learn something new...
Well, look out. Be careful, maybe you'll stay alive...
Why are you wandering around at night? Better rest, or you'll find death in the dark somewhere...
What do you want? I'll get by perfectly fine without you! Goodbye!
Uh-huh...
Well, what? Going much further? Maybe let's go?
Not far, let's go...
I've seen some stalkers around here with old rubles...
Ah! You mean Soviet ones? Yeah... Main currency here in the Zone, I mean...
But that's not serious! The Union's been gone for almost thirty years...

Well how should I explain it to you...\nStalkers mainly come here to earn money. No one brings normal money with them. But you need to eat, drink, buy bullets... So we old-timers, so to speak, decided to use these old rubles. Back in the very beginning, when the first people climbed in here for artifacts, one respected person found a whole wagon with old Soviet rubles. Good paper - didn't deteriorate at all over all these years.
But you transfer money from PDA? And what do stalkers need these rubles for afterwards?

Eh, Marked One... This is the ZONE! How can you completely trust some electronic gadget! And about why need rubles afterwards, I'll tell you this - if you manage to earn a decent sum in these paper bills, come to me, I'll honestly write you a bearer check to one of the respectable banks. And you'll be able to get whatever currency is closer to your heart... Understand?
Hmm... I assume this isn't exactly a clean scheme... And how can I be sure you won't screw me over?

You seem like a grown man, but you're talking nonsense! Is my life really worth less to me than a dozen or two dollars... I've been sitting here for more than a year, and I'm alive, as you can see. That's the guarantee!\nIn general, decide for yourself, if you want to save your blood-earned money - come to me, I'll convert your paper bills for a small percentage...
We'll see, we'll see...
I want to convert rubles to hard currency.

Right decision! How much do you want to convert? Only let's do it like this: we won't mess around with small change, agreed? My exchange rate for now is - for 50 thousand rubles I'll write a check for a thousand dollars. Plus my percentage, naturally. Total... Hmm... I wish I had a surname like that! Alright. You got fifty-five grand on your account?
Got it, got it... Write it up.
You're taking too much percentage!
Don't have that much on my PDA...
The office writes! And Sidorovich does business! Here's your check. Don't lose it, it's bearer. I advise hiding it well - who knows!
What did you expect? Lady "Freebie" doesn't live in the Zone.
Well, when you have it - come by. You understand yourself: PDA is unreliable. Your encoding crashes - and consider there's nothing...
Alright, I'm off on business.
I need a bearer check in greenbacks. How about it, can we work something out?
Any whim for your money! You know my exchange rate? Check for a thousand dollars for 55 thousand rubles from your PDA, plus my percentage. Total: 60 thousand rubles. Got that much?
Yeah, got it. Write the check.
You're taking too much percentage!
Don't have that much...
Here you go! You can cash it anytime at this solid bank!
My job is to offer. Don't like it - find somewhere cheaper.
Come by when you get enough.
Alright, I'm off on business.
Nimble, what was that sawmill you mentioned?

Don't know?! In the Guts - that's what we call the area - there's an old sawmill, not far from the dirt road that leads to the destroyed overpass. There's like a small hunter base there. They shoot mutants on orders, and just like that - make stuffed animals. Fun folk, they distill moonshine - would raise the dead! What do they make it from? Don't even want to know, afraid it won't go down my throat...\nLast time I was going to the Cordon, I stopped by there to rest. Well, took a shot of rotgut, can't just sit by the fire with men dry. Ended up getting so plastered that I wandered off toward the gas station, and that's where I was lucky enough to stumble onto that stash, damn it...
What kind of stash? Judging by the look of it, you're not too happy with your find...
So it was you who found the green box with the jacket inside?

Not the find itself, but what happened after. You could say because of that stash I ended up captured by bandits, but I don't want to talk about it now. I found a cool jacket though. Sturdy, with chain mail lining. I already made a deal with one rookie in the village - he's willing to pay good money for it. Problem is, I gotta go get it first... Thing is, I had to drop it while running from blind dogs. But it's here, nearby, by the railway tunnel, well, the one you can get through to the old hospital, or was it a departmental sanatorium before - don't know exactly. Doesn't matter anyway. I feel awkward asking, but... would you agree to go look for my jacket? I still can't get over that story with the bandits...

Yeah. Good jacket, sturdy, with chain mail lining. I already made a deal with one rookie in the village - he's willing to pay good money for it. Just gotta go pick it up, probably still lying where I dropped it, by the railway tunnel, well, the one you can get through to the old hospital, or was it a departmental sanatorium before - don't know exactly. Doesn't matter anyway. Listen, I feel awkward asking, but... would you agree to go look for my jacket? I still can't get over that story with the bandits...
Wait, about this Sanatorium, can you properly explain how to get there? And where can you exit from it?
Wait, I'm a bit confused. You got out to the Cordon through this Sanatorium, right? How did you end up there?

I'm telling you: here, at the Cordon, you can get in through the railway tunnel if you're not afraid of getting a decent dose of radiation, of course. Also from the Guts, through the destroyed overpass. In the Sanatorium itself there's an inconspicuous door under the stairs, that's the exit back. Let me mark on your map the passages I know about, or you'll forget...\nThere. So about my jacket, will you help?

Obviously how. I came in from the Guts, through the destroyed railway bridge. Didn't I tell you already? And in the Sanatorium there's an inconspicuous door under the stairs, that's the exit back. Let me mark on your map the passages I know about, or you'll forget again...\nThere. So about my jacket, will you help?
And what's the point for me to mess with this? I already risked my head once getting you out of captivity, but there I at least had my own reasons. And now?

What you risked for me - I won't forget that, indebted till my grave. Now for this small favor from you, I offer good compensation: I got one stash for a rainy day, I'll tell you how to find it. Or you can take it in money. Or there's some gear - the guys shared. Fair enough?\nI should warn you right away - today the guy I made the deal with still has money, but tomorrow he might decide to blow it all somewhere, and then I'm screwed. So don't drag it out too much with the search, okay? Try to manage within a day. And one more thing. If you want to wear the jacket yourself, then show it to Vergas afterwards, let him patch it up and clean it if needed. Otherwise, I'm afraid the rookie might balk if I show him the goods all torn up and stained. Deal?
Alright. I'll try to take a look, but I'm not promising anything! Got any ideas where to start looking?
No. Too many conditions, and the payoff is questionable. Go get your own threads.
On the north side of the embankment there's a fallen tree. Look there. Good luck!
Your call, your call.
I'm about that jacket you lost.
What, found it? I wasn't even hoping anymore...
Yeah, found it where you described. Here.
Nice little jacket. I'll keep it for now.
You're the man! I got some money - about five grand. Or maybe you need a dosimeter to detect radiation? Then I'll throw in some batteries and anti-rad, in case you still manage to catch a dose.
Hmm, give me the dosimeter, it'll come in handy.
Better money, got some ideas...
You mentioned something about a stash...
Second time you're helping me out! Thanks! Take it!
Second time you're helping me out! Thanks! I'll transfer the money to your account now.

About the stash? Oh, right, I mentioned... Only it's not really mine. I overheard a conversation between two hunters. One was telling the other that he dropped a backpack with a good artifact when he was running from a herd of angry flesh.\nI didn't catch everything, but it's somewhere in the northern part of the Guts, not far from the road that leads to the Valley. Near a truck frame it's lying.\nThat hunter was later torn apart by dogs near the old regional committee dacha. Saw it myself when I was returning to the Cordon. I wanted to go look for that stash, would've come in handy for a rainy day. But then I figured screw it and spat on it. When I remember that last trip there and how it ended... Anyway, look for it yourself. And... thanks. Second time you're helping me out.

About the stash? Oh, right, I mentioned... Only it's not really mine. I overheard a conversation between two hunters. One was telling the other that he dropped a backpack with a good artifact when he was running from a family of angry boars.\nI didn't catch everything, but it's somewhere in the central part of the Guts, on a hill, northeast of the sawmill, by a power line tower.\nThat hunter was later torn apart by dogs near the old regional committee dacha. Saw it myself when I was returning to the Cordon. I wanted to go look for that stash, would've come in handy for a rainy day. But then I figured screw it and spat on it. When I remember that last trip there and how it ended... Anyway, look for it yourself. And... thanks. Second time you're helping me out.

About the stash? Oh, right, I mentioned... Only it's not really mine. I overheard a conversation between two hunters. One was telling the other that he dropped a backpack with a good artifact when he was running from a dozen angry rodents.\nI didn't catch everything, but it's somewhere on the road from the Guts to the Cordon, at the gas station, not far from the fuel pumps.\nThat hunter was later torn apart by dogs near the old regional committee dacha. Saw it myself when I was returning to the Cordon. I wanted to go look for that stash, would've come in handy for a rainy day. But then I figured screw it and spat on it. When I remember that last trip there and how it ended... Anyway, look for it yourself. And... thanks. Second time you're helping me out.
Yeah, the local dogs are scarier than wolves. Almost tore me apart myself.

Tell me about it. They don't even have eyes, but somehow they sense you. Oh, by the way! There's an artifact that scares them off, heard about such a thing? I don't know why, but when you hang such an art on your belt, the dogs scatter in fear. Our guys call it "Bubble" - it looks like a yellowish ball...
Holy crap! And where can I find one, you know?

Mmm... Well alright, you helped me after all. Basically, I saw one in the Sanatorium when I was crawling through there last time. Watched from afar a burer that seemed to be playing with just such an artifact. Burers love collecting all kinds of shiny things. Just watch out: going after a burer with bare hands is risky... Anyway, it's up to you. The artifact is certainly very useful for a stalker, I wouldn't refuse one myself.
You want to ask something?
I heard you've been to Yantar? Not planning to go there again?
Well, I've been... I'm planning to go many places, what did you want?
Need to pass a note to Sakharov. Nothing special - just a small list of items. He'll understand.
Go ahead, write it, I'll wait for now.
I'll write it right in front of you, don't go far.
Wait, what are you writing on? See, there's something written by hand on the back... Where did you get this paper?

What? Oh... Petrenko gave me the paper for various "technical" needs, ask him where he got it... don't interfere for now... So, here's everything - pass the note when you get a chance. Not urgent, but if there's an opportunity - definitely pass it, don't forget.
Alright. Let me read what's on the back for now.
Not now.
Well alright, I'll pass it with someone else...

Note to Sakharov from Docent. Nothing interesting, but on the back is a fragment of some letter.

"...Alyoshenka, son, you try not to stick your neck out there. I know it's silly to ask you, but understand me too - I heard they're shooting there. Lord, what's happening, it's a peaceful area - not some Iraq, and I can't find peace. Try to get assigned as a clerk somewhere, so God forbid some fool doesn't shoot you... Wait, here's father, wants to add something.

Alexei, son! Don't let us down, prove there that our breed is the best. Keep up the honor, don't stick your neck out, but know how to fight back. And mother is somewhat right too, we're waiting, but there are no letters from you. Not much time left now. Well, for now. Write more often..."
Docent asked me to pass a note, but he wrote it on the back of some letter, says you gave him the paper. Where from?

Well I gave it, so what? Our guys brought the paper from the Garbage, found some plastic bag. A bit wet, but they dried it - it's fine: what they gave for hygiene, and the blank pages were good for other business. What's it to you, you expecting a letter or something?
No, I don't have anyone to expect from. But maybe... I'd like to read it, maybe it would shed some light.
Light?.. Oh right, Barman told me something's wrong with your head, I completely forgot, sorry... Ask our guys at the Garbage, maybe they have some left - you can read it.
Unlikely... They have "hygiene" too. But I'll ask.
I saw in the messages that you go to Yantar?
Sometimes, to Yantar and other places. What's up?
I need to get to Yantar. To Sakharov.
What do you need him for? Even though stalkers chatter about Sakharov paying good money for artifacts, it's not entirely true.
Someone is very sick. And only Sakharov might know how to help.

Oh really? What a predicament... Alright, let's get to business. Let's make a deal - I need someone who could quickly run somewhere and talk about something. Then, for that same person, I could show how to get to Yantar. Understand?
More specifically? Somewhere is a flexible concept...

Here's how it is... You probably know about the hunter base, the one at the sawmill in the Guts... According to my information, they've recently started offering a nice alternative to these canned goods and sausage. I'm interested in: can they establish regular supplies and in what volume. Also - samples would be nice to taste. If you make a deal with them - I won't forget it. We, Duty, value the word of a real man!
I've heard this somewhere before... Agreed.
Maybe next time. I'm heading in the other direction now.
Colonel Petrenko, Duty's supply officer, asked me to bring sausage samples from the hunters in the Guts. In return, he promised to tell me about the road to Yantar
I talked to the hunters.
Took you long enough, I already sent someone else... But whatever, what's the story? Did you reach a consensus?
Seems like it, here, by the way, are samples of their grub...
Aha, I see. Doesn't stink too much. We'll try feeding it to volunteers in our free time. But how is it in general?
The head hunter said they can provide food for about fifty people. If you can pay them properly.

Fifty... Hmm... Probably enough. I should probably visit them myself. We'll discuss what kind of "payment" they want.
Well, thanks to you.
Here, take some ammo, probably spent some?
And... You wanted to know the way to Sakharov at Yantar?
Look here on the map, this is the checkpoint, from there you walk straight to the territory of the former Rostok factory, there you'll reach the tracks, walk along them to the abandoned construction site. From there turn left, under the railway bridge and straight down the road...
Well, go on, when you're at Sakharov's - give my regards from an old soldier...
Greetings! Wouldn't there be any little assignment, comrade colonel?

Don't clown around, Marked One, it doesn't suit you. As for an assignment, well, perhaps there's something for you. Or maybe not for you. Depends on who turns out quicker. By the way, do you know Nimble? I also loaded him with this business.

Don't clown around, Marked One, it doesn't suit you. As for an assignment, well, perhaps there's something for you. Or maybe not for you. Depends on who turns out quicker. See, I'm planning to give this business to other stalkers too.

So what kind of business? I hope it's not delivering secret correspondence to the devil's backyard, for safety, hiding it in... one place? Nimble's a specialist in these matters, I can't compete with him.
I'm all ears. What's the business?

What? Alright, you'll tell me this story later. For now listen to mine.\nWe have one fighter in Duty, Romka Mosya - brilliant sniper. He's on duty at the towers scattered around the perimeter here. I personally saw once how he planted a bullet from three hundred meters straight into a bloodsucker's head while it was fighting with a boar. An unpleasant story happened to him the other day. He had to step away from his post for personal needs. He climbed down from the tower and headed to the nearest bushes, leaving his rifle by the ladder. Did his business, comes back - no rifle. The man was gone five minutes, and the thing was snatched, as if we're not in the Zone but at Odessa's Privoz market. We tried looking, of course, but where...

We have one fighter in Duty, Romka Mosya - brilliant sniper. He's on duty at the towers scattered around the perimeter here. I personally saw once how he planted a bullet from three hundred meters straight into a bloodsucker's head while it was fighting with a boar. An unpleasant story happened to him the other day. He had to step away from his post for personal needs. He climbed down from the tower and headed to the nearest bushes, leaving his rifle by the ladder. Did his business, comes back - no rifle. The man was gone five minutes, and the thing was snatched, as if we're not in the Zone but at Odessa's Privoz market. We tried looking, of course, but where...
Well, thing's lost and lost, so what? I'll never believe you don't have another sniper rifle in storage for your Romka. By the way, what kind of strange nickname is that - Mosya?

We don't have exactly THAT kind of rifle. And about the nickname you could've figured out yourself. We got a Mosin rifle fanatic. Came with his own, though from ancient years, but well-maintained and modernized. The saddest thing is he flatly refuses to fight with other sniper rifles. We offered him SVD, SVU-A, and foreign bolt-actions, but no, he's stubborn as a mule. Says it's all nonsense. Find me a three-line rifle, he says, or I'm writing a resignation report.

I see. So you decided to ask if I have a spare Mosin lying around? Wouldn't it be simpler to bring a brand new one from the mainland? I'm sure there are still plenty lying in long-term storage warehouses.

That takes too long, and I'm not sure they could find one at all. We're supplied according to a certain standard, as you've probably noticed. All weapons and gear are of modern designs... relatively. And for such an "antique," plus urgency, plus smuggled delivery, they'd probably charge a price - good Lord.\nAnd I really don't want to let the guy go. Such natural talents in marksmanship like him are rare.
Makes sense. But how can I help?

I've heard rumors that somewhere here in the Zone, a couple stalkers are wandering around with just the rifles we need. So I wanted to ask you to find one of them and negotiate a trade or buyout. With what? That's up to you. It'll be easier for you to make a deal with your fellow professionals than for any of ours. There are two mandatory conditions: the weapon must be in good technical condition, and include a PU scope in the package. For my part, I guarantee that as compensation for the service rendered to Duty, you can choose to receive either an AK-104 "Tactic" assault rifle or a very rare recipe for modifying the "Film" artifact. What do you say?
Tempting. I'm in.
To be honest, I have a pretty vague idea how to complete such a task, so I'd better refuse right away.
Very good. Try to handle the assigned task quickly, before Romka gets completely angry without his beloved "Moska" and decides to break with our organization.
Then you're dismissed.

Petrenko, Duty's supply officer, suggests finding one of the few Mosin rifle owners in the Zone and trading or buying this weapon from him. For delivering the sniper rifle in good condition, as well as the PU scope that goes with it, I can choose a reward: AK-104 assault rifle or a rare artifact modification recipe.
Remember, you gave me the assignment to find a new Mosin for your sniper?
I remember, of course. Did you manage it, got one?
You bet! Look, here's the rifle, and here's the scope for it. Everything's working, everything functions.
Not yet. It's not such a simple task, as you understand. But I think it'll work out. Just reminding you that I'm still on it.
I'm forced to admit that I failed and give up this assignment. Please understand and forgive.
Let's see... Yes, perfect condition. Well done, Marked One! I remember our deal. What do you want as a reward: assault rifle or recipe?
No worries, someone else already hustled and got it sorted.
I prefer something tangible. Give me your assault rifle.
I love tinkering with artifact transformations. Hand over the recipe.
One moment... Just don't forget to clean off the gun oil. Thanks for the excellent work.
I'll transfer it to your PDA now. Thanks for the excellent work.
Hey, Nimble. I want to ask you about something. Petrenko also hired you to look for a three-line rifle for their sniper, right?

Also? Ah... so you're participating too. Well, yeah, in general. Only, honestly speaking, after all my recent misadventures, I'm not particularly eager to run around the Zone with my tongue hanging out, doing searches with extremely low chances of success.
I understand, I understand. I see you've settled in nicely here. Warm and the flies don't bite, right? Why did you agree to work for the colonel then?
Well, I had one idea. Thought I could quickly find out everything and dash off for the rifle, but it turned out that it's not so simple, so I spat on it.
Can you tell me? You've basically already given up on the search anyway.

What else! I mean... I'm in debt to you, Marked One, don't think I forgot, but... Ah, it's no big secret! Basically, I chatted with buddies here and managed to get on the trail of one old man, owner of a Mosin. Some say he's often seen somewhere in the northern part of the Swamps. Others say they saw him at the Forgotten Hamlet. Either Ivanych or Stepanych they call him. That's all I know. You understand yourself, with such a meager lead dragging yourself across half the Zone doesn't seem worth it, so...
Either Ivanych or Stepanych. I have a feeling I know who we're talking about. Thanks, I'll check out this lead.
Always rummaging, rummaging... Scurrying around all day long.
I heard you guys found some package with letters?
Eh... when? There was a package with papers. And there were letters in there too? I would've read them, otherwise whenever I go to take a leak all I get are some forms... Not anymore.
And where did you get it?

How should I remember?! We were walking past one of the piles, so we picked it up along the way. There was other stuff lying around, various boxes, more packages... only it was radiating hard, so we didn't bother figuring it out, and we couldn't afford to delay - there were tons of dogs there. Maybe bandits wasted some mailman or courier? Good thing you reminded me, we should go rummage there again, maybe something interesting is left... if only I could remember exactly where... I think there was a box lying around, or found it in a pipe... I remember it was near a pile somewhere, a tree, swamp, ravine on the right, and seemed to be toward the Dark Valley...
Oh... one more thing. You don't happen to know if the military has conscripts here? I thought there should only be contract soldiers...
Why are you asking me? Ask the military, if they want to talk to you.
Yeah, they're not talkative with stalkers. We'll see...
You again! How much is enough!
Calm down, I'm leaving.

Bundle of papers. Mostly personal letters and some forms. Only a fragment of one letter catches attention.\n \n"...now there's Captain Sergeev here, so I'm directly under him. He was somewhere with you guys, why was he transferred? So he says he heard at headquarters that you'll be getting serious reinforcements soon. It's both good and bad. Good that there's reinforcement, and bad that it means they might throw us to you too. Damn, how I don't want to sit in this shit... (And Sergeev probably thinks the Zone is over for him. Yeah right, dream on, if there's reinforcement, they'll send him right back as a "specialist". :))
Memory:\nSergeev! And exactly captain! I've heard this surname. We're probably even acquainted... Where is he?
I've wanted to ask for a long time, just out of curiosity... do you have conscripts serving too?

Of course... Me, for example. Finally getting discharged! Already, you could say, packed and ready. One last duty and toot-toot! Our folks have been bombarding us with letters, and the mail works like hell knows what. Haven't been able to send anything there or receive anything from there for a long time.
I happened to see a fragment of a letter, seemed to be to some soldier. They say somewhere a whole package of letters was found. I'll look around, ask questions, if anything, I'll bring it.
That would be great...
I happened to find a package with letters at the Garbage, take a look.

At the Garbage?! Holy crap, that's why our mailman's been gone so long, did he fly into somewhere? Let me see. Wow, a letter for Kolyan, but he's already been discharged... This is for Vitka, he'll dance for me today... So, so... Well, this guy doesn't need it anymore, yeah... Aha, and the guy with glasses got lucky too... so... damn, it's not here... Was there more?
That's all.
Well, you made them happy, sorry it wasn't me, but still. What do you want? I got some ammo for the Kalash...
Give me everything you can.
Here, just turn around so it's not obvious.
Conspirator...
Don't need anything, you better tell me, where does Captain Sergeev command?
He had a position at the Swamps. Only he was transferred two months ago, you won't find him there.
At the Swamps... So I was there after all... That's just me thinking out loud. Thanks.
Here, there's a note for you from Docent.
From Docent? Who's that?
Hmm... I thought you knew. Thought he was one of yours... He's at the bar - brainy guy like that. Always tinkering with something... He wrote you a note, says you'll figure it out.
Ah! That one... So he's not a docent, he doesn't have a degree... Alright, thanks. He wants to check some ideas about the Zone. Hmm... Let's see...

Unknown stalker. April 2012.
Just a good man. Sorry, didn't get to ask his name.
He had a scar across his whole face.
If anyone knew him, come by. Just closer to nighttime.
Memory:\nThis guy with the scar... Someone familiar? I saw him somewhere... Or didn't see him, but someone told me about him... Something's there, can't quite grasp it.
And who's buried near the house? Some Scar guy...
I don't know. I wasn't here when they buried him. Went to the forest to check traps. What's it to you?
Something seemed familiar, but I can't figure out what. I have memory problems. So I'm looking for at least some thread...
Try to find whoever buried him. He appeared here several more times. If I'm not mistaken, then
Alright, thanks. I'll try to find him.
Haven't you heard, they say there's a tunnel to an underground lab somewhere around here?

Why "heard"? I know. Not long ago two weirdos were heading there. Supposedly there are some special documents there that can help deal with the "Brain Scorcher". Another tall tale, of course, about documents, but the tunnel entrance definitely exists. Long ago, even before the Zone expanded so much, eggheads would come and go from there from time to time.
Come and go? And these weirdos, did they get through too?
No, I don't think so. One, as they said, chickened out completely. And the second one climbed in and... that's it! Gone without a trace. What's got you suddenly interested in the lab?
There's one interest. So where's the entrance?

Well... From here as you exit, there will be gates to the Nature Reserve straight ahead. You'll enter - turn right and along the fence to the entrance to the old excavation. Well, there, look around - you'll find the passage... Only, you won't get through - there's an anomaly there. Seems it can be "turned off" temporarily with an artifact, this ruby one. Well, you probably know about this...
So you can remove anomalies like that?
Yes, I know, "Carousel" can be shut down with "Ruby Spring".
Hmm. I know that "Funnel" can be plugged with "Ruby Battery".

Yeah. Exactly. There are such artifacts that can "collapse" an anomaly temporarily. For how long - who knows! And there's a "Funnel" sitting there. Nasty anomaly. You can't discharge it just like that. But with a "Ruby Battery" you can slip through. If you have one, of course...

Yeah. Exactly. But there's no "carousel" there, there's a "Funnel" sitting there. Nasty anomaly. You can't discharge it just like that. But with a "Ruby Battery" you can slip through. If you have one, of course...
Exactly. That's exactly where the "Funnel" sits. Nasty anomaly. You can't discharge it just like that. But with a "Ruby Battery" you can slip through. If you have one, of course...
Alright, got it. Need to get this "Battery". You don't happen to have one lying around?
You kidding? It's worth a ton... If I had one - would've sold it to traders long ago.
Mmm. You don't happen to know where to find such a "Battery"? Maybe you have one?
Eh... Well I've heard about how you can try to "cook up" such an artifact. And... Maybe I'll even tell you... Not for free though.
Yeah, I get it - for free you can only spoil the air here in the Zone. How much you want?
Keep your cash. I need some ammo. For the shotgun. Bring three hundred shotgun shells - and I'll outline everything I know. Deal?
Keep your cash. I need some ammo. For the shotgun. Two hundred buckshot - and I'll outline everything I know. Deal?
Keep your cash. I need some ammo. For the shotgun. Don't be stingy with a hundred slugs - and I'll outline everything I know. Deal?
Alright. You'll get your ammo.
Remind me, what do you need for the way to get a "Ruby Battery"?
Head doesn't hold anything at all? It happens. I need some ammo. For the shotgun. Bring three hundred shotgun shells - and I'll outline everything I know.
Head doesn't hold anything at all? It happens. I need some ammo. For the shotgun. Two hundred buckshot - and I'll outline everything I know.
Head doesn't hold anything at all? It happens. I need some ammo. For the shotgun. Don't be stingy with a hundred slugs - and I'll outline everything I know.
Aha! Right. Just something made me doubt. Here, take it.
Aha! Right. Just something made me doubt. Here, take it.
Aha! Right. Just something made me doubt. Here, take it.
Just forgot a bit. Alright. I'll find it.

Yeah, sorry about that. But you understand yourself, it's hard to survive here. Alright, that's all lyrics.\nWrite down the method: if you throw a "Battery" artifact into a "Snow" anomaly, you can get a "Ruby Battery". Transformation time - a bit more than two hours. With this artifact you can eliminate "Electra" and "Funnel" anomalies.
Hey there, friend. Why so worried? Sit down, rest...
Don't know anything about a guy with a scar?
Boy, you're asking... Show me who doesn't have a scar here. Wait... or are you talking about that guy with the scar on his face that we buried once?

Well, probably... I saw the grave, it says "if anyone knew the guy with the scar on his face, come by". Something like that... Won't you tell me about him, I think I might have known him... or seen him... Generally, I'm confused myself, either I saw him myself, or someone told me about him.

Actually, it wasn't me who wrote on the cross, but my buddy, he's not here now. He brought him to us... or no, didn't even bring him, but he just appeared suddenly somehow. I was off to the side, didn't really listen to what they were chatting about, wasn't the time for it, we were getting ready for business... But from their friendly exclamations and laughter I understood that the guy was sociable and communicative. And then suddenly shooting, mercs showed up from somewhere... not many, more of ours. Well, in short they scattered, shot it out as usual, they seemed to withdraw. And my buddy got wounded. We didn't have great medicine then, so that guy patched him up a bit with his supplies... Yeah, he practically saved him, you could say.
And then what? Why suddenly the cross?

Yeah, it was all stupid somehow... Our own fault, thought everything was over. The mercs withdrew, but at the end someone took a shot from afar with a sniper rifle... They, apparently, weren't even after us, just stumbled upon us by accident. Well, that's how it happened. What made you think he was familiar anyway? Because of the scar?

Yes. Something seemed to switch on in my head for a second. You see, I have my own... little problem with memory. And here it seemed for a moment that... No! It feels like it wasn't even me who knew him...
Did it hit you that hard? Yeah, it happens... Go to my buddy, ask him, maybe he'll tell you more.
If there's a way there, I'll definitely ask.
How are you? Still looking for traces of Scar?
Greetings. What brings you here?
Greetings again. Found anything?
Nothing interesting.
You buried the guy with the scar on his face? I saw the cross with your note. Tell me who he was.
What for all of a sudden? I already forgot about him, and actually I wanted to find out more about him myself... I wrote: come by, if anyone knew him.

You see, I have a feeling I knew him, even seem to remember his appearance... And at the same time I feel like it's not really mine... How to explain it... Well, it's like I remember, but like I shouldn't remember. If someone would remind me, give me a hint... Nothing left of him?

Well how should I put it... just, nonsense. There was a PDA. I didn't sell it, somehow felt bad about it, he basically saved me... and then I lost it anyway... Are you shell-shocked? He was strange too somehow. Guy seemed cheerful and sociable, quickly somehow fit in with us. Immediately common talk about the Bar, about Sidor, about loot... well, you could see he knew what was what and wasn't his first day in the Zone. But he was also looking for someone, but who - couldn't say, or didn't want to... or like you, didn't understand himself what to say. Maybe he was looking for you?
That's unlikely... So you can't really say anything either, that's a shame.

What can I say now, that was so long ago... I didn't even get to ask his name, thought maybe someone who knew him would write the name on the cross later... Those mercs appeared at the wrong time... Listen! Maybe they were looking for him, huh? You reminded me of them... So they shot for show, spotted him, figured out which one, didn't bother with us, and nailed him from afar... And they aimed precisely, for sure, to get him with one bullet... Damn, why didn't I figure it out right away? Why did they back off from us so quickly...
And where's his PDA?

I'm telling you, I lost it. I didn't really look at it properly. But if there was such a situation as I'm thinking now, it would've been interesting to dig through that PDA... Wait... So I looked through it briefly there at the grave, put it in the backpack... pockets were full. I remember at the tech dump it was still there, I just took it out to flip through, but quickly shoved it back - dogs came running, you know... then I had to dash to the Hamlet. Aha! And when I came back it was gone. And there was a hole in the backpack, I lost a spare battery then too, and something else... Well yeah! Exactly! Somewhere at the Hamlet... Or no... We also went to the Cordon, chased flesh... Ah! Can't remember anymore! Basically, it's screwed, you'll never find it now, and that's a shame. In short, most likely
Yeah, shame. Now you won't find it in the grass, in the mud. Unless by luck it's lying somewhere on clean ground.
I saw your message on the network. I'll need to head to the Cordon soon anyway...

Excellent, you're the first to respond. There's a job here, couldn't be simpler - take personal belongings of one of my fighters to the trader at the Cordon. He was a good fighter, former stalker, by the way. He's been here almost since the Zone was formed, but understood in time who to stick with. Yeah... he was with us for a long time, and now you see how it is... Basically, Skryaga is collecting some of his things, just - small stuff, need to take it to Sidor, he should forward it further, we have an arrangement about this. Skryaga will put together a package, write the address, your main job is to deliver it before Sidorych takes off.
I won't mess around with someone else's junk.
As you wish. Don't want to - live as you want... just don't forget: as you do, so it's done to you...
Alright, since I'm heading that way anyway.
Max asked me to take someone's things to the Cordon.

Yes-yes, right now. He had so few things - practically nothing, a couple photos, notebook with scribbles, this and that, some knife... basically, a little package of stuff... Hey! Marked One, why are you staring at one spot? You here?.. I was talking to you!

Huh? I was thinking... Here we run around the Zone, fuss about something and forget that everyone has... I mean, had some life before, and there are things that remind of it. And there's someone to pass them to. And me? I don't have any personal things. Can't count an assault rifle and torn backpack as personal items. Eh! No photos, no mementos, no memories - nothing...
Where were you wandering? Already delivered without you.
Ah... Well, alright then.
Maybe need something else? Just ask...

That's what you're about. So here, I'm saying, I wanted to keep this knife for myself, but it's too small, what use is it - can't even cut sausage, though the handle is nicely made... What are you slowing down again, were you getting high yesterday or something?
A knife! I've seen one with such a handle before! That means I should have known the owner. Let me see the photo... Is this him? What was his name, you say? And who's next to him?

This one? His name was Ilyukha Ace. And next to him... yeah, seems like his buddy, who he started as a stalker with. Only he didn't join us. But Ilyukha didn't tell anything about you, and nobody here remembers you. So if you knew him, it was probably back in his "stalker" life. You should go to his buddy, this one here. I think he's somewhere... Ilyukha once said... let me remember... Ah:
Ilyukha... Hmm... Alright, give me the package, I'm off.
Here, come by if you need anything...
Here are some things from a Freedom guy, they asked me to deliver them, you should know what to do next.
Things? Were you acquainted?.. Alright, leave it. Fine, don't need an artifact - I'll take money from you. Just 5000.
What for?! Max-Freedom guy said just to deliver, and you'd handle everything yourself, arrange it all...

Well... I thought you found an acquaintance, thought to do it faster for you, more carefully. And speed and care cost money. Who's Max to me? He can wait. But for you I would've tried harder, you understand...
What a cheapskate! These are things of a dead stalker. Do you have any conscience?
Yeah... You're right, it's not right somehow... Then 3000 - but everything instantly.
In short, I was told to deliver, I delivered. That's it.
Well, suit yourself... Let it lie for now, I'll forward it when there's a free opportunity...
Here, our conscientious one...
Right, who knows... And you won't fill your belly with conscience, you should understand.
I'll think about it, maybe find someone who values these things.
Think, think, what do I care...
Hey. Who are you looking for?
You. Did you know Ilyukha Ace? He's gone... Max-Freedom guy asked me to take some of his things to the trader to forward them where needed.
Ilyukha?.. Yes, I already know. Just didn't expect Max could ask such a thing. Never even crossed my mind... Seems they became really close. Did you know him too?

I think so, but can't remember exactly. I saw his knife and it seemed I'd seen such before, which means I met the owner... But I didn't recognize him in the photograph. Well, that photo where you're both together.

Ah! Right, there was that. And the knife was made for him by either his father or grandfather when he was still a child... or bought. Anyway, he treasured it for some reason. And Max probably knew, since he decided to send it with the things. Didn't expect that from him, honest. And thanks to you for fulfilling this request. I hadn't seen you with him before, though we hadn't been in touch for a long time, basically since he went to Freedom. Actually, long time - that's by Zone standards. But basically, none of those he came with are left. Some left, and some like Ilyukha...
Yeah... And there was hope...
Wait a minute... There's still our mutual acquaintance. If you're in his area, talk to him...
If I'm there... Because I feel he won't say anything either. But who knows...
Ah! Hey! How's it going?
It's alright. I guess.
What are you looking at, stalker?
You knew Ilyukha Ace, right?
I did, long time ago though. He went to Freedom, and recently they told me he's gone.
Well... me?.. Don't you recognize me?.. By any chance?..
No. I don't recognize you. What, should I have?.. Ah! Wait! You're the one who sent his things at Max's request? My buddy just sent me a message... You did good, of course.

I'm not talking about that at all... It's not about the things... What rotten luck! Why is it like this? Just when you start to understand something, the person's already gone and you can't find out anything from him. Just seems like any moment now I'll learn something, that it's right there, already close... and again disappointment. Nothing but disappointments everywhere...

Exactly! In life generally it's mostly just disappointments. That's how it's arranged. And especially in the Zone. But! Something still makes us happy... My buddy forgot to thank you. So here, I was collecting something for him at his request. He asked me to give it all to you. Take it!
Thanks.
How are things, Marked One?
Well, going slowly somehow.
You still haven't told me about Ghost.

Well, listen. This was last week. Or the week before?! Anyway, doesn't matter. Our scout signaled that two were coming with rich loot from somewhere far away. I sent my boys to feel them up, all as usual. They took one right away, turned out to be an egghead. He had practically nothing with him. Just some papers, a bit of grub, and various small stuff.
That's clear. And the second? Was that Ghost? Was he escorting the scientist?

Yeah, but I didn't know that then. The second one just vanished into thin air. And about half an hour later a seasoned stalker comes rolling up to us here like nothing happened. Silent type, collected, eyes darting around. Yeah, his eyes were unusual - very light. Anyway, when he introduced himself, I immediately remembered what the brotherhood told about him, that he's completely off his rocker... He didn't want to make contact, so I decided not to escalate. Just sent two guys to watch this weirdo.
By the way, how did you figure out it was him who was with the egghead?

Ghost told us himself. He also added that he understands why we're sitting here, and so we don't come out empty-handed, we can take the papers from the egghead and push them to some guy at the Bar for decent cash. Said and done. And at the end he dropped that we'd better not even try to shake him down. Turns out he bought himself off with the egghead, kinda.
Even so? Well, well... And did you manage to track where Ghost went after?

Only to the entrance of the valley in the eastern part of the forest. My guys swore that Ghost shook them off his tail, but I suspect they just chickened out following him. There's tons of mutants there. That's all I know. So are we even now?
Now we are. Be seeing you, lucky one.
I wanted to ask. You sit closer to the center of the Zone, probably good loot gets brought to you often?
What good loot... Who brings it here? You see yourself, came with an empty bag.
And a scientist accompanied by a stalker... How to describe him? Seasoned, silent and with very light eyes... Such guys didn't visit you recently?
I know nothing! What stalker, what scientist... who told you such nonsense? Nobody was here and I saw nobody. And how did you come, through the bridge? Did you visit the boys by the forest?
I did, why?
Nothing... wanted to know how the weather is in the forest - maybe mushrooms started growing, should pay a visit.
Same as everywhere... I'm off.
Do you sometimes get scientific information?
Don't remember anything like that. Be more specific about what you need, maybe we can make a deal.
More specific: Greedy's guys said they sold you some scientist's notes not long ago.
Greedy's? Now I remember something. They're gone already, some egghead came and bought everything.
You mean to say you don't make copies for yourself? And who came?

I'm saying you ask too many questions, and my answers cost money and I don't have time to just chat with you. Fork over a check for a thousand bucks and you'll get a copy. If that's too much, give me a second level artifact and you'll find out who came.
Uh... Too expensive! I'll think about it.
Alright, here's an artifact. So who was it?
Some egghead was interested
Hmm... should pay him a visit.
Here's your check. I'll try to figure it out myself, maybe at least these notes will lead to something.
Here's a flash drive, I scanned the papers. But it probably won't help, it's all formulas...
We'll see.
Remember, you talked about egghead notes?
Don't remember anything like that. Who knows who I talked to and when. Be more specific about what you need, maybe we can make a deal.
Well those, Greedy's thugs brought notes. You even talked about an egghead who bought everything from you.
Ah! So what? Why are you dragging up all kinds of stuff! You might as well tell me about Stirlitz...
I talked to that egghead. The one you told me about. Only it's dead quiet there. You don't have any copies left?
You ask too many questions, and my answers cost money and I don't have time to just chat with you. Fork over a check for a thousand bucks and you'll get a copy.
Uh... Too expensive! I'll think about it.
Here's a thousand check.
Here's a flash drive, I scanned the papers. But it probably won't help, it's all formulas...
Alright, we'll see. I'll try to figure it out, maybe at least these notes will lead to something.
Did you want something?
Did you want something?
Yes, I was told at the Bar that you bought some notes from Tooth. Are these your notes? I don't actually need them, I just wanted to know about that stalker-guide who went with you from Limansk.

From Limansk? You've obviously mistaken me for Dr. Perelman. We crossed paths with him at Yantar not long ago. He told me about some guide, but not very willingly for some reason, and I didn't dig too deep. He also talked about a robbery, that very important scientific materials were taken from him. I don't know how they ended up with this acquaintance of yours - Tooth, right? - and how Perelman found out about it, but he asked me to buy them back. He gave me for this, probably all the money he had with him. And I was just heading toward the Bar to... I mean, I want to say, to fulfill one assignment from the bosses. Basically, it was on my way, so I decided to help a colleague.
Why didn't he buy back his papers himself, if he knew who had them? And where is this Perelman anyway?

He had to leave urgently. Said it was for new instruments and equipment. Also wanted to resolve some organizational issues along the way. We're not exactly, you know, close friends. Just acquaintances. Met at a couple symposiums, but didn't talk much...
I see. So the notes weren't that important, if he left without waiting for them?

What makes you think that? We agreed that I would immediately send the papers along with official correspondence to the address he left me. Dr. Perelman also promised to bring good cognac as thanks... But that's strictly between us! I don't know, though, how soon he'll return now...
Alright, I'll wait and talk when I get a chance... Or better yet bargain with Tooth some more.
Copy of notes taken by Greedy from the scientist.

Lots of incomprehensible formulas, calculations, diagrams, tables. Seems like readings from some measurements were recorded and analysis of those readings was conducted. Numbers, numbers, numbers... hard to understand anything.
 There's a draft of a letter. The letter itself was most likely sent by email.

 "To Academician Aleksandrov.
 Subject: Indirect confirmation.

 Dear Alexander Nikolayevich.
 It seems that you and I were right about the randomness of psi-field surges and their connection with anomalous process activity and the emergence of neoplasms (artifacts). Yes, intensity has a significant influence, as well as the field's directional vector. But, as you rightly noted, the field surges themselves don't have any cyclical character, that is, no periodicity is observed. And now there's confirmation of this.
