I took various functions as a baseline and noticed no correlation. That is, here we can confidently assert the chaotic nature of surges, there's nothing ordered about them. And this is quite enough to reject the known theory about the presence of some "intelligence". I, like you, am now inclined to think that this is rather an uncontrolled "natural" phenomenon. I deliberately put "natural" in quotes, because the nature of this phenomenon is just not understood. I meant that these are completely spontaneous, random processes, like manifestations of natural forces. So Professor Vasiliev, who put forward the plant hypothesis of the Zone, is possibly also right about something. In any case, now we have indirect but very strong confirmation of the Zone's "non-intelligence".
 To avoid being unsubstantiated, I'll send or bring you my measurements and calculations on them. Measurements were taken at different points in the Zone, including places where very, very rarely anyone went. After all, the whole problem was that we judged by measurements made on the outskirts, and never made them close to the center. Now practically the entire area is evenly covered and some conclusions can already be drawn. You'll ask how I got close to the center? This is where the unpleasant part of my letter lies.
 The thing is, I had to contact one experienced stalker, Professor Vasiliev introduced us. This stalker agreed to be my guide, but for a very original payment: he needed that experimental sample of the new psi-field meter that you got for Professor Grigorovich's scientific group with such difficulty at my request. Why he needs it, I have no idea, but he said temporarily and promised to return it later. By the way, my guide watched very closely how I made measurements with the device, and also asked me along the way what exactly and how I was doing - a very curious young man. I'm not inclined to think he deceived me, but... basically, he disappeared. And the device with him. And the most unpleasant thing is that I took the meter without Ivan Sergeyevich's permission (after all, he's the materially responsible person, and I, it turns out, committed theft). But look what results we achieved!
 I feel very awkward both before you and before Professor Grigorovich. I'm going to fly to you immediately to privately discuss the current situation and the results of my research. I hope you'll help me get another sample of the device in case they suddenly don't return it to me, and then I'll explain myself to Ivan Sergeyevich.
 P.S. Since I mentioned Professor Vasiliev here, I remembered one strange case. My employee two or three weeks ago was at the Army Warehouses (that's what one area here is called), I don't remember on what assignment, and that's not the main thing. So, he assured me that he saw Professor Vasiliev there, though in a very strange appearance - his look greatly struck my employee. I assured him it was a mistake, since at exactly that time I was meeting with Vasiliev at Yantar and he was introducing me to that guide with whom I then worked so persistently for a whole week.
 Literally yesterday I told Vasiliev about this story, to which the professor assured that he had never been in that area at all. All this is very strange... I'll need to talk to him again when I return.
 Dr. Perelman."
Note found in belongings at Yantar

Resembles a draft of a letter hastily scribbled, intended to be sent by email. This is indicated by numerous corrections and lack of clear structure.

 I.S.
 Subject: Available information on X-16.

 I.S.! Our mutual stalker acquaintance nicknamed Ghost surfaced, as usual, from nowhere and reported what he knows - how to get into X-16! And, according to him, it was YOU who gave him documents from which he got this priceless information! I feel like a complete fool... Six months of meaningless trampling around, three graduate students died. And the answer was with you! Just needed to read it. I understand you have somewhat different problems in your swamp, but you knew how much I needed this information... Well, whatever, tomorrow we're going to storm it... I'm even afraid to suppose what might await us there - inside...

 Yours."
Hey there! Don't remember you somehow. Let us inspect you, see if there are any prohibited items for bringing onto Freedom territory.
What-what?
That! Freedom is here! And therefore, dude, share some vodka.
Alright, take what you need.
I don't have vodka for you, nothing but shakedowns everywhere!
There you go, now you're "free". And don't sweat it. You understand - burning boredom.
Yeah right, suit yourself. Move along then, since it's beneath you to respect good people.
And what's going on here anyway? What do you do?
Too many "good people", can't satisfy them all... And what's going on here anyway? What do you do?

Just this and that. Catching naked dudes falling from the sky. Heh-heh.\nDuty guys also showed up. About 10 faces holed up in the hamlet to the right of the road. What they want - hell knows, but we should clearly keep an eye on them. What should we call you, by the way?
Just this and that. Catching naked dudes falling from the sky. That's it, move along, don't feel like shooting the breeze with you.
Just this and that. Catching naked dudes falling from the sky. Duty guys were hanging around here recently, so we settled the issue with them. What should we call you, by the way?
I'm Marked One. Listen, so what about these Duty guys? Are you really at each other's throats? I thought it was just, more in words.
Oh, how tender we are...
I'm Marked One. Alright, I'm off, got plenty to do...
Take care, busy man! And... don't hold a grudge against us for the "inspection". Here, take some ammo, for foreign guns though, but might come in handy.

Well, how should I put it. With some it's in words, with others at knife point. Won't you do a small favor? Drop by our base and tell the senior, Lukash, about these Duty guys. Such info is better passed personally. I'll signal the post commander to let you through. Say you're from me. And we'll keep an eye on these soup-slurpers meanwhile. Just gotta be quick about it. So, how about it?
We'll see, maybe I'll tell him. See ya!
Nah, dude, sorry, I'm heading the other way.
Ah, it's you! What do you want?
Greetings! How's life?
You... Talk to the senior over there.
And what about you? Mute?
Don't mess with me! Or I'll smack you in the ear with the stock! I said - shoot the breeze with the senior.
Yeah right...
You again... What do you want?
Hey there, dude! From far away, I bet? Your face doesn't ring a bell...
Shame it doesn't ring a bell, I don't remember who I am either...

Well I'll be! At least you're not naked. Picture this - the other day we're walking with Boryan, and suddenly - bam! A naked dude falls right from the sky! Mumbling and can't string two words together. We dragged him to the base - he's human after all...
The Zone... You never know what you'll hear.
Ha! Hey, dude! How's life?
Alright, I guess... How about you?
Everything's good! They say we'll move toward the center soon! We'll grab artifacts! Everyone will have enough for life...
Well now. And who do we have here? Coming to us? On business or just to rest - refuel? What should I call you, buddy?
They call me Marked One, haven't you heard?
Nope. Should I have? Did you want something or just looking around?
Yeah, want to chat with people.
We don't let just anyone in. Who knows what's in your head. Then again, need to inspect your belongings for inappropriate things to bring in... You understand?
What kind of "inappropriate things"?
My loot is not subject to inspection. See ya.

All kinds of weapons, including bladed. We're safe here and all our own, so visitors turn in their guns for safekeeping. And we charge for peace of mind, but we know moderation, don't worry. The guys work their asses off, protecting this place from all kinds of scum. And here you can take a nap safely, get some grub, and chat with people. So, nicely: fork over a hundred rifle bullets. Not for Kalash, we got plenty of those, for foreign guns.
Hold on, let me figure out my "finances"...
Hmm... I met some of your guys nearby, they asked me to pass an important message to the base.
NATO ammo? Alright, fill up the cap.
I don't have those bullets! Maybe you'll take money?
What do we need those for here... Can't even wipe your ass with them.
Ah! So you "respected" our patrol? Alright, Freedom remembers kindness. Turn in your guns and come through.
No way, I won't trust my gun to anyone.
Alright, let me see what you got here. Take this...
Come through, always pleasant to chat with good people.
Hey there! Coming to us? Same rules as before - turn in your pieces, wipe your feet and fork over a hundred bullets for the needs of "Zone defenders" for Western popguns.
Don't have that many. Don't use them.
Then turn your head the other way. Freebies won't work here today. Or maybe you'll find bullets for the old Kalash, about a hundred? You know, 7.62 ones.
Alright, I'll manage without.
Well here: bullets. Here's the weapon.
7.62? Alright, here... Take it.
Good man! Don't worry: we're like a pharmacy. What you turn in, you get back. Come through, rest, chat.
Don't get worked up. Rest, relax, grab a magazine to flip through. Girls in there... Eh...
Oh, you showed up! Didn't leave anything of yours with us last time, did you?
Yeah, I came back for my weapon. Got so worn out, forgetting such things... Return it, please, as a brother.
Take back what you turned in and don't screw up like that again. Good thing I'm still nice, but another shift would never return it.
Thanks, from the heart.
What do you want? Can't rest?
I'm leaving, give me back my weapon.
Alright, move along. Take it - what you turned in is ready for pickup. Drop by if anything.
Yeah, it's tiresome somehow. I'll go talk to people some more.
Better take a nap: your eyes look wild, and your face isn't great either.
Ah, it's you, Marked One... Still wandering? Coming to us again or what? If so, turn in your guns just in case. Who knows what might happen when you're tipsy.
Nah, I'm just saying hello, then moving on.
Well, greetings! If you have something to tell, drop by.
Yeah, got business with some of your guys, here's my "arsenal".
Uh-huh, let's have it. Come through.
Ah, it's you Marked One, still wandering... Lukash said not to search you, come anytime.
Is that so? Well, not bad. Alright, I'm off.
Hey there, buddy. How's life? Sit down, let's rest.
And good health to you. Relaxing?
Yeah. Just came back from a trip. Want to feel safe for a bit at least. Turned in the gun - and my head doesn't hurt. Got tired of being on edge all the time.
Do they really make everyone turn in weapons?

Not really, I think. Saw Diodor here once with a gun. Here you can freely have some vodka and all... And after that business, you know yourself, many people go off their rocker. So Lukash ordered: whoever hasn't earned respect from the local freedom-lovers, we take their guns and knives just in case. And it's better that way, honestly. At least if something happens - you'll get away with a beaten face, not a bullet to the head.
Sounds reasonable. I see you even got a TV with VCR here. Set yourselves up with maximum comfort.

You bet! That's why many love hanging out here. The repertoire is meager though. Just a couple tapes, and those have been watched to death... Well, you get it.\nListen! Couldn't you dash over to Barman, get something new from him for our "cinema"? I heard he regularly orders fresh stuff from outside the perimeter for his joint. Boosts the establishment's attendance, you know.
Haven't you confused me with someone, dear sir? Go dash yourself. Found yourself an errand boy.

Sorry, put it badly. I can't dash over myself no matter how much I want to. I have somewhat... tense, let's say, relations with Duty guys. So, maybe you'll help out? Not for "thanks" of course. I understand. I'll share a solid tip on fat loot.
Fat, you say? We'll see. If I don't forget, I'll ask Barman.
Find someone else. Don't have time for nonsense.
Oh! I've been waiting for you. Haven't dropped by Barman yet for a new tape? Sick of rewatching the same thing for the tenth time.
Here. Don't know what's on it. Barman said - for connoisseurs. By the way, so you could continue satisfying your... aesthetic needs here, I had to give up a good artifact.
Get off me with your nonsense.

Great! We'll have a premiere showing. Appreciate that you didn't cheap out paying Barman. That guy always jacks up the prices... But I'm sure the loot that's waiting for you will cover all your losses with interest. Listen here.\nI dropped by Cook the other day. You know the barracks by the campfire where he's always "cooking"? So. It was early morning, but Cook was already drunk, crawling out of the storeroom. I look, and he dropped a key from his pocket. I got some grub from the drunk, waited till he started nodding off, and picked up the key. Now it's yours, a gift.
Is this some kind of joke? What do I need a key for, especially one I don't know what it opens? Where's the promised loot?

In the stash that this key opens. Everyone here knows Cook skims part of the supplies for himself and sells on the side. How else would you tap into the food flow without setting aside something for hard times? It doesn't happen otherwise. If not for Lukash, they would've kicked him out long ago. But Lukash always covers for Cook, don't know why.
And what, you're suggesting I just clean out his stash? And where is it, generally, do you know?

What's the problem? Main thing is to do it quietly. He can't afford to raise a fuss. Plus with his reputation as a drunk... They wouldn't listen to him anyway. The second question is somewhat harder. Where Cook hides everything - nobody knows. But surely somewhere near his barracks. Most likely right inside. You'll have to figure out how to search.
Well, suppose so. Why didn't you search yourself with such prospects?

It's simple. Cook may have been wasted, but he remembered I came by that morning, and after that his key went missing. He suspects me, in short. Immediately starts giving suspicious looks when I'm nearby and generally acts unfriendly.
I see. Need to think how to handle this. Maybe it's better to return the key to the owner?! Alright, see ya.
Resting? Better lie down, you're shaking all over.

Stalker nicknamed Dobriak, who always hangs out at the Freedom base, asks to bring him a videotape with adult show recordings. Barman should have such things. In return, he promised to give a tip on fat loot, according to him.
I'd like to earn some money. Maybe there's some job?
There's one... You wander the Zone a lot and surely have encountered zombies, right?
Met them, of course, but what about it?
Some people think they're "humans". Even try to cure "poor" zombies, practically puts compresses on them himself, idiot...
Who are we talking about?

I'm talking about Ivar. Used to be a normal guy, worked with scientists, helped us. But then something hit him hard - got into it with the eggheads, with almost all of them, and doesn't want any contact with ours at all. We're not against him personally, it's just that we exterminate these zombies as spawn of the Zone that we're fighting against, and he treats them, you see... Half-baked "Dr. Aibolit". He won't accept the obvious fact that zombies are no longer people! The Zone creates various monsters, and zombies are just one of the known forms.
And you've already figured everything out about the Zone?

Not about the Zone, about zombies. He once brought us a "cured" one. Said he managed to bring a not-too-zombified Duty soldier back to consciousness. Ours was a fighter, for sure. Went missing at Yantar, Ivar said he met him as a zombie, but not completely yet, well... partially, I guess. Said his memory wasn't great, so we should treat him normally. Didn't leave his side for a second. But after the first emission this "ours" started drooling, rolled his eyes, pulled out his rifle and went to "waste" people... Wounded Ivar himself and two of ours. We put him down right in front of Ivar. Since then he doesn't want to talk to us, though I tried to drill into him that it's a stupid idea - nothing will help. Until the first emission - and that's it... There's only one way to help them - put them to eternal rest. Same as with the psychos he used to try treating, just as useless...
What about psychos? Is Ivar somehow connected to psychiatry? Did he work at some clinic?

He worked somewhere... Tell me, has anyone, ever, well at least one psychiatrist, at least once cured some psycho - once and for all? And they have clinics, all kinds of recommendations, methods, tons of information on all possible media... But no. Only the appearance of treatment, not real treatment. The psycho seems to get better, then bang - back to the old ways. Same with his zombies. Doctors, damn them!

Eh, I don't know... By the way, about information media. This Ivar - you say he's also from scientists. Treated psychos, probably had access to some files, medical records, maybe kept something on a flash drive...

You're obsessed with this Ivar! Someone else came here asking all about whether Ivar worked at a clinic, if he still has connections, where to find him... That's it! Closed the topic with Ivar! And anyway, I'm talking about something completely different...
Yes, we got distracted somehow, you wanted to tell me about some job.

The job is exactly about this. I was told that somewhere at Yantar they saw a squad of zombified - former Duty fighters, judging by their uniforms. We had a raid group lose contact there recently. If you encounter them, do a good deed - free them from such terrible existence. I don't want Duty soldiers, even former ones, wandering the Zone in such condition...
Well, I'll try to find and put these poor souls to rest.
General Voronin gave an assignment to find and put to rest at Yantar a group of zombified former Duty faction fighters.
About your zombified fighters...
Report.
What's to report... There's a swamp at Yantar, behind the scientists' camp. There's also a rusting helicopter nearby. Found your... former yours near it.
Location matches the report...
Anyway, job's done: they rest in peace. And you were saying that Ivar brought one like that to the Bar? I don't understand how it's possible...
Not like that. I told you he looked normal, but the emission immediately returned him to zombie "norm".
But is such a thing really possible - bringing a zombie back to consciousness?

Don't load yourself with extra questions. That's scientists' business. Let them deal with it, try, I personally don't rack my brains over it. Neither should you. Our job is to cleanse the Zone of its spawn. And zombies are one of them, no doubt about it. So thanks for the work, stalker.
Yeah, you're welcome. But it's all strange...
About Ivar...
What, did you talk to him after all?
Well yeah, sort of talked. He's not quite sane somehow. At first I thought he really was a zombie or drunk.
There you go... I'm telling you, radiation got him. For sure.
Maybe so. That's not the point. He said something strange. That they shouldn't have turned off that "Brain Scorcher". I don't understand this.
Why do you need to understand? Who knows what he's mumbling. Try to figure out now whether he's saying all this in delirium or awake.

No... He speaks poorly, but you can see it's just hard for him to speak. Otherwise he understands me, talked about scientists in Pripyat. And generally, he clearly wants to turn the installation at Radar back on. But if radiation appears again, those who already went north might die.
So go and lead them by the hand if you're so caring. Created a problem out of thin air. Took someone's ravings seriously... What's it to you who went where.
Ravings or not, there's something here. And he keeps saying it's Strelok...
What about Strelok? Come on, finish.
Just like that, nothing. I don't understand yet myself. I should check something. Make sure, in case Ivar's right.
You've tired me with your Ivar! Instead of wearing out my brain with his ravings, go to that Pripyat, take a walk, what's it cost you.
And where is it, Pripyat, don't you know?
I've heard about it, but how to get there - I don't know. Ask Docent. I think he'll tell you.
Hic... Who are you?
Marked One.
Ahh... I heard somethin' about you... You're good overall, quick...
You're confusing me, I'm not Nimble.

Wait, let's drink... I ain't confusing nothin'... You're quick at pulling off deals, they told me... Finding all kinds of crap - that's your thing... Come on, what's your name - Soaked, Drenched... Oof, Soviet power is strong!
Alright, I'm off.
No, wait... Don't you respect me or what?
Go sleep it off. I don't have time to listen to your babble.
Yeah, I respect you, I respect you. Come on, keep talking... What'd you want?

I wanted? Wasn't it you? Oh, right! I got business, right up your alley, finding stuff... bringing... this and that. Anyway, one smart-ass dude... I, he says, I'm a scientist with a name, I'm all so learned. What was his name... Sniper... Shooter... Marksman. That's not it. Something like that spinning around. Ah! Whatever. So... asked to find his suitcase. There, he says, hic... instruments for the monolith gun. Says he left it in the lab... said something else, a number... no, an index...
Well, well, what was it? X-16? X-18?
Oh! You're the hammer. Gimme five... no... ten. That's what he said - 10. Pour it up!
Hold off on pouring. What do you mean "ten"?
I'm telling ya: at Yantar the egghead left a suitcase... You don't get it or what?
Not really so far. Who - is he? What was his exact name? Remember! And what's Yantar got to do with it, you were talking about a laboratory? What monolith gun, what are you even talking about?

What am I... or what was he talking about? How should I know? You imagine what a big gun it is if there's a whole suitcase of instruments for it! Well, anyway... come on, Soaked, when you find it, drag everything here, we'll figure it out...
Alright... get some rest already.
Hic... Who are you?
Marked One. Go to sleep already.
Ah, you... What's your name there...
Hello. I'm Marked One. Remember? Listen, what was that about a scientist with a suitcase of instruments you were talking about?
What?
Well, you asked me to find instruments, remember?
No... Get lost, you're bugging me...
Bullshitter!
Good day! Or not so good? Something about your face, bro... Well, whatever. What should I call you? Got anything for me?
They call me Marked One. And what do you have here?

Marked One?! Listen! You're the one who took down that scum - the burer? Man, you're the guy! I owe you a gift! Wait a bit, I'll rummage through my stash, maybe I'll find a decent gun for you...\nAh! I didn't introduce myself - Lyokha's my name, nickname's Junkman. I collect all kinds of weapon junk, well not just weapons, don't turn down armor either. A small business like that. So if you have anything - bring it, I'll trade your junk for decent medicine.

Marked One?! Haven't heard. My name's Lyokha, nickname's Junkman. I collect all kinds of weapon junk, well not just weapons, don't turn down armor either. A small business like that. So if you have anything - bring it, I'll trade your junk for decent medicine.
By the way, about armor. Couldn't you find me a decent suit, with a mask or gas mask? Really need one. I'll pay.
A suit, unlikely. What stalkers bring me can't be restored anymore. I told you - junk.
And what do you need junk for?

Well... The question's not quite right. And a bit slippery... This worthless junk has quite a high price there, outside the Zone. You just need to know where and to whom... But that's purely personal business, you understand? Generally, I know - where and to whom.
Makes no difference to me, just sometimes you get such scrap metal instead of a gun.
You bring it, we'll see. Won't shortchange you, be sure.
Are you here all the time?
Almost all the time, unless some other creature drives me out of here. But I know who to turn to in such a case now... Right?
Tell me this: from here where can I get out to get closer to the Bar?
There's a path to the Garbage. I'll drop a marker in your PDA. There was a "Tarzan rope" there, but now the passage seems to be open.
Good, I'm off.
Hey, wait, Marked One! I promised you a gift...

By the way, I advise searching around here in the vicinity. Stalkers still manage to find useful things, can't figure out where they come from though? And also: be careful on the lower floor, don't get too close to the water, it's radiating like crazy there.
Found something?
I'll keep that in mind, thanks.
You bet! Though there's not much iron now, but good weapons can always be found with me. Here, quite a decent gun... if you repair it.
And what do I need this scrap metal for?

What are you saying? This is one of the most lethal guns. Takes down any monster with one shot. Well, almost. Yeah, condition's lousy, but take it to craftsmen - they'll fix it and use it to your heart's content.
I'm starting to feel sorry for that burer. Alright, see ya.
Greetings, Marked One! What do you have?
Here, take a look...
Well then... Let's figure it out.
Lyokha, you wouldn't happen to know Strelok? They say there was such a lucky stalker, but there's been no word of him for a long time. I really need to find him...

Strelok... Didn't get to know him, but his partner, Fang, used to visit me often. He was handy, could make candy out of junk, so he sometimes looked for certain parts. Also was a lucky stalker. But... too stingy. Why the sudden interest in Strelok after so much time?
If I'm asking, there's interest. I'm not interrogating you about your business. No offense. Can you tell me anything else useful?

Nothing special... It was long ago, more than six months passed.\nIf you happen to come across Strelok's trail, keep in mind - he had quite an unusual gun. I could throw in some valuable loot for it. Or maybe an expensive artifact. The rifle looks like an ordinary Kalash, but if you look closely, you'll immediately notice it's tricked out. Fang came to me with it once, looking for suitable parts. I first asked him to sell it, but he refused, no way. And then he spilled that the weapon actually wasn't his, but Strelok's. That's probably all I know.
Thanks for that. Tricked out Kalash, you say? I'll remember.
About Strelok's Kalash, remember we talked about it?
Yeah. What about it?
One person claims this is it. Recognize it?
Holy crap! Will you trade it? I'll give you a good artifact. Third level!
Nope, first I'll see it in action, then we'll see.
If the artifact's good, then you got it.
Thanks, Marked One!
Don't know when the emission will be?
Well... I don't have exact data, but I think information came through from Sakharov that
Don't know how much longer until the emission?
Vergas stopped by, complained about radiculitis... So,
The rats started squeaking strangely somehow... So,
Hmm, on the radio scientists seemed to say that
The color on my "Kolobok" is strange somehow... Probably,
Vergas, as he says, got relief... Heh-heh... So,
What do the instruments say - emission soon?
Can't say for sure yet, but it seems like,
Greetings. So I managed to get here. How are you doing?
Alright, generally.
Well that's great. Here, take a crab!

You helped me big time, and Rat remembers kindness. In the Valley I got a buddy left, they call him Rasp. He needs a neutral person to establish some connections. If you're in the Valley, shoot the breeze with him. He's got something unique, something that could really help in your wandering life. And he knows a lot about all kinds of shady deals they pull in the Zone.
Let's do without displays of "tender feelings", yeah?
Rasp? Yeah right, yeah right, memorable meeting...
So... you know him then, turns out?

You could say that. Your Rasp mugged me with his buddies. You weren't planning to send me to him on purpose, were you? In cahoots with him, confess? Watch it, I could whisper to the Duty guys who they really sheltered here...

No-no, what are you, bro! I'm not involved, I swear! No setup here, he really is looking for a capable stalker for some work. And for the trouble I'll compensate you a bit... gave away all the artifacts I had, but got 5 anti-rads. How about it, will you take them?
Alright, hand over your anti-rads. So you say there's sense in visiting Rasp again?
You bet! Won't lose out, for sure. Main thing, signal to him that you came from me, not just some random guy...
We'll see, maybe something will work out. See ya, "bro".
Hey there, pal! How's life?
Pal? Yeah right...
Greetings, Marked One. From where, to where, why?
Dropped by to chat with Doctor. How are your affairs?

Recovering slowly. In a month or two I'll be able to play football - that's how Doctor jokes. That's why I moved here, because time goes faster in the Thicket. I'll get better, settle some business and follow Mole and Fox to the resorts. Eh... girls, warm sea, tasty food... we'll party.
What about Fox and Mole? Have they left already?

Yeah, we talked and decided we have enough loot. For us, and our children, and our grandchildren, but life is one. They took their share and left. I stayed behind for now. I still have one business - unfinished.
What kind of business? If it's not a secret, of course.

No, not a secret. I really want to learn the mystery of these trucks with dead bodies. About six months ago my good friend disappeared, and then, two months later, they found him on one of those crashed trucks. Face disfigured, even hands seemed not his, but I recognized him. I tried not to think about it, but I can't. I'll keep trying to get to where these trucks come from. And deal with those who do such things to people.
And where do you want to get to? Do you know exactly where they come from?
I don't know for sure, but they come from somewhere in the center. But who launches them from there and why - that's a big question. You heard about teleports?
Something... in general terms.

I've been here for a long time, observed and understood for myself that the Zone is like... an anthill. You stand looking at it from above and can't understand how everything is arranged so cleverly. Seems like they're bustling around senselessly and you can't understand anything, but look closer - there's meaning in everything. Each one performs its role, and knows where to enter, where to exit. And there are many passages and exits. And they didn't think this up themselves. Someone controls this whole organization, structure.
I don't catch the connection... You took quite a sharp turn and drove a truck... into an anthill. And what do teleports have to do with it?

That's what I'm telling you - there are plenty of passages in this Zone, like in that anthill. There are entrances and exits. Such holes in space, sometimes even visible - like translucent bubbles hanging in the air. You've encountered them, probably? Someone even learned to use some passages by trial and error.\nSo here's the thing. I once got carried away to the District Center. And there, in the very center of the city, I spotted one such bubble. Right before my eyes a truck jumped out of it, flew through the whole city and flew into another bubble. That second one dissolved immediately, but the one in the center - remained, but not for long. It also disappeared after a while. That truck didn't decide to drive on its own, someone directed it through one bubble to another, and there, probably, to a third - and God knows where and through how many passages it flew out. Maybe even at Cordon... Most interesting - from where, where's the starting point?
Listen, Redhead, was there a controller nearby by any chance?

There was a controller, but far away. And this isn't a hallucination! In other places there are bubbles too, and they say they've seen trucks...\nAlright, listen, since we're talking about the District Center. I have a small stash left in that District Center. There's a healing artifact there, I really need it, you understand. Could you bring it? There's another excellent artifact lying there and some other small stuff. You can take all of it for yourself, as gratitude, both for this and for previous help.
You're talking about Ivankovsky District Center, right? Tell me where exactly, I'll try.

About it, yes. But I don't remember the exact place... You see, this city is a very bad place. Especially the central part. Like some energy vampire settled there and pulls strength out of you drop by drop. I spent only a couple of hours there, but got so exhausted that I could barely stand on my feet and was really out of it. That's why I dropped the backpack with part of the loot.\nIt was in the school, somewhere on the second floor. Look there.

About it, yes. But I don't remember the exact place... You see, this city is a very bad place. Especially the central part. Like some energy vampire settled there and pulls strength out of you drop by drop. I spent only a couple of hours there, but got so exhausted that I could barely stand on my feet and was really out of it. That's why I dropped the backpack with part of the loot.\nBehind the garage boxes there are garbage containers, next to a tree. Look there.

About it, yes. But I don't remember the exact place... You see, this city is a very bad place. Especially the central part. Like some energy vampire settled there and pulls strength out of you drop by drop. I spent only a couple of hours there, but got so exhausted that I could barely stand on my feet and was really out of it. That's why I dropped the backpack with part of the loot.\nThere are three Khrushchevkas in the northern part. I remember, I stopped to catch my breath near one of them. Downed a couple energy drinks straight away, and then a "Burner", such a bastard, showed up and I had to run. Seems like I threw the backpack onto the canopy of the entrance where I was standing. Or maybe it wasn't an entrance, but the opposite - a descent to the basement.
Marked One, glad to see you.
And you stay healthy.
So you're just sitting here?
Yeah... getting treatment. Did you visit the District Center?
I did, damn it... Terrible place, and the creatures...
What is, is. Did you find what I asked for?
I, well... Can't get through to the center there, legs like cotton and fierce hunger.
Found the stash. Here's your artifact. Barely made it through... Heavy going there, legs like cotton and fierce hunger. Strange city.
Found the artifact, but I still have it... thought already and not... If anything, I'll bring it quickly.

Alright, don't worry, I understand everything. Couldn't do it, so you couldn't. Don't take it to heart... I don't really need it anymore anyway, I'm getting better as it is. If you find it, keep everything for yourself. Well, if you already found it, it's yours anyway, by right.
Thank you, Marked One. With this artifact I'll get back on my feet quickly, well and Doctor will help with his remedies. Write down this recipe, how to get a very rare modificate.

Thank you, Marked One. Doctor helped a lot with his remedies. I'm feeling much better already. Go up the ladder, there's a box under the roof. There's a supply of medicine there, it's yours. I don't need that much anymore, I'm getting better as it is.
Alright, don't worry. I'm feeling much better already. If you found something, keep everything for yourself. It's yours, by right.
Greetings.
Redhead asked to get to his stash in Ivankovsky District Center and bring a healing artifact from there. I can take the rest of the stash contents for myself for the effort.
I was at the Army Warehouses, there's one strange person there.
You know, sometimes it seems to me that it's hard to meet normal people in the Zone, and there are plenty of strange ones here... What struck you about this individual?
He appeared unusually. They say he fell right out of the air, completely naked. Two-three weeks ago. They say his face was cleanly shaven and generally, he didn't look like a stalker or military.
Hmm, curious. And what does he say himself?
He doesn't say anything coherent. Mutters something... I thought I heard: "Ghost, ghost... took the brain... Colleague... Sakharov doesn't answer..." - that's why I got interested.

Hmm... This can't be! Could it really be... however, I won't make hasty conclusions. How could I get to know this subject closer? At the Army Warehouses, you say? That's where the so-called free anarchists dwell? Pretty far. Maybe you could try to bring this person here?

But he can't make head or tail of anything! Sits there, shakes his head, mumbles under his breath. Can't carry him on your back, and I don't have transport. This isn't a job for one person. You should assign someone to help.

Let's do it differently. Our graduate student, Mateyev, will go with you. Escort him to the Bar. From there, to the Army Warehouses, he can go himself. The road there is safe, as far as I know. We need to make sure it's really the prof... the one I'm thinking of. If my guess is confirmed, we'll send transport.
Unfortunately there are no free people right now. But I'll keep your information in mind and try to solve this problem.
Vovchik Mateyev?! He's here? And how is he in your opinion?

He's normal now. He's a strong guy. Yes, he experienced a strong psychological shock, but the stress from what he experienced in the laboratory will quickly fade into the background before the opening prospects of scientific recognition.
Well then, I'll go chat with an old acquaintance.
I'll tell him now, he'll come over.
At the Army Warehouses they said you took... the strange subject.

What are you talking about? Oh, yes... assistant Mateyev spoke with that person, as much as it was possible, examined him and reported to me. I decided to transfer him to our research center. There are people who can deal with him.

What are you talking about? Oh, yes... assistant Sukharev spoke with that person, as much as it was possible, examined him and reported to me. I decided to transfer him to our research center. There are people who can deal with him.
So is this Vasilyev or who?

Externally, as I was told, he resembles the professor, but his cognitive abilities have suffered significantly. Even if it's confirmed that "physically" it's him, then mentally he currently doesn't differ from those mooing ones that wander around the factory. How severely his brain was affected by radiation exposure, one can only guess.
Shame, I thought I'd manage to talk with him.

That's completely out of the question. A long rehabilitation course will be required, and even then no guarantees. In any case, thank you for taking part in Professor Vasilyev's fate. I'd like to reward you. I'm sending to your PDA a method of obtaining a rare and unusual artifact.

That's completely out of the question. A long rehabilitation course will be required, and even then no guarantees. In any case, thank you for taking part in Professor Vasilyev's fate. Accept this small reward.
Professor, I'd like to ask you something about the District Center.
What district center? Where?
Well in the Zone it seems, where else.
Ah... district 85 - Ivankovsky District Center? You mean that one?
Whatever you call it! 85, 86... Am I asking you or are you asking me? Well, probably that's the one.
Calm down, young man, why have you become so jumpy... I just didn't understand, speak more specifically, what interests you.

You'd get jumpy here too... In short, they say there's such a district center, well this one - Ivankovsky, 85. And supposedly there should be some kind of group there... your colleagues. I'd like to talk with them.

You see, I personally didn't send anyone there. We don't conduct activities beyond district 73. Especially in such dangerous places as district 85. That's somewhere beyond the Tesla zone, if I'm not mistaken. I definitely wouldn't send anyone there, even if they begged to go themselves.
So, but what about... I thought you were the head of all the scholarly brotherhood here, well that is the expedition...

No. I repeat once more: if some group of scientists is working there, it has no relation to us. And why did you get the idea that I manage all field expeditions? We have our own direction, strictly limited by funding framework. But I know that other groups of scientists also operate in the Zone, having their own sources. Many, you know, try to advance their utopian ideas in the Zone at someone else's expense.
So, not yours... And what can you reliably tell about this district 85 in general? The rumors going around are... varied.

Actually, nothing. And don't look at me like that! Remote districts of the Zone currently don't present scientific interest for us, and idle curiosity is somehow not too characteristic of me. You should ask about this in your stalker environment.
If only I knew who to ask. It's not exactly a thoroughfare there. Try to find at least one stalker who's been to the District Center.
Well then engage in searching, and don't distract me anymore with such trivial questions. Is that all?
Heard anything about the District Center?
The one that's - Ivankovsky District Center?
How should I know! District Center and that's it. What is it, how to get there?
Somewhere in PDAs I came across mentions... Didn't particularly interest me, but I saved the information on the laptop. If only I could remember which file...
Trading has begun, as I understand. How much?

Pleasant to deal with understanding people. A second level artifact will be enough. But keep in mind, I can't guarantee reliability, so no complaints later if something's wrong. I need to rummage through archives, give me a couple minutes.
Alright, I'll walk around meanwhile.
What about the District Center, found anything?
There's something, yes. And did you bring the artifact, as we agreed?
Of course. Take it, hard worker.
Damn, forgot. Wait up.

Anyway, if you summarize and filter all the stalker nonsense, this area really exists. And the rumors about it are, to put it mildly, strange and contradictory. Supposedly fatigue piles up on a person there and terrible hunger overwhelms. Just like some anomalous zone inside the Zone. Moreover, the closer to its center, the stronger the fatigue presses - you could just lie down and die. Horrible, in short. Reminds of typical stalker tales, right?\nWell that's all lyrics. You wanted to know how to get to the District Center - here you go. It's located north of the Tesla zone, accordingly, that's where the road begins. Let me mark on your PDA... approximately, somewhere here should pass the old asphalt two-lane, follow it and you'll get there.
Hmm... seems like quite a place this District Center. Listen, is there any mention of scientists in those parts in your archives?
No. I mainly get PDAs from stalkers or bandits. You'd better ask at Yantar from Sakharov. They there, supposedly, maintain contact with all the scholarly brotherhood of the Zone.
That's understandable... Alright, thanks for that much.
I got my hands on a bandit PDA, will you take a look? It's password protected tight, seems like.
What's there to look at? Plenty of those punks die with mobiles. Just criminal filth inside.

There's an opinion that it has recorded secrets of their boss - Borov. Well and, possibly, something else interesting. I'm especially interested in information about the underground laboratory. Supposedly it should be in Dark Valley.
Well give it here, I'll look. Got curious myself. The service will cost you two zero-level first tier artifacts. In excellent condition that is. Deal?
Yeah, deal. Here's the PDA. When should I come back?
Nah. I'll think it over for now. Maybe I'll come back later.
Come back in about an hour.
Got it. In an hour, so in an hour.
Well, how are things with cracking the bandit PDA?
I, as promised, got into the memory of this minicomputer. And you didn't forget about payment?
Yeah I remember everything, I remember. Here are the artifacts.
Haven't found suitable artifacts yet. But I'll bring them for sure. Later.

Excellent. I had no doubt.\nHere, look. There was a schematic in the PDA. As I understand it, it shows the entrance to the laboratory you were interested in. I'll transfer it to you now. Is this what you needed?
Yeah, thanks. Well, see ya!
I found a PDA in one laboratory, will you take a look?
Hmm... You can always take a look? Only the rate has gone up now. There's less work, everyone rushed north, but you gotta live. An artifact... third level.
Understood. Here's the PDA. When should I come back?
I'll think it over for now. Maybe I'll come back later.
Working on one order right now. As soon as I'm free, I'll deal with your PDA. I'll let you know, wait.
Clear. Just try not to take too long.
Heard you were asking for me? Well, how are things with the PDA?
I, as promised, got into the memory of this minicomputer. And you were supposed to bring me something for this? We agreed on an artifact?
Yeah I remember. Here's the artifact.
Slipped my mind. I'll bring it.

I had no doubt.\nManaged to decipher something! There's a lot of scientific chatter and other personal stuff. But here's what might be interesting for you - there's a stash, by description a rich one, in Red Forest. So if you happen to visit there, look for it. And also... It turns out strangely somehow. Seems to me that different people made entries in the PDA. And about this stash, it's like an addition, doesn't fit the general style, doesn't match. Didn't even have to decipher it much. But there's no author's signature. Only P.S: "left part of the equipment... this should be useful to him".
Red Forest isn't a couple bushes, it's big. Where exactly?
Somewhere in the northern part. It's written that it's hidden in a tank. As far as I know, by rumors and gossip, there's only one tank there. You won't miss it...
Alright, maybe I'll check it out, if the occasion arises. Yeah interesting, how did a nerd get such information in his PDA. And for whom?
Listen, Docent, I got my hands on one curious radio. Someone sends messages to it with some telecode. Encrypted, I think. Can you tinker with it?
Telecode? Who the hell thought of that? Let me have it for a minute... Yes, there's one received message in memory and - you're right - it's encrypted.
Aha! Will you work on it? I'll pay you back, of course.

Yeah no problem. Only the payment this time will need to be special. In my free time I'm working on one... project. Right now I have a block due to lack of some spare parts. Ordering them from outside the perimeter will cost crazy money, but I found a reasonable alternative. Local science extensively uses universal anomaly detectors. By disassembling a couple of those, I'll get the missing parts. As I know, at Yantar Sakharov readily trades detectors to stalkers. Are we agreed?
Uh... You know, it's not that important for me to know what's in the message. Two detectors he wants...
Two universal anomaly detectors. Deal. Here's the radio. How much time will you need?
Can't say for sure. I think, about six hours. I'll let you know when I'm done.
\nFor decrypting the message from Bold's radio, Docent asks to bring him two universal anomaly detectors.
Well, how goes it, Docent? Got something to cheer me up? About the radio, if you didn't get it.
No news yet. I told you I'd let you know. That's it, don't bother me.
What do you think? I didn't send you a message for nothing. Did you bring what I asked for?
What do you think? Otherwise I wouldn't have come. Take your gadgets. So?
Damn it! Got completely worn out, totally slipped my mind... Everything will be ready soon.

The message turned out to be extremely short. These are coordinates of a district in digital format. Let me mark on your PDA where this is... Done.\nYes, if you don't mind, I'll keep the radio for myself, it'll also come in handy for parts.
Hmm... Coordinates in Red Forest. I think I can guess what I'll find there. And you can take the radio, I don't need it. Farewell.
But what about Fang? He was supposed to be taken out of the Zone.
Fang... This is very complicated. You see, it's not quite Fang...
Not quite? I don't understand something...

Not surprising. Nobody can understand. I'll describe the facts to you, and the conclusions... You can draw conclusions yourself. When what we call the stalker nicknamed Fang was taken to one of the hospitals in Kiev, some... Um... Incidents began... Something like that...
What kind of incidents? Please, don't drag it out, I need to know! This person is one of the keys to the lock of my memory...

All kinds... Electronic equipment was failing. Electric current was disappearing. Gravity was changing chaotically. It seemed like the laws of our world stopped working. Certainly, it was interesting from a scientific point of view, but this creature... It became unstable. That is, the longer it stayed there, the less time someone could see it...
And then what?

It was decided to return it to "natural" conditions. Here, to the Zone. But here it went into a rage and now we have to constantly keep it under the influence of tranquilizers and hope for a miracle that will allow us to understand what surprise this Zone has given us...
This is all somehow... unclear. Are you sure he was taken away? I never went to the surface, as you ordered. Was there a helicopter or not?
You don't believe me, my dear fellow? And I just wanted to thank you. I wanted to give you a suit.
What did I do to deserve such honors?

For your diligence. You've done so much for us already, conducted so many experiments, and in such places where not everyone would risk going. Provided many artifacts and other materials for study. This cannot go unappreciated. Accept it and remember - you earned this not in vain.
Well... I don't even know... Thank you. Well okay, but what about Fang? Why don't you undress him? Even if you don't consider him human, there are still some moral norms.

What moral norms, for what's lying there? Oh yes, I didn't explain. It turns out that what he's wearing is one with the flesh. There's no person in clothes, there's a creature that looks like a person in clothes. Maybe it considers itself human, but it's not human. The metamorphoses are very surprising: heavy radioactive elements don't settle on this creature's surface, but penetrate inside and are somehow "dumped" somewhere. It's completely "clean" in radiation terms... Practically doesn't need food.
Can you talk to him? I did talk to him there, in the underground. And he didn't seem strange to me... Well, considering what happened to him, of course.

I'm afraid that much has changed in him since then. So... there is no Fang, there's something that looks like Fang, accept this as a given. I'm very sorry. But don't despair, every day the Zone presents us with another riddle. And sometimes a solution. We'll try to research, study, look for ways... Maybe we'll get lucky... Or you will.
I need to charge my PDA.
Well go ahead, what are you waiting for?
The guys in the village have a fuel shortage right now, they're told to save electricity. You should bring them a canister of gasoline, Marked One, eh? Or we'll have to wait until others deign...
Charger's busy for now, come back later.
Here, take this one.
Made a mistake...
What bad luck... Alright, let's see.
No problem, I'll wait.
Yeah, indeed the charge is at zero. Come back in about half an hour. Prepare four hundred rubles for charging.
In half an hour? Good.
Well, what about my PDA? Is it charged?
Huh? Sorry, got lost in thought. Your PDA isn't charged yet.
One moment... Yes. It's charged. Do you have four hundred rubles?
Alright, I'll wait...
Yes, of course. Here, take it.
But I forgot about the money... I'll bring it later.
Take it. If you need to charge something else - bring it over.
I'd like to charge my PDA.
Give it here.

Sorry, can't do it now. Generator was switched to economy mode, only enough for lighting and the Bar's needs. Nobody's brought gasoline in a while... If only you'd take on bringing a canister, otherwise it's unknown how long we'll have to wait.
Charger's busy now, come back later.
Here, take this one.
Uh... seems like I took the wrong one with me.
Well, what can you do...
Alright, it's not urgent for me anyway.
Is it really discharged? Maybe it's just broken? Though I see the light is blinking. Alright, come back in about half an hour. Seven hundred rubles it'll be.
Deal.
How's it going with my PDA? Is it charged?
Has half an hour passed already? No. Why did you come then?
Yeah. Seven hundred kilobucks from you, I remind you.
Well, sorry. Why did you get so worked up?
Kilobucks? Let me pay in rubles instead.
Here's the thing... I spent a bit too much. I'll pay you back somehow later.
Rubles, so rubles. Here's your handheld.
Can I charge my PDA with you?
Let me look at the connector. Yes, no problem.
You, Marked One, come in the evening, or even better - at night. During the day the load on the network is heavy, and the professor constantly grumbles about it.
Can't do it now. No free charger.
Then take it. How can I thank you?
Stop! I got confused, I don't need to charge anything.
Hmm... if that's the case, then I'll drop by after sunset.
Got it. So, another time then.
Oh come on. I'm not cranking a dynamo machine by hand here to charge for it. You'll pick it up in about thirty minutes.
Really? Thanks. Small thing, but nice.
Can you check if my PDA is charged?
One moment... Not yet.
Just took it out of the charger. Here's your device.
Alright, I'll take a walk meanwhile...
Thank you.
I'd like to charge my PDA.
Show me what you got there.
Nothing doing. All chargers are occupied.
What's there to look at? Regular PDA. Here.
Wait, where's the one I prepared?! Sorry, seems like I made a mistake...
Bad luck! I'll come back later.
You never know. Some guy brought one here too, and his connector was all clogged with some crap. Had to clean it. With alcohol, by the way.
Got the hint. A bottle's on me.
Now that's completely different! Come back in about thirty minutes then.
Ah come on, Cook asked for you, so you don't need anything. Just come back in about thirty minutes.
Agreed. Just wait for me. Don't get the urge to go "clean" something else.
How are you doing, in good shape? And my PDA?
What? Oh! No. Not charged yet.
Yup. It's charged, waiting for you. And I'm waiting for something too.
Yup. It's charged, waiting for you. Take it. Don't need anything else charged? No? Suit yourself.
Alright, I'll wait...
Yes, I remember. Here it is, the precious one.
Damn... slipped my mind. Wait, I'll be quick.
Thanks! Your PDA. Don't need anything else charged? No? Suit yourself.
He!.. Will be... He-e-e... Omnipresent...
Good-d-d... Good-d-d... We'll learn....
He will come and... Yes! It shines!
We'll soar and in the sky life... Goes away. He...
Who? Everywhere! And protection from everything!
Bright is the road and softly will touch. Huh?! Me!
Who is this - He?
H-h-h-osan-n-a-a... P-p-p-e-e-e-ace-e...
W-w-w-w-well... Yeah right.
What's this about?
G-g-g-g-go away-y-y-y...
Already, what's going on...
What? What's shining there?
He! He! Everywhere! Knows! A-a-a-a!
Alright, calm down. I already understood everything...
Goes away? Who?
Light... Light... Light...
Did it get dark in your eyes or something?
Protection? What? Didn't understand anything.
Come-e-e-e...
Something wrong with the head, apparently...
What do you want?
Fear... Darkness... Horror!
Terrible business... Indeed.
We see you... we see all of you at once, anywhere in the universe... He helps us see...
I see you too... And who is he?
All are united with Him...
Mmm...
He feels your presence... He's ready to open the path through us...
Who are you talking about? Path to where?
All paths are open...
Come on...
With us is strength and light! It opens the path to past and future...
A time machine or something?
Light, light... Look, look, look...
Everything's clear with you...
We are here, we are everywhere... We are at any point. He helps us with this...
How's that? What do you mean everywhere?
He helps, He won't leave us... And there will be eternity!
Well if you don't want to talk, fine...
Enter me... enter my mind and move with me...
I'm not like that... And where are you calling me, where will we move?
We are in eternity... Darkness, and light, and mind, and crystal...
Didn't understand anything... What crystal?
I opened my mind... you can go... The path is free, He will guide you through time...
I'm already going... Where will he guide me, you say?
Path, the path is free... Go! Go! And... Desire...
Alright, I'm leaving already...
Light illuminates us... His light... Light lights our way... We have no barriers when He is with us...
Mmm... And whose light is it?
He is always with us... Light. Thought is primary...
Well, during the day yes... Or are you not talking about that? Ah, whatever...
Our consciousness is open... It is free in flight, He transfers it... to any point in the universe...
Really to any point?
Everything is one... Substances...
I see... That nothing is clear.
We are one... He and We... We abide in eternity with Him, time is subject to us, thanks to Him...
Uh-huh. And who is this We and who is this He?
Before us is eternity...
Well yes... why would you hurry when eternity is ahead.
He waits for you... Come and merge into His space... And abide in eternity...
He won't wait... Where, by the way, should I come to merge?
All paths are free...
Well no, so no...
He sees us... He is everywhere... He occupies all space, and We are in Him.
Calm down... We're all in the same space anyway.
He is not here...
What's that about? Hmm...
I immerse myself in him... He moves my consciousness. Space and time are subject to Him...
Well come on, move me somewhere away from here too...
Consciousness... Not all there... Here is the world.
What? Yeah right...
We are one consciousness... We merge with Him in a single flow... The flow carries us through time...
A flow, you say... And where will it carry us in the end?
All in a single point of the universe...
Uh... Well yes, I thought so...
We perceive you... He helps see, wherever you may be... And whenever you may be...
Well perceive away... Can you perceive my past?
Everything was, everything will be...
And what was? Yeah right...
Me? You! No one else will see... To me!
Won't see? What won't they see? Come on, speak properly...
Everything was, everything will be...
Something wrong with the head, apparently...
Be born anew... Live forever... And be everywhere...
Forever? And as what? Share the recipe...
Everything was, everything will be...
Will be, will be... Kebab out of you will be.
Blackness there, darkness here... Little understanding...
How can we understand you?! Darkness, blackness...
You will come and behold! Radiance...
Already. I behold. Stupidity...
You. Came. Long time. Marked with sign?
Sign? Mark on the hand or what? Here.
Yes... Too long.

What's too long? Were you specifically waiting for me or something? I actually don't even remember where this tattoo came from, thought I'd find out from you. Someone thinks you should know about this and that we could talk...
Waited. You weren't there. One like you. You people talk much. Ask much. Empty. Say main thing...
I don't get it... We're people, so what are you then?
Mind. Thought. All existence. Highest stage of development.
Really? And those over there mumbling nonsense, they're also the highest stage? Something's hard to believe...
You don't understand. Common mind. Talk not needed. Not for all. Talk with me. Don't get distracted.
Well alright... So who were you waiting for? It's unclear. And why?
One like you. You need to go further. Installation interferes with you. Interferes with us. You can pass.
Where? And why is it only I can pass, others probably can too if they try...
No. Blockade. You can. Those like you.
Hard to talk with you... Well alright, I need to go further, and why do you need the Brain Scorcher turned off?
Won't let leave. Interferes with thinking. Need to talk. Hard to understand.
Exactly, very hard. You definitely forgot how to talk... And what does "those like me" mean?
With blockade. Can get to needed place. Help us. We cannot.
Get where?
O-o-o... Not now. Now need to turn off. Will make sense to continue. All...
Continue what? Conversation? With you? How will I find you later?
Not me. Anyone. Many questions. Later. Do your business.
Business... If only I knew what kind of business...
Go. Act!
Already am.
Uh? Who are you? Can't figure it out somehow.
They call me Marked One.
Marked One? Nah, haven't heard... I think.
I'm new here. Walking around, looking around.
What's there to walk around for? Our people are sociable. At any campfire they'll be glad... if you got something to pour in a glass.
And who are you yourself?

I'm Slavik, the local cook! Master of knife and spices! Parsley there, dill, all kinds of greens... well, grass, basically. Bread too. And sometimes there's canned stuff... condensed milk, stew. Sausage! Game...
Alright-alright, I get it! Cook, then. I'll drop by again.
Marked One, will you do a good deed?
No time right now.
Depends what kind of deed.
Well see for yourself.

It's nothing! There's this dummy sitting not far from here on a swamp. A bit touched, but we don't hurt him, on the contrary even - we feed him. Even though he's not all there, he reliably shoots monsters. Go to him, bring some grub. I'll throw you some food for it too.
Your dummy, you take it to him. And I don't need food.
Since it's nearby, I'll go.
Look at us, what we are... I'll get better and go myself.
That's good, take this. Just keep in mind: there are mines and radiation there, so be careful, go along the edge of the swamp.
Just knew it was a setup. Eh...
Oh, what's your name, Marked One... Everything alright?
Your guy definitely doesn't have all his marbles. Barely convinced him to take the food.

That's true, there's a bit. Though, you know, even though he's a dummy, sometimes he'll say something and you sit and think, whether it's chance or he has some kind of gift of prophecy... It happens with fools, I once read in a scientific journal.
So what did he predict?
Not that he actually predicted... A truck appeared here recently, maybe you heard? So he was blabbing about a truck coming long before that happened.
That's all nonsense... If you write down everything every fool blabbers, you'll go off the rails yourself. You didn't forget about the grub, did you?
Ah! Of course, here.
Bro, hello. How are you? And I haven't slept a wink.
Hic... What, can't you see - I'm feeling bad?
Got wasted again?
So what?! Ah! You still won't understand... Some scumbag shot our touched guy...
It's boring somehow. Maybe, you know... five drops each?
I won't refuse if you're treating. And why five drops? If we're drinking, let's drink!
Then... Come on, let's have one.
Ah, went down good!
What, another shot?
Yeah... So it doesn't swerve to the side!
Let's go!
Heh-heh... you're slick at this! B-boom - and a new bottle. You got a warehouse there or what?
Got a supply, one more?
You asking! Well, so it's not the last time!\nA-ah, we're sitting good!
I found some key here... was lying by the entrance. You didn't lose it?
Let me see... Holy smokes! That's mine alright. Been searching all over, looked everywhere here it seems and still missed it somehow.
Nothing surprising. With your... lifestyle. Don't lose it again.

What do you mean me?! I just... Thanks, bro. Really helped me out. And I got nothing to give you... You know, I can ask Screw, our mechanic, to charge your electronics for free... Well, PDAs there, batteries, something else if needed. I think he won't refuse.
Kindred spirits with him? I get it. And actually, that would be nice. Thanks.
Here's what I want to ask: you wouldn't know, didn't some guy show up here with a distinctive metal briefcase?
What are you getting at, man? That I should... that to you... go and spill all the details? Who do you take me for?!
Calm down, calm down. I didn't know it was that serious.
Ah drop it! I'm just... we've only been drinking together on broth... brude... damn you... shaft! In short, be more careful with such questions, got it?
Deal, just between you and me. So do you know or not? I really need this guy... Just give me a hint.
Well... he was supposed to meet with our guys in the village. That's left from the bus stop, along the dirt road. But where you'll look for him there - no idea.
Ah!? Who are you?
Easy... Just passing by. Already leaving.
Brought you food. Here, take it, I'm in a hurry.
Brought... Food... Yes... Eh!? You have the sign! So it's you!?
Well a sign's a sign. Don't look at it.
Higher people... they're waiting for you... there... beyond the Barrier.
Alright, alright, don't strain yourself... I understand you, everything's fine: higher people, green little men on a saucer, we'll all be there in the end... You better put the food away somewhere.
No, wait! They're looking for you. I heard through the stone... stone fragment. Don't shoot them, they're waiting, want to talk only with you, don't want to with me, I lost the stone...
Listen, man. I understood everything... Don't get too upset, it's bad for you. There's nobody beyond the Barrier, well except zombies and Monolith guys probably.
That's it! They're waiting for you! Go to them... But I can't anymore, they won't accept me... And you come, come again, I'll tell you, tell you a secret!
Ugh! You tired me out. Alright, I'm leaving now, I'll talk to them, just sit quietly until I get further away. Don't grab your gun for now, okay?
Yes, I'm waiting for you, later. I have a secret...
That's it? Well I'm gone.
Ah!? You again?
Easy... Just passing by. Already leaving.
I... You didn't forget me, that's good. So what were you saying about a secret?
Did you talk to the higher people?
I talked, I talked... What's the secret?
"Scorcher" - barrier...
Well I get it. Beyond the Barrier is the "Scorcher". I know that. You concentrate... Remember about the secret? Come on, better tell me about that.
I'm talking about the secret. "Scorcher" - it's a barrier for the higher people. Need to turn off - they'll come here and make us all the higher race...
That's it? Make us the higher race, you say. And if I have Jewish roots, then probably I won't get it... And how did you learn about the sign, about the Monolith guys?
Stone spoke... In my head. But I lost it, now I don't hear, everything just buzzes... Bad! I want to go there and can't, they won't let me!
I thought you'd say something about a real secret.
Yes... real. Everyone wants... I already told them. They threatened.
Who are "they"? Also marked ones?
No. Others. Wanted secret. Different... I told them about forest, but didn't give key...
So there's another secret? About the key?

Huh? I need to go there, to them. How will I go? Man said he'd give their clothes, then they'll accept me as one of theirs. Even without stone. But gave different ones. I threw them away, don't need such...
Yeah... not easy for you to concentrate. You strain yourself, well that is, don't strain... well in short, relax. Damn! You confused me. What clothes?

Bad... there's much better than what I threw away... In them they'll definitely accept me, hid them well, in forest... and I have key... He said, a man will come, look at me, and will heal. And I'll give him the key. But he has no time to wait... But I'm not sick, no need to heal. I lost stone. I need stone.
Yeah what's there to heal about you, really. You're yelling that you already have a certificate... Alright, you confused me completely. I'm going. You don't have any key.
I do. I didn't give it to them. I'll give it to you. You were with them, you're allowed. Here. Everything's in forest, underground, open there...

Hmm... And indeed. A key, and in the forest a lock. Well, see ya. I'll drop by again sometime, and you'll tell me about other secrets. And... calm down. It's bad for you. I'll go, and you sit quietly, don't think about the stone until I leave.
Well yes, well yes. Me. How are you yourself? Alright? Got something to talk about.
Not for me. There. Everything was. But here - empty. Living without what exists. He. Took and here...
You should. Drink something maybe. Might feel better... Will you drink vodka?
Cool it, sicko! You answer me straight - is there something in your head?
Yes! Yes! Vodka. Give. It's burning there! Everything burned down, only ghosts remained. He.
Here. Don't pour it down your collar... And what ghosts?
But there's no vodka... I'll drop by later.
Ghost... Was looking. I found, but didn't tell. Told another.
You found something again, what a lucky guy. And what is it?
Tool... Found. And took apart, stone inside it. Wanted to take. But there's no stone there. Then hid... Don't remember.
Mmm... You found it? And who else did you tell?
Don't... remember. Redhead... in tank. In forest. Was smart, with ghost. Told him where, but didn't tell his ghost. Got angry at me...
Redhead in tank? Or what? And who got angry - the smart guy or his ghost?
Ghost... ghost... go away. There was tank, redhead. Don't remember anything...
Hey! Wait! What kind of tool? And what was inside?
Nothing there... It burns. Vodka, vodka. Give!
I won't give you anything else... Everything's clear with you - psycho.
Get lost! I'm a psycho, and I have a certificate! I'll strangle you!
Idiot...
Good health to you, stalker! What's your name? If not for you, some creatures would be eating me.
I'm Marked One. What happened?

My story's pretty banal. Saw an artifact. Got close and... Got hit on the dome with something heavy. Some scumbags were lying in wait. While I was out - they pulled everything out. Bastards. While I was lying here, thought I'd get better - bullshit! And now... Stayed alive and that's good... Just a shame, got nothing to thank you with. Ah! Here's binoculars they left... Need them?
Sure, will come in handy. What kind of scumbags?

Take them... Just ordinary ones. Would crush the bastards. But we just can't unite, everyone goes alone, so they take advantage. Through my knockout I kinda heard they gathered a pile of loot to drag to Borov. Went north, to the Valley, the bastards...
I see. Alright, see ya. I'm going my own way...
Listen, bandits are pressuring people at the vehicle graveyard.
Those bastards! Always like that, gang up on one or two and bolt quickly. Go look for wind in the field...
Well here's just the case when you can catch them red-handed. It's known they'll show up at the vehicle graveyard by evening. Bes is gathering a team for ambush there. Will you join?

Hmm... Bes? I heard he's not particularly clean himself... Well-l-l I'll think about it. I still haven't recovered from that hit to the head, seeing double. What kind of fighter am I? I'll just get in the way...
Good journey to you, Marked One...
I was told here that you're interested in Strelok?
Yeah. Know anything about him?

I once talked with Lyoha. I got lucky then, got into a shootout between Clear Sky guys and bandits. Well watched from the side how they wasted each other... What stupidity, right? Anyway, took a lot of junk from the departed and went to him, to the Sanatorium. Drank, ate, talked about life... Lyoha mentioned that someone from Strelok's group brought him something unusual, some kind of gun. If you get a chance - talk to him. Lyoha was really angry at this Strelok then. Probably knows something specific...
Lyoha, who's he?
Well, this... Junkman. Sits in the Sanatorium. Trades various busted junk for medicine. Everyone knows him...
Ah... That one. I thought you meant someone else.
There's no other one like him.
And how do you carry junk, through Cordon?
Why run so far... You can enter from Garbage. In the woods, behind the swamp, there's an old collector. Through it you'll get to the Sanatorium.
Alright, we'll see...
Listen, bandits are pressuring people at the vehicle graveyard.
Those bastards! Always like that, gang up on one or two and bolt quickly. Go look for wind in the field...
Well here's just the case when you can catch them red-handed. It's known they'll show up at the vehicle graveyard by evening. Bes is gathering a team for ambush there. Will you join?

Hmm... Bes? I heard he's not particularly clean himself... But I'll think about it. Honestly, still haven't recovered from that hit. Head spins sometimes, seeing double, hands shake. What kind of fighter am I? I'll just get in the way.
How's life, Marked One? I see you look pretty good.
From Garbage? How's our Prapor there, alive, smoker?
The soldiers got all worked up lately. Don't know why?
You should, you know, get going from here. Or some brass will show up for inspection and see that I'm shooting the breeze with you here...
How's the loot? Haven't carried out all of Garbage yet?
Man, dogs keep attacking constantly! Don't accidentally get in the crosshairs...
Heard you got business with our general? You're rising.
Wasn't it you who stirred up trouble at Agroprom? Ah, anyway, what's it to me...
You got access to Voronin, they say? Probably there's a reason for it.
How sick of everything! These duties, inspections, damn bar...
No contact again with our guys at Garbage. Wonder if they're alive...
You better run through quickly before the monsters charge again.
Man, don't hang around here, you might catch a stray bullet by accident.
No desire to help? You look military. Duty needs people like that.
No time for you now. Come to the bar later, we'll talk there.
Be more careful, stalker. Blind dogs always hang around nearby.
Hello! Someone from ours told me about you. They say you're a stand-up guy.
Oh! You're that... Marked One, right? I heard you earned respect from our guys.
Don't loom around here, okay? Forward scouts reported that mutants are stirring again in the area.
Want some free advice? Right behind our outpost the wasteland begins. Don't go there. Wild Territory didn't get its name for nothing.
If you're planning to head to the Army Warehouses, keep in mind they recently heard a chimera roaring in that direction.
Hello, man. We don't know each other? I think I saw you somewhere. Or it just seemed...
Well, hi. I have memory problems myself. So maybe we do know each other, but I don't remember. Come on, strain your mind. Do you recognize me?

I'd strain it, but not now. Gotta somehow stand guard until the end, but I got no strength left. These "righteous" ones wore me out... When they invited me to Duty, they promised there'd be money and gear. But in reality - stand here like an idiot, watch for order, like a security guard at a market. E-eh...
Yeah. Maybe we'll talk when you get off shift then?
You know what... What did you say your name was?
Now it's Marked One. And what I was called before - no idea.
And everyone here calls me Lucky. But that's a long story...\nYou, Marked One, come by the bar early morning. We'll drink, chat. Maybe I'll really remember something about you...
Deal.
Marked One, I can't talk now. Look for me at the bar in the morning, okay?
Got it. See you there.
Get lost.
Hello, man. We don't know each other? I think I saw you somewhere. Or it just seemed...
Well, hi. I have memory problems myself. So maybe we do know each other, but I don't remember. Come on, strain your mind. Do you recognize me?

I actually came here to relax, not strain myself. If you knew how these "righteous" ones wore me out... When they invited me to Duty, they promised there'd be money and gear. But in reality - you stand for half a day like a security guard at a market, keeping watch for order. Ugh... Come on, maybe we'll have a drink to getting acquainted? What's your name, by the way?
Now they call me Marked One. And what I was called before - no idea. Wait before drinking. So do you remember me or not?

Yeah the face seems familiar... Everyone here calls me Lucky, if you're wondering. But that's a long story...\nHere's the thing, Marked One. I'm tired. You'd splash me some white stuff, maybe it would clear up in my head. Maybe I'll really remember something about you then...
Marked One, is that you? How about five drops each? To clear up the brains.
Will there be any point? Oh, I'm doubting something.

I once came across an old newspaper, and there was an article about some folk healer. He claims that alcohol in moderate doses stimulates mental activity. Expands blood vessels or something. And we'll be - exclusively moderate. Pour it, in short.
Pour, pour... Hell with you! Let's go!
The pourer's broken. Another time, maybe.
There... feel it? Already started expanding. Let's immediately chase the first one to consolidate success.
Now... Shuddered!
The fog in my head almost cleared. A little more and crystal clarity will come. Continue?
Enough. You yourself just talked about moderation. Let's return to the main question on the agenda: do you know me?

Eh... Don't be angry, Marked One, I mistook you. You look like my buddy, Mishka Potapenko. We used to go AWOL together... that was still in training, before I got to the Zone. Haven't seen him for two years already. He wanted to go work in Europe and stay there. Maybe he left, I don't know. Eh... let's have another shot, eh?
I knew it. Waste of time. Find yourself other drinking buddies.
Hello, bro! Will you drink with me?
Some other time. I'm here on business.
Yeah? Well then lay it out, what's on your mind.

Remember, you said the bosses got on your nerves? Like, they promised one thing, but in reality - no decent pay, no good gear, no meaningful work... Deceived your best expectations, in short. Was that the case?

Well... I was exaggerating a bit, for effect. But generally, yeah, I even thought about writing a report, turning in my gun and parting with this shop amicably. But then I thought: what exactly am I fussing about?! The work isn't dusty, and that they pay little - well risk bonuses are only for those who work in the field. But in raids you can easily lose your head.
They pay little? What if you were offered to improve your financial situation in exchange for a small favor?
Logical. And here, on the territory, is it really that safe? Mutant packs regularly come out to your outposts, as I understand.
What? What kind of favor?

So they shoot them at the outposts. It happens, of course, they break through sometimes, and there are plenty of holes around, but we catch such ones quickly with the whole community. Except at night it's really scary. Especially when you're standing guard alone. Last week there was a case: a pseudodog dug a passage under the fence, wandered into the warehouse yard in the darkness, and mauled the sentry to death. Nobody noticed until the sergeant stumbled on the body.
One guy would like to transport cargo through your territory, but quietly, without publicity. Ready to pay well to whoever would help out.
Just, you know, nothing special. Need to drag some cargo through the general's domain. And without extra attention. Compensation guaranteed.
I see. Aren't you a planted spy, dear man? Singing like a nightingale here, you know... This is like a test, right? Confess while it's good! Who sent you? Ivantsov? Him, right?

I see. Aren't you a planted spy, dear man? Singing like a nightingale here, you know... Confess while it's good! Who sent you? Aren't you from Borov's gang of scumbags? Hey, guys! Looks like a disguised bandit here!
Hey, friend, calm down! I'm not planted, just joking! Such stupid humor I have.

Well, you tell me! I understand that there's such darkness you could poke your eye out, but don't they even give you flashlights for night duties? What's the use of such a guard if he can't see shit a couple steps from himself!

Yes, the organization of service is not up to par, to put it mildly. Better then to really go on mutant raids - at least you can make some money.
