However, there's an option to rise up nicely even in your rear position. What do you think, if you were offered to improve your financial situation in exchange for a small favor, would you agree?

That's just it, they don't give them out. Shining all night - no batteries would be enough, they say. And there are few flashlights themselves, if our supply guys are to be believed. There are searchlights at checkpoints, lighting in the Bar, at our headquarters, some other places around the territory. But you still can't stick a flashlight in every dark corner, and night vision is a terrible shortage. They only give them to those who go on long mutant raids.

What cheapskates your commanders are. Maybe someone just has their own little business, selling supplies meant for you on the side?! And what, very likely. You know, in that case you could with clear conscience also have your own little profit. Purely to improve financial situation. In exchange for a small favor.
And what do you think to do? Will you keep screwing around until someone else gets torn apart? Soon you'll get to deserters.

Saving the drowning is primarily the business of you know who. I talked here with knowledgeable guys from your shop. Turns out local science doesn't stand still. Eggheads who sit somewhere in the Swamp learned to make special pills that allow a person to see in the dark for some time. Called "Dog's Eye" or something.
Not "dog's" but "cat's", but otherwise correct. The quartermaster at the science camp trades them for various monster guts or artifacts.

Right, that's what they told me. I'd love to get there somehow, but who would let me go? Leave isn't soon. And I got nothing to offer for trade - I'm not a stalker.\nListen, Marked One, you seem like an experienced guy, probably been to the Swamp, right? Maybe you'll drop by those eggheads, get me some pills, about 20? I'll find a way to thank you, you won't be at a loss, I promise.
No problem. It's right on my way. Only instead of thanks I'll also ask you for a small favor, deal?
Sure I won't be? They'll ask plenty for 20 pills. Quite a safari ahead, or I'll have to crack open my stash of artifacts.
About a favor? What favor? And by the way, you said at the beginning of the conversation you had some business...
I'll find a way to compensate, don't worry. And if it's not enough, we'll work something out. By the way, you said at the beginning of the conversation you had some business...
We'll discuss when I return from the Swamp.
Lucky, a Duty fighter, asks to bring him "Cat's Eye" pills, 20 pieces, so it won't be so scary to stand guard at night.
Still drinking, Lucky? I visited the Swamp and got what you asked for.
This... "dog's eye", right? Cool! Pour them into my pouch. I'll definitely test them tonight.
Here are your pills. Now let's talk about what's due to me, if you don't mind.
Judging by your look and mood, there should be a lot due. Did they really rip you off that bad?
Doesn't matter. I warned you I'd ask for a return favor, not payment for overhead costs with a bonus on top.

Ripped off or not, I had to invest quite a bit. So I want, besides expense reimbursement, to additionally ask for something. Especially since it won't cost you anything. Rather the opposite - you'll profit yourself.
Well, yeah, exactly. And what do you want from me?
Even so? Curious. Continue.
Not me, another person. He'd prefer to remain incognito, so he'll communicate with you exclusively through PDA. And for that he needs your device's communication code.

I'm only acting as an intermediary, the request comes from... another person. He'd prefer to remain incognito, so he'll communicate with you exclusively through PDA. And for that he needs your device's communication code.
Ah, I get it. So from an unregistered PDA you can connect to another directly, by its code. Heard about that. And what does this mysterious Mr. "X" need?

One-time help with moving some cargo through Duty territory. So it's without noise and dust. He'll thank you from the heart. That's all. You'll discuss details yourselves. I need your agreement in principle, well and the communication code.

Not planning to smuggle a nuclear bomb, I hope? Alright, you scratch my back, I'll scratch yours. I'll try to help if we agree on price. I'll copy the communication code for you now...\nAnd also. I don't know what they promised you for my "recruitment", but I'd like to repay you for the help. Especially since you trusted me and got the pills at your own expense.\nThere was a small skirmish here a month ago. Some random mercs showed up at the northern outpost, our guys shot them all. One of the trophy guns taken from them, I won that same night in cards from a direct participant in the shooting. But I don't use it because it's NATO caliber, and they don't issue us such ammo. I'm giving it to you basically. Only you'll have to go get it, it's not far. As you head toward the Army Warehouses, on the left side of the road there'll be a "gap" between two buildings, where dogs always make their den. You'll see a cross by the fence - that's where I hid the gun.

Not planning to smuggle a nuclear bomb, I hope? Alright, you scratch my back, I'll scratch yours. I'll try to help if we agree on price. I'll copy the communication code for you now...\nAnd also. I don't know what they promised you for my "recruitment", but I'd like to repay you for the help. Especially since you trusted me and got the pills at your own expense.\nWhen I was seriously considering whether to bail from Duty, I started preparing an emergency stash so I wouldn't be left bare-assed when I turn in my gear. Put everything in a cache nearby. Own it basically. As you head toward the Army Warehouses, on the left side of the road there'll be a "gap" between two buildings, where dogs always make their den. You'll see a cross by the fence - that's where I hid everything.
Didn't expect that, thanks. I'll go look for your cache, and you wait for messages on the PDA now.
Well this... Hello, or what?
Well hello. What are you doing here?

Like... sitting here. Got anything to eat? We traded bread from the local guys for ammo, but can you really get full on that?! We could use a couple cans or some sausage... we'd even agree to that stalker crap. You got any?
Here, I got some sausage...
Open a can?
Try the local liver? Here...
I don't have any with me...
O-o-oh! Thanks! Been days without normal grub... Good thing you showed up... What's your name?
Liver? Smells like something... Rotten, no? Alright! Been days without normal grub... Maybe we won't croak... Good thing you showed up... What's your name?
Marked One... And what are you doing here? Hiding? Or what?
We... this... in short... we're on the run.
On the run?! So it's you the captain from the oil pumping station is looking for... You were supposed to guard scientists? And where are the assistants? What happened to them?

We don't know, they disappeared... We escorted them to the burned village in the Swamp. There, in the house, there's this ball, shimmering. They approached that bubble, took some device out of a box... Argued about something... Turned it on... And then... Screams, shrieks and voices, like from a grave, definitely not theirs, others, many... and flashes. White, then bloody, then white again... and it got dark, like night. Came to - head doesn't work, ringing in ears, and the eggheads are gone. My grandma told me about hell when I was a kid - exactly the same.
Don't drag your grandma into this. What happened next?

What next... Bolted from there, wherever our eyes looked, didn't understand anything. Only came to our senses here. Now we're hiding. They'll blame us for those scientists, and we're done for, sure as shit.
Done for or not - it's not for me to decide... And those eggheads didn't say why they went to that bubble. What did they want there?
You gotta understand them. This scientific brotherhood talks in some kind of their own, fancy language... They talked about some holes. About how you can move somewhere and come back.
So maybe - they already returned?! Though they're not at the base. Maybe monsters ate them on the way...

Marked One, one thing I can say for sure, they weren't planning to fly anywhere. I saw their faces. Eyes were mad, terror in them. Seems like they didn't expect such a thing themselves. It sucked them in there, and we were lucky, we stood at a distance.
Alright, I'll go to the village, see what's there and how.
There's evil there, I'm telling you straight.
Hello, or what?
What kinda mug is this? Ain't seen ya before.
You'd take a look at yourself. Some Thumbelina you are...
Wise guy? Well come on, call about the Bolshoi Theater.
That you, Marked One? What's with our business? Or ya just drove by to admire papa Borov?
Marked One, I got one special offer. Keep in mind, I don't voice it to just anyone, but for you, I think, it might come in handy someday.
Something tells me I don't trust your offers, but I can listen, why not?

I know that you stalkers sometimes like to start trouble out of nowhere. Someone can't share loot, someone doesn't watch their mouth, and someone grabs for iron when drunk. Anyway, if you get some misunderstandings with "colleagues", I can step in and sort everything out. For the mediator role I charge dearly, two grand in green, but I guarantee results. Of course, provided you don't manage to turn half the Zone against you. Yeah, there's one more thing. I won't go to bat for you again if you screw up after. Not by the code. Nobody likes troublemakers and psychos.
Hmm... That might really come in handy someday. I'll keep it in mind.
Keep it, keep it. Borov don't blow hot air.
Yo, wanderer. How ya doin'?
Borov, you said you could go to bat for me if I ask. So it happened that I'm at odds with some folks...
Hold up! Important clarification: if you ask and throw in the green stuff, as much as said - two grand in green.
Here, two bearer checks, thousand each. Barely scraped it together. What now?
I thought you were joking about two grand. Where does an honest stalker get such money?

Now listen and remember. I'm givin' you this gadget - radio frequency scanner. You get close to where your enemies hang out. Don't need to get too close, or they might start shootin'. Press the button and hang around for five minutes while the little device picks up frequencies of all PDAs in the area and sends them to my guy. He sends messages to these PDAs, like, you got confused about somethin', losers, Marked One's a stand-up guy, you gotta back off.
And how's that supposed to work? You'd think someone would bother figuring out what some unknown person is writing to them...

Not your worry how it'll work. Some we'll scare, some we'll buy, some we'll con. You can find leverage on anyone, if there's desire. Or almost anyone. Against soldiers, mercs and criminal psychos I got no methods. Well, and I warned you: if you're in deep shit and even the most pathetic newbie rookie from the village at Cordon dreams of wasting you, then I fold, deal with such mess yourself.
I see. I admit, I'm surprised that... a person of your profession uses such high-tech solutions.

What, ya thought we're lappin' up soup with bark shoes here? We're keepin' up with the times, like. Got myself a specialist. Tech guy, electronics. Did time in the slammer for raisin' hell big time in Kiev back in the day: stuffed some homemade crap into ATMs that burned all the data from rich suckers' cards. Made enough dough for a new Beemer in a month. Got out recently, no bearings. Well, and headed to the Zone. Now he's with the crew.
That's how it goes in life.
Someone thinks you might know the location of an entrance to one of the underground laboratories...

Someone? Who's that? Rat? Don't ya go actin' mysterious! What Borov knows, nobody else should know...\nThough... What's the use of this... What do I care! Right?\nI know where the entrance to the underground might be, where all kinds of eggheads were diggin' around, but, as ya know, even a pimple don't pop up for free... Want me to tell ya, prove that you can do business...
How's that? Wanna set me up!

Come on, don't be scared, I can see who I'm dealin' with. Recently a chopper crashed not far - east of the swamp... Why - dunno, it was comin' from the center of the Zone, smoke was half the sky. I sent my morons to check what's there and how, but there turned out to be a chimera den nearby, so my bros chickened out gettin' closer. Only saw that there's a couple corpses by the chopper and some junk scattered around.\nSo maybe you'll try your luck? Poke around there, if there's somethin' interesting, bring it, then we'll talk about what I know about the underground and maybe cook up a couple more deals...
Yeah... Your soldiers, scared of chimeras... I'll go check...
Well let your punks risk their asses...
Borov sent to investigate the helicopter crash site that fell behind the swamp in Dark Valley. Everything valuable goes to Borov...
I'm... About the helicopter...
What now? Pissed your pants?
Watch your tongue, respected... I wanna clarify again: where'd you say the helicopter crashed?
You'll piss yourself here! There's a whole pack! No-o-o... I ain't suicidal!
Pack? Yeah, probably one chimera... Alright, screw it, we'll figure it out ourselves, maybe we'll pull off another deal? Not so scary...

What ya pretendin' for? I think I explained clearly: south of here there's a swamp, road goes through it, seen it? If you're walkin' from here, turn your noggin left at the bridge, you'll see a hill behind the swamp... Look behind it. Damn!
Alright! Swamp! Hill! There's swamps and hills all around here... I'm outta here!
I was by the helicopter, the chimeras ain't that scary...
So you were. I sent my boys to tail you, somethin' I didn't get their report... What was there? In the helicopter?
There was nothin' there... Couple egghead corpses, that's all...
I found somethin': container with some kinda artifact, which exactly, dunno, I didn't risk openin' it, and some documents...
Yeah here, just the container and corpses.
You say, container? What's inside?
Here! Open it and look? Who knows, might explode...

Explode? Yeah... maybe I'll tell my slackers to take it far away and open... Well why ya standin'? Borov keeps his word, you respected me, I respect you! Take this little diagram, we found one egghead who tried unsuccessfully to crawl out of his underground... Only got buried. And the entrance got buried too. Probably blew it up somehow wrong, or maybe the earth shook, hell knows...\nOnly poltergeists fly out of there.
Nothin', you say? And here I thought you were takin' me for a sucker... My punks saw how you picked up the container...
Lost it...
Well, it's pleasant doin' business with you, gimme the container and documents...
Take it, what about the laboratory?

Ha, Borov keeps his word, you respected me, I respect you!
For efficiency and for not squirmin' around like a broad, take this little present from me...
Well and here's the diagram about the laboratory, we found one egghead who tried unsuccessfully to crawl out of his underground... Only got buried. And the entrance got buried too. Probably blew it up somehow wrong, or maybe the earth shook, hell knows...
Only poltergeists fly out of there.
Poltergeists?

Well these... ghosts... poltergeists... Such crap flies around, can't tell what it's even made of! No point shootin' bullets at it, and grenades don't always work... I'm tellin' ya straight as a friend: without a flamethrower you shouldn't even stick your nose in!\nThough... What am I to you - your real father? See for yourself...\nWhen you got time, come by, I got another job...
Flamethrower, you say? Alright, we'll see...
Your punks didn't see anything else? Maybe I also stashed a MONOLITH... Heroes...
Alright, it ain't worth tearin' our throats over, let's try to work together again... Maybe we'll pull off another job?
What kinda job you wanna pull off?

Had this one thug here, Rat was his handle. Like a real rat. Crawlin' around here, sniffin', watchin'. Anyway, I got info that he was writin' down many of our secrets on his PDA.\nWhen I wanted to grab him by the soft parts, he bolted. Here's the deal: find that rat and take his PDA from him. How - that's your problems. Bring it back, then we'll talk about rewards.
Where am I supposed to look for him? The Zone's big.
Last time he was seen at the Guts. Crawled into the very... ass. Well, shake on it?
Deal, I'll try to find your rat...
That's your problems. Deal with it yourselves.
If there's somethin' else, then talk, if not - don't block the way...
\nThe bandit nicknamed Rat recorded many secrets on his PDA. Borov wants to get this PDA by any means.
Yo, Borov. I found Rat.
Don't make noise... Where's the PDA?
What about my reward?
You'll get your reward if you behave normally.
Alright, I'll trust ya. Here's the PDA.

Alright, here's a diagram about the laboratory and a tip about one good cache. True, the little guy I got the info from was trash, lousy snitch... But the loot should be good. North of Army Warehouses, near the crashed helicopter...\nThink you'll just waltz into the lab? The entrance is buried. Probably blew it up somehow wrong, or maybe the earth shook, hell knows...\nOnly poltergeists fly out of there!
Poltergeists?

Yeah... Such crap flies around and glows. And throws all kinds of heavy junk. Poltergeists! Hell of a pest! Can't take 'em with bullets, and grenades don't always help. Flamethrower's just right there...\nAnyway, why am I convincin' ya? Wanna lose your head - go ahead...
Flamethrower, you say? Well, well...
Alright, here's a tip about one good cache. True, the little guy I got the info from was trash, lousy snitch... But the loot should be good. North of Army Warehouses, near the crashed helicopter.
Well alright, I see you keep your word. We'll meet again.
Diagram showing the location of the supposed entrance to underground laboratory X-18
Found that Rat...
So? Where's the PDA?
Your weakling croaked. Searched the corpse - nothin' worthwhile on him.
Your weakling croaked. Searched the corpse - this gadget was on him.
So the little rat kicked the bucket? Good riddance. Too bad he managed to stash the PDA somewhere.\nAlright. Take this little gift from the crew.

So the little rat kicked the bucket? Good riddance. But we had a deal, didn't we, Marked One? You were supposed to bring me the PDA, not sad news about the untimely death of its owner. That was the deal? That's right. So you're missin' out on the reward, that is.
So the little rat kicked the bucket? Good riddance. So... PDA's password protected, I see. We'll deal with that.\nAlright. Take this gift from me personally.

So the little rat kicked the bucket? Good riddance. So... PDA's password protected, I see. How am I supposed to understand that it's the right one? You didn't decide to fool papa Borov, did ya, Marked One, sellin' him a fake handheld? That ain't how business is done. Take it back. You're missin' out on the reward, in short.
I was countin' on more. Well, it'll do...
Decided to bail? Yeah right. I almost forgot who I'm dealin' with.
I got a request for you. Need to clear the blockage.
What blockage?

I found out how to get into the underground, not far from here, at the factory. Only the entrance is blocked. Not such a big blockage there. If we gather about 5 guys, we can clear it in half a day. Won't you help? I'm addressing you as a local old-timer.
Clear the blockage at the factory? That's where Borov's renegades settled?
I think I heard you guys have some kind of truce with the bandits? And they even... fear you. Or are they lying?
There's nobody there anymore...
Lying or not, but we need to negotiate with them. You understand... foreign territory, foreign rules.
That doesn't change anything. Today it's some, tomorrow others will come. We'll still have to negotiate. You understand... foreign territory, foreign rules.
So what to do?
I'll figure out what to interest people with for such work. And we'll have to pay for the agreement with the punks.
Raven, you understand, in that laboratory there could be a bunch of interesting stuff.

Death is there - that I know for sure. And there might not be any loot! So, let's do this - bring five "Gravi" level artifacts, and make sure they're in good condition. Maybe the boys will get interested. There'll be some left for the bros too.
Artifacts? I'll try to collect them.
Artifacts? That's quite a demand. I'll think about it.
Let's agree right away - once you collect all the artifacts, then we'll talk.
Raven: for five second-level artifacts in good condition promises to organize stalkers to clear the blockage for passage into the old laboratory.
I'm here about clearing the blockage.
Brought artifacts? I remind you, we agreed on five pieces of second level and in good condition. If you have that many, then everything's fine.
Yes, I collected everything.
Haven't found that many yet, I'll go get them.

Excellent. The guys will start working right away. They'll mess around for half a day, no less. You take a walk meanwhile, when it's ready, I'll send a message. Well if you don't get it - come by tomorrow, I think it'll be ready.\nBy the way... People say that all former underground laboratories were sealed. And so that outsiders wouldn't stick their noses in - they pumped in poisonous gas. So in a regular suit, with a gas mask, you better not go in there. You won't last long, you'll suffocate. Here you need a suit with a closed breathing system, and better yet a power armor. Each faction has analogs, but it's exclusive merchandise, you can't just get it or buy it. A scientific suit would work too, but for that you need to go to the scientists at Yantar.
Thanks for the warning... Listen, maybe you have a suitable suit so I don't have to go looking around?

Actually have one, though it needs significant repair. The former owner managed to crash into "Jelly" in it... But it's quality stuff, can be patched up by local craftsmen, no problem. Half the Freedom guys swagger around in such suits. Ready to let it go for a thousand bucks. Bearer check. Does that work?
Bit pricey... let me think.
Think, just not too long. Another stalker was already interested in this suit. But I'll hold it for you for now.
About the suit for descending into the laboratory - is the offer still valid?
So far yes, I'm giving it for a thousand bucks. Will you take it?
Yes, here's the check.
Haven't decided yet. Just dropped by to check, in case it's no longer available.
Try on the suit. Just don't forget to take it for repair before descending into the lab in it.
I'd like to ask for help - clear a blockage.
What blockage?

I found out how to get into one underground, not far from here, in Dark Valley. Only the entrance is blocked, but it's not such a big blockage. If we gather about 5 guys, we can clear it in half a day. Won't you help? I'm addressing you as an authoritative guy, look how many rookies hang around you.
Clear the blockage? That's where bandits cluster?
I'll deal with the bandits, don't worry.
There's nobody there. I already cleared the approaches.
I'm not worried, so go ahead - act, clear them out. Then come by.

Cleared, you say? Hmm... Doesn't look like anything special. Your last name wouldn't happen to be Terminator? Alright, just a joke. And what will you pay with? These may be rookies, but nobody's going to break their backs for a thank you.
I said it - so I'll do it!
So name your price, maybe we'll come to terms.

Hmm... Then let's do this... I'm gradually expanding my clientele here. Now, besides local recruits, serious people sometimes drop by. They buy goods for expeditions in bulk. They should come by in a few days. Already paid an advance. And my supplier got into an anomaly yesterday. Not fatal, but he'll be laid up for a week. If there's such a need for workforce, then, according to this list, bring provisions. Not much here: 30 cans of stew, same amount of bread, 10 bottles of vodka, and anti-hangover, 20 cans.
How much, how much?!

That's not all... We have a shortage of buckshot here, but with mutants, as luck would have it, no shortage. So along with provisions grab another 300 rounds... Now that's everything. I'd advise visiting Sidorovich. He always has goods in abundance.
Well... I guess I'll try to get it.
He advises. Won't your "serious people" get sick?
Just don't drag it out too long.

Cook: for 30 cans of stew, 30 loaves of bread, 10 bottles of vodka, 20 cans of energy drink and 300 shotgun shells, promises to organize stalkers to clear the blockage for passage into the old laboratory. Advised to contact Sidorovich for provisions
I'm here about clearing the blockage.
Marked One, you were bragging there about clearing all the approaches? But I heard that you didn't deal with the bandits, and ran away in shame. Is that so?
How so? It was clear.
Don't chicken out. Everything's agreed, you provide the provisions and ammo, we do the work.
Then take the goods.
Hmm... Alright, I'll go get them.

Well, as agreed, so it shall be done.... This work isn't easy. You go take a walk for half a day or so. When we finish, I'll give a signal. Get ready...\nAnd one more thing. My friendly advice to you. Find a good suit with a closed breathing system, or better yet - power armor. People say that some kind of gas was released into all the old underground laboratories so that outsiders like you wouldn't stick their nose in there. Every faction has such suits, but they're rare goods, you can't just buy them. Scientists have them too. Ask around at Yantar.
Thanks for the advice... Then I'll wait for the signal.
About the laboratory in the Dark Valley.
The one that's X-18? Interesting! Been there? What does it look like? Any data on our problem with the "Brain Scorcher"?

I found out how to get into those underground areas. Only the entrance is blocked, but not such a big blockage there. If we gather about five guys, we can clear it in half a day. Then we can get inside. Won't you organize the people?
Clear the blockage? In the Dark Valley? Hmm... No, while bandits are clustered there, no one will take on this job.
Well I'll deal with them.
There's nobody there. I already cleared the approaches.
When you deal with them, then come back.
Cleared them, you say? Hmm... And what will you pay with?
Don't worry. I said it - so I'll do it!
Well... Maybe some favor is needed or some goods?

Clear the blockage? In the Dark Valley? Hmm... It'll be hard to convince the guys for such a thing. You know our stalkers - they won't even scratch their own ass for free. Will need to pay. Do you have decent savings? Will need to fork out about a thousand bucks each, no less... You say four will handle it? Well, two more will definitely need to be posted as guards, you never know - the place is dangerous! So, about six thousand green ones.\nAlright, I do have my own interest in this matter. And someone else too. Let's do this - I'll take two-thirds of the expenses on myself. You'll have a trifle left - one hundred thousand rubles. Not much, in general...
Agreed, I'll go scrape the bottom of the barrel.
One hundred grand?! That's a bit much.
Good then. And I'll think about who this job can be entrusted to.
Barman: for 100,000 rubles, promises to organize stalkers to clear the blockage for passage into the old laboratory
I'm here about clearing the blockage.
Did you already clear all the approaches? But I heard that you can't be trusted - and you didn't deal with the bandits there, but ran away in shame.
So that was me...
Yes! I already talked to whoever I needed to, people agreed. Waiting for your share and we can start the work.
I managed to collect the needed sum.
Hmm... I don't have enough yet.

Well, as agreed, so it shall be done. This work isn't easy. You go take a walk for half a day, maybe more. When we finish, I'll give a signal. Get ready... I heard that it's not sweet in the underground areas. That's why no one risks going there. There must be a very compelling reason for that... like you have.\nAnd they also say that either the scientists themselves, or their military curators, released poisonous gas into all the old underground laboratories. So, Marked One, my advice to you - find a good suit with a closed breathing system. Better yet - power armor. In ordinary rags with a mask, there's nothing to do there. You'll die.
You couldn't have said that earlier?! What if I had gone there... Well, it's understandable, you wouldn't have grieved.
Don't make noise. You were warned for free anyway.
So what to do? Where to get a suit?
I can help with a suit, but not right now. We'll talk a bit later, alright?
Good, I'll wait for the signal.
Hey, stalker! Come here, let's talk.
Are you Rat?
Krysyuk! My last name is Krysyuk!
Well, any news?
Alright, whatever I call you, there's one matter I have for you.
What kind of matter? I don't think I had any dealings with you...
Heard about Borov? He's rolling a barrel on you, wants you to give him your PDA.

He wants a lot, the coordinates of several of Borov's stashes are recorded there, everything's encrypted though. And there's other... important information. But I'm ready to trade you the device, and you in exchange will fulfill one assignment for me...
What if I wring your neck - won't that help the matter?
Assignment, and what does it consist of?
Wring it, only then you won't see the PDA, I hid it in a secret place.

I'm afraid of my accomplices... You, I see, really need this Borov PDA? Then there's a business proposition. You know Tooth? He's been sitting in the bar lately, trading in all kinds of information, deceiving suckers. Talk to him, he's an agile guy, can slip into any... Hmm, in general, he can spin different deals. If he negotiates with those debtors to let me in there, then the PDA is yours...
Too-oo-ooth. Think I saw him. What, is he a buddy of yours?
Screw you! You're all pissing me off! Go there, go here...
Alright, I was joking - you had a laugh... What assignment do you have?
You little bastard! You'll tell me everything!

Yeah right, buddy... He's everyone's buddy, whoever he can shake more dough from. And won't even scratch himself for free. You tell him that, they say, Krysyuk stashed in that cache where Owl used to hide his loot, a couple artifact capsules and one more good artifact. Put it on - and it's like a second wind opens up, you can run away from anyone. Even from chimeras sometimes... The key word - "sometimes", hehehe. Anyway, Tooth knows where this stash is. Let him take it for himself, the dealer...
Hmm... Alright, I'll talk to Tooth.
Don't doubt it! You won't be left out.
Alright, whatever I call you, there's one matter I have for you...
What kind of matter? I don't think I had any dealings with you?
Heard about Borov? That pig croaked. But he had some information that I really need.
Croaked? For sure? Well good riddance! And what do you want from me? Ah! Think I might know too? And what kind of information?
They say he knew how to get into the underground laboratory in the Dark Valley?

Hmm... I heard something like that, seems like Rusty found some dead egghead somewhere who had documents about some underground place. Haven't seen Rusty for a long time. I think the info should be in Borov's PDA. And wouldn't you know, you're in luck - I know where to find that computer. Not for free. You get it?
What if I wring your neck - won't that help the matter?
Not for free? Then for what?
Wring it, only that won't help you, the PDA isn't with me. So, look out for yourself...

I'm afraid of my accomplices... You, I see, really need this Borov PDA? Then there's a business proposition. You know Tooth? He's been sitting in the bar lately, trading in all kinds of information, deceiving suckers. Talk to him, he's an agile guy, can slip into any... Hmm, in general, he can spin different deals. If he negotiates with those debtors to let me in there, then the PDA is yours...
Too-oo-ooth. Think I saw him. What, is he a buddy of yours?
Screw you! You're all pissing me off! Go there, go here...
Alright, I was joking - you had a laugh... What assignment do you have?
You little bastard! You'll tell me everything!

Yeah right, buddy... He's everyone's buddy, whoever he can shake more dough from... And won't even scratch himself for free... You tell him that, they say, Krysyuk stashed in that cache where Owl used to hide his loot, a couple artifact capsules and one more good artifact. Tooth knows where it is. Let him take it for himself, the dealer...
Hmm... That's... Well alright, I'll talk to him.
Don't doubt it! You won't be left out.
There's a request from one bandit...
From you, by any chance? I haven't seen a more bandit-looking face yet...
Quite the joker. One crook, Rat, wants to hide out in the Bar. Can you organize it?

Rat? What kind of... Ah! That one, Patsyuk. Yeah, I heard he slipped away from his accomplices. It'll be hard to convince the duty officers to turn a blind eye to his past "merits"... Will have to grease many palms. And what will I get from this? If he wants safety, let him pay...
He says he hid a couple artifact capsules and one more new one in a cache...
Who knows what he says! Moscow doesn't believe in words! Ever heard of that?
Says everything's lying in some Owl's stash. Everything will be yours for the work.
Owl's? Ah... That's in the Valley. Am I out of my mind to go there? And why are you vouching for this, hmm, Krysyuk? Is he your brother-in-law or something? If he croaks - good riddance!
I need him! He knows something...

Well? If you need him, then let's make a deal like this - go to the Valley, check this stash, if there really is what there is, then bring it here, and then we can have a proper talk. Okay? This stash should be here, if rat-face didn't lie. Or, if you don't mind, give me three level-three artifacts - and it's a done deal... And you'll settle your own business with the ugly mug yourself...
Well... Alright, I'll go take a look.
I'm here about Krysyuk...
What about him? Did he fall and bump his head? As the Great Helmsman said: "No person - no problem"... Right?
In that stash, in the Dark Valley, there were three artifacts. Two capsules and one - not quite clear...
Interesting... Didn't lie? The things you see in this world. Hand over the artifacts and tell him he can come here, I talked to whoever needed to, they'll let him through the checkpoints.
I'm thinking, I have three good artifacts...
Why think? Hand over the artifacts and tell him he can come here, I talked to whoever needed to, they'll let him through the checkpoints.
Give them up? Maybe I'll keep them for myself?
Here, take them...
Alright, let's see how he behaves here. Rat...
Heh-heh, keep them of course, and to hell with your Krysyuk...
Tooth says you can head to the Bar. Now are you satisfied?
Let's say, more at ease about my life...
What about my share?

Your share awaits you at Agroprom... Right here... That's where I hid the PDA. And also a good cloak - made from flesh skin.\nAnd... Ah well! There's a way to get "Jellyfish" from various junk...\nYou need to throw a dog tail, tushkano head, boar hoof and a "Thorn" into the "Electra"...
Alright, I'll check... If you screwed me over, I'll shake your soul out of you...
Be well... And who are you, don't seem to be one of ours?
No, not one of yours... I'm the Marked One.

Ah! So that's who I heard about, then... Like a scary-looking face... Well... You're supposed to be tough as nails, right? Managed to pass through almost the entire Zone, monsters running in terror to the corners?
What are you blabbering about?

Well you're looking for Strelok, I heard. And you came here too, probably not without reason - aiming for Strelok's stash, the one in the mine shaft... Well why are you making those eyes, as if you didn't know?
Uh... I'm looking for someone who knows me. And what about Strelok?

Well... I happened to chat with one fool who hangs around near the base at the Warehouses. Well he's, of course, completely nuts, but he mutters some interesting stuff. From his rambling I understood that in the mine shaft of the former mine, literally nearby, behind the fence on the territory of the Limansk reserve, Strelok stashed a bunch of loot. Immeasurable valuables. And maybe something else interesting too. You get it? Strelok might have left something useful for you there too. Dangerous though, to poke around there. But we're moving out soon. Just need to gather strength, get gear, stock up on ammo. We're waiting for one guy, and meanwhile we had a drink for the road, then another one for the other leg, and away we went... We've been sitting here for the third day now. But look, I'll remember you - don't you dare go there. Whatever you find in that mine - it's all ours. I staked a claim.
Hmm? Strelok's stash, you say? Well-well...
The old mine behind the fence here? Well I was there...
When did you manage that? And I'm thinking, what was all that shooting! Well you... Share up. I'm telling you - that loot is ours!
Yeah, right now...
Well? Found Strelok's stash? Come on, confess...
Yeah, found it and already drank it all away...
Still joking... Well-well...
Haven't heard about Strelok's stash somewhere around here?

Strelok or not Strelok, I don't know, but many say there was one very lucky stalker here who hid everything he found in some place. There are always freebie lovers around, but judge for yourself - if it was so simple, it would have been known long ago.
What about some mine or shaft, somewhere around here nearby?

Ah, that one. They used to mine some rare ore there, but then it became unprofitable and was abandoned. For a while several fanatics from a sect clustered there. Well those ones who worship the Monolith. But something didn't work out for them there. Either they lost something important, or something else, but one day they weren't there anymore. No one even saw how they left. And monsters started appearing in the mine in droves, as if crawling out of some burrow.\nThe entrance is very close - you leave from me, the gates lead to the reserve, when you enter, turn right and along the fence... And there you'll see.
I see. So there's no stash there?

I don't know what someone could have hidden there... And they've been talking about this stash for a long time. They searched for it, searched, but haven't found it yet. Saw some guys around here nearby? Also "seekers"... On the other hand, maybe it's true: how does everyone know that Strelok's stash should be here? Although... What kind of stash is it that almost everyone in the Zone is looking for... An open secret. It's all bullshit, probably?
Maybe it is bullshit. Only I don't have other threads to the past. Probably will have to pay a visit.
See for yourself. Be careful. The forest itself isn't a resort, and this mine...
Listen, Barkeep. About that Bloodsucker place.
What's up there? Some vermin settled in again?
Wanted to, forgot... my head's not right. Maybe... later.
Your fighters, in that Bloodsucker place, who did they meet? Not a courier with a distinctive briefcase?
You should go see the doctors, Marked One. Head's a serious thing. When nature calls, you'll forget to take your pants off. Heh-heh...
Whoa... Something about your face is starting to not please me. Didn't a Duty spy come to visit us?

Hold on making noise, premature. Still unknown which way it'll turn. You didn't tell me about "Prosaist" for nothing, right? I think Lukash isn't in the know about your business. Otherwise his thugs would have shaken my whole soul out last time.

If you know about the courier and the case, then you're in the know...\nYes, the courier was carrying some papers in the case. Didn't show up to the meeting on time. Our guys went to check, there's a pack of bloodsuckers there, and then you showed up. So did you find something or just came to chat - to find out?
I found that courier's corpse - it was empty. Someone was faster than all of us.
Who's so nimble? Outran everyone, even the bloodsuckers... Don't go blabbing among our guys. You never know.
I found that courier's corpse. He only had a PDA on him. Interested?
PDA? What do I need that for? I need the case... Although, I'll give you a "Twist", very good one, without flaws. Agreed?
Take the handheld. Where's the artifact?
Uh-uh, no! I'll dig around myself. Maybe I'll find something interesting.
Here, take it! "Green one"! Fresh! Just the other day one stalker brought it... Don't go blabbing about the briefcase though. Okay? You understand...
Go ahead and dig! I was giving you, as a respected person, such an artifact! Aaah!
I found that courier's corpse. He had a briefcase on him. What will you give?
Looks similar... Will you take a "Crystal Thorn", exquisite one? Or what?
Hmm... Alright, give me the "...thorn".
Uh-uh, no! I'll try to crack it myself. Maybe I'll find something interesting.
Here, take it! "Green one"! Fresh! Just the other day one stalker brought it... Don't go blabbing about the briefcase though. Okay? You understand...
Go ahead and crack it! Look, don't... dig your own grave. And better not spread word about the briefcase. You get it...
I found that courier's corpse. He had a briefcase and a PDA on him. What will you give for them?
Yeah, the case looks similar... And why do I need the PDA? Although... for everything I'll give two excellent artifacts. First and second category. Good?
Hmm... Alright, give me your artifacts.
Uh-uh, no! I'll try to dig around myself. Maybe I'll discover something interesting.
Here, take them! "Green ones"! Fresh! Just the other day one stalker brought them... Don't spread word about our business in public. I'll throw in some extra cash for keeping quiet.
Go ahead and dig! Make sure you don't dig your own grave. And better not spread word about the briefcase. You get it...
Listen, Colonel. There's a story here that seems to concern you.
What do you want?

You're like Voronin's deputy. See, he gave me a job - to find out something at the Warehouses. So, looks like I saw there... well, someone he knew, only dead. That's fine, but there was a case with papers nearby...

Hmm. That's not the point. What to tell Voronin now? After all, it turns out that since his man was at the Warehouses with something, then either he was passing it to someone for something, or someone gave it to him... And now I kind of know or suspect...

Aha... and you come straight to me - not to Petrov, Sidorov, but to Ivancov, because I should be delighted to listen to your accusations against Duty leadership... Is that how it is? Did you make up this fable yourself or at someone's suggestion, come on, tell me who sent you to me, blackmailer?!

But I... I want to help Duty on the contrary... you know how much I've already done for Duty? I've already, you could say, absorbed your idea, and then this! Such confusion... And it would be okay if it was some ordinary soldier...
Stop wriggling! Hey, you two! Come here!
Wait! I was probably wrong... and it just seemed to me. He's just a courier, I thought his briefcase...

Hey, you two! Back to your post!... Now you have to tell everything, since you blabbed something about a "courier", there's no point hiding the rest! What Voronin said, exactly... And don't yell! They're not cutting yet... Just yet... Come on, spill it, and remember - you have no choice.
Well, he asked me to find out about some courier... I found a corpse matching the description. A briefcase nearby. That's all.
No, not all. Now they'll take you to the basement, and there it will be all. What's in the briefcase!? Come on!
How would I know? Bloodsucker chased me, and the case was heavy, so I dropped it... Why such a reaction all of a sudden?
Encrypted papers, nothing understandable... I stashed it for the time being...
Don't freak out, take this damn briefcase... Sort it out yourselves.
Listen here: run back to that bloodsucker and make sure the briefcase is with me tomorrow. And don't you dare tell anyone. Clear?

Listen here: you have 24 hours and make sure the briefcase is with me. And don't you dare tell anyone. This is your only chance to stay whole. Otherwise an order will be given to every Duty member to shoot you on first approach. Clear?
Well then. You decided correctly. Better to stay on good terms with me. Duty doesn't consist only of Voronin.
We'll see... get lost.
I already got that, bye.
I'm here about the courier's briefcase...
Get to the point, where is it?
I found it, thankfully the bloodsucker didn't crush it. Here, take it...
I can't find it yet, need more time...
Well then. You decided correctly. Better to stay on good terms with me. Duty doesn't consist only of Voronin. You're free. For now...
I get the feeling you're playing games.\nI'll wait a bit more, and then... It'll be bad...
Don't try to scare me, scaredy-cat.
I don't like this "for now" of yours.
Got a message that you were looking for me?

Well I thought a bit. You showed me respect, you could say - showed consciousness. I think such actions should be fairly rewarded...\nWell you know - for good work the most worthy reward is even more dangerous work? Just kidding.\nI can either throw in some cash if you need it, or some ammo, or a small pile of artifacts... What's better?
Money wouldn't hurt...
Some ammo would be nice.
Artifacts wouldn't be extra...
Don't need anything, thanks.
Here, fifty grand from me, take this dough...
Get whatever you need from the Barman. I'll tell him I owe you.

Stalker. Life ain't life without artifacts? You know the cross beyond the northern checkpoint? There's a stash there. Take my reward from there. Just hurry, you understand - it's not in a bank under lock.
Well then. Be seeing you. I'll remember you.
I'm from Ivancov, the Duty guy. Need ammo.
Yeah, he mentioned it. What kind do you need? 5.45, 5.56, 9-millimeter or maybe for AKM?
Give me the Kalashnikov ones - the 5.45.
I'll take the NATO 5.56.
For the "Vintar", 9-millimeter.
Give me the AKM ones. 7.62 - that's power!
Take them. What did you cook up with Ivancov? Although... What's it to me...
About that dead courier from the Warehouses...
Hmm, something additional?
Looks like your courier kicked the bucket...
Kicked what?
Well, meaning he's a corpse. In the village, in the Bloodsucker place. Bloodsucker finished him. By description it's your man.
So... Nothing on him?
Nothing was there... Was he carrying something on himself? I didn't dig through the corpse, it was already... you know...
No, not on himself, but with him.
There was some briefcase lying nearby, I thought it was just junk, but...
Briefcase? What briefcase? What's in it?
Interested? Well I got interested too. But there were tons of bloodsuckers there. Were.
Driving up the price? Don't. I have my interest, of course, but not excessive. I need that case! And not empty, as you understand. So what?
Well I couldn't carry it then. Bloodsuckers were there. And it's heavy, that case.
I stashed it, in a notable place, thinking - maybe I should try to figure it out myself.
Here's that very briefcase... And what do I get in return?
What are you talking about?! Anyway, go bring it, just quietly, don't advertise it to anyone here... Then we'll find out whose briefcase it is and what's in it. Task clear?

Well they won't shoot you today - how's that for a reward?\nThat's a joke...\nWhen you're at Yantar - tell them it's from me, Sakharov will give you some. Something good. Don't frown. You should like it.
Now it's clear. Need that briefcase. No one should know.
I'm here about the courier's briefcase...
Well, what's with it? What's inside?
Here. Brought it. Well I took a peek. Nothing understandable, some squiggles, not letters.
I can't find it yet, need more time...

Well then. You decided correctly. Better to stay on good terms with me. Duty - that's me!\nAnd worthy stalkers can find honor by joining our ranks! Well for now, as preliminary compensation, you'll get a worthy reward:\nWhen you're at Yantar - tell them it's from me, Sakharov will give you some. Something good. Don't frown. You should like it.
I get the feeling you're playing games.\nI'll wait a bit more, and then... It'll be bad...
Come on, stop trying to scare me...
There's a delicate matter. More like a problem, don't know how to resolve it...
Why are you whispering? Constipation or hemorrhoids? You're not the first, nothing to be ashamed of...

Screw you! I'm talking about something else. I've already done something for you and can probably count on your help in return... I think... See, the other day one high-ranking Duty officer gave me a job - to find out about someone at the Warehouses. So, looks like I saw there... well, someone he knew, only dead. That's fine, but there was a case with documents nearby...
So... what's the delicate part? You were too shy to take it?

Take it? That's not the point, but what to do with it... After all, it turns out that since his man was at the Warehouses with documents, then either he was passing them to someone for something, or someone gave them to him... And now I kind of know or suspect that the high-ranking officer has some business...

Aha... and you just couldn't keep quiet and hide everything, conscience wouldn't let you? And you ran straight to me to blab everything about the high-ranking officer's dealings at the Warehouses, as if I was pulling your tongue... Is that how it is? What do you want from me?
Well how to put it... you like collecting all kinds of documents? I've brought you some before...
You're offering to sell, but afraid to lose on price, I gather? Come on, let's take a look first before bargaining, why buy a pig in a poke...
Hmm... Maybe I will sell it, I'll think about it more.
Well here's the briefcase. Take a look. How about it?
Well... It's all ciphers here... Nothing understandable. I can fork out, say, 70 grand...
Agreed. If something interesting turns up there - give me a shout...
Hell no! Give it back! For such pennies...
Alright, I'll let you know. Take your cash...
Don't want to - suit yourself. Take your toilet paper. You can go to the crapper...
Accidentally came across an interesting PDA. Shall we read it?
Encrypted? Then why do you think it's interesting? Well let's take a look.
Yeah there are a couple indirect signs that the stalker who had this PDA was connected to big people. Well and... You understand. Here, look.
Forget it. Changed my mind.
Uh... Big people, as a rule, are a source of big problems. Like... Big problems - big danger... Well... You understand?
Listen, I've been doing business with you for a while. How much do you want?
Third-level artifact! You understand. Such a matter. And... Payment up front. Well? How about it?
Alright, here you go. And don't drag it out.
Only I don't have it with me... I'll go get it.
You're asking too much! Give it here, I'll figure it out myself.
Alright, I'll work on it. I'll try to be quick. You should probably come back in half an hour, maybe something will clear up.
Alright, just don't drag it out. You never know.
Well yourself, so yourself. Take it. I saw nothing, you said nothing...
I'm here about that "interesting" PDA.
Huh? Did you bring it?
Yeah, here you go. As we agreed.
I'm... well... Wait a bit more, basically.
You're asking too much! Give it here, I'll figure it out myself.
Alright, I'll work on it. I'll try to be quick. You should probably come back in half an hour, maybe something will clear up.
Alright, just don't drag it out. You never know.
Well yourself, so yourself. Take it. I saw nothing, you said nothing...
So what about that "interesting" PDA?
"Interesting"? We're screwed, brother. Basically, I'm telling you everything and... I know nothing, saw nothing. But, Marked One, you understand, if they corner me, I won't keep quiet.
Don't shake before it's time. I got it all.

Maybe you have three lives, but I have only one. And I want to end it without outside help. Clear?\nAnd for you, in case of probable trouble, I advise looking for the loot that the courier was going to use to pay for his "exit ticket" from the Zone. Maybe you can buy yourself out too, if it really comes to that. As you can guess, it's hidden somewhere at the Warehouses. I didn't find exact directions in the PDA, but there are a couple landmarks. Apparently the guy was afraid he'd forget the place himself.\nAlright, listen. Look for a backpack where construction slabs are piled up, on the road from the Freedom base to the Barrier.

Maybe you have three lives, but I have only one. And I want to end it without outside help. Clear?\nAnd for you, in case of probable trouble, I advise looking for the loot that the courier was going to use to pay for his "exit ticket" from the Zone. Maybe you can buy yourself out too, if it really comes to that. As you can guess, it's hidden somewhere at the Warehouses. I didn't find exact directions in the PDA, but there are a couple landmarks. Apparently the guy was afraid he'd forget the place himself.\nAlright, listen. Look for a backpack in the swamp, by a fallen tree.

Maybe you have three lives, but I have only one. And I want to end it without outside help. Clear?\nAnd for you, in case of probable trouble, I advise looking for the loot that the courier was going to use to pay for his "exit ticket" from the Zone. Maybe you can buy yourself out too, if it really comes to that. As you can guess, it's hidden somewhere at the Warehouses. I didn't find exact directions in the PDA, but there are a couple landmarks. Apparently the guy was afraid he'd forget the place himself.\nAlright, listen. Look for a backpack north of the old farmstead, where blind dogs often make their lair.
Thanks... Hope everything works out.
Voronin sent me. Said he made arrangements with you regarding my reward.
That's the one who leads the Duty organization? We contact him quite often. From time to time he provides us with support. But, you understand, we're not a warehouse for the needs of passersby.
Uh, he told me, go to Sakharov, he'll reward you. I ran around like a deer following his whims... So he lied?

Hmm... Let's not heat up the situation. I certainly believe you. And I'll provide as confirmation of my respect for you and General Voronin some consumables - medical preparations, food supplies... Also, to somehow calm you down, consider that I'm giving you a very high-quality suit. This is our best model.
Come on, what do you have there. Might come in handy.

Accept this as small consolation.\nAnd please tell Voronin: we are not under his care and don't intend to squander accountable funds left and right. Who knows what he promises.\nOnce again - this doesn't apply to you, Marked One, you know how I respect you.
Hey, stalker. Come here, warm up. Maybe 150 for mood? We got some - fire running through your veins... I'm Ignat. Kind of run things here. What should we call you?
Hey... I'm the Marked One.
Marked, we all are... Marked. They say whoever came to the Zone will forever remain marked... There are almost no artifacts here at all. So only hunting helps us out. Are you a good hunter?
Well I don't know. I shoot pretty well.

Ha, shooting isn't the main thing in hunting. You need to feel the beast. Know its habits, places. Also see - is this the beast you need, and not confuse it with the one that needs you... Right? Big difference. You stalkers are mushroom pickers by nature: found an artifact, sold it, drank it away and again. But we try to be masters. Today you took a beast, tomorrow you waited - studied what and how, day after tomorrow - took much more. Understand? Calculation, skill, cold blood - these are hunter qualities. Few are capable.\nIf you feel the urge to be not a consumer - come, maybe we'll make an apprentice out of you.\nWhat are you looking for anyway?
Uh... I'm looking for someone who knows me. Or about Strelok...
Yeah, guy, when a person doesn't know himself, that's bad. And I heard about Strelok. Long time ago though. Seems like he made himself a den somewhere in the Misty Thicket.
What kind of Thicket is that?
Yeah there's this terrain here, very strange. I haven't gone there myself for a long time and don't advise others to.
Still - how to get there? Maybe I can find something important for my search there... or someone.
You'll find your death there, premature. And I don't want to take extra sin on myself, so sorry, but you won't learn the way there from me.
What kind of horrors are there?

Mysterious place... Time doesn't go there like in the normal world. The sun just rose and it's already evening. Instruments don't work. Sometimes it seems you're walking straight, not turning anywhere, but actually you're cutting circles among three pines. In general, getting lost is easier than easy. And you can also get caught by a wandering anomaly. They're weaker than usual ones, but still, if it hits you - it won't seem like little. And most importantly, dread overcomes you there, for no reason at all.
Yeah, better to have drunk vodka... really unsettling.
Hey, Marked by the Zone. How's life? How's the memory?
No change so far.
I sympathize. Although... Sometimes it's better to just live. Not rushing, not fussing. What's needed - it will come by itself. That's what I think...
What do you guys do anyway?

We hunt certain beasts. Flesh, boars, dogs. There's some demand for what they can give. For example, leather cloaks are made from flesh skins. From meat you can cook pretty good sausage. Well with some additives, of course. From boar hooves they cut all kinds of crafts - they glow in the dark and are warm to touch. Not every hoof and not from every boar, of course... From dog fur and skins very warm shoes are made. And it's good for other things too, from tails we make extract - viagra doesn't even come close. Very profitable business...
I see, why did you settle here specifically?

Places here aren't very visited. Very few artifacts, no direct path to the Zone center, so stalkers don't often drop by. Also there's quite a lot of forest - beasts frolic unafraid. And it's not so far to the exit. In general, I think we'll stay here for now, and then we'll see.\nNot far from here there's also a nice little house, we call it among ourselves the Regional Committee Manor. Maybe it was someone's dacha, some bigwig - from party bosses, maybe something else... Only there at nights the dead rise from the earth - horror! Screw that, it's calmer here...\nWe're hunters, and that says it all...
Hunters. But I saw hunters at the Cordon. They say they guard the tunnel...

Those are Deon's guys? Well he drives his own line. Thinks that hunting is extermination. And calls everyone to this. Well, to each his own. As long as he fulfills his part of obligations towards our group - he's a hunter. And therefore we support him and his guys as we can, and he us, of course.
I see. And you make sausage, you say? Can I try some?
Excellent! Doesn't spoil, very filling, weighs almost nothing - so you can take it on long raids. But not for free, understand. We trade for dog tails - we need them constantly... And hooves too.
Alright, when I have tails...
I'm here on assignment from one of the Duty officers.
From Voronin or what? Seems like they turn their noses up from common folk there. Like - "We're DUTY! And you're nobody"... Well screw them... What did you want?
Yeah, they're like that... Not from Voronin. He has a deputy for grub. Says he wants to make a deal with you about supplies...

Ah, that one. What's his name... Anyway, I understand who you're talking about. Well... In principle, we're not against it. They, these DUTY guys, are also kind of hunters, also cleanse the Zone. In their own way though. If he offers something worthwhile, we agree. I think we can feed 50 mouths or even more...
He's asking for samples. For testing it seems...

Oh my! Let's be honest, friend Marked One. You're of course a good guy and all that, but put yourself in my place - someone comes, says they're from someone, and asks for our goods... A word won't fill the stomach, right?\nI can put together a box of samples, but not for free. We could use more flesh eyes right now. Collect half a dozen and then we shake hands. Deal?

Oh my! Let's be honest, friend Marked One. You're of course a good guy and all that, but put yourself in my place - someone comes, says they're from someone, and asks for our goods... A word won't fill the stomach, right?\nI can put together a box of samples, but not for free. We could use more pseudodog tails right now. Collect half a dozen and then we shake hands. Deal?

Oh my! Let's be honest, friend Marked One. You're of course a good guy and all that, but put yourself in my place - someone comes, says they're from someone, and asks for our goods... A word won't fill the stomach, right?\nI can put together a box of samples, but not for free. We could use more cat tails right now. Collect half a dozen and then we shake hands. Deal?
Half a dozen - that's nothing...
We'll see, we'll see...
Ignat asks to bring six flesh eyes. For this he will give a batch of sausage for the Duty members
Ignat asks to bring six pseudodog tails. For this he will give a batch of sausage for the Duty members
Ignat asks to bring six cat tails. For this he will give a batch of sausage for the Duty members
I have flesh eyes...
Is this about the Duty samples? Well come on, let's see your eyes... Not yours, of course, ha-ha, but the flesh ones you brought...
Ha-ha... Where do they get such ones. Here.
Something makes me not want to deal with you...

Come on, stop pouting... What, not a man or what? Everything's fine. Here, take this little box. I packed our delicacies in there. Pass it on. Say we can send about this much every couple days if they supply us with some things. Well, be seeing you...
Alright, be seeing you...
I have pseudodog tails...
Is this about the Duty samples? Well come on, let's see your tails... Not yours, of course, ha-ha, but the pseudodog ones you brought...
Ha-ha... Where do they get such ones. Here.
Something makes me not want to deal with you...

Come on, stop pouting... What, not a man or what? Everything's fine. Here, take this little box. I packed our delicacies in there. Pass it on. Say we can send about this much every couple days if they supply us with some things. Well, be seeing you...
Alright, be seeing you...
I have cat tails...
Is this about the Duty samples? Well come on, let's see your tails... Not yours, of course, ha-ha, but the cat ones you brought...
Ha-ha... Where do they get such ones. Here.
Something makes me not want to deal with you...

Come on, stop pouting... What, not a man or what? Everything's fine. Here, take this little box. I packed our delicacies in there. Pass it on. Say we can send about this much every couple days if they supply us with some things. Well, be seeing you...
Alright, be seeing you...
So, people here are interested in your sausage.
You bet! Sausage is flying off the shelves. We supply the Duty guys, stalkers also buy it often. Even surprisingly so. Sausage business, damn...
Well why not? Sausage doesn't spoil. Stinks though, and the taste... But we eat it. So here's another gang that's dug in almost at the Zone center - they want to get these delicacies of yours.
Gang? You're being mysterious, friend Marked One. Who are you planning to feed?
Heard of the Freedom guys? They want to live in peace with the Zone, but they gotta eat something. So they asked me to scout - would you agree to throw them your delicacies from time to time?

What will they pay with? Here's the deal. Money in the morning - chair in the evening... well, sausage. Payment - artifacts or hard currency. Say, equivalent to two of those Baku ones for a batch of fifty sausages. Yes means yes, well and no - you understand.
I'll pass on the terms...
Pass them on, pass them on...
I have flesh eyes...
Is this about the Duty samples? Well come on, let's see your eyes... Not yours, of course, ha-ha, but the flesh ones you brought...
Ha-ha... Where do they get such ones. Here.
Something makes me not want to deal with you...

Come on, stop pouting... What, not a man or what? Everything's fine. Here, take this little box. I packed our delicacies in there. Pass it on. Say we can send about this much every couple days if they supply us with some things. Well, be seeing you...
Alright, be seeing you...
Want to get some of your sausage.
What do you have for us? Blind dog tails, boar hooves or something else?
Sorry, friend. We collected an order. Nothing left in small amounts. Come by tomorrow, maybe there'll be something...
I see. Too bad.
Here, got this from a blind dog.
Boar legs? Well here.
Pseudodog tail, will you take it?
Cat tail work?
Got an almost whole flesh eye.
Got bloodsucker tentacles, here.
Chopped off a burer's hand.
Pseudogiant got caught, here's his hand.
Controller tried to grab me. Left without a hand.
Will you take chimera claws?
Got a poltergeist eye, need it?
Here's flesh skin, you taking it?
Snork got what was coming, got his foot, will it work?
Don't you need tushkano heads?
For this - a sausage wheel...
Good job, take the sausage...
Pseudodog will pull a couple sausage wheels...
We don't really need those, can trade for one sausage.
Flesh eye? Whole? Worth three sausages...
Killed a bloodsucker? Take five sausages!
Found a burer? Haven't seen them for a while... Five sausage rolls for you!
Managed to kill a giant? Take five sausages!
For the controller here's some sausages!
Chimera - what a contagion! Take three sausages, I think we'll find use for these claws...
Poltergeist - rare creature. Take five sausages...
Flesh skin? You convinced me. Here's three sausages...
Snork is quite the creature. Here's three sausages...
Don't have any now, they all went bad, had to throw them out.
Sorry, won't give them for free...

Ah this stuff...\nThough we distill killer moonshine from them. Clear head, butterflies flying in your eyes... And such girls appear next to you...\nAlright. Let me see your heads, if they'll do - I'll trade for a sausage ring...
Here, got some tushkano heads...
Take fresh sausage. Almost no smell...
Want to get some of your sausage.
Come by in the morning. Maybe there'll be sausage for you.
I'm looking for one guy here... Rat. Haven't heard of such?
No... haven't heard. From the stalkers?
How to put it... He had some business with Borov's guys in the Dark Valley.

A bandit, huh? Someone came by here the other day, bought sausage from us. Face - definitely bandit. Kept looking around, watching for someone or afraid of something - can't tell. Eyes just darting back and forth, a real rat...
Where did he go?

How would I know, I didn't follow him... The guys were passing by the gas station, they say smoke was drifting from somewhere near the rubble, like someone was lighting a fire. But none of ours were there for sure, so maybe that's where your rat dug in.
Alright, I'll check there.
I was told that extraordinary cloaks can be made from flesh skin?

Well. Not so extraordinary. Just the pigs mutated so that their skins became very good at protecting from sharp penetrations. Like molecular armor. But cuts easily with a knife. And very tear-resistant. A backpack from it allows carrying heavy weight.
How would I get such? A cloak, I mean...
Ha. Need to kill a couple adult flesh. Don't ruin the skin. Then tan the obtained hides. Then find a master who will give these hides the needed properties and cobble together a cloak.
What? How do you tan? And what master?

What-what... That... You planning to skin raw hide off flesh and put it on yourself? Then they'll mistake you for flesh yourself and start hunting. The hide needs to be processed so it dries, hardens... And our conditions, you understand, aren't industrial. Takes a month, maybe two to give raw hide marketable appearance... And the master. Well there's Stepanych, appears sometimes at the Forgotten Farmstead. There are a couple other people, but they're on the mainland, far away...
So maybe you already have processed hides? I'm not taking them for free...

Yeah obviously not for free. For hides from stalkers we take medical supplies. Med kits, anti-rads... Only if you want to get a ready one, you'll have to bring a couple raw hides from flesh. And if you want special processing hide, extra-strong and light, then you also need three liters of sulfuric acid and a bag of salt... We don't have enough of that for tanning. The rest we have for now.
Where to get that?
That's your problem. Order from the mainland... You need it, make deals with traders or someone else yourself.
Nah... So much hassle with these hides. Don't need it...
Well, suppose I find acid and salt, where are these special flesh? Or can you take from any, flesh is flesh everywhere, what's the difference?

Too smart? Fish is also fish everywhere, but they salt exclusively spawning ones... And these flesh who the hell knows. You need good leather with special properties... And such can only be gotten from mature piglets. Our tracker, One-Eyed Vanka, just spotted several such. Not far from here, northwest of the Manor.
The regional committee dacha? Alright, I'll try.
I'm here about hides for good gear.
Don't have ready ones yet. I told you - we ran out of salt. And acid too.
Don't have ready ones yet. You brought acid, but no salt.
Don't have ready ones yet. No acid.
Here, brought salt, quite the weight...
Managed to get acid. A whole three-liter jar.
Already have both salt and acid! Here.
I thought maybe you already have some.
Wow! A whole bag! Now it'll last a long time. If only we had acid...
There'll be acid too.
Jar of acid. Should last a couple months... And salt?
I'll find it - bring it.

Excellent. When there are fresh hides - bring them, we'll process them. And ready ones can be spared now. Saved several here for a rainy day, so you don't have to wait for raw ones to be ready. I'll trade raw hide immediately for ready one, for medical supplies.
How much and what do I need for a processed hide?

Well... Depends what you have. If standard med kits, I'll take eight pieces. If army ones, five will be enough. Get scientific ones, only three will do. Yeah, also need anti-rads. I'll trade a hide for ten of those. That's just for the work, for processing that is. The hide itself, I think you'll get?
I'll get it somehow. I'll come back.

Don't rush, Marked One. I owe you. Choose - there's a good knife, hunting one, or I can offer an artifact - saves from hunger, especially when zombies are nearby. Oh, almost forgot, I can also offer a short-barrel shotgun "MP-153" - kills any vermin at close range in one shot. Only need to fix it up a bit, haven't used it for a while.
If the knife isn't made of tin, I'll take it.
Give me your artifact, tired of hauling a bunch of cans on my back. Easy to throw out my back.
Kills vermin in one shot up close, you say? Then I'll take the shotgun.
You offend me, we use the same ones ourselves. You won't regret it.
Rare specimen. Called "Pizza". You won't regret it.
Excellent choice. As a hunter I tell you: you won't regret it!
I need processed flesh leather.

You came to the right place. Give me your hide and for processing, if you remember, a bit of medicine: eight standard med kits or five army ones. If you have scientific ones, we'll deal on three. We also accept anti-rads as payment. Need ten of those.
Got regular med kits.
Just collected army ones.
Take the scientific ones.
Got some anti-rads here.
I don't have that much...
Order. Everything's in order. And you don't even need to wait - there's a small stock of ready hides. Take it.
Yeah, thanks.
I need salt. And acid. Do you have any?
Got a craving for salty stuff? You watch yourself... the guys here are cunning, you never know... Heh-heh.
Funny to him... I need a whole bag. Got that much?

A bag? You know how much a bag of salt weighs, especially if it's damp? How will you drag it and where? Though, not my concern... Wait, let me remember... Someone already ordered it from me, I even dragged it to the storage with food, less moisture there. Been lying there for a long time, probably hardened already. If they didn't come on time, then you take it, and I didn't even know where to offload it. Give me a couple simple artifacts, or one better one, and drag it wherever you want.
Got two simple artifacts. Give me the bag.
Got one, but better. Give me the bag.
I'll bring them soon. Don't sell to anyone!
You're messing with the old man... Take the little bag. Don't drop it on your foot, the salt's become like stone...
Yeah, hurry up, I got a line for salt... Heh-heh.
Do you have acid? I need about three liters.
What are you cooking up, homemade explosives? Where would I get acid for you.
I need it... Maybe you can order some?

I don't have such supplies. I know the military guys had a battery guy, well there for BTRs, charges old batteries for machines. Ask Kuznetsov, or maybe someone else deals in military supplies. They don't need much, you know what they like.
Exactly!
I'm here about salt.
What kind of "about"? Got artifacts? Give them. Don't have? Then no conversation...
Got a couple simple artifacts.
Got one, better quality.
Still thinking.
Well good. Take the bag. Don't drop it on your foot, the salt's become like stone.
Sidorovich offers to sell him a bag of salt for a couple first-level artifacts or one second-level
Listen, can you get acid?
What kind of acid? What do you need it for?
You still haven't brought me vodka for the anniversary, though you promised, and you're already pestering me with your requests.
Regular, sulfuric. You guys probably have some motor pool? Where they fill batteries for equipment?
Really... that's not good. Wait a bit more, soldier, I'll bring it soon.
Ah! Well yeah, there is. A soldier watches the equipment. Need much? For a jar, probably five bottles will be enough. Can you find them?
That's nothing, take them.
Don't have them with me.
Good then. I'll tell the soldiers. Come back in an hour. You'll have your jar of acid.
Then bring them. When you bring them, then we'll talk.
Alright...
I'm here about acid, remember?
I remember, my head didn't get knocked off, like some... Just kidding. Did you bring vodka?
That's nothing, take them.
Don't have them with me.
Good then. I'll tell the soldiers. Come back in an hour. You'll have your jar of acid.
Then why start the conversation? Bring them. When you bring them, then we'll discuss everything.
Deal.
Did you bring the acid?
You're quite hasty. I said in an hour. Go take a walk.
Here's your acid. Take it, don't spill it.
Got it.
For five bottles of vodka Kuznetsov promises to get a jar of acid
Stepanych, is it about you they say that you're a master at making leather cloaks?
Well, master or not master... There's a little skill. If only the material was good...
Do you make new ones? Or only repair old ones?

Different ways. I can make a new one, and patch up what's there. And modify a little. Well... reduce weight, strengthen, or make it so you can lift more weight. Something like that. Of course, not for free...
Well, not for free, that's understandable. What exactly is needed?

Look yourself: just patching I can do for free - well you respect the old man, throw some money and good. But to sew a new cloak or improve the one that's there... For that also need animal skin, and my ingredients that you don't need to know. And a good artifact, no lower than second level for the work...
Skins, then. From animals. Understood. If needed, I'll come back.
Want to order a cloak, here's a skin.
Well yes, well yes. Good skin, yeah. How many of these do you have? For a simple cloak need a couple pieces, well and to make a good thing - no less than four...
Got a couple. Let's do a simple cloak.
I want a good one, strong. Here's more skins.
Uh... I think I'll think about it.
Well then, good. Prepare a good artifact for payment - no lower than second level. By tomorrow, maybe, I'll manage. So you rest for now...

A good person needs a good thing, that's right. For a good thing also good payment - an artifact. And no lower than third level. You rest for now, gather strength. In a couple days I'll manage, I think, if I stay alive.
So think, think, drink some tea. It thinks better then...
Alright, I'll rest. Yes! Maybe we can also carefully build in a gas mask?
Well alright, fine. I'll come back when it's ready.
Well it's possible, why not!? Throw in one more good artifact on top and you'll have a cloak with gas mask. Or won't you change your mind? We work and work, and then...
Don't doubt it. If I said it, then I did it...
Well, is the cloak ready?
I did my work. Cloak is something else, look, you can't even see the seams, everything seems to have grown together... Well? How about payment? Second level artifact. Do you have it?

Cloak is ready, look, you can't even see the seams, everything seems to have grown together... And gas mask... Not a single extra hole. Right? How about what's honestly earned? One artifact - for the cloak, second - for the gas mask. Together - two second level artifacts. Do you have them?
Yes, of course, I remember. Here you go.
Yes, of course, I remember. Here you go.
I left the artifacts in a stash. I'll run get them now.
Well... You respected the old man. Here's your new gear.
Well, is the cloak ready?
I did my work. Cloak is something else, look, you can't even see the seams, everything seems to have grown together... Well? How about payment? Third level artifact. Do you have it?

Cloak is ready, look, you can't even see the seams, everything seems to have grown together... And gas mask... Not a single extra hole. Right? How about what's honestly earned? One artifact - for the cloak, second - for the gas mask. Together - two artifacts. Third and second level. Do you have them?
Yes, of course, I remember. Here you go.
Yes, of course, I remember. Here you go.
I left the artifacts in a stash. I'll run get them now.
Well... You respected the old man. Here's your new gear.
Maybe... Listen, look at this cloak...
Come on, turn around... Hmm...
You wait! I haven't finished that one yet...
Well... Alright. Finish it.
Well? Will you do it?
Why not? Can try. You better pour some vodka to grease the process...
And I think you'll find something for the work.
Hmm... Well... No, won't take it. Too torn up already. Easier to make a new one than bring this to decent appearance. You're out of luck.
Yeah. Shame. Should I throw it away...
Alright, here you go...
Don't have any right now...
Oh! You respected the old man. You go - lie down a bit, you look bad. Completely tired. And I'll work on this slowly.
Alright, alright, work...
Well how's my cloak?
Here it is, look. Of course not like new, but the structure is whole. Can wear it like before. And protection is good. Take it.
You wait! Where are you rushing to. Not ready yet...
Hmm, yes. Seems like the seams aren't visible.
I'm not rushing! Work...
Maybe you'll sell some monster parts?
Well... No. Monsters are dangerous and to give away what's obtained with difficulty through hunting, for those rubles that stalkers can offer... No, not worth it to us.
No options?
You go talk to our Prosha. He sometimes accumulates some parts, but lacks others. Maybe he'll trade some for others...
Who's Prosha?
Axe virtuoso... Our butcher. There he is...
Axe virtuoso... Our butcher. He's sleeping it off now, come back later...
Where's Prosha, your axe virtuoso?
He sleeps it off in the mornings, come in the afternoon.
Where? I urgently need him...
I told you - the man is resting! Who cares what someone needs. When the sun shines in the treetops - then come.
What's the word, Ignat? Any news?
Nothing special, though...
I have everything needed, take it.
I'll keep it in mind...
Excellent! How to thank you? Will you take money or gear?
