Give me the material stuff you were offering... money for life is enough anyway.
You can never have too much money. I'll take rubles.
Mission accomplished - that's good... Awesome!
Yeah everything's as usual.
Alright, won't distract you. I'll drop by again sometime, we'll chat.

Did you hear that from tushkano brains you can make an amazing brew? No fatigue, brain works like a computer, you barely feel pain... And even, well I don't really believe it, they say the ability to move objects at a distance appears! Hmm... We want to test these rumors... Will you help? Need just nothing - collect ten tushkano heads... And for this I'll give you loot:

Soon we have a big feast planned, and some local gourmets - won't point fingers - will definitely want to try my signature dish - dog tails in pork sauce. Anyway, lots of people, need about ten pieces... Why are you dropping your jaw? Think, what do we need so many for? Alright, agreed, eight will be enough.\nFrom me you can get:

Here are boar hooves, seems like nobody really needs them, but there's demand for them too. Some want them as a talisman, others make tinctures, third ones... don't even want to say! But they pay... So if you cut up many, bring them! But one by one makes no sense for me to collect them, they'll just stink here... Anyway, need half a dozen at once, and fresh ones - then the payment will be worthy:

Local dealers who try to engage in racketeering are eager for all kinds of tales about miraculous properties of monster guts. One was here recently, telling that supposedly from zombie hands organisms stop aging. Don't know if it's true or bullshit... If you don't mind, get five hands of these monsters.\nI'll thank you if anything. Can offer:

Listen, Marked One, you're not afraid of cats? There's one job. I was talking here with our researchers - they can't figure out their secrets. They tried this way and that - but nothing works. So they decided to go another way - the method of Protivny, heard of such? Famous scientist was, they say... Like, if the problem doesn't give from the head, try from the end. And don't grin, talking about the end of the body, the tail that is, and not what you thought. Five cat tails will be enough for them to start.\nAs reward I can offer:

Listen, how timely you showed up, Marked One! There's one job - oh, interesting! You imagine what our eggheads dug up - you've seen the local swine many times... well, this flesh. So it turns out, in its eye - these... smell recipes, got it?! Or not?! Receptors - like that, maybe? Anyway! They don't just look with them, they also smell with them - with their peepers! Look what wonders are here, turns out! So a scientific idea appeared: try a transplant, conduct "transportation", so to speak. Or again not right... Translocation... Yes, exactly! Translocation, means... And for this experiment need several fresh organs - eyes, I mean. Supposedly will implant them in dogs, we have enough of that "good stuff", but no eyes. Graduate students are only strong in the scientific part in the swamps, but to kill flesh and not damage its peepers - they can't. And they won't be allowed... Well, will you help our eggheads?\nYou're an experienced stalker, what's it to you to dig out four little eyes? No... better bring five, one for backup, in case they mess something up. And I'll find something to thank you with:

Marked One, among rich boys who haven't smelled the Zone, a new fashion has spread - they wear pseudodog tails, supposedly these tails increase potency and all that... In short, I have constant demand for them, will you take on getting them? To replenish the ordered batch I need five more pieces. Just look carefully: so the fur isn't too worn and doesn't radiate. Then you'll get as reward:

Biologists from one company are interested in researching the Zone's impact on people. As source material they take snork parts. If you have need for some equipment or money, try to carefully shoot snorks so you don't damage the needed parts. Well you understand, with one I have nothing to do, what if there won't be others? For one piece I won't send a courier running. So let's do this: you get me at least four pieces, then I'll pay accordingly:

Chimera claws were ordered from me, don't know why, they don't say. They paid a deposit... I threw out a call to my guys - already a couple people are working on this issue. How about you, will you participate? Only need three more pieces, and I'll thank you:

One middleman, a foreigner, asked me to get him three burer hands, he pays well for them. Says it's for a private collection. Supposedly all Zone spawn are represented there, whatever exists. From whoever - what, to be exact, because taking out the whole giant, for example, or controller to the mainland isn't so easy. Anyway, that collection is only missing burer parts... For guarantee exactly three pieces are required, in case something rots completely on the way.\nIf you're interested, look what you can get as reward:

Soon it's Prosha's birthday... Eh, we'll party gloriously! I found out a recipe for one dish from the Barman by chance - bloodsucker tentacles in pork sauce. Want to delight the old friend with a new culinary masterpiece. Dog tails in pork sauce have gotten old for everyone. Anyway, I need the tentacles of this creature - three should be enough...\nFrom me you can get:

Eh, Marked One... there's one job, but dangerous - I really don't know. Very respectable people from a very serious office approached me. Couldn't refuse them. From the talks I understood that their leadership got one crazy idea... don't even want to talk about it... damn psychics. Anyway, find a controller and chop off its hand... Well or cut it off, you have a knife?\nBring it - you'll get:

Eggheads want to study monsters, but are afraid to go into the Zone... They ordered from me here, for genetic research, to get a pseudogiant... whole! Simpletons. Anyway I explained that his carcass can't be dragged out of here for any money. So they agreed to any part. They promised worthy payment, so I can offer something to whoever completes this task:

I heard that in the laboratory, the one in Dark Valley, these very... poltergeists dwell. I have one brainy acquaintance from the scientific brotherhood. So I want to make him a gift. He's long been interested in the possibility of researching telekineti... what they call... Monster abilities, in general. Look, almost broke my tongue. In short... Try to get these damn poltergeist eyes, by rumors, all their power is in them. And let them dissect, study there. Good for us and scientific interest for him.\nIf you please me with a pair of eyes, then from me:

Our scientist comrades have long been trying to understand: how does the electrochimera generate such a strong discharge. They suspect that the kidneys are that very "generator". Get one for experiments - there will be gratitude from the scientific brotherhood and from us!\nAnd this gratitude will be expressed in material form:
What kid, wanted some meat?
Yeah from this meat, you'll probably become a goat.
Well don't fidget under the cleaver then.
Already left.
What do you want, curious one?
Want to offer to trade monster parts.
Let's see what there is...
Get lost, sick one... Don't have anything today... One guy came here, bought up all the guts that were...
Want to talk with you.
Ta-a-alk... What's that about?
Hey, man. Haven't we met before? Something about your look seems familiar to me...
I don't remember. Don't remember - who I am and where I'm from.
Well you're something! How should I address you, Ivan-no-memory?
Marked One. That's what they call me.
Hold on there, Marked One. What brings you to our Guts? Not many artifacts here, but plenty of dogs... can feed yourself any moment. Heh-heh.
Yeah I saw. Real herds. And I'm here on business. My own. What are you guys doing here?
Don't want to talk, no need. And we have nothing to hide. We herd beasts. Get all kinds of stuff. Hunt, in general. I teach stalkers how to become real hunters. Maybe someone will be useful. In time.
I see. I'll move on.
Be seeing you, familiar stranger.
Decided to hunt or just visiting?
I'm here on business, on business.
I'm looking for one person. Called Vaska. He should have passed through these parts recently. He's got a distinctive rifle - TOZ-66. Haven't met him?
Hmm... If it's the one you're talking about, then yes, I saw a stalker with such a rifle, he came from the Cordon. Cheerful guy, exchanged a couple phrases, and that was it.
Did he happen to mention where he was planning to go?
Yeah seemed like he wanted to swing by the sawmill, stock up on sausage for the road. Ask our guys there, maybe they'll tell you more precisely.
Got it, understood, thanks.
Greetings to you. How are we living?
Slowly. You guys just sit here all the time? When do you hunt?
Hunting is serious business. Doesn't tolerate haste.
Always running around. Sit down, rest.
Greetings. Are you here on business? Petrov is my surname, and you are?
I don't remember. I don't remember - who I am or where I'm from. They've been calling me the Marked One for now.

Hmm. Consequences of trauma? Or psionic influence? Well yes, yes... You can't remember, of course. My colleagues and I once had quite a heated debate about how a person's informational essence cannot simply vanish without a trace. Have you heard of Vernadsky's noosphere? Although... I apologize once again...
Well, alright. And what do you mean - cannot disappear? This interests me greatly, as you can understand...

Well, there exists a theory that all information is some kind of matter that doesn't come from nowhere and doesn't disappear into nothing, but merely redistributes itself. Perhaps there are ways to tap into the general information field and obtain information bypassing intermediaries. There's even been a hypothesis put forward, not by me, that the so-called Monolith, which rumor has it is located somewhere in the central area of the Zone currently inaccessible to people, is actually some kind of access terminal to this noosphere.
And what does that mean?

In theory, an individual who makes contact with the noo-terminal would be able to gain knowledge about practically everything... But this theory is too radical and doesn't withstand any serious criticism. Although... there's something to it.
I see that nothing is clear. So it turns out that if I get to this Monolith, I'll be able to find out who I am?
Well, if we approach it with a considerable dose of optimism, then yes, possibly...
Greetings. Are you visiting us again?
Yes, thought I'd drop by to say hello...
Then greetings once more... Glad you stopped by, new people are scarce around here. Though that's good for research purposes.
I'm interested in the laboratory at Yantar.
Hmm, the one that Vasiliev was searching for? As far as I know, there hasn't been any reliable information yet. Or has there?
As Sakharov said, Vasiliev with guides managed to penetrate that very laboratory. Just not clear how. Ivan Sergeevich speaks vaguely about something. Well, do you know anything?

In his last message, Vasiliev mentioned that a certain stalker with the strange alias - Ghost - told him something. Something about the existence of a method for instant controlled transport through space, and possibly time. But for this, simultaneous activation of three unique artifacts is necessary. As an example, a scheme was given for teleportation two-three meters in the direction toward the center of the earth. In my opinion - very, very dangerous experiments...
Dangerous, that's for sure. And what artifacts? Didn't he mention them?

In that example there was reference to artifacts of the so-called "emerald" group. "Twisted," "Jellyfish" and "Stone Blood." To verify this hypothesis probably won't be possible - these artifacts are far too rare.
Probably it was still possible, since Vasiliev and those who were with him managed to get into that mysterious underground laboratory... And where is it located? The specific place?
Hmm... Vasiliev was certain he knew. Even marked it on the map. Right here, in the basement of this building at the Yantar factory. Mark it down for yourself if you're interested.

In the basement? And you're saying another two-three meters toward the center of the Earth, where could it go even deeper? And how to use these "emeralds," Vasiliev didn't say? Maybe throw them on the ground or arrange in a triangle? I don't understand...

I think we shouldn't engage in magic and build triangles out of artifacts. Vasiliev didn't say, but I suppose not because he was hiding it, but because the method of application is somehow simple, obvious... You see, stalkers use homemade belts for carrying artifacts, even though they don't even understand what this might lead to. Well, try hanging them on your belt then. Only I don't advise mindlessly experimenting with such dangerous things. If you do decide to do it, then only at the indicated point, or God knows where you might end up.
Yes, dangerous, of course. But we need to check. "Emerald" artifacts, then... three pieces. Hmm, that means we need a belt for three artifacts too... We'll be searching.
You were telling me something about the Monolith. Noosphere this, noosphere that...
So. And what?
Well, nothing... Some interesting notes came my way, so I thought, maybe it could be that thoughts can flow from one person to another? Like be transmitted by teleport...

Interesting view on teleportation... However, if we consider that thought could theoretically have some mass, even if insignificant, then why not teleport it through space... From point A to point B. Only what should we consider the starting and ending point? After all, we don't know where exactly and how thought is born. But interesting approach. And what does the Monolith have to do with this?
Just like that, came up in conversation. You were saying something about the noosphere, information field or whatever... About the Monolith. So there you go.

Yes-yes, I remember, and your interest is understandable to me. Unfortunately, I can't reassure you with anything... And regarding teleportation and the so-called Monolith, you know, there's one bold hypothesis by Academician Kutin. I won't go into details, but the essence of the assumption is this: there's a negligible probability of stumbling upon such a teleport that can transport not only through space, but also through time. And for a physical body located spatially near the Monolith, this probability increases geometrically. The amplitude over time also increases, well that is, it'll throw you further. Perhaps the disturbances near the Monolith itself are such that not only physical objects are teleported, but also thoughts, as you said... why not. These are assumptions, we can neither confirm nor refute them yet.
Strong disturbances... That means it knocks your brains out there, right?

I can't assert that, though such a thing is possible. Something must definitely happen to the information field I told you about, and consequently to human consciousness. And as for physical bodies, it's assumed that falling into some field near the Monolith, you could fly off in an unknown direction for hundreds of thousands of kilometers in space and millions of years in time... Theoretically, of course.
Holy shit, what theories you have... In general, I understood that it's better not to mess with it, or it'll hurl you somewhere - and you won't come back.
I'm telling you - it's only a hypothesis. And it doesn't have many supporters.
Heard anything about teleports?
Well...
What "well"?

About "Whirligigs" they talk a lot, but that's been known for ages. And they also say there's someone who can somehow create a teleport... Bullshit, in my opinion. Although... Here in the Zone, anything can happen.
Why? Seems possible...
Seems, yeah kind of... One egghead here had too much to drink once, gave such a performance... said you can travel through time in general. What a performer that one was.
But what if... It's the Zone, after all. There are reports about Semetsky. Maybe he got stuck somewhere in a teleport and flies back and forth like that.
And you're going there too? Semetsky - that's just a tale, stalker folklore... Ah, don't rack my brains! Another wise guy to me. Better get down to business.
Remember, you were telling me about a stalker who crawled from the Red Forest into the laboratory at Yantar?
When was that? Ah... I told you, that's bullshit, in my opinion. Drunk talk. Such bullshitters here - every other one.
Bullshit or not - we'll figure it out. And where is this stalker now, do you know?
He was here the other day. Looked like he was getting ready for a raid.
What's his name?

His name... slipped my mind. Ah, here! He and Prut were "buzzing" by the fire past midnight, people complained later that they wouldn't let them sleep. Even wanted to beat the crap out of that pair, but the debt collectors calmed the troublemakers down in time. Try Prut, in general. Though, it seems to me that all this is a dead end. But Sakharov might know something...
You trade artifacts? We had a deal.
And they said you have a pot instead of a head. Look here - you didn't forget. I trade, I trade - crappy ones for better ones. Let's have a look, what do you have?
Let's wait on looking... What do you mean crappy? You explain properly. What specific artifacts do you need. As I understand it, you won't take just anything.

Oh... look how many questions you have. I thought that if a stalker already made it to Limansk, then he's an experienced person and doesn't need to be told which end of a bottle to hold...\nAlright, listen again.\nArtifacts have different properties. So here's the deal - I give you one artifact, as you say "in the green," and you give me two, but slightly worse ones. Got it, or should I explain again?
Ah, well yeah, that's obvious even to a hedgehog.

What a hedgehog we'll have between us, such will be the arithmetic. Just make sure you bring the same kind - I have my own props and my own nuances for them. And don't make that face - with me everything's by the rules... yes is yes, no is no. Nobody's twisting your arm - if you don't like it, don't trade. Clear?
Clear. If I need anything, I'll come to you.
I'm here about trading artifacts.
Well, show me - what do you have there? Maybe we'll trade.
Here's a couple of simple artifacts.
Take two medium-class artifacts.
Here are high-class artifacts.
Yeah, that'll work - suits for trade. Here, take a good artifact...
Hmm, where did I put them... Wait, I think I had some. Can't find them anywhere.
Look, look... don't rush. Mikhalych sleeps, money drips... Heh.
You, uh... Looking for someone? Or just - running past?
You could say yes, I'm looking. For Strelok.

Strelok? Nah, nobody like that came through. We're shooters ourselves here. Washing our pants after that business... Boss said we need to move to the town, to the district center. Like there are some guys there we need to have a word with. But can't get further - lightning strikes. Over there our buddy, Crucian, got zapped so bad - only ash left. Who are you anyway?
Marked One. Lightning, you say. Alright. We'll see.
Washed your pants? Shooter... Heh-heh...
Should check your own, talking nonsense...
I'd like to add more slots for artifacts on my belt.
Well, that's possible. What do you have available?
For one artifact.
I have a belt for two artifacts.
Got one for three artifacts here.
I have one for four artifacts.
I changed my mind, don't need anything.
Hmm. One stalker left me a two-slot one here. I can let you have it, and I'll gradually improve yours. Give me any simple artifact like a jellyfish or twisted - and the belt is yours.
I happen to have a three-slot one. If you give me an artifact no lower than second level, I'll give it to you. And I'll work on your belt.

Actually, I need to reassemble the entire voltage multiplier circuit. But I have one ready for four discharge units. If you don't mind parting with a third-level artifact, I'll replace it for you in no time.

Four to five? Isn't that a bit much? You'll look like a Christmas tree... Well, your business. For five discharge units I need very powerful thyristor assemblies. I have them, of course, but... In short, for less than an Empty-class artifact, I won't part with them. Agreed?
Alright, I agree. Take the artifact.
Second level? Well, alright.
What an appetite you have! Alright.
An Empty! Holy crap! Where is the world heading! Agreed!
I'll think about it some more...
Here you go. Belt for two artifacts.
Good, here you go. For three artifacts.
Let me install it. Here, additional slot... Done, take it...
Well, you judge for yourself - where would I get new ones now? Only by order. And that's time and big expenses. Take this one, be more careful.
How's my little device doing?
Uh-uh-uh... You're rushing too much. I haven't checked it yet, come back later.
Yeah, everything seems fine. I cleaned it up a bit... Wiped the contacts with alcohol and all that... Right?
You... Don't give me that "right". I settled everything with you fair and square. So...
Alright, just kidding. Here's your PDA. Clean as a whistle. You take care of it, you hear. Just in case...
What about the money?! There was more there - what, down the drain?
Money, it's for vitality, like oxygen, you understand... So you can breathe freely there, "where man breathes so freely". It's my little pension fund. So go on, go on your way.
Hello, Marked One. This man has been sheltering me for now... Have you heard anything new about Vlad?
Uh-uh-uh... No, haven't heard anything. You should go home already.
I met your husband, told him about you. He immediately rushed here, should show up soon, I think.
He's dead, unfortunately.
I'll wait. However long it takes...
Really? You think soon? Thank you so much!
I don't believe it! It can't be... What now...
Well, suit yourself, wait.
Whatever, no big deal.
Go home, Oksana. Otherwise you'll die here too.
Hello, Marked One. Have you heard anything new about Vlad?
Hello. Everything alright? Good luck to you!
Thanks for the kind words.
How am I supposed to live now...
Like everyone who's lost loved ones... Just live.
Hi there, friend.
Hello. Thanks for helping my wife. She told me how you led her out of Cordon. I don't even know how to thank you... We're getting ready to head back home soon. Hope I can think of something.
Don't mention it, no thanks needed. You're alive and together, that's what matters. And don't go into the Zone anymore. Good luck.
Hi, Marked One. I was just waiting for you. I told Oksana: we can't just leave like that - without thanking this man.
Don't worry about it.

Of course, I can't thank you properly - too much has piled up, but maybe what I saw will be useful to you. When I was walking here through the Gut, I noticed how to the left of the bridge over the swamp, a giant was writhing in agony. Apparently hunters shot it, could barely move. So if you hurry, you can take some good trophies from it. It was lying near a lone birch.
A giant, you say? We'll see.
Hey, how's it going?
Fine...
What's with you, Sanyok, like you don't know me? Grabbed a full bag of loot and, like, I don't know you guys?
What are you talking about? You know me?
Sanya! What's wrong? Don't I know you? I just don't understand what happened to you?
You say Sanya? But I really don't remember you, I swear. They found me recently near a truck, and... that's it, no memories in my head. Are we really acquainted?
Found you by a truck?!.. Ahem... Damn! Man, sorry. You look a lot like Sanyok, got confused. Sorry, really.
No worries, happens...
Ah! It's you, bro... How's it going?

I'm freakin' out! I'm looking at you and you don't want to recognize me? Got rich and full of yourself? Soon as you went north, you disappeared, and now you don't know and don't want to. And we drank so much vodka together...
We drank together? When?
Well hello, I'm your aunt! Andryukh, what's wrong with you, really? What happened to you?

Long story... I lost my memory, don't remember anything about myself, they picked me up near a death truck somewhere, now I'm wandering around... Tell me, where did we meet before. Am I really Andryukha?
Uh... Man, are you serious about the truck? Holy shit... I was mistaken, you just look a lot like someone, got confused... And anyway, I don't have time.
Mistaken, huh...
Hi there, look-alike...
Holy shit! What the hell, pal? Nah... fo' real turnin' your mug away and, like, we don't know each other? I'm crackin' up!..
What are you babbling about? We know each other or what?
What? And who carried you on his back with loot from the vortex - Pushkin or what? Nah, Tolyan, I fo' real don't get it, what's the joke?
And when was that? A lot has happened since then, I completely lost my memory, they found me recently next to a truck, you know, that death truck. That's the whole deal. So my name's Anatoly?
Oh, damn! Wait a sec, let me look at ya... What a moron I am! Been hittin' the bottle and still seeing things! You ain't Tolyan, you just look like him! I'll be damned. Alright, see ya, mister!
Should drink less...
Ah! It's you again...
Wait a minute! You're Oleg, right? Remember how we fought off the dogs? You left somewhere after that, I didn't even get to thank you... Thanks, you helped me out.
You're welcome... When was that?
About three months ago, I got mauled pretty bad then, was lying there like a log. And you don't remember? You look kinda rough, and where did you disappear to then?

If only I knew where I've been! Memory got knocked out completely, forgot who I am entirely. Thanks to good people who picked me up by some interesting little truck, now I'm wandering the Zone, trying to remember. So you knew me well?
Damn, what bad luck... well, what can you do. I think I only saw you briefly, or maybe it wasn't you at all, just looked similar... Right, not you. Mixed you up.
Too bad. Would've been better if it was me...
How are you, friend?
Hey there, dude! I'm looking and thinking: is that you or not?
It's me alright. And you recognized someone in me?
What do you mean "someone"? You're Lyokha, I know you, we went artifact hunting together in one place, come on, did you forget?
Forgot. Ever since I got off the death truck, I forgot everything. When was that?

Man, you got messed up, really messed up... I've had withdrawals before, but to climb into a truck - no way... Ah! I totally forgot, Lyokha left the Zone a long time ago. What a blockhead I am! Had a drink in the morning, then smoked some, got a bit confused.
Yeah... Fun times you have here.
How's it going, buddy?
How's life, Petruha?
You talking to me?
Well, who else? What's wrong, Petruha, don't you recognize me or what?
Don't recognize... I have this, like shell shock - lost my memory, after I rode in a truck...
A truck?.. Actually I don't know Petruha very well myself, but by description you kinda look like him. Thought if you respond, then you're Petruha... But you're still not Petruha. Sorry, man.
So, not Petruha...
Well, made a mistake, happens to everyone...
Yo! Look who's here without security! Come on, tell me, how's it going over there?
What? You sure you got the right guy?
Pal, what's wrong? Or did ya get all high and mighty after grabbing some loot? And who was drinking with Scabby, who was talking about good stuff - wasn't that you?
Maybe it was me... When was that? I'm like, after the little truck, when I rolled off it, I don't remember anything.

What? Wait, turn around... Ah! Mixed you up, pal. From the front you don't look like him, but from behind - damn similar to some guy, I swear! That's how I mixed you up... Don't even know how, but from behind you look alike...
By the back of the head, probably...
Ah... by the back of the head, ha! That's a good one!
Oh! Where'd you come from? They buried you...
Where? You must not be awake yet, seeing things.
Where - you want me to show you the cross or what? And they wrote on it: Here lies Mytyay. Holy shit! You're like a werewolf or some ghoul from the grave...

Cool down and wipe your eyes... You say my name is Mytyay? That's from Dmitry, right? Tell me in detail, where's the cross, what happened there. I have this... amnesia, after I got off a truck a couple months ago, like they told me.

And I don't give a damn about your amnesia... Wait, what did you say - got off a truck? Ah, so that ain't you! Mytyay croaked like half a year ago... And I was scared, thought it was some werewolf... was about to grab an aspen stake.
Yeah... Keep silver bullets for such cases - they're more reliable.
Where would I get silver ones?
Hi, why you turning your mug away, like we don't know each other?
Me? What's the matter?
Not me... You, they say, crossed Tooth's path. Seems he even tried to put a hit on you for good money. We don't need walking tanks in the Zone, he says...

Do I look like a tank? Listen, since that's the case, tell me, 'cause I got something wrong with my head after riding the death truck. Can't remember who I am, kill me if I'm lying. So they called me Tank?

Is this some kind of joke? Really rode in a truck?... Ah, yes! I remembered, Tooth was talking about someone else. There's something elusive between you two... But it's definitely not you. So, see ya, man.
Elusive, you say... That's what I'm trying to catch, at least something.
Catch it faster, or it'll run away... Don't sweat it, just mixed you up.
Hey, Garik, why so serious? You could at least say hello...
Well, I'm like, Marked One... But that's a nickname, and the name might be Garik.
Are you completely drunk? Forgot your own name? You didn't drink so hard before.
And before - when was that? Before I got into the truck or after? Tell me about me, what you know.
Hey! I didn't get a good look myself, half asleep. I'm thinking, well Garik can't get so wasted he doesn't remember his name... But this ain't Garik at all. My mistake...
Too bad... I was starting to like the name - Garik...
Move along, don't loiter...
Yo, bro! You brought the grass?
Was I supposed to? You asked me to?
Quit joking around, if you got it - tell me the price, why you playing dumb? Don't be slow, Scarred, come on, what you got.
I've been slow for a long time. Looks like that truck I got off of didn't have brakes. I don't remember anything after it. You say I'm Scarred?

Were you shooting up or what, dude? That doesn't work anymore, last season's trick - grass from Agroprom... Wait a minute! Hey, you ain't Scarred! Why'd I take you for him? Move along, I didn't ask you nothing.
Well, I'm moving... you asked yourself, and now "move along".
Come on, come on, get lost, we don't know each other...
So what's up? Haven't seen you in ages, Vanyuha...
Been a while... Am I really Vanyuha?
What, hit it hard yesterday? I don't have anything to cure a hangover with myself.
Don't need it... So you recognized Vanyuha in me? Don't you remember where I'm from, didn't we talk about this before, by any chance?
Huh?.. Come stand closer to the light... Why you messin' with my head? What kind of Vanyuha are you! Go look for hangover cure somewhere else... some wise guy. Don't know you at all.
You started it first...
I ended the chatter...
Greetings... Oh! Who are you?
Same to you. I'm just a stalker. Confused me with someone?
You look so much like our lieutenant colonel, a spitting image. You just need a cap and shoulder boards - couldn't tell you apart. We call him Boss among ourselves - you two aren't related?
Don't know... My memory for names and faces isn't great, and everything else too... This is after they found me by a truck.

Not related then. If you were related to our Boss, you wouldn't be hanging around here crawling in the dirt. Ah, if only I could be related to the defense minister - so he'd send me home for discharge faster...
Even better to be related to the president...
Ah... It's you... From the United Nations...
Hey, Vityok?
Me?
You. What's with you, Vityukha, soon as you left us your nose went up... I see you're decked out with such trinkets I've never seen.
How long ago did I leave? Trinkets are trifles - you should tell me about me, I'd give them all to you for free... I came in a truck, heard about those? Don't remember a damn thing since then.
Yeah... damn. Never would've thought a guy from the truck would look so much like Vityukha. Keep your trinkets, I got nothing to tell you...
Alright... Maybe you do have something to say?
Go on, go on, move along... I was mistaken.
Hey, Vityok?
Me?
You. What's with you, Vityukha, soon as you left us your nose went up... I see you're decked out with such trinkets I've never seen.
How long ago did I leave? Trinkets are trifles - you should tell me about me, I'd give them all to you for free... I came in a truck, heard about those? Don't remember a damn thing since then.
Yeah... damn. Never would've thought a guy from the truck would look so much like Vityukha. Keep your trinkets, I got nothing to tell you...
Alright... Maybe you do have something to say?
Go on, go on, move along... I was mistaken.
Ever been to the Tesla Zone?

Nah... Far and dangerous. Mikha Crooked once bragged he could make it there... Borrowed gear from everyone, said he'd pay back with interest. I'll be back - you'll be amazed! He left, with the Guide it seems. Sent word he was back with loot, so we're waiting. Then suddenly another message on the network: Crooked's done for. We were amazed alright. And I gave him my rifle and sleeping bag. To hell with the gear, feel sorry for the guy.
Bad luck then.
Maybe bad luck. Or maybe... Don't want to talk about it.
Listen, do you know who's been to the Tesla Zone?

Can't say for sure who exactly. Some guy was bragging here once that he goes there like it's his own home almost. He's a talker... Smart people don't flap their tongues, they find out everything, learn, weigh all the pros and cons before going there. And the smartest ones don't go at all. Like old Starik, you don't know him - this was long ago, he went and vanished. Even though he found a safe route, from the Guide it seems. Went and even came back, but still ended up vanishing there later... Or maybe not there. You want to poke around there too?
Thinking about it... Just weighing all the pros and cons.
Think, think. You know the saying - measure seven times and then sew up whoever you need... Just kidding.
Have they brought you anything from the Tesla Zone? I'm interested in who's been there.

Well, they brought stuff... Said it was from there. A couple guys hired some guide as an escort to there, or maybe just to there... I didn't ask much. But they're gone now. Went to another place later, and both died there. They say a giant trampled them. Who's gonna check now, and what difference does it make how...
Yeah... No difference "how", the result's the same...
Maybe not... But there's something bad about these stories about guides. Like they're guiding people to the other world...
What have you heard about the Tesla Zone?

Nothing definite. Mass of theories, no reasonable explanations. There are descriptions, suppositions, hypotheses. Even some measurements... Our colleague went there for an experiment with some guide, the guy escorted him. So he told us some things... But he's not here, they took him to the mainland. Got poisoned by something.
Looks like they give you poor quality alcohol for experiments. No wonder he got poisoned...
Hmm... Well-well. Who knows...
So you just sit here? What about wandering somewhere farther, toward the center?

It's far... Need a reliable guide, can't make it without one. This stalker came by once... haven't seen him in a long time, maybe he's gone already... So he said there's this person who can show you the way wherever you want. Only you need to know exactly where you need to get to. True, he said that guy's a bit not right in the head or not of this world. And loves to hit the bottle. Can you really rely on a drunk, especially one who's "not right in the head"? That's why none of us used his services.
Yeah, taking a drunk with you on a trip is the worst...
Especially some of them...
Why so gloomy? Like you buried someone.

Heard about Borka Gray? I told him, don't get mixed up with these shady deals! Who the hell knows what's inside them. And he tells me: "I know this guy - reliable man. He knows all the paths and trails, don't worry! He'll guide you himself, or if not himself, he'll tell you how". So much for don't worry, Borka bought it like a rookie - flew into a "Whirligig" and that's it! Or someone helped... unclear. Screw these know-it-alls! Where, I ask, does that guy know all the paths from, huh? Screwed him over, the bastard... for sure.
Like your Borka was a saint! He probably screwed the guy over before... So he got what was coming to him.
There are no saints here, but there are cursed ones...
You know different trails... Can you tell me something?
What should I tell you and why?
You don't have to, of course... I'm just asking. It's like, your specialty. So can you help? Need to get through the Tesla Zone further north, but the electricity's in the way.

Help... I can help, but will you really want me to help you? Where you want to get to is very dangerous, I'm telling you this without any drama, if you go there, you'll lose your head, that's for sure. No alternatives.
How to get there, I already know. And I know it's dangerous there. But I heard there's a more or less safe trail there and you supposedly know about it. You are the Guide after all.

"Guide"... "Specialty"... "You know trails"... People say different things, and you listen. Have you met even one person I showed a trail to? Talked to him yourself, face to face, not through rumors? That's the thing, that's the whole problem. You don't understand anything. And nobody understands anything.
Why are you talking in riddles? Some big secret?
Ehhhh... What's a secret got to do with it... I'm not being capricious, I'm scared myself, and scared for you too. Interested now? Look how you perked up your ears. It's a long story.
I'm not in a hurry, tell me.
Then get out a bottle, I'll tell you the story over drinks. Then you decide what you'll do about it.
Don't have any with me, but wait, don't leave. I'll be right back.
Yeah! I happen to have some right here... Shall we have a drink?

Let's do it!\nI'm just a regular stalker, so I'll tell it like it was, and whether you believe it or not is up to you.\nBasically, I became a "Guide" about a year ago, after one incident. An emission started once, and I had nowhere to hide. I completely missed it and started looking for a good spot, got all flustered, and then "thunder struck"... I was dashing around like a madman, got really scared, trying to find at least some hole to bury myself in. The emission had already started, and suddenly out of nowhere I realized that two hundred meters to the left there was a ruined farm and there was a good cellar there. Somehow a revelation just hit me in my head - that I needed to get there!
Intuition, or what?

Maybe intuition, maybe revelation, maybe a gift. I ran to that farm and hid. Thank God, made it in time. Since then, how do I put it... if I need to get somewhere, I know exactly how to get there quickly and safely. And lately, to know how to get somewhere, I don't necessarily have to have been there before. Like someone draws a map in my head.\nThat's how it is. Maybe another one?
Let's do it... Huh! Can't even believe it... You're lucky!

That's what I thought at first too. Everything would be fine, I'd live without a care, just rejoicing: any loot I want is mine. But it turned out not to be so simple. I only learn the route when I'm already very close. But while I'm searching, I can get into trouble 10 times. But I can calmly show others the way, even from far away. Such is the gift... And I should be taking loot from stalkers for this, living without worry - I wouldn't need to go anywhere myself. Only now I feel that I don't need such a gift at all, because it didn't appear in me for nothing. And what kind of gift is this anyway, it's a curse of the Zone, not a gift. After all, everyone I somehow show the way to goes much further than the places they wanted to reach.\nE-eh... My soul burns! Pour some more!
Coming up. Let's go! And where do they go?

They lay down their heads for nothing, that's where... I didn't pay attention to this at first. But then I look - one died, there's talk about the second one disappearing, the third got into trouble somewhere... I didn't connect it right away, because it was much later after I showed them the way. But then I specifically showed one guy a path... And that was it. He's gone - vanished. And then it hit me: I'm the one responsible for their deaths! Or rather, it's my curse from the Zone, damn it! Such a mark from the Zone is on me. You're also marked by the Zone, but you just don't have memory... But this! I'd rather get such a mark than this "gift"!
How would you know what's better?.. "Just no memory"... how simple everything is for you. We all want to have something different.
Don't get worked up. One's own pain always hurts more.
Tell me about how you became a "Guide".
Hmm, well get out a bottle, we'll drink, maybe it'll relax me. Then you decide what you'll do about it.
So how are you? Will you tell me about the path through "Tesla"?
What?... Oh! That one... Wait a bit... something's not right with me... Aha.
Had too much to drink. Alright, back off.
Eh? You still want to get this "gift" from the Zone? Everyone only has one life, you like to take risks?
Cut the whining already... My life has always been my responsibility. Come on, lay it out, what do you want? Not for free, I understand...

You're a fool, Marked One! You think I'm bargaining with you and driving up the price? I don't need anything from you. I wanted to stop you, but you understood nothing. But since you're "all grown up"... So you were there, you say... And came back alive. Strange, so the Zone must be protecting you for some reason. What did you leave there anyway? It's a cursed territory. I wouldn't go there if I were you, might not be so lucky the second time...\nAlright! Describe that place to me, but in detail, I've never been there even once.
How can I describe it to you, especially in detail? If I knew that area in detail, I wouldn't be asking you. Is there no other way?
Why not... There is. Don't you have anything from there with you? Any object - a pebble, a twig, old scrap metal... In places where I haven't been myself, I can only orient this way.
I don't have anything from there, didn't take anything.

What do you mean nothing?! You walked around there. Take off your boots, I'll try to sense something through them... \nEw! What a stench! Take them back, I've read the aura imprint. Now don't bother me, take a walk for about twenty minutes, I need to figure this all out.
Like, get into it? Got it. I'll wait.
Hey, snap out of it! Is there a path?
Don't bother me yet. I haven't figured it out yet.
Well, I'll wait some more.

Well then... Remember, you wanted this yourself. I sketched this out for you. Look here - these marks are "nodes". Between them run "threads". Walk strictly along the "threads", a step or two to the side - you'll get it so bad your boots will stick together. Got it?
Got it, I'm not stupid. And where does this path lead anyway?
I don't know, that remained hidden from me.
Well hell with it, thanks for that anyway! See you later, "scourge of God".
Take care... If you come back from there - drop by, we'll talk.
Hello, stalker! Sit down by the fire, let's chat. Where from, where to, what for?
Hi, but I don't really have time to sit around, running on business. What about you? Hunting?
Well yeah. Something like that. Or they're hunting us. Can't tell here in the Zone. Everyone calls me Chinaman, and what about you?
I'm Marked One. Hmm... You don't really look like a Chinese guy though?

I'll remember you, Marked One. As for the nickname... It's been dragging since mandatory service, from the army. We had this jokester - he stuck it on me. My last name is Nikitin. And he says: Chinese surname - Nik-I-Tin... So it stuck. And why are you called Marked One?
Just somehow. Probably because of the tattoo on my hand, or because of scars. Sidorovich called me that. I don't remember anything myself.

Yeah. The worst thing is not knowing anything about yourself. Maybe you're a great person, but you're rummaging in dirt with everyone else. Though, looking from the other side - knowing about yourself that you're dirt isn't particularly fun. So how about tea? Made from mutated currants?
We meet again, Marked One.
Oh! Are you alive? Or... No! Don't come closer...
Hmm, another nutcase. But at least you're not grabbing for your gun.
Yeah, sorry, I haven't seen regular people here for a long time, so I had my doubts...
Regular? What, are there irregular ones? I'm Marked One, by the way.

Very, very glad to meet you, Marked One. My name is Ilya, but I'm better known as Brainiac. As for irregular people...\nHere in the Zone, regular is hard to come by. But the "Tesla" zone is especially unique in this regard. I think this is exactly where it all started. Did you see how the earth is heaved up? What kind of force would you need to wake up for this to happen? That's just it. They opened the gates unknowingly to something otherworldly. Yeah... Did you see the skeletons? That's THEM. The very ones. Who worked here. There was also a lot of stuff in the underground. But almost immediately after this all started, they brought troops here and pulled out everything they could from the underground and took it away. And what couldn't be taken - they destroyed. They probably wanted to blow it up too, but THEY interfered... Those very ones, the irregular ones.
But who are THEY?

Well, I'm telling you. What, aren't you listening?
Those who worked here. The skeletons. Sometimes, not very often, of course, but they kind of come to life. They get up, walk around, do something. Those who were guards - they even seem to shoot at someone. And such a low, rumbling hum. Turns you inside out.
And very rarely it happens that you start to feel their fear, hope, despair. All at once...
I thought they could be understood... I approached, extended my hand. This one, the left. And that was it. Woke up a day later. Now I can't feel my hand at all. As if it's not with me, someone else's.
And THEY, the further it goes, the stronger, more alive, somehow. Some of them you can't tell from a human anymore. Just God forbid you run into THEM...
Uh... interesting story.
Marked One, are you alive? Phew... must have been my imagination.
Listen, what are you doing here anyway?

To be honest, I don't know myself. I'm waiting for when that unusual time comes again, when THEY will be HERE again, and not THERE. My consciousness torments me that somewhere nearby is the solution. The solution to everything - the Zone, anomalies, and life itself.\nSo I wait, and hope, and... fear. Until my knees shake. I always considered myself a brave man, but now... What awaits us THERE? And is there even such a thing, this THERE?
Damn, you're really messed up. Alright. You haven't heard of such a stalker by any chance - Strelok is his name?

Strelok? Yes, I heard. Supposedly he found a path to that very Monolith. Well, the one that grants wishes. And supposedly Strelok wished for the Zone to end, but this didn't happen. Or did it? Where is that Strelok now? And where are we all? Maybe the Zone disappeared, and we all became shadows in the world of the living? What do you think?
I think... I think I'm hungry. And since I'm hungry, that means I'm alive. And the living belong among the living. Something like that.

Yeah, yeah... Look, there's plenty of such hungry ones on the surface. Corpses crawl out of graves and reach out, and moan, and are ready to devour. Are they also alive then? That's just it...\nYeah, also about Strelok. At one time they said that the path to the Monolith starts somewhere around here. And Strelok supposedly knew where exactly. And at Mikhalych's they chattered that for this you need to pass the "Labyrinth". What kind of tales you don't hear...\nYou said you're hungry? I have a small stash. Can trade for vodka. For a bottle I'll give a couple of cans.
Wait a minute. Tell me about the "Labyrinth".

Haven't you heard? There are such places in the Zone that are surrounded by all kinds of anomalies, but in their center you can find something very special. Either some artifact of extraordinary power and usefulness. Or a hole in space through which you get to another place. Here, at "Tesla", there is one such "Labyrinth". Your Strelok, by the way, could have passed through it.
How do people even walk around here when the discharges hit so hard that your boots almost fly off?

People say there's a safe path. And supposedly someone boasted that he has a map with such a path. What was his name... No, I can't remember - I was drunk then. Supposedly the Guide drew him that map.
And how do you yourself go to people? Canned food doesn't fall from the sky.

What about me? It's routine business, and it's not far from here to the nearest stalker camps. As soon as you get out, to the right are transformers, and behind them is the passage to those... to the Warehouses. Well, where the Freedom guys are. But I don't like going there, it's noisy. The road that goes south will lead to the passage to Limansk. Quiet little town, almost no beasts, peaceful there. One trader set himself up comfortably there, goes by Mikhalych. Clever guy, supposedly Sidorovich's godfather. And so, people say there's a path here to the "Brain Scorcher" too, and somewhere else, but I haven't gone myself, don't know. If you need to, look for it.
I'll look, if I don't get fried.
Haven't seen any scientists here? Supposedly they were heading this way in mid-spring?
Uhhh... Yeah, they walk around sometimes, who knows. I don't ask for passports. Mid-spring, you say? Cough. Yeah, there were some, I think.
Well? Don't keep me in suspense...

What "well"? One guy dropped by here. Eyes like cataracts. Was asking about a safe path. Promised to pile up cash. But what do I need their money for? I sent him away. Too arrogant he was behaving. But in general there was a whole squad there, ten guys or even more. Soldiers on guard, and that one, with the cataracts, was like their guide. And why did he bring them here? These are cursed places - even a hedgehog understands.
And where did they move on? And what about that cataract guy? What was his name?

The cataract guy, what was his name... Ah! Transparent. Or no... Something otherworldly... Ghost, maybe. Yeah, that's it - like that. This Ghost, I remember, said that they have special suits that can withstand the local discharges. And that's why they're going where nobody goes - to the antennas. And there the discharges are the nastiest, by the way... But there was something there, very interesting for science. And Ghost, it seemed, needed something else... His eyes kept darting around.\nAnyway, they headed north from here. And I haven't seen them since.
Get this, I came here from the "Brain Scorcher" through the underground!

You came and you came, what's got you so excited? Good for you, I guess. Or you're a fool... Depends how you look at it. Many of these undergrounds are connected to each other. That's how they were built...
And you apparently know a lot about this?

Well, not that much. It's just that in the time I've been here, I've had a chance to see some things, talk to knowledgeable people, read some documents... THOSE who are here sometimes have records with them, diaries, other papers. And when THEY are not here, you can take them and read. I thought a lot, compared, figured this way and that...
And what did you figure out?

As I understand it, all these underground laboratories were built in the late eighties. How many of them - nobody knows, but many. Just the numbered ones alone should be a couple dozen. Here, for example, is X-6. It's connected to X-8, which is that very one at the "Brain Scorcher". I've heard about X-18, X-16, X-12.\nFor what purpose were they all built and why underground? I think they wanted to create some weapon of intimidation, because then, in the eighties, it was clear to everyone that using nuclear weapons would be more expensive for yourself - you could destroy the whole earth.\nSo they kept developing. Apparently, something happened... Many laboratories weren't evacuated at all. After all, most of them employed prisoners, such "sharashkas". And the leadership at that time... You probably remember? Coups, revolutions, independence... So everything fell apart.
Yeah... But some laboratories are still radiating something there, as they say.

Yes. They built them well. Triple redundancy of all main systems. That's why some underground facilities look similar. Power was also duplicated, of course. They didn't just get energy from Chernobyl, but also from their own geothermal installations. So yes, it's still humming underground. Something's knocking, and maybe someone... Suddenly, they forgot to tell people that the Union no longer exists, so they continue to work hard. I don't know, I don't know...\nGot anything to drink? My throat's gotten dry...
I met with Fox, he told me about you, sent his regards.
Yeah, yeah. Solid guy. We drank vodka together, and not just once. Haven't seen him for a long time, how is he?
He was planning to get out of the Zone. Said he was fed up to here. So, I don't know if you'll see each other again...

We'll see each other! The Zone, brother, doesn't let go... Many have sworn off. Beat themselves in the chest with their heels: I've had enough of this nonsense up to here. It's over, they say, enough! Yeah right. But in half a year or a year, look, familiar names appear on the net again. So... He shouldn't have sworn off.\nBut what was your conversation with Fox about? Why were you mentioning me?

He was telling how you guys discussed those... clairvoyants. And that you knew such a one. Well, and he mentioned his debt. As I understood it, he left it near some "gravi-trap". What the hell is that thing?

Doesn't matter. So people still have conscience. Didn't forget, then, little Fox about how Ilyukha helped him out. Well, that's heartening. And about clairvoyants... That's a long story.\nThough, maybe you'd find it interesting. You've probably heard about monolithians? Well, that they're half-crazy and not of this world. Some people take the second part of the sentence literally. This, of course, is nonsense. There are a number of theories, the meaning of which boils down to the fact that everything that happens in the world is recorded in the "matrix". Or, as it's also called - in the noosphere. According to another, much less popular theory, monolithians somehow learned to extract various knowledge from this "matrix".
And what do clairvoyants have to do with this?
My throat's gotten dry. You'd pour something for the conversation? Otherwise it's all questions, questions...
I'll pour for you, no problem, but I won't drink myself, don't even try to persuade me. In these places, giving up your soul to God is easy as spitting, and when drunk - even more so.
I don't have any with me. Maybe later?

Yeah, I insist... Well, to your health! Ah! Different stuff! Otherwise, you understand, it's depressing here. Well, listen on.
You yourself said you don't remember anything about yourself, right? And somewhere there, in the information field, there's a complete dossier on you! Where you were born, what you dreamed about in first grade, what kind of women you prefer... I don't know for sure if those memories can be shoved back into you, but something like helping you remember, I think, is possible.
I once talked with one guy, you probably don't know him. He used to be like a scientist. He studied something in the Swamp.
He also had such a surname, bird-like. Either Solovyev or Dyatlov. I don't know how he did it, but the fact is he knew how to look into the "noosphere". He would fish out such things for me that good Lord! Maybe it would be useful for you to talk with him too.
Well, when there is some, then we'll talk about it. I think it would be useful for you to listen.
Bird-like surname? Something familiar... And where is he now?

In his time he was, you could say, a celebrity. Local scale, of course. Then he went to Pripyat. Said he needed to develop his abilities. Maybe his abilities worked better closer to the center of the Zone?! Anyway, there in Pripyat he joined the monolithians and, according to rumors, even headed their faction soon after. That's how it is.
Pripyat... And how, I wonder, did this Solovyev-Dyatlov make it all the way there? Alright, thanks for the story. I'll keep it in mind. You never know what the devil might bring...
Shall we talk about clairvoyants? I've got a bottle.
Then don't keep me waiting. Pour it to the brim so the conversation turns out soulful.
Man! Great! Thank God!
Oh... What are you doing here? Problems?

You bet! My friend got paralyzed. Some infection hit him, so now he can't move. And I can't pull him out myself: even though I have artifacts with protection from discharges, here's the trouble - all the batteries died. Thought we were done for. I tried to call for help from someone - silence. Communication, fuck, that is, comes and goes...\nDid you catch my message or are you here by accident? Can you help, maybe?
More like by accident. How can I help? And who are you anyway?

Friend, we need a couple of charged batteries. Doesn't even have to be "fully charged", but at least half capacity, enough to get out of here with guarantee. With activated artifacts I'll be able to drag my friend to Limansk. And there it'll be easier. At least, fewer unexpected troubles.\nDon't doubt our gratitude! We're from the "Seekers" ourselves. Ivar is our leader - probably heard of him? We'll pay up, be sure. There's a recipe for one artifact, just right for such terrain. Oh, sorry. What's your name?
I'm Marked One. I've heard something about Ivar. "Seekers"? Why that name?

I'm glad to meet you, Marked One. Very much! And "Seekers"...\nIvar organized our group, he lost a friend at the "Brain Scorcher", that one turned into a zombie. That's it. And Ivar doesn't believe that zombified people can't be returned to normal life. Says there's such an artifact that can return to the head what was there before... Well, something like the imprint of a person's personality always exists in some world of information. Such an artifact finds this imprint and copies it into a specific brain...\nThat's it. Ivar searches for such an artifact, and even seems to have found it already. And he got other stalkers enthusiastic about such an idea. So we search. "Seekers", that is...
And this Ivar of yours - is he a scientist?
Can't say for sure, but there's something like that about him. He was like an orderly in a madhouse somewhere or something like that... Tried to treat crazy people...
In a madhouse, you say? Don't you know if he was acquainted with Strelok?

Don't know... Wait, Strelok... Strelok... He said something like someone threw him some idea. He walked around all wound up after that: can't be, he says, that it's all for nothing. We must find it, he says...
Find what? And when was this?

Well you asked! Do you yourself ask everyone when who met with whom, what they said? Do I need this? I didn't understand jack shit myself then... So, something was said in passing, I forgot. If you hadn't asked, I wouldn't have even remembered that.
Yeah, of course... It's just that I found some interesting data about psychos. I'm thinking: whose is this. Maybe your Ivar's, or maybe Strelok's himself...
Marked One, hey... So how is it?
Seeker at Tesla is asking to bring a couple of batteries. Theirs are completely dead. For this he promises a recipe for some unusual artifact
I have a couple of batteries.
And? Why are you being so meaningful?
Hmm, remembered that nobody ever gave me even a stone for free...

Don't have anything valuable with me right now. Got a couple of artifacts with protection from "Electra", but as you understand, they're desperately needed... But here! Take this recipe. Cooking a "Battery" artifact according to it is expensive, of course, but you get a rare specimen, and in this area it'll be very useful, trust me.
I'll trust, once again. Here you go.
Let me look around first...
Don't frown. Ivar will stand up for his people, even if something happens to me... If we make it to Limansk - we'll meet there, come by, we'll discuss what and how.
And this Ivar of yours, where can I find him? I've got some business to discuss with him.

Hmm, don't know exactly. Was at the Warehouses last time, he's looking for a path through the "Brain Scorcher". Says there are unique artifacts there, further toward the center. The kind we need - us "Seekers".
Oh yeah? Well-well, alright, I'm off.
I see you made it. I'm glad. And how's your friend?

I'm glad to see you too, Marked One. And my friend died. When you showed up he was already very weak. As soon as we left the basement, the very first discharge finished him off. There, at the farm, I buried him as best I could. Such is life.
Sorry of course, but you're alive, and that's better than two corpses...

Yes, if not for you, we'd be lying in that basement together. But it's alright, now I'll pull myself together a bit, gather strength, and I'll need to go look for Ivar. Haven't heard from him in a long time. Strange.
You're a Seeker, you'll find him. Good luck to you.
Well, hello! Hope to slip through the "Brain Scorcher"? Heard enough, I bet, about "artifact fields"? These fairy tales are only for clueless dummies...
I have my own interest. And you, then, are not a dummy?
Huh?! What, did you get offended? For nothing. This isn't a pioneer camp... Almost nobody returns from here alive. Shake hands, friend. What's your name?
I'm Marked One. If you're not a dummy, then what are you sitting around here for?
Playing the coward. Didn't have the guts to continue tempting fate with a real man. Now I'm hoping he'll return. So I wait. And... Fear... Such a coward... So what are you here for?
You don't look very scared? And I have one assignment that I need to try to complete. Who's your friend?

Friend? Ah! No, I can't say about Ivar that he's a friend to me. He... He's a leader, he's the one people follow. But... Few can call him friend. He tries to help those who lost themselves. Those unfortunates whose mind was damaged by this very "Brain Scorcher" or other dangers of the Zone. And he'll achieve his goal, I know. Only I didn't dare accompany him to where he headed. And when he realized this, he said I should stay here and prepare everything necessary for his return. And I... I agreed...
And this Ivar... He treats people, then?

Well, if you consider zombies people... Before, yes, he seemed to try treating people too, psychos that is... He, I think, worked somewhere in a psychiatric clinic, or had some connections, can't say for sure. He himself didn't elaborate, but I heard in passing. A man came to him once, asking about some psychos. Ivar also told him about some clinic, and that man asked him to collect information about crazy people... I didn't pay attention because their conversation became strange, very specific: "deviations, diagnoses, symptoms, insulin, therapy...", blah-blah - incomprehensible. I stopped listening, but I gathered that Ivar understood what he was talking about. And that man also listened intelligently... \nWhy are you looking so glum? Boring topic, I agree. But you asked yourself...
That's not the point, it's just I thought... You say Ivar passed information about psychos to that man? What was his name?

How would I know! He didn't introduce himself, came and left. Some shady character, just confused Ivar. Ivar walked around all wound up after that: can't be, he says, that it's all for nothing. We must find it, he says... And I didn't tell you that Ivar passed something to him, I said that guy asked Ivar to gather the info he needed somewhere, even on a flash drive...
Yes-yes... exactly on a flash drive. So there's something important there after all.
Where?
On the flash drive... That's about my business, don't worry about it.
Marked One, hello... How are you?
Hello, stalker! We need help! All kinds of evil comes from the "Brain Scorcher", soon there'll be another wave! If you have a rifle with good firepower, can you help?
No, I can't, I have my own business.
I'll try to help...
Don't have a rifle with me, but I'll get one.
That's a shame... Then go, don't hang around here.
Excellent! Go get on the tower! They'll come rushing now. Hit them from above, don't go down, or we might accidentally treat you to some lead. Task clear? Can you shoot?
When you get one, come back if you don't change your mind. Just don't drag it out - if not today, they'll attack again tomorrow.
I know which end the bullet comes out of, don't worry.
That's good. Hope we'll stay alive. Yeah, don't go far... Or I'll think you decided to run away. I'll think it with all the consequences, mind you! Well, get to your position.
To the tower, then? Alright...
What else? You had your own business, right? Well go... About your business.
Yeah...
No time for talk! Evil's coming! Run to the tower! Shoot!
Alright, alright...
Got the rifle?
Got it.
Not yet.
Looks like we nailed them all. As for me, that's enough for today. Thanks for the help! What's your name, by the way?
They call me Marked One. I'm looking for a stalker named Strelok. Haven't heard of him?
Hmm, something's spinning in my head, but... No, can't say for sure. And you seem to be a pretty good marksman yourself! Why do you need someone else?
Greetings, Marked One, how's life? Still searching? Good luck!
I lost your device, can you help?

Damn... now Sakharov will eat my head off! Well... Alright, I have another one, formally written off. One of our graduate students managed to drop it into a springboard. Good thing it was right at the edge and the device was just thrown aside a few meters - turned out to be repairable.\nIn short, will you give good artifacts for it? A couple of second level? If you have third level, one will be enough.
Well, what can you do... Here's a couple of artifacts.
Tough luck... Alright, here's one third level.
Hide it quickly so the professor doesn't see. And don't lose it anymore, this is the last one.
I don't have any artifacts.
Your battalion commander said there would be a reward for the work done.

Not battalion commander. His deputy. Yes. He called for me. We talked for a long time. Seems like he liked you. We discussed and decided to offer you a choice. We can give you up to five of our army medical supplies with anti-rads per day. Or ammo for Kalashnikov, also once a day, about a hundred and fifty. But only during my shift. The fewer fellow soldiers know that you've been put on allowance - the better. Otherwise they'll start asking questions... that's unnecessary. So choose what you need more.
I'll probably take the medicine.
Need ammo constantly, so I'll choose that.
Right. The main thing is health. Everything else will follow. Here, take today's batch. And come back another day when I'm on duty. There'll be the same package waiting for you. Go on, good luck.
Well then. Ammo will always be needed in this place. Here, take them right away, as I said, hundred and fifty. Every day during my shift there'll be the same amount set aside for you. Come by.
Good, understood. Thanks.
Can I get the medicine as we agreed?
Yeah, sure, why not. Prepared it since yesterday evening. How are you in general? Alright? It's boring here. Sometimes for the whole day there's nobody to talk to.
I'm alright. Don't really have much time. Always business, business...
I get it. Here, take this package. Drop by when you can, we'll knock back a shot, talk. Our guys promised to throw in some snacks...
Alright. Maybe I'll swing by. Later.
Can I get the ammo as we agreed?
Yeah you can, why not? Prepared it since yesterday evening. How are you in general? Alright? It's boring here. Sometimes for the whole day there's nobody to talk to.
I'm alright. Don't really have much time. Always business, business...
I get it. Here, take these bullets. Drop by when you can, we'll knock back a shot, talk. Our guys promised to throw in some snacks...
Alright. Maybe I'll swing by. Later.
So-o-o... Marked One, as I understand? I'm deputy commander of the special forces battalion. I was informed that I can count on you.
Yes, I'm Marked One. And whether you can count on me depends on what exactly you want from me.

Then straight to business. In mid-spring a military-scientific expedition was sent. An experienced stalker nicknamed Ghost volunteered to be the guide. Unfortunately, the expedition vanished without a trace. But, as it became known, Ghost was seen alive some time later in places far from the route the group was taking. Understand?
Mmm. Not quite. Where was the expedition going?

The final destination wasn't disclosed, but there's data about the last point where the group made contact - a small town called Limansk. There's reason to believe that the group made contact with one Mikhalych.\nWe don't want to risk untrained soldiers by sending them deep into the Zone. They won't pat you on the head for personnel casualties.\nSo we need an experienced person who can find out the circumstances of this expedition's disappearance. So your task is to reach Mikhalych as quickly as possible and get concrete facts.
I'm not getting something, commander...
You wanted to learn about Ghost, as I was informed. Well, you'll learn about him at the same time.

Yeah, about Ghost, I think you've already said everything and won't say anything new. Ghost was the expedition's guide, that's clear. So if I find him, then you're basically not needed anymore. But I don't understand from what angle you're interested in this expedition. Plenty of scientists wander around here, maybe they flew away long ago and didn't tell you anything... What's the need for you to worry about their fate?
The expedition was accompanied by our soldiers, and their fate interests me much more than the botanists' fate. Clear now?

Actually - completely unclear. I may be without memory, but my head's working fine... I hope. You judge for yourself: you say you have a SPECIAL unit here, not just anything. You know soldiers went missing, surely comrades of those who stayed here. And you sit here, all military, armed to the teeth, but you don't want to risk your people unnecessarily, you say. As if searching for your missing comrades isn't a necessity at all. You're offering this to the first civilian you meet, so to speak. As if I have more strength, and weapons, and more serious reason to look for your soldiers... Well, I don't get it, no matter what.

That's exactly what we can do, if you ask nicely. We can apply just such measures to "civilians" like you - violators illegally penetrating guarded territory with weapons... Alright, don't strain yourself. Let's talk seriously.\nThe scientific riffraff doesn't matter to me, you're right, they have their own command. But soldiers went missing. But I can't say they died. What then? Who knows... Maybe they ran, maybe they told everything to go to hell, dug in somewhere and are drinking vodka, understand? Need to find out for sure. If you find their tracks, remains or something like that - then everything's clear. Or you don't find anything - then something becomes unclear.
So what?

What, what... Judge for yourself: they were assigned as escort by order. And if I send more people to look for them now, without orders from above, they might get interested, start finding out - where, why, who sent them, weren't there enough of those... And if it turns out they ran away, or abandoned the botanists, which is equivalent to unauthorized abandonment of post... In short, I feel sorry for the boys, understand? If this turns out to be exactly the case, then figure what awaits them. And I would find a way to reason with them, they'd return and we'd settle it here ourselves, without "commissions" and "inspections" - cover it all up. That's why I'm asking you, that's why this needs to be done quickly, before they're missed. Does it get through to you?
Well then. That's a completely different story. Otherwise look: "Shortest timeframe! Execute. Yes sir!" Now it's clear why you're not sending your own, should've started with this.

Don't always need to start with the main point... So, deal? I ordered some equipment prepared for this trip. You'll take it from the box at the entrance. Just look: you take it, means you're signing up for this business. I await results. Just let me know through Sidorovich when you'll be returning, so no misunderstandings happen. That's all.
I got it, alright. Can I ask a favor in advance? Order your guys under the bridge to let me pass without inspection. I'm tired of running around.
You'll be let through without hindrance. I'll give the order.
Time is passing. Don't delay.
Yes-yes, I understand.
So you returned. Well, frankly speaking, didn't expect it. Too much is said about stalkers. Alright, let special agencies deal with that. What about our business?
Well... managed to find what remained of the expedition. There's such an area in the Zone, stalkers call it "Tesla". Very dangerous: constant electrical discharges, radiation, unusual monsters...
I understand already - you heroically overcame all this. Closer to the topic.
Anyway, everyone stayed there. Both scientists and your military.

Everything pointed to this, but there remained hope that... However, that's pointless. Did you manage to learn anything concrete? Why did they die? And why was the guide seen alive? And where is Ghost now?

Unfortunately, I don't have exact answers to all these questions. Apparently, there was no gunfight there, and everyone died instantly. Only one scientist lasted longer than the rest, about him later. Some bodies were gnawed by monsters, but already after death, that's certain. So the local wildlife definitely had nothing to do with people's deaths. Among the corpses there was no body of Ghost, naturally. According to Mikhalych, the trader from Limansk, he quietly left the squad while still in town. Nevertheless, I believe that at "Tesla" he caught up with the group again. What really happened there - can only be guessed. However, among the belongings of the scientist I already mentioned, this note was found. Whether to believe what's written or not, decide for yourself. But personally it seems to me that Ghost is involved in the death of all these people. Where he is now and how to look for him - I have no idea. I'm curious myself. That's basically all.

Unfortunately, I don't have exact answers to all these questions. Apparently, there was no gunfight there. Some bodies were gnawed by monsters, but already after death, that's certain. So the local wildlife definitely had nothing to do with people's deaths. Among the corpses there was no body of Ghost, naturally. According to Mikhalych, the trader from Limansk, he quietly left the squad while still in town. Nevertheless, I believe that at "Tesla" he could have caught up with the group again. What really happened there - can only be guessed, but personally it seems to me that Ghost was somehow involved in the death of all these people. Where he is now and how to look for him - I have no idea. I'm curious myself. That's basically all.

Not much. Alright, we'll try to get to Ghost through other channels. Well, and to you... gratitude. This gratitude will be expressed in more substantial form. What specifically - I'll convey through Kuznetsov. You're apparently great friends with him. From me personally, accept this recipe. The smart guys invented something new there. And now, you may be free.

Not much. Speculation, assumptions, and no facts. Alright, we'll try to get to Ghost through other channels. Well, and to you... gratitude. You already got the advance, a hefty one, I want to note. If there were some concrete evidence, I'd throw in something more, but like this... You may be free.
Well alright. I hope if you find out something about Ghost yourselves, you'll find a way to signal me too.
For now you're free. If I need you - I'll let you know.
Yes, yes, I understand...

Not often do I get to work for the military. This time I agreed to do a favor for Colonel Obukhov from Cordon. He asked to find out the fate of a scientific expedition whose final destination is unknown. Their last communication session was from Limansk. The scientists were guarded by a group of soldiers, and their guide was Ghost himself. This mysterious stalker was later seen alone in other areas, the rest disappeared without a trace. Need to obtain material evidence regarding what happened to the expedition and report to the colonel.
Heard something about the scientific expedition that Ghost was leading?
Maybe I heard something, maybe I didn't... What do you need it for?
So we agreed, right? Please the old man - give an artifact, maybe memory will kick in. Then we'll talk.
Here's a third-level artifact... Bon app‚tit.
Here's three second-level ones... Won't you burst from gluttony?
I need Ghost and the expedition's fate also concerns someone.

"Ghost"? That bastard Guide, slippery one - when he comes nobody sees, and when he disappears, nobody notices either... And what, you say, someone's worried about the expedition? And you, then, hired yourself to find that out? So you probably already got a bag of money? Eh?\nYeah, don't twitch - money's your business, I don't look into other people's pockets. But I'm not sitting here for free either, I do know something - so maybe something should come my way for this knowledge too. Eh?\nLet's say like this - a little artifact... around third level... would honor the old man.
Well, what an appetite you have, old man. Alright. Agreed.
Don't have anything like that with me. Maybe something else?

Fine appetite, nothing to say - won't complain... Hmm, but this artifact seems a bit rotten? Well alright, let it be like that.\nListen here:\nThat was back in spring. This slippery Guide showed up here, but not alone, with a bunch of nerds and about five soldiers guarding them... the soldiers even started hassling stalkers, but those quickly calmed them down. So anyway, they went somewhere in the city, and when they returned, they brought in a bag what was left of Carbide - knew Carbide? Well, the one who flew into the "Vortex" - such a sight it was... I'd rather not have seen it.
Forget about that Carbide, tell me what happened with the expedition.

That's what I'm telling you... don't interrupt or I'll forget!
Damn you, threw me off track... What was I saying?
Ah! They wanted to go to "Tesla". And there electricity strikes - terrible! But supposedly they had some protection, something new - brought it in boxes. I didn't see it myself, the guys told me. So there they went, but back - they didn't return. Somewhere there they vanished... terrible place, that "Tesla".
That's how it happened, and that slippery one didn't go with them - I'm telling you straight! He vanished that very day when they arrived - disappeared like he always knows how to do. The head scientist nearly choked on foam when he learned that Guide left, but there was nowhere to go, so they trudged off where they were planning...
So that's the story. And your Guide, I haven't seen him since that day. But someone told me they saw him in the forest. Well, that one in the Limansk reserve. Probably likes mushrooms too... What do you think?
