What kind - another one, second level? Well, devil with you, give me two of second level... no - three!.. got carried away talking.
Alright. Agreed. Well, what an appetite you have, old man.
Hmm. Don't have that many...
Well... if not, then not - your business.
What the hell?! Where are my artifacts and everything else?!
What do you mean? Why are you yelling?
There was loot in my storage locker! A lot! And now there's basically nothing there except a couple of dead cockroaches!

Calm down! Artifacts, you say? Hmm... Strange that they disappeared. Nobody ever complained before.\nAlthough... Recently one stalker was rummaging around there suspiciously long. Could it be him?! Listen, Marked One, be sure, we'll find and punish the thief!
They'll punish... I'll figure it out myself. Who was hanging around there, you say?

I already said - don't get worked up! If you make a big deal out of it, you'll only make it worse for yourself.\nLet's make a deal? We'll handle everything ourselves, and then tell you when we find the thief. And of course, we'll return your valuables, if he hasn't drunk them away by then.
I'll see... And where am I supposed to store my honestly earned goods now? You can stop offering your "services"...
There's a stalker in the Bar, he also takes stuff for storage. Look into it.
Hello, stalker. Haven't seen you around before. Newbie? What's your name? What are you looking for here?
Sorry you haven't seen me. My name is Marked One.
Marked One? I've heard something about you. So, not a newbie. I'll ask again: what are you doing here? Or just dropped by to chat with our Bootlegger?
I have memory problems. I'm looking for those who might recognize me. Or know about a stalker nicknamed Strelok. Or about Ghost. Well, and in general - looking around.

Hmm... About Strelok, I think many have heard. Only there's been no news about him for a long time. Ghost dropped by not too long ago. Took supplies and left. Where he is now - no idea. We're "Freedom"! We don't pry into people's souls.
So nothing definite? Too bad.
Well... I wouldn't be so categorical. If we move to mutually beneficial cooperation, maybe something useful for you will surface.
Marked One? Got something to say?
Well hello, stalker. How's life? Getting better? I see you're a quick guy, running around here and there. Will you do a small favor?
Depends on what kind.

Well, it's generally a trivial matter, but for you, a neutral, it'll be easier than for one of ours. I heard that some pretty useful guys showed up in the Gut - hunters. Like they cook good food and all that. Talk to them, maybe they'll agree to send us some of their delicacies sometimes? And we won't be stingy - we'll pay everything fair and square.
Oh yeah, delicacies! I've tried their delicacies - stench beyond belief. But seems nutritious. Alright, if I'm in those parts - I'll ask.
You ask, and whether it stinks or not... you know, you yourself smell so bad it brings tears to my eyes, but nothing - we don't turn our noses up.
Hello, Marked One! How are you, wanted something?
About your request, concerning the delicacies.
Delicacies? That's... Ah! And what's the story?

I recently had to visit the Gut, with the hunters. Talked about supplying you with their sausage. Anyway, they agree. For fifty sausages they want a couple pieces in currency, or equivalent in artifacts.

Well holy shit! Two tons of green for stinking garbage! They've completely lost their sense of smell there! Hell knows what, people have nothing to eat, and these... Alright. I get it. Thanks for the "good" news. We'll have to send an "official delegation" to them, apparently.
So what? That's it?
What? Ah! You want to get tons of loot for your talking? Sorry - no bananas. Alright, don't bug your eyes out... Here, take three government bottles. For health improvement.
What? Ah! You want to get tons of loot for your talking? Sorry - no bananas. Alright, don't bug your eyes out... Here, take a handful of bullets, can't help with anything more.
Well then, you did fulfill my request, yes. Of course, this should be rewarded. Take these medical supplies. Things that are always needed in stalker business, isn't that right?
I want to ask: why is your faction called "Freedom"? What does this even mean to you?

Hey, brother, what questions you have! Freedom is the most important thing there should be in life.\nInside every person there's a desire to be happy. And by and large, it's precisely in the absence of external coercion to unwanted actions that the feeling of happiness lies. The greatest misfortune is power over personality. Power, coercion from another person or group of people.
So you have no power? And some Lukash doesn't command?

You're confusing the concepts of power and organization. Power is violence against personality. Violence that humiliates a person, forces him to be not what he would like to be. But I only organize. I provide some coordination of actions of separate free personalities, necessary for survival. Each person has his own vision of this necessity, and I can only show the right path.
Right? "Right" for whom?

For the one who agrees with me. And the one who disagrees can directly express his vision. We'll discuss everything and come to a unified decision. And if not, then again, no violence - let him go his own way.
Really? And if this disagreeable person just starts shooting?

Violence against free personalities ends with a response - destruction of the instigator of violence. Everything is fair. "Freedom" is not biblical pacifism or non-resistance to evil! "Freedom" is the absence of oppression from an individual or group of people. That's how it is. And who to listen to - everyone chooses for himself. Show your path - we'll see.
I need to tell you something important. There's a squad of Duty guys holed up not far from here...
Where exactly? How many? How armed? What else do you know? Don't chicken out, Marked One, "Freedom" remembers those who help it. As well as those who harm it. Speak.

At the farm south of you, near the road. About ten men. Armed with assault rifles, grenades, didn't notice any sniper or heavy weapons. Supposedly on some mission here, from what they said. Even offered to participate. That's all.

I don't know the details, to be honest. I only know there's about ten of them, set up at the farm south of you, near the road. Your guys asked me to pass this along. I was even surprised: why do they need a messenger when they have PDAs? I even saw one of them had a radio.

Stop-stop! All this is pointless. It so happened that I personally delivered an order from Duty leadership to the commander of that squad to cancel the operation... if I understood everything correctly, of course. I think very soon they'll get out of here.
Oh really! Don't trust these red-bellies. Bor was saying... Ahem... Anyway, time to give them a good beating! What about you? Will you join our squad?
Ah! You mean those guys. Well, we already dealt with them. Took you long enough to bring the news.
You sing smoothly, Marked One. This all looks too much like a setup!
No. Your squabbles are none of my business.
Well, that's how it turned out.
What setup? I was just told to...
Well, that's your business. We'll handle it ourselves. And thanks for the story.
Alright, anyway - thanks.
Who told you? What exactly were you supposed to pass along? Hey, guards!
Easy, guys, easy! I...
Listen here: now you tell us everything-everything, with all imaginable details. Otherwise - I promise - you'll regret you were ever born.
Anyway, there's this guy in "Duty" - Ivantsov is his surname. He hired me. Said to find Major Cherepanov at the Army Warehouses, at the southern farm, pass along a few numbers verbally.
What numbers? How exactly did the phrase sound that you were supposed to pass along?
How would I know what numbers? Probably some code. Well, pure spies. The phrase was: mission cancelled, act according to code twenty-nine, thirteen and eight are out of the game. That's all.
Well, and then?
Then I trudged to the warehouses, on the way to the farm I met your guys. They asked me to tell Lukash, that is you, that a squad of Duty guys showed up here. I got to the farm.
And what there?
Talked with Cherepanov. He offered to participate in their operation, but I didn't even get into it - refused. Passed along what they asked, he dictated return numbers for Ivantsov.
Which ones?
Seven, seventy-two. Ah! Also I'm supposed to tell Ivantsov that "Skull understood everything". There...

Oh, these conspirators... Alright, seems our agreements are still in force... however, this no longer concerns you.\nNo complaints about you, guy, but to finally bury this unpleasant story, let's do this: you'll pass along different numbers to Ivantsov. Not seven and seventy-two, but, say, seven and seventy-five. Do it - you'll get something valuable and gratitude in your personal file, and if not, you'll get a reprimand with entry... in your chest cavity. Relax, I'm joking. Just want to... teach our restless opponents a lesson. So, will you do it?
Uh... probably possible. We'll see.
I'm about that story with the Duty guys... well, about the "spy" nonsense with numbers.
Eh? Oh! I already forgot to think about it... well, had a laugh with the guys about these "secret agents", and threw it out of my head.
Wait... you yourself asked me to give Ivantsov the wrong numbers. I did as you said, so what now?

What now? We'll see what kind of fuss your message causes with the enemy... there are people to check this. And to you - gratitude in your personal file, as agreed. They might even give you a medal. Need one?
Hey, Lukash, that's not how business is done! You promised something valuable...
Well screw you then. I'll manage.
Alright, alright, don't be angry, I'm joking. Just in a good mood. Here, take this.
Yeah... see you later, joker.
Greetings, brother. What wind brings you to us, to the Farm? Call me Mikhas. And how should I address you?
I'm Marked One. I have my own business.
Oh! So you're Marked One? That very one? I heard they say about you that you're looking for Strelok?
Well... They say a lot of things, can't believe everything... What's it to you?

Don't get prickly... Maybe I can help? And you... Well never mind.\nHere's the deal: not long ago one guy dropped by... for a purchase. Gave his PDA to transfer money. Well, from that PDA besides money I managed to grab a bit of information. Wanted to sell it to Tooth, but we didn't make a deal... And they told me at the Bar that you're looking for Strelok... So there. Get it?
Not yet. Do you really sell for money? Thought it was only for artifacts? And what kind of guy?

What's it to you? For money or how... The question now is about something else. This guy clearly wasn't one of ours. Spoke with such an accent, immediately clear - westerner. And such a sophisticated guy had interesting info in his PDA. About Strelok... Information is for sale. The rest doesn't concern you.
You're selling a pig in a poke. Would like to take a look...

Don't doubt, it'll be interesting for you. In short: someone, while still in "Clear Sky", hired a mercenary to search for Strelok. So, from the information it's clear where you can find this someone. Well, then you'll have a more concrete talk with him.
And you said about Strelok... You're pointing me to some nobody yourself. Beating around the bush... And what's the price for the tip?
Two hundred thousand. In bills.
You gone crazy? For information "go to another guy, you'll learn everything from him"? Won't something burst on you?
So what? Cooled down? The principle is simple: goods - money - goods. I need money, and you need information. You can walk around in circles as much as you want, but...
Four grand in bucks! For words...

Think about it... This guy, about whom the information is, was apparently acquainted with Strelok. And he's the one who hired a killer to hunt Strelok. Why? What didn't they share? He surely knows so-o-o much more...
Listen, did you also want to shake money out of Ivar at the Bar? And didn't make a deal with him either, as I understand?
Ivar? And how do you...
From a camel... He said you wanted fifty grand from him.
Don't try to bluff me... I named the price, it's up to you to decide.
Damn you! Why should I save money now?! Here are the bills. Now it's your turn.

You did right... So, here's how it is. There was this Lebedev. Either a professor, or just a security guy masquerading as a scientist, but he wanted to kill Strelok. And now this same Lebedev is in Pripyat! And not just like that, but became like the leader of that sect - the monolithians. They call him a bit differently there - Swan Liaison, something like that. That's in brief. You can read more details yourself. That's it, I uploaded everything I had. Think it over.
Lebedev-Liaison. Pripyat. Alright...
I don't have that kind of money... With me.
Alright. Then thirty thousand... Rubles. But! You need to go check out one little place, information about which, note, was also in that PDA. So it might also concern Strelok.
You dropped your price pretty sharp... Too weak to go yourself? And what does "check out" mean?

I could go myself, but you're the one who needs Strelok...
The place there isn't the most welcoming. And there's word about you that you're a master at coming out of such places alive. Well? How about it? Give me thirty grand and I'll outline the place for you...
And there very well might be something you need too. And us. The guy was clearly not a loner. One of those sent specially. They have loads of different gear. Well, and there's possibly a warehouse. If you get through - outline a map of how to get there.
And leave a beacon there for precise guidance.
Give you thirty grand for me to scout the route?
Eh-eh-eh! No! Thirty grand for me to draw you an awesome storage location... And then you decide for yourself.
Alright. You talked me into it, you smooth talker. Stick out your pocket for the cash.
I think I'll manage without this... See you.

You won't regret it - for sure! You heard about Foggy Thicket? There, according to the description, there's a small cave. That's where very serious people set up a secret storage. I won't mark the exact spot, of course, but approximately over there...\nYou install a beacon there and come back. Then everything I know, you'll know too. Here, take this beacon.
Thicket. Foggy. Nasty place. Well, whatever...
How's it there, buddy? Found that place we talked about? Or are you just here to chat?
Well, found it... Dropped the beacon where you asked.
Uh-huh... Seems to be there... Well I'll be, you actually made it...

And you didn't hope... And you lied about everything. There's no awesome warehouse there. Maybe there was once, but now there's nothing. \nSo what are you mumbling about? That's it. As agreed, transfer the data.
Don't rush... Everything will be according to the deal.
Well, I did everything right, didn't I?
Yeah, to chat... My talkative ones...
I thought a bit. Anyway, here are the bills, as you asked... Give me back the thirty grand and transfer the data.
Hey, brother! That's not how it's done. You already signed up for the job, a deal is more valuable than money.
I changed my mind. Four grand in bucks doesn't suit you anymore, or what?

It's not your business what suits me. And you're not a girl to act coy - I want, I don't want. You took it on - do it! This is already a matter of principle. Otherwise, you understand, word will spread quickly, nobody will trust you anything with such an approach.
Alright, don't scare me... We're already scared. Just wanted to check your reaction.
So what, friend Marked One, matured to a normal decision? The money's peanuts, I don't understand what you're being tight about?
Take the thirty grand. Draw the place.
It's not about the money. I don't like all this.
I'm not going anywhere, here, there are bills for the full amount...
How's life? Found your Strelok?
Still looking...
Information about Lebedev

The following information was obtained from a reliable source:
 About a year and a half or two years ago, a "Clear Sky" group appeared in the Swamp under the command of one Lebedev... 
 This faction solved practical tasks for studying the Zone. At first glance - simple information collectors. However, what they were actually "collecting" is unknown. As are their true purposes for being in the Zone. Their main cover was scientific research, although the group was led by professionals in military affairs.
 After some time, stalkers joined them. Nicknames Ghost, Strelok, Fang. They began actively working with these "scientists" and were interested in strengthening this clan's positions for unclear reasons.
 One Strelok had a huge desire to penetrate the center of the Zone and even made an attempt (result unknown, Strelok and his group disappeared from sight from this moment). According to reports, it was after this that Lebedev came into confrontation with this group, despite all the previous help this faction had received from it...
 The search for Strelok was unsuccessful. The other two were not worked on... 
 
 Currently we have the following:
 Lebedev has long been listed as dead, which does not actually correspond to reality. His search was undertaken in connection with suspicion that he very likely may have the object of interest to us or has concrete information about it.
 After the Radar installation was shut down, a sortie to Pripyat was undertaken, where, according to group reports, Lebedev was discovered. The group did not return and does not communicate.
 Awaiting instructions.
Do you know about "green", that is "emerald" artifacts?

What a question! Of course! These are artifacts that are made from the very best ones... Want to know how? I know how to get "emerald" "Jellyfish", "Stone Blood" and "Wrenched". My interest is a couple of first-level artifacts or one second-level for any of the recipes. Just so the artifacts are in good condition, you can keep the rotten junk for yourself! Will you take it?
You already asked... Hand over the artifacts.
For the "Jellyfish" recipe, here are two first-level artifacts.
Really need to cook "Wrenched", here are two first-level artifacts.
Taking the recipe for emerald "Stone Blood". Here's a couple of first-level artifacts.
Here's a second-level artifact, give me the "Jellyfish" recipe.
Here's a second-level artifact, give me the "Wrenched" recipe.
Taking the "Stone Blood" recipe. Here's a second-level artifact.
Okay! Listen here: if you throw a "Jellyfish" artifact into the "Fruit Punch" anomaly in Foggy Thicket, you can get its emerald variety. Just look! The "Jellyfish" must be completely non-radioactive!
And where can I get such a "Jellyfish"?

Alright. So, listen: "Wrenched" needs to be thrown into "Fruit Punch" - that's such an anomaly. But not just any, but in Foggy Thicket... There, in this thicket, hell knows what's going on in general... Ah! And "Wrenched" must be completely non-radioactive!
And where can I get such a "Wrenched"?

Didn't I tell you about this recipe? Emerald "Stone Blood" is cooked in a special place - in Foggy Thicket. There time is like not of this world, so there you need to find a bubbling anomaly, they call it "Fruit Punch". You throw regular "Blood" there... Ah! Not completely regular. You need "Blood" without any bad properties. I think such ones sometimes come up... There.
What if none turn up? Where can I get such "Blood"?
Uh... Ask other stalkers. Or... Hey!\nSidor's godfather exchanges bad artifacts for good ones. Go see him. Sidor will tell you how to find his godfather, if needed.
I'll think about it. Maybe I'll come back later.
Alright, I'll try. Maybe something will work out.
Tooth, are you selling recipes for artifacts from the "ruby" line? I'll pay well.

Wow! You're pretty excited, Marked One. Looks like you really need these recipes. And... I have them. I know how to get "ruby" "Battery", "Spring" and "Pellicle". All guaranteed. A guy "cooked" them in my presence. It'll cost a lot - two any artifacts of "Dummy" class, zero level, that is in excellent condition. That's for one recipe. Like that, no haggling. Can you handle it?
We already talked about this. Hand over something from the "Dummy" class. Two pieces per recipe, and they must be zero level.
Will these two artifacts do? I'm interested in the "Ruby Battery" recipe.
Really need to cook "Ruby Spring". I have such artifacts. Will they do?
Here's a couple of artifacts. Tell me the recipe for "Ruby Pellicle".
I'll think about it. Maybe I'll come back later.

Yeah. Just what's needed. Here's how to cook the artifact you need: an ordinary "Battery" should be thrown into "Snow" - that's such an anomaly, in case you didn't know - and wait around a couple hours. Easy as pie, right?
Fine. So, listen: a simple "Spring" needs to be thrown into the "Snow" anomaly and wait about two hours. That's all there is to it.
Well, write it down. Or will you remember? Anyway, you throw an ordinary "Pellicle" into the "Snow" anomaly, wait about two hours, and - voil…! Everything's quite simple, as you can see.
Well, thanks. I'll run along...
Listen, Tooth, I want to find out something else about emerald artifacts...
Well? All the recipes I know I already gave you. What else?
No, I'm not about the recipes themselves. You said they need to be cooked in Foggy Thicket, but can you tell me the path there? I somehow didn't think to ask right away...

No, I'm not about the recipes themselves. You said they need to be cooked in Foggy Thicket, but is there no short road there, do you know? Don't want to make a detour through Dark Valley, and show myself to the local contingent once more.

Well, look at that! He's going to cook emeralds... I thought you yourself knew how to get there, since you were quiet. Ah, but you have head problems... Alright, for the sake of our future fruitful cooperation, so to speak... Give me your PDA, I'll mark everything for you.
Ah, that's what you mean... Alright, for the sake of our future fruitful cooperation, so to speak... Give me your PDA, I'll mark how you can quickly get there from the Garbage.
Leave me alone...
What?
Go away, everything's meaningless...
Where would I go...
I'm tired...
Me too.
No strength left...
Tell me about it.
I don't want anything...
And I'm not offering anything.
What's the point anyway...
Exactly.
Why all this?
What "this"?
Everything...
Ah... yeah.
Don't want to talk...
Uh-huh.
Yeah, let's stay quiet.
I can't do this anymore...
It's hard, what can you say.
I'm dying...
I'm barely alive myself.
I have no strength left...
My legs feel like lead too.
What's the point of talking about it...
Yeah, won't make it easier anyway.
Everything's meaningless...
Hard to say...
Can't change anything now...
Perhaps.
We can't get out of here...
Not easy, who'd argue.
We'll all die here...
Sooner or later...
Why? Why...
Huh?
Why all this...
Yeah...
All for nothing...
Who knows...
Useless...
Maybe so.
Go away...
Where?
Go wherever you want, I don't care...
Alright, I'll go.
How hopeless everything is...
Not cheerful, that's for sure.
And there's no way out...
I don't see one yet either.
Hey! You there, look - we're holding like a checkpoint here. So that, you know, everything's proper. Well, you get it?
You lot are multiplying... I already paid up!

Calm down, brother, I'm showing you all respect... I know about you paying up. Good one! I'm warning you for the future: if you come walking from the center, have a real artifact ready, not some fake crap, or you'll be turning back...
Really! And if I put a knife to your throat?

Tough guy? With a knife, sure, that's possible, nobody's immune to that business... But it won't help you. We planted explosives all over the bridge, and if I don't switch off the detonators, anyone who climbs up is a dead man. So it's simple as mooing: either you pay and go, or you don't pay and don't go. Clear?
We'll see about that...
Look all you want. We don't rush headfirst into a fence. We live peacefully, keep the bridge intact, so simple folks can haul their loot... You should understand.
Hello there! Is that you again? Want to stomp across our bridge? Or just dropped by to chat?
Your bridge? And you're what, a watchdog?
Listen, don't start: you give me an artifact and go on your way, or no - hit the road.
Now! Take a bullet, bastard!
Got a second-tier artifact lying around, take it.
Here, take this, third-tier artifact!
Take this dummy artifact, hotshot...
What if I don't have an artifact?
Good deal! I'll switch off the mines now. Wait a bit. Don't rush.
Then you better turn around.
Switch them off, I'm waiting.
So what? You either go, or... Or do you want something?
Hey! You there, look - we're holding like a checkpoint here. So that, you know, everything's proper. Well, you get it?
You lot are multiplying... I already paid up!

Calm down, brother, I'm showing you all respect... I know about you paying up. Good one! But that was then... We have this kind of order: coming from Limansk, you share an artifact. And not some junk... And if you got no artifacts, then turn your skis back around.
Really! And if I put a knife to your throat?

Tough guy? With a knife, sure, that's possible, nobody's immune to that business... But it won't help you. We planted explosives all over the bridge, and if I don't switch off the detonators, anyone who climbs up is a dead man. So it's simple as mooing: either you pay and go, or you don't pay and don't go. Clear?
We'll see about that...
Look, look all you want, we don't rush headfirst into a fence. We live peacefully, preserve this bridge, so simple folks can haul their loot... You should understand...
Now you'll understand! Take a bullet in the gut!
Is that so? You convinced me. Take this second-tier artifact.
Alright, got a third-tier artifact. Take it.
Preserving the bridge? For that I won't even mind giving a dummy.
What if I don't have such an artifact?
Well, you're a good one... Wait a bit, I'll switch off the detonators. Don't rush...
You washing your ears with compote or what? I said: no artifacts - go back where you came from.
Switch them off, I'm waiting.
What do you want? Need something from me?
Just move aside, want to pass through.
They walk here, and walk here... No peace at all...
Just wanted to say hello...
Huh? So what? You'd be better off going about your business... We'd all be healthier.
Well, well! Look what showed up... What are you sniffing around for? Looking for business? What's your name? Your handle, like, what's your nickname?
Dogs have handles, I have a name: Marked One. I'm looking for someone.

Marked One?! So that's you, huh? You're my buddy now! I heard you stuck your neck out for me. I understand that thanks won't be enough... Well, the earth is round, you know, we'll settle up later. But for now here's a present for you, write down this recipe.\nWho you looking for? Maybe I know?

Marked One?! So that's you, huh? You're my buddy now! I heard you stuck your neck out for me, even though Rasp and the boys roughed you up a bit first by mistake. I understand that thanks won't be enough... Here's a present for you - found it nearby. And write down this recipe too.\nSo who you looking for? Maybe I know?
Ever hear of a stalker called Strelok?

Strelok, Strelok... Hold on a sec, something's spinning in my head... Ah! Right! The brothers were talking among themselves, saying that, well, Borov set up his base in a bad place, like there's a dungeon, or something else below, in the basement.\nSo they were saying that, well, this Strelok guy used to walk around there, all the way to the "Scorcher". You know, the one that won't let you go north. Yeah. But what your buddy was doing there and why he went there - hell knows.
Underground? Is that the one that was collapsed?

No! The collapsed one, that's the labo... rabo... Damn it, you'll break your tongue! Anyway, the nerds were doing something there. That one seems to be all understood, and it's not at the base either.\nNo. This is something else. This one guy, Mityai Bruise, well you probably didn't know him, he croaked last winter, he was all blue when he told about it, said that there, in that underground, you can go crazy, easy as pie... Well, you get it...
Yeah. But how do you get into that underground?
Damn if I know! The brothers were saying, like they blocked the door with crates long ago, like the entrance, so nothing nasty would crawl out from there. Such things happen there...
Oh! Buddy! Maybe, you know, for the meeting?
Hmm, I'll pass, thanks.
Suit yourself, I'll relax a bit...
Another time. Got business with you.
So don't go soft on me like... a flower in ice water. Speak up.
Dimon, Nut that is, said you know a lead, about Ghost's own stash.
And where'd you see that vagrant? Ain't heard from him in a while.
Sitting tight in the Gut. Says he's got some business there. So, how about that stash? You kinda owe me, didn't forget?

Whatever I owe, I always pay back... Alright, listen here. There was this interesting stiff. Looks like the cards fell wrong for him that day, caught a bullet in the gut - and that's it. Found a note on him, seemed to be from Ghost himself to some buddy of his. And it said where he, Ghost, set up a stash in the District Center.\nI won't feed you empty talk, but so there's no complaints later, I'm saying right away - I've never been to the District Center and what kind of place it is, can't say for sure. And I don't remember anymore how it was written word for word on that paper. But what stuck in my head was this: need to look for a backpack on the roof of a half-destroyed Khrushchev building, from which you can take a look at Ilyich. What kind of Ilyich - hell knows.
Yeah... not much to go on. Well, thanks for that much. See ya.
Oh! Marked and seasoned. Fifty each and let's chat, or you in a hurry?
So what? Wanna talk - talk... Who are you anyway?
Generally, I'm Marked One. And where you from, acting all tough?

Whoa - hey! Marked One? I heard about you... Like you're looking for your buddy, who either got whacked, or something else. Or am I wrong? Well, I don't give a damn really. If you got nothing to do, then run around the Zone. I know where and why to move. You dig?
Lot of words, but no substance.

No substance? You're totally nuts! I opened up to you like to a priest - there's a stash, a rich stash! And the owner croaked, long ago... Only need to get to the stash. Like it's far. All the way past the "Scorcher".
What's it to me? Go yourself...

Shit! Just listen! It's that buddy's partner's stash. Yeah! What was his name...
Fix, maybe... No... Tooth? Nah, that one's stuck in Bar. Jaw... Tusk...
Come on! Help me out! Something connected to teeth...
That one, who went on trips with your buddy...
Ghost? Or Fang?

Yeah! Exactly! Fang! So basically - this guy told me, who found this very Fang's note, where the richest stash lies. And nobody can get there, 'cause it scrambles your brains, if you go there through this, Radar. Get it? No?\nI see - nah...\nI know where the stash is, understand? Dough! Artifacts! But how to get there, to this very Pripyat, I don't know! You're gonna, fo' real, go there someday anyway, so if you find a secret path, whisper it to me... I'll break off a big chunk of that loot for you! Yeah? But you tell nobody!
Why so sure I'll go to that Pripyat?
Let's say I dreamed it. Or someone whispered...
Oh! You! Brother! You, uh... But tell nobody!
Brother? Don't remember such a buddy...
Come on! Don't play dumb! I'm showing you all respect.
Respected, I see. Well, well... So what we sitting here for?

Well, met a buddy, got out of the can, from the slammer.
Man, what bastards!
Aaah!
Spit and rub it in.
Chatted with him, now I'm gonna stomp to my boys. To Limansk.
Where? What you need in Limansk for.

What, you don't wash your ears? I told you clear as day - got boys there. Boss gave us important business! Boys are already there, and I bolted here - had to check on a brother. Gonna stomp there before my boys drink away all my PDAs.
PDAs? You got them? Many? What you need them for?

Maybe many. What's it to you? Haven't heard about the serious Caucasian at the Warehouses? He pays good loot for any PDAs. And generally. I heard that lots of secret places are recorded in those gadgets. But almost all broken. Shame. Well, I talked too much - see ya, Marked... If anything - I'll be there for now, in this Limansk. Find me - we'll chat about our business.
See ya, "respected".
Oh! Hey there, Soaked! Let's shake hands. You, uh, how's things there?
There? What you mean?
Shit man, why you playing dumb? I told you all about that fat stash in Pripyat! Found it? How's it there?
No, didn't find it. Didn't even try. You didn't give me any specifics then. I'm thinking there ain't no stash at all, you made it all up just to get the safe road to Pripyat out of me.

Well you... I gave you the tip! The info's solid gold! I'd go look myself, but gotta keep watch here for now. Uh... Basically, can't leave - boss will blow my head off. And the stash, fo' real, exists, but to hell with it, don't need nothing from it, you can take everything yourself. Got different business there, in Pripyat, you're right.
So that's how it turns out, huh? Your business don't concern me, just so you know. And about that path... I'll think about it. You were saying something about bunches of PDAs, remember?
Yeah, there's such a thing, seems like our boys don't need 'em much. Wanna take some?
Yeah, thinking of taking a couple, what you want for them?
What? Money of course, what else? Give me like fiv... no, six thousand rubles and take this handful... But hell knows about them - they don't turn on, dunno if they work or not...
I see. Alright, if I need them - I'll come back. See ya.
Just don't forget my little request, yeah?
Hello again. How's life and all that other stuff?
Still hobbling around, Marked One! So, tell me something about that sacred path.
Why you keep running back and forth. How's our business, figured out the deal?
Speak faster, gotta go.
The bandit asks to find a safe road to Pripyat and bring him a scientific suit. Promised to give a lead on "fat" loot in the ghost town.
Uh, how's your head?
Marked One, what's wrong with you? What's with these sudden statements?

I'm not... Not in that sense. I mean about myself... Don't even know if it's worth... Tell me, do you remember anything from your life? I mean, you do remember, of course, I wanted to say, how accurately do you remember everything?
Uh... what are you getting at?

You see, I'm new to the Zone recently, or maybe I've been here long, but I've only been aware of myself recently. I lost my memory. But from time to time something surfaces. I'll see something in the Zone, and bam - some connection to something, like from the past. And pictures in my head - like a familiar place, and there's someone familiar... But everything's somehow dim. I'm not sure it was exactly like that... Ah! Alright, this is about me, you won't understand... Forget it.

Why not... I understand you. Actually, not every person can guarantee to recall the exact time and place of any event, even if reminded about it. A person isn't a machine, he doesn't store everything in memory so it's always "at hand" and you can take any data off the shelf at any moment. He doesn't go through episodes sequentially in memory, but remembers more associatively, in connection with something. There's something that reminded - you remembered. No - then it wasn't needed, and doesn't bother much. Even though you're new here, can you, for example, precisely remember what happened to you a week ago - exact place, time, circumstances and such?
Well... I remember where I was, what I did. Roughly...

Exactly - roughly. And only a week has passed. And the further back, the hazier the memories. Usually people remember from the distant past only some very bright moments, and even then vaguely. There's only a feeling that yes - this happened to me. But the memories themselves are at the concept level of what actually happened there.
At the level of what?

Concept... Well, it's a general idea, at the level of thoughts, sensations and impressions, without awareness of exact phrases, place, time. Roughly where, roughly when, roughly how... I think it's the same with you. Something suddenly reminds you of something, some connection arises, and something surfaces in your mind, resembling current events. Some bright association...
So, you're saying that even you don't remember everything exactly?

Of course. Nobody can remember everything-everything exactly. Of course, it depends on the person. Someone remembers more, someone less... Well, consider that I remember about myself a bit more than you remember about yourself, that's all... Look at it simpler.
Can I have a word?
What?
Know of any medicine for memory?
There is. 50 grams, better yet 100 right away. I get like this, until I take some, can't remember a damn thing about what happened yesterday.
Joker... I'm serious.
So am I serious. And sometimes you forget so bad that even a hundred won't help, only a bottle.
Clear enough about you...
You again? About memory?
Chill, better take a hundred.
Can I have a word?
What?
Can you remember exactly where you were, say, a week ago?
What? Do I owe you or something?
No... I'm just asking. I don't remember exactly, how about you?
Get lost! Remember, don't remember... Here you can't even remember yesterday sometimes, and he wants "a week ago"...
Alright, don't get heated...
You again? Get lost.
I'm leaving already.
Can I have a word?
What?
Do you remember anything from childhood?
What's it to you?
Don't be angry... Important for me to know. I don't remember myself, and if something does surface, it's somehow dim, as if it didn't happen to me.
Maybe it's for the better... I remember, but I had such a childhood, I'll tell you, better not to remember.
Sorry...
You again? Remember something?
Well... something.
Can I have a word?
What?
You got parents? Like - mom, dad...
Nah... don't remember them. Why?
You don't remember either? How much do you remember from life generally?
I remember everything, why you pestering me! And my mom and dad were drunks, they say, that's why they dumped me in an orphanage.
Ah... I didn't know.
You again? Remembering family?
Trying to.
Can I have a word?
What?
Where you from? Tell me.
What are you, a prosecutor? Tell him...
Don't be mad. You don't get it, I just have problems with my memory, so I'm looking for any clue. Maybe we're from the same city...
I get everything. Walking around here, sniffing around: where from, where to... I'm from a village, not a city. Clear?
Clear... Sorry.
You again? Sniffing around?
Don't worry, I won't ask you about anything.
Can I have a word?
What?
Haven't we met before? Well... in our city.
In ours? What city is that?
I thought you'd tell me. Where are you from, where were you born?
Where they birthed me, that's where I was born. And we haven't met before, neither in our city, nor in your village.
Don't want to talk... I'm not insisting.
You again? Found buddies from your village?
I'll find them, don't worry.
Can I have a word?
What?
Just wanted to talk about life, remember different things.
Ah, you're the "memoryless" one? Always trying to remember something. So, how's it coming along?
Vaguely. Something seems to surface, but there's no certainty.

You should write it down for certainty. I started writing down my dreams too. Sometimes I dream such things, you might as well stand or fall. So I immediately write it fresh in my notebook. When I leave the Zone, I'll publish a book. "My impressions of the Zone", something like that... So you too - as soon as you remember something, straight to pencil.
I write sometimes. Just for myself, not for a book.
You again? Wrote down many memories?
Not much yet.
Can I have a word?
What?
You got family? Wife, kids...
Yeah, was married, very briefly. Split up right away. And I never saw the boy at all, she said he's mine, but she's not making claims and won't demand alimony. That's how it is. What about you?
Don't even know. Like there was a wife... or maybe not a wife...

Common law? That's right. I got burned once, then only lived with women like that. Soon as she starts whining about "getting married", immediately - goodbye. I advise you too - soon as she starts nagging about legal relations, drop yours right away.
Clear advice... If only I knew who to drop.
You again? Still remembering your woman?
Remembering...
Can I have a word?
What?
You often remember home?
Sometimes, especially when rain makes you feel so melancholy. All around dirt, dampness, stench, eating some canned food. But at home it's warm, cozy, smells like pies or hot borscht...
Sometimes the smells here remind me of something. But just as I start sniffing around, it immediately slips away, can't catch it.
Start sniffing around too long here, someone will devour you. In this Zone everything only smells like death...
Well I'm speaking generally... Alright, forget it.
You again? Remembering smells?
Trying...
Can I have a word?
What?
Do you remember the school you studied at?
I studied at different ones. My father was military, so I didn't have time to get used to one school before moving to another.
And you remember all of them?
What do you mean all. I remember several more or less, some not very well, and some I don't remember at all.
That's me too, I vaguely remember something like that. But mostly I don't remember at all...
You again? Remembering school?
Remembering as best I can...
Hey, man. Sit down? You here for us or just passing through?
Hey, servicemen. What we guarding?
Just a transit point. Sometimes they bring scientists who study this infection. And we shine lights into the swamps so they don't get lost. You never know. Anyway, here we sit.
Hmm, not very cheerful. Tired of it?
Sick of it up to here! No decent food! Nothing to drink, radiation... Even though they give us pills, still - scary. You don't happen to have normal canned food or rations?
Well... What if I do? Why the hell should I feed servicemen?
Come on! We get it! We can throw in some ammo. Got plenty of that stuff for now. Look, rounds are piling up, they drop them from the chopper - but who to shoot at? It's quiet here...
Trading in ammo? Well, I got some spare provisions. What's the price list?
Alright, if I need anything - I'll drop by.
Great! You climb up the tower to Curly, he's trading now. You'll make a deal there.
Drop by, or our bellies from what we have to eat have completely stuck to our spines...
Hey, man. You here for us or just passing through? Got decent food with you?
Maybe I do. I'll look around first, think about it.
If you got some - let's trade? Our supply chief's up on the tower. Go up, have a talk.
Oh! You got food? Got anything decent?
Got food? Meaning?
So you're the supply chief?
Well... We make deals with guys - they give us decent food, canned goods and stuff, and we give ammo in exchange. Thought you knew, that's why you climbed up here. No?
Not supply chief, just my turn on duty, and to watch the warehouse. So? Got anything to trade? Canned food, army rations?
I'm just looking around. But since we're talking... How much will you give for canned food, and how much for sausage?
You only take canned food and rations? What about sausage, for example?

That sausage of yours - screw it! Already the scientists... Barely saved one guy. We take canned food. At least it's made in a factory. For a can I'll give 5.45 armor-piercing rounds. For two - 7.62 ammo. And don't forget bread - a loaf for each can. And if you happen to get army rations, I'll throw in a pack of both calibers for a package. Just make sure it's whole, not opened.
Here's a can with bread. Give me 5.45 rounds.
Take a couple cans and loaves with them. That'll be 7.62 rounds from you.
I got a ration pack, sealed. Will this work?
Alright, I'm going. I'll drop by again if I get a chance.
Well, thanks! Here, take the ammo. Need anything else?
Hold on, let me check what other food I have left...
Hello, you here about trading again?
Hello, serviceman. Thought I'd ask...
Need ammo, right? Then get ready with canned food or rations.
If it's about ammo, we're all cleaned out for today. Come tomorrow - they should drop more.
Alright, got it... See ya.
You here about an order?
Yeah, from Sidorovich.
Your order arrived. Sign for it.
Excellent!
Your order hasn't arrived yet. Wait.
Eh... Can I at least trade for some ammo?
Guy before you dragged a whole crate of canned food, so had to clean out the last rounds to settle up with him. Another time... no hard feelings.
What a mess...
I'm here with a package. Sherstyuk sent supplies.
Well I'll be! And we thought they forgot about us already.
They remember and really worry that you don't starve to death here. So take it. My back's already aching from carrying such weight.
Thank you. Take at least some ammo. Sorry, got nothing else to give.

Nothing else? If only they always thanked like this! Sherstyuk also told me to tell you that he knows about your little business, but hasn't reported to command yet. That's all, figure out the rest yourselves.

So that's where such generosity from that drunk comes from. Saw competitors in us, rear rat. No wonder stalkers are saying the captain from the pumping station's dealing ammo for rounds, and for foreign currency checks too. Sherstyuk's in on it with him, fact. And here we traded a couple packs for rations and we're already traitors to the motherland. Well, nothing, soon there'll be goods of completely different quality and quantity, both will wipe their tears, so come around. Just between us.
I gotta deal with my own business.
Hey, man! Interested?
Yeah, something like that... What you studying?

Can't explain just like that. For now I'm watching the equipment. And it does everything itself. During emissions different energy fluctuations are registered, everything's compiled and sent through relay retransmitters to our institute. And there they try to understand what came out.
Why here, at the very border of the Zone? Closer to the center emissions are much stronger it seems... There you could probably collect more information, no?

Much stronger emissions, seriously? Well I'll be! And the guys don't even know...\nJust kidding.\nAll that's understandable. But the data we get during emissions also needs to be sent where they can analyze it. Communications in the Zone are generally nonexistent, but here they work normally, though glitches happen sometimes. So it turns out that only from the outskirts is it possible to conduct systematic observations.
Hmm, so you have constant communications here? Interesting... Alright, see ya, joker.
Hey, man! Still wandering around?
Ah, Marked One! How's things?
Hello, friend Marked One. Alive and well?
Yeah. A stalker, like a wolf, is fed by his legs. I was advised to turn to you here...
To me? Curious. I'm listening.

You were telling how you have constant communications here with the mainland, right? I had trouble here - lost my memory. Don't remember who I am or where I'm from. Everyone calls me Marked One, but that's just a nickname. Someone whispered to me that you can get information about a person through fingerprint database. How, for real?
Ah... That's what you're about. Well, I have an acquaintance, works in law enforcement. In principle, we could try to run your fingers. But you understand - this is illegal business, who knows...
I understand. I won't let you down! I'll pay up, however much needed.

Money? Cash, you mean? What good are they to me here? They'll kill me for them. Let's do it this way: favor for favor.\nYou correctly noted during our first meeting that emissions are stronger in the center of the Zone. So here's the thing, can you carry a special device to a point I'll indicate? When it starts working, after the next emission we'll start getting readings from it. And you'll get the results of the check, and I'll get materials for my dissertation. And we're even.\nSo? Deal?
And if I say "yes", then what? Let's be more specific.

Then I take your fingerprints right now and send them to my acquaintance. And I give you a device that needs to be installed in a small town, north of here. Limansk - that's its name. There the emission has sufficient force to manifest those properties, the study of which particularly interests me. Your job is just to install it, nothing more needs to be done. Everything's already configured, the device will start working automatically.
How will you take fingerprints and then transmit them? Not by radio.

That's no problem. We'll mix soot in oil, smear it and you'll press your fingers to a sheet of paper. Then I'll scan this thing and send it by email. Our internet's crappy, through satellite channel, only catches a couple hours a day, but for such a small thing it's quite enough.
I see. So you're saying I have to haul some gadget deep into the Zone? Let me think whether I'm ready to deal with this now.
Think, no problem. I'm here for a long time, my shift's just started, so to speak.
I decided about that trip to Limansk. Basically, I agree, give me your device, I'll take it where needed.

Decided? Great! Here, take it. The device needs to be placed as high as possible to minimize interference effects. I looked at satellite images, there's one unfinished high-rise on a hill there. If you put it on the top floor - that'll be perfect. The device constantly checks its coordinates and is programmed to send a message to your PDA about starting work when it's installed in the right place.
Good. But what happens if I put it in the wrong place?

That's extremely undesirable! Some data will be obtained, of course, but not what's expected. And there's no second such device here. Getting one, theoretically, is possible, but by the time we order it, they review the request, approve it, find it, deliver it, and whether it's the right one needed... One hassle. Understand?
What's not to understand? Hope you won't try to make me sign a material responsibility contract?

Marked One, take this matter seriously, okay? As I said, everything's extremely simple: the device will send a signal about successful start of work to your PDA. If the message doesn't come, then the installation location was chosen incorrectly.
Alright, alright. Limansk, unfinished high-rise on a hill. I'll take it, even though it's heavy as hell, damn thing. And you do what you promised.
Of course, I have almost everything ready. So... Give me your right hand.
Hope I was fingerprinted out there, beyond the perimeter...
Hey there, science. Everything seems alright, I hauled your iron coffin to Limansk. And an emission already passed since then. Got signal?

Yes! Works like clockwork. Tons of new material, will take a month to process, no less.\nAs for your matter...\nUnfortunately, your fingers weren't in the special services database. Either you were very law-abiding, or those fingers aren't yours, well or maybe you're from very far away. I asked my Lyubasha, she'll try to make an Interpol request, but that's not fast. If there's anything, I'll definitely let you know.
Damn! And I was hoping... All for nothing!

Don't get upset, maybe it'll still clear up. Well, for the help, accept this from me, from a pure heart. Not much, of course, but it won't be unnecessary either, right? I can also share a recipe. I know, in your stalker community they're valued, right?
Yeah. Thanks. What did the device show at least, anything important? Didn't I break my back for nothing?

Too early to speak about results, but don't doubt - not for nothing, very much not for nothing. There's a hypothesis I've long wanted to confirm. Well, briefly if... How to say it simpler...\nEverything in the Zone changes, everything's subject to some periodic law. Events happen like waves, understand? They manifest themselves and fade away in waves just the same. Here, say, mutants, no, no and suddenly - like a wave washed them to shore. Ever notice?
Uh... Well, I've observed such things, yeah. Sometimes you get the impression they appear right out of thin air.

So that's a simple example. With emissions it's more complex. But their appearance is also not random and obeys the same law. It's cyclical action. What other example could I give? Here, breathing. Inhale-exhale. As if the Zone is a living being. Only "inhaling", the Zone absorbs not oxygen, but energy from our world. And it "exhales" not carbon dioxide, but some byproduct of its life activity. Here, those same mutants. Or anomalies. The point is that, according to people smarter than me, but with whom I completely agree, studying the cyclical nature of Zone phenomena can give the key to understanding how to "cut off the oxygen", isolating ourselves from the Zone's influence on our world.

Inhales, exhales... Someone already told me something like that, only there it was about something divine. Like the Zone breathes on us. Inhales - life, exhales - death. Or vice versa. Some kind of mysticism...

Everything is born and dies, everything has cyclical nature. Even the universe has cycles of expansion and contraction. And, of course, theology has its explanations, and the scientific world has its own. But I see you caught the idea?
In the most general terms... Alright, I'm going.
Hello-hello. As you see, still smoking the sky. I heard you seem to deal with energy problems, well... study fields, flows, something like that, right?

Something like that, uh-huh. Though some of my superiors think I'm wasting time and they've already hinted that if there are no positive results from my research soon, they'll cut the already meager funding.
Can you look at one thing for me? It's right up your alley. Maybe it'll be useful to you too. Well, for your research...
Well-well. Show me, I'm even curious now.

Look. Here's a battery. It goes into... a special barrel, but that's not important. What's important is that such energy was accumulated in it that from one discharge it turned stones to dust. Now it's empty though. You, as an energy specialist, can you say if it's really possible to increase its capacity, and "fill it to full tank" at the same time?

I'm, by the way, a candidate of sciences, not a battery technician... Hmm, but interesting thing overall. Where'd you find such a thing? And you say, stones to dust? Unusual... compact... Interesting. Leave it for a while, I'll take a look.

Uh... well, alright, I'll leave it, but keep in mind: it's one of a kind. And it's not even mine. And since you got interested, what do you think, is it possible to make another one like this in Zone conditions, only so you could give several discharges with it. And even better, like in an automatic magazine... You understand the concept?
Trying to build pulse weapons? You're not the first, won't be the last. Hmm... but that's a thought! And just on topic... In short, I need time to study this product and figure out what can be done.
How long will that take?
If I start right now, then tomorrow I can give some specifics on your question.
Good. Then I won't interfere. I'll come by tomorrow or in a few days. Just please: don't break this thing!
Came to check about the battery. Any progress?

Of course! The product turned out to have quite interesting internal construction. Unusual alternation of plates from rare earth element alloys. And the conductive gel-like medium contained inclusions of strange mineral. I think these are grains of anomalous formation group F, fine fraction. Though I might be wrong, but I think experiments will show...
Stop! What does "internal construction" mean and why "contained"? What happened to the battery?! You broke it?

Why immediately broke? Disassembled into components. How else would I understand what it consists of and how it's made? I don't have X-ray here, only spectrometer. You wanted me to study it thoroughly: can another similar copy be made, can the capacity be increased, can an analog be created on this basis, as you put it, of an automatic magazine...
Oh for crying out loud! That is, of course, yes, that's what I was interested in, but... Can't it be assembled as it was? What am I gonna tell Petrenko now?
Who's that, your accomplice? Customer? Partner?

What's the difference to you! Well, scientists! Like children - just give them something new, unusual, and they immediately spoil or break it. Yeah... my recipe's screwed. Alright, I'll say I gave it for study and that's it. Died, so it died.

Why are you so nervous? This is normal business - reverse engineering. Haven't heard of it? If there's no accompanying documentation for the product, then that's the only way to figure it out. Did your partner need this now-useless piece of iron or did he need data about how it's built and how to create something based on it?

You suggesting I tell him about what unusual innards this thing had? He'll be very happy learning about this. And in response he'll tell what a great recipe he had, but the paper it was written on tore - only scraps left. Like from the battery.

Stop dramatizing. There's good news too. I got interested in the device you brought and this topic in general. So by analogy I assembled from available materials... mmm... a laboratory model, experimental sample, if you will. It's, of course, somewhat unsightly and bulky, but we're not displaying it in a museum. Main thing is to make sure it works, and working on appearance can come after.
What are you getting at? You want to say this is a battery, of increased capacity... or power? Awfully big. Doesn't look like an automatic magazine either.

I said this is a test sample. It still needs to be perfected, but first we need to conduct an experiment and find out if it holds charge at all. Right now it's, as you probably guessed, completely discharged and can't be powered from regular 220 volt grid. That battery you brought... don't know how exactly they charged it, but to get similar effect here, in the Zone, we'll have to sweat.\nWe need an anomaly with open energy circuit. Won't bore you with theory and formulas, I'll say right away that there aren't very many such ones in the Zone. The closest one I know of is located in an area nicknamed by stalkers "Foggy Thicket". In the region of this anomaly, outflow of high-order energies is regularly observed. Sometimes this visually manifests as transparent figures floating in the air. In your environment they're called phantoms, if I'm not mistaken.

Foggy Thicket? Nasty place. Dragging this thing there... Listen, you're not pulling my leg? This is definitely a "test sample" and not an ordinary starter battery from some car? Because it looks like...

I have nothing better to do than fool you. I repeat: don't pay attention to appearance. Just suitable form for this experiment - sealed non-conductive case, ability to install several plates, terminals... Couldn't find anything better. It weighs quite a bit, true, but still less than a regular battery.\nSo, will you undertake the experiment? If you don't know the way to Foggy Thicket, I'll show you the passage. And mark the place on the map.
Just like that, off the bat, I'm not ready to answer. Need to figure some things out first...
Basically, I'm ready to move to Foggy Thicket with the "test sample" you cobbled together.

Excellent. Take the product. Now let me mark in your PDA the place of energy flow concentration... Install the sample there, as close as possible to the energy anomaly. I think it should visually stand out on the terrain, orient yourself on it. Peak outflow of energies, by my calculations, should occur during emission. So, you leave the sample at the indicated point, and after the next emission passes, you take it and bring it back to me.\nDo you know the way to Foggy Thicket?
Yeah I know, won't get lost. Alright, see ya.
Well, tell me about the one you know, then I'll figure it out.
Here, from the Garbage side there's a path. I'll put a marker now...
Got it. Alright, I'm off.
Phew... got tired dragging your homemade battery across half the Zone back and forth. Heavy, damn thing. Take it.
Come on, half the Zone. Did everything as instructed?

Yes. There's this big stone there, like colored glass. Phantoms circle nearby. Put it next to that, then took it after the emission. But you sure found a spot... Stuff constantly falling on your head, anomalies hitting from nowhere, plus those phantoms - wore my soul out completely.
Strange place. But there wasn't much to choose from. Other options, I suppose, you'd hardly like more.
Alright, that's all lyrics. What's next?
Next I'll see what came out. And then I'll try to figure out if the sample can be refined to the level of practical field application.
Uh... What do I tell Petrenko?

Hold on with your Petrenko. I said - need to understand if we managed to charge the device or not. Whether we chose the right direction... Basically, walk around for an hour, then we'll continue the conversation.
Keep in mind I'm not dragging this anywhere a second time. So calculate your direction accordingly.
Already figured out the battery? Did it charge up near that stone?

Seems like everything went successfully! Instruments are detecting very high field intensity. That is, essentially - this is already a finished battery, charged with anomalous energy, similar to what was used in the original sample.
I'm still in the process. Don't breathe down my neck, okay?
Great! But you don't look satisfied...
Alright, alright. I'll check in later.

How should I put it... Basically, the good news is that the energy concentration in this product is indeed enormous. And the bad news is that we still won't be able to use it. At least - not right now. Need to find a way to transform this energy into electrical and only then...

No-no-no! I warned I'm not carrying this anywhere else, if that's what you're hinting at. Give me your theoretical calculations, experiment description, product blueprint and all that stuff. I'll take it to Petrenko, and then let him rack his brains about what to do with all this.

Wait. First, what will he understand from my calculations? Is he a scientist or engineer? And second, just think, Marked One: we're essentially opening a new chapter in Zone study right now! And I wouldn't want to just share my scientific research with anyone. I admit I have considerable hopes for... well, that's not important. And third, the final result hasn't been achieved yet. It might turn out that the sample will remain useless, even being pumped full of energy, but without the possibility of converting it to the kind we know how to control. But I already have an idea how we might try to accomplish the conversion...

This doesn't concern me anymore. I didn't sign up to work as a lab assistant or pack animal. After all, you can contact Petrenko yourself and arrange to continue the experiments... or whatever else you've thought up. However it is - count me out.

I understand: urgent problems seem more important to you than any scientific work... Well, fine, maybe your Petrenko can perform the second part of the experiment? Himself or with someone's help. After all, he should be interested in this himself. Then you take him this container and my instructions, and then let him pass the results through someone... What a pity I can't just drop everything here! Especially since quarterly reports are coming up soon - what a hassle.
Give me the instructions, and let him come for this gadget himself. Or hire someone. I'll explain to him that you took the right direction, that everything's going great for you.

Alright. Here, I already jotted this down while you went to Foggy Thicket. In case you change your mind and decide to personally deliver the sample to Petrenko, I'm leaving it here. You can take it anytime. By the way, who is he exactly, this Petrenko? Or is it a secret?
What secret. He's from Duty's top brass. Everyone in Bar knows him. Now you can visit him yourself if needed.\nTime for me to go, stay healthy.

Greetings to the workers of science! You won't believe it, but I'm here about the same business. And your laboratory sample... or whatever you called it, I got it with me, in short. Check what's there and how. Everything was done according to your notes.

Really! Well, well... Wow! Energy conversion definitely went successfully. And the charge - what a charge! Load fork overheats instantly and the device goes off the scale. Well, well! Honestly, I wasn't completely sure of success myself... Now we can sit down to real work. Just think how the topic developed!

Enough clucking like a chicken over an egg. So you're saying everything's good? Now such accumulators can be mass-produced? And charged without problems, did I understand correctly? What about magazines, like automatic ones?
What? Ah, you're still about pulse weapons. I think that in time this will be possible too. Main thing is there are no more gaps in the theoretical part, and the rest is a matter of technique.
That's great then. So I'll tell Petrenko you're thrilled and let him contact you, and then you figure out what to do with all this next.

Yes, yes, of course. Though our goals are different, cooperation will benefit both me and him. What prospects, breathtaking!\nAnd to you, Marked One... I don't have anything valuable here, and don't know how to thank you. Except maybe some medicine. Here. Thank you!
Uh-huh, will come in handy. Gotta run. See ya.
Oh! Hey, Marked One. Still walking around, searching? Glad you're alive.
Hey there too. I see you changed your deployment location?

Well, how should I put it... You probably heard they shut down the "Brain Scorcher"? Stalkers rushed there - to the center. They think there are piles of artifacts, untrodden places... idiots.\nSo we decided: "Duty" isn't just an organization, it's a way of life, a way of thinking. The leaders took the wrong path, got lost... Started thinking they ARE Duty. And everyone else should follow them blindly, like sheep. That's not right!\nNow we're here, in this place, trying to gather like-minded people ready to continue fighting the Zone's spawn.
So you split off? Who'll protect Bar? What about Borov and his gang? What if they return.

Borov took those who agreed to go with him. As I heard, they also headed to the center. Looks like they'll be shaking down stalkers there. As for the rest... Those who tried to stop us - they don't interfere anymore, others scattered, sitting somewhere in their holes. Though this scum can still bite if you let your guard down - so stay alert!\nRegarding Bar... You see, everything's rotten there. Duty was supposed to protect people from Zone infection, but that was only in words, in reality... They started profiteering! Everyone! Turned into just a "roof" for all kinds of underground schemes, for "their own" sales channels... Disgusting. Thought leadership would fill their pockets over time and calm down, but it kept getting worse and worse. So me and the guys decided not to deal with all this dirt anymore.\nWell... Alright, I'm rambling like an old man here. How are you? Remember anything about yourself? Found Strelok or someone else?

Everything's normal. Memory's slowly returning, but sometimes I feel like it's not mine... By the way about Strelok. They say somewhere here, in the basement, there's a notable door. Don't you know? There's a tip that Strelok used to go through it to some underground rooms.

Door? There's a basement here, of course, maybe there is some door there, but... The entrance to the basement is blocked - sealed tight with concrete. And why someone needed to mess with this - can't figure out? Unless Borov's psychos committed some atrocities there and covered their tracks. Bastards! So... Consider there's no door.
No way! I was there, not long ago, in that basement. Maybe dig it out somehow?
Dig it out... Only with dynamite. If you have some, then we'll solve this little problem.
Where would I get it?! Listen, you don't happen to know where to get dynamite?

Heard that Wolf was messing with dynamite. Got some somewhere. Probably through Sidor. Who else?\nAsk Wolf yourself, if you find him, of course. Our Duty guys didn't have any, I know for sure - there was talk at one time. Nobody particularly wants to deal with explosives, who knows what might set it off, this is the Zone after all.
Either Wolf or Sidor... Got it. See ya, we'll meet again.

Either Wolf or Sidor... Yeah, also! You guys had a flamethrower. Won't you lend it? I've already been in the local basements, got experience... All kinds of nasty stuff flies around there, fries you with electricity.
You say all kinds of nasty stuff flies around? What if you stir them up there and they try to get to the surface? No, Marked One, sorry, but we'll need the flamethrower ourselves.
Well, that's reasonable. Alright, I'll manage somehow.
Hey, Marked One. Maybe a hundred each? Or you're on business?
A hundred each? Hmm... Nah. In a bit maybe.
Your call. I'll have a little drink maybe...
About the basement. I got explosives, how do I blow it up?
Well, got a remote detonator? No? Then advice - place the explosives roughly in the middle of the concrete, step back, and blow it with automatic fire. That'll be simplest...
I'll try... Listen, maybe give me a couple fighters to help? Well, who knows what's behind that door.
Uh... I don't have free people, you understand - just settling in, up to our necks in work. But don't go too deep there, just take a look, if something serious comes up, get out right away...

You're all the same! When it's time to share a hundred, everyone's here and ready. But when it's time to crawl into some... hole, suddenly everyone's "busy". At least post a sentry at the door, just in case. Who knows what's really behind that door. And maybe I'll have time to call for help if something happens.
Don't grumble, I'll post someone.
You were going to the underground? Or changed your mind?
Didn't change my mind, need to do something.
In one piece?! Glad for you. How was it there? Anything interesting?
What's interesting there - dark, gassed, damp and stinks...
What's it stink of, if it's gassed?
Stinks of death, what else. Basically, you did right to close the entrance there. Something tells me I don't want to go there a second time.
Hmm... Should probably post two guards there, who knows... What if.
As you wish. But I don't advise going there. There's no place for people there.
Hello, friend Marked One.
Hmm... Familiar face, we've met I think. Marked One, right?
Maybe we met. Can't remember everyone. Seems like at the checkpoint, at Garbage we met. What's here now?
Yeah, exactly! Now we're here. It's quieter here. And in general...
What "in general"?

Well, how should I put it... You probably heard they shut down the "Brain Scorcher"? Stalkers rushed there - to the center. They think there are piles of artifacts, untrodden places... idiots.\nSo we decided: "Duty" isn't just an organization, it's a way of life, a way of thinking. The leaders took the wrong path, got lost... Started thinking they ARE Duty. And everyone else should follow them blindly, like sheep. That's not right!\nNow we're here, in this place, trying to gather like-minded people ready to continue fighting the Zone's spawn.
So you split off? Who'll protect Bar? What about Borov and his gang? What if they return.

Borov took those who agreed to go with him. As I heard - they also headed there, to the center. Looks like they'll be shaking down stalkers there. As for the rest... Those who tried to stop us - they don't interfere anymore, others scattered, sitting somewhere in their holes, though this scum can still bite if you let your guard down - so stay alert!\nRegarding Bar... You see... Everything's rotten there. Duty was supposed to protect people from the Zone's spawn, but how did it turn out? Like this! They started profiteering! Everyone! Turned into just a "roof" for all kinds of underground schemes, for "their own" sales channels... Disgusting. Thought it would somehow change, but look how it turned out. Worse and worse. To hell with them! How are you? You were looking for someone... Strelok? Or someone else there?
Yeah, Strelok. That's why I came here. They say somewhere here, in the basement, there's a notable door. Don't you know? There's a tip that Strelok used to go through it to some underground rooms.

Door? There's a basement here, of course, maybe there is some door there, but... The entrance to the basement is blocked - sealed tight with concrete. And why someone needed to mess with this - can't figure out? Unless Borov's psychos committed some atrocities there and covered their tracks. Bastards! So... Consider there's no door.
No way! I was there, not long ago, in that basement. Maybe dig it out somehow?
Dig it out... Only with dynamite. If you have some, then we'll solve this little problem.
Where would I get it?! Listen, you don't happen to know where to get dynamite?

Heard that Wolf was messing with dynamite. Got some somewhere. Probably through Sidor. Who else?\nAsk Wolf yourself, if you find him, of course. Our Duty guys didn't have any, I know for sure - there was talk at one time. Nobody particularly wants to deal with explosives, who knows what might set it off, this is the Zone after all.
Either Wolf or Sidor... Got it. See ya, we'll meet again.
There was word that you have dynamite...
Well, people! Can't hide anything. I'll need to ask them to remind me where I stashed the valuable loot... Alright, I'm joking. What do you need dynamite for? Or is it a secret?
No, not a secret really. Need to bring down a wall, can't get to the underground. Cautious thugs walled it up.
You're a risk-taker, I see. Well, work fears the master, as they say. I have explosives. Just not here, naturally. Only an idiot would drag dynamite here.
Why's that?

Ha! The closer to the Zone's center, the emissions are - wow! Any explosives can blow up by themselves. Can't predict it. So I dropped the dynamite crate in a safer place for the time being. Figured if I need it - I'll pick it up then.
Well I'm not planning to store it. So what? Trade for something? What do you want?

Trade, you say? Mmm... Basically, let's agree like this: I need a recipe for getting one artifact right now. Specifically - "Battery". Get me such a one, and I'll tell you where to stomp for the dynamite. Deal?

Trade, you say? Mmm... Basically, let's agree like this: I need a recipe for getting one artifact right now. Specifically - "Jellyfish". Get me such a one, and I'll tell you where to stomp for the dynamite. Deal?

Trade, you say? Mmm... Basically, let's agree like this: I need a recipe for getting one artifact right now. Specifically - "Springboard". Get me such a one, and I'll tell you where to stomp for the dynamite. Deal?

Oh! How lucky! I know this recipe. Write it down:\nArtifact "Battery" is obtained by joint transmutation in "Witch's Jelly" anomaly of bloodsucker tentacles and three artifacts. These are "Stone Blood", "Meat Chunk" and "Soul".

Oh! How lucky! I know this recipe. Write it down:\nArtifact "Jellyfish" is obtained by joint transmutation in "Witch's Jelly" anomaly of cat tail, poltergeist eye, "Emerald Jellyfish", as well as regular "Jellyfish", but with completely positive properties.

Oh! How lucky! I know this recipe. Write it down:\nArtifact "Springboard" is obtained by joint transmutation in "Springboard" anomaly of artifacts "Thorn" and "Crystal Thorn" with exclusively positive properties, "Urchin" artifact and chimera claw.
Recipe, huh... Alright, I'll find out - I'll be back.

Hope it's no deception? Come on, don't frown. You proved you can be dealt with.\nSo here's the deal. You know Burnt Village in the Swamps? Well the one almost in the center of the Swamps. Yeah you know, don't scratch your head. I stashed the crate in the ruins of one of the houses. Don't know how to describe exactly which one. But there's not many there, you'll find it. Basically, I don't need this dynamite anymore, you can take it.

Hope it's no deception? Come on, don't frown. You proved you can be dealt with.\nSo here's the deal. You've been to the Sanatorium? Well the one near Cordon. I stashed the crate under one of the staircases there. Don't know how to describe exactly which one. But there's not many there, you'll find it. Basically, I don't need this dynamite anymore, you can take it.

Hope it's no deception? Come on, don't frown. You proved you can be dealt with.\nSo here's the deal. You'll have to stomp to the Gut. In the north, by the road that leads to Dark Valley, stands an old construction trailer, and several boulders nearby. Among them I stashed the crate. Basically, I don't need this dynamite anymore, you can take it.
Remind me, what recipe did you want for the dynamite?
Memory problems? Ah, well, yes. I need to know how to cook "Battery". You owe me this recipe, and I'll explain where to stomp for the dynamite.
Memory problems? Ah, well, yes. I need to know how to cook "Jellyfish". You owe me this recipe, and I'll explain where to stomp for the dynamite.
Memory problems? Ah, well, yes. I need to know how to cook "Springboard". You owe me this recipe, and I'll explain where to stomp for the dynamite.

I found out this recipe. Write it down:\nArtifact "Battery" is obtained by joint transmutation in "Witch's Jelly" anomaly of bloodsucker tentacles and three artifacts. These are "Stone Blood", "Meat Chunk" and "Soul".

I found out this recipe. Write it down:\nArtifact "Jellyfish" is obtained by joint transmutation in "Witch's Jelly" anomaly of cat tail, poltergeist eye, "Emerald Jellyfish", as well as regular "Jellyfish", but with completely positive properties.

I found out this recipe. Write it down:\nArtifact "Springboard" is obtained by joint transmutation in "Springboard" anomaly of artifacts "Thorn" and "Crystal Thorn" with exclusively positive properties, "Urchin" artifact and chimera claw.
Yeah right, exactly... I'm being stupid.

Hope it's no deception? Come on, don't frown. You proved you can be dealt with.\nSo here's the deal. You know Burnt Village in the Swamps? Well the one almost in the center of the Swamps. Yeah you know, don't scratch your head. I stashed the crate in the ruins of one of the houses. Don't know how to describe exactly which one. But there's not many there, you'll find it. Basically, I don't need this dynamite anymore, you can take it.

Hope it's no deception? Come on, don't frown. You proved you can be dealt with.\nSo here's the deal. You've been to the Sanatorium? Well the one near Cordon. I stashed the crate under one of the staircases there. Don't know how to describe exactly which one. But there's not many there, you'll find it. Basically, I don't need this dynamite anymore, you can take it.

Hope it's no deception? Come on, don't frown. You proved you can be dealt with.\nSo here's the deal. You'll have to stomp to the Gut. In the north, by the road that leads to Dark Valley, stands an old construction trailer, and several boulders nearby. Among them I stashed the crate. Basically, I don't need this dynamite anymore, you can take it.
I need explosives. Really bad.
Well, you're something! Explosives for him. And I don't want to look for my ass all over Cordon. Explosives in Zone conditions are extremely unstable.
Jacking up the price again? I know you already got dynamite for someone. So - how much?
Eh... I wanted to warn you for old friendship's sake. Well, you decide. I want two "dummy" class artifacts from you. And make sure they're in excellent condition. Bring them - you'll get dynamite.
You completely lost your mind, old miser? Such a price... I could trade these artifacts for a howitzer on the mainland.
