Do you need that howitzer in the Zone? No? Then don't chirp. Though, I really did go a bit overboard. Agree to accept slightly worn artifacts, if you want.
Yeah right, so lucky... Here, I just happen to have dummies with me, take them. When will there be explosives?
Just an attraction of unprecedented generosity. You'll get your dummies, old miser.
Let's see... Yeah, these'll do. Come back in half an hour, they'll drag it over.
So, what about the dynamite?
What-what! Wait for now. The courier hasn't returned yet.

The courier returned from the military. Don't know what they need dynamite dropped off for periodically, but for your luck, they're ready to part with a couple dozen kilos without much "persuasion". What are you standing for? Go, take it. They put it in the first house from the road, not dragging it here. Run before someone makes off with it. People here are crafty.
I'll make off with them...
Sidorovich, can you sell products wholesale?
What? What is this, a grocery warehouse?

Come on. Canned meat, for example, isn't delivered to you one can at a time. Surely several boxes at once. Can you sell me about 30 cans at once? And some other stuff too, preferably with a discount, so to speak... for wholesale.
I had a feeling there was something about you. Decided to go into business? Watch out, Marked One, you'll go broke. And if you don't go broke yourself, you'll help others. Heh-heh.

I'm not planning to sell this. I need 30 cans of stew, 30 loaves of bread, 20 cans of energy drinks and vodka, 10 bottles for one job. Doesn't matter to you if you sell piece by piece or all at once? And I'll take everything at once - obvious benefit to you from such commerce. Even with a discount.
No, there's definitely something about you. You're not circumcised by any chance? Look how you started talking: "benefit", "commerce", "discount". And what price you planning to take it for?
I think for such a large order you could knock off 20%.
What?! Want to completely fleece me?
So, as I understand, we have a deal?

Alright, you convinced me, you'll get everything... wholesale. And with a discount, so be it, but 15%
Only I have a counteroffer for you: so you definitely take everything, no tricks - thought and changed your mind.
For urgency and wholesale you'll throw in a simple artifact on top.
Artifact up front. Got it?
Could've knocked off more. Here's an artifact.
You'll get your artifact. In a bit.
Forget you! I'll gather it myself somehow.
Marked One, can't go any lower. Or do you want stalkers to find out why I'm holding back goods and not selling to them?\nBasically, drop by in half an hour. Need to check the warehouse.
Deal, I'll swing by.
About wholesale products, is the deal still on?
Pay the advance. Then we'll do our little business.
Yeah, here's an artifact, when to expect it?
Yes-yes, I remember, but no artifacts yet.
Come by in half an hour. Need to check the warehouse.
I'll run by, won't forget.
About the products, did you collect them?
Marked One! When were you told? Head problems again?

Collected, got all sweaty. Phew...\nLet's settle up first? You owe... So... With the discount... Exchange rate difference... Hmm... Plus fees... Total... Fifty tw... fifty-five thousand rubles, zero zero kopecks. You'll ruin me, by God you'll ruin me.
Come on, come on! Can't even ask.
Fifty-five thousand?! Alright, deduct it.
I'll rummage in my coffers, maybe I'll gather the needed sum.
I asked too little... What won't you do for a good person.\nTake it.\nAnd remember my kind heart!
Good to you and pure thoughts, human...
Hmm... And good to you... Uh... What should I call you?
We are island. Fragment of great. Part of common. Essence - shells, separated from soul... From Great mind of universe. From Awareness of all existing...
Head's starting to hurt... I asked like a human: what should I call you?

We are not humans. We are higher and purer. We are mind! But for now, at this stage, we are bound to flesh. And this flesh has mark - Reaching Lazurite. Your mind is covered by veil, what is your mark?
Mark? This about tattoo? Ah! You mean my name? They call me Marked One, maybe you know?
Mark Marked One is known to us... Are you that one? One of those? You are needed by enlightened. Accept assignment and fulfill prescribed as we all do!
Stop, stop! What's this about? What assignment? What are you talking about? I didn't ask for any assignment. I was told to do something here and they promised a reward.

There is message. Was. From Existing. One who bears Mark will come. Will be able to receive what he thirsts for. And will bring understanding. Need to direct... No communion at this moment of time flow. Need transponder. You can make. Then will be communion. Will be replenishment. Will be direction... You, Marked... Take seed. Carry to place. Leave. It will sprout. Then will be communion and... Reward.
What "seed"? What "place"? What "reward"? What is this even? Why?
Seed. His. Will give possibility of mind unity. If will be sown in points... In needed...
Why don't you "sow" it here? And generally, you'd do it yourselves. Your seeds, you sow them.

Not here. Need there... near Him. We can no longer return... We lose connection with Him. It strives from here to distance. It extends attention further... It does not look nearby. We must go after It. Cannot lose connection for long... But seed is needed for Him there. Those with mark can do. They are not bound to Him strongly like us... You can return.

Wait, wait... Brrr! "It" goes there... somewhere there from here. And you must go after it... on a leash like. Is that it? So why are you here then, and not following "it" there... I'm getting confused already.
We wait. Here is connection through His sprout. He is near. Here is His breath... He needs more such... For this seed.
What? So somewhere here already sprouted something like that... A sprout from it?

Yes. Long ago. You are on path of understanding... Analogy is appropriate... Was seed, It sprouted... It received energy... But this is not important. One is few... It needs more. Now need more... Such as you can. You do not need His attention, like us. But you are also with His seal, It will let through. You are Marked, it will let you through.
What am I marked with?! What seal?
It will tell. You will understand everything with Him. Who you really are. Do not waste time. Strive to Him.
Alright... What the hell. If there's a chance to understand something... What seeds and where to plant?
Places of energy. Flows. Exit points... His sprouts. You call these places "Matrices". Take...
Those are like anomalies... And generally, depends where to carry them still. I haven't decided yet.

You, humans, say "District Center", there. You will be able. Leave seed... And you call "Tesla". Leave there... And you say "Radar". Leave. And plant... Take. Seed is alive. It will not die. In right place will sprout... At right time. Do not wait. Time itself will come.

Oh, damn... Well I don't know... Your seeds are heavy. I'll think about it. And I need to drop my little seed somewhere here or in neighboring chamber - small beacon. Don't mind? \nAnd this... if I lose them, or someone steals them suddenly, or I sell them - who knows what need might arise - so what then? Back to you again?

Oh, damn... Well I don't know... Your seeds are heavy. I'll think about it. \nAnd this... if I lose them, or someone steals them suddenly, or I sell them - who knows what need might arise - so what then? Back to you again?
Cannot lose... Do what must be done. There will be no others.
How complicated everything is with you... Why does "it" give so few seeds? Don't you mind parting with such rarity?
Not few... But by your time measures process is long. In this time segment there are none. Seed is always. Will not run out. But later. Much.
Yeah, "it" is in no hurry. It has eternity ahead... Well alright, but if I do plant your seeds, so what? Look for you here again?

No. Will not be already... Go to place Pripyat. Connector will inform when. He is still there, he is in contact with It. He will understand from It what you did. He will call you and give His reward...
You, his, from him, yours, damn... Head will spin with you.
Go. Connector. Pripyat.
Human... No thoughts... Need connection...
Ooh! Damn you...
Communion not restored... Seed not sprouted. Need... District Center. "Tesla". Pripyat...
Human... No thoughts... Need connection...
Ooh! Damn you...
I see - training a tushkano?
Training? You mean our Gena?
Gena? I mean the tushkano in the wheel...

Well yeah... I'm saying - Gena... It's from the word "generator". Hunters gave him to us. Along with the wheel. They used to use him to recharge their batteries, and some other small stuff. They had one "trainer", but he died, and they felt sorry for Gena. So they gave him to us. There he is, running... After sausage... Also spins the generator. We don't give him much food so he doesn't get lazy... Just don't stick your fingers near him, or he'll bite off your whole hand. He's not friendly, even though he's "trained".
Who? Oh! It's you! Hello. How's life?
Hey! I thought you were already home eating mama's pies. What brings you here?

Yeah, I was thinking, what's there to do back home? Watch my drunk stepfather again? I'm thinking of heading to the city, to Kharkov. But I need money for the start. So the guys advised me to do some stalking. They introduced me to Sidorovich. He gave me this PDA to transfer money. And advised me not to go deep at first, just look around here. So I'm looking around. Already found my first artifact!
Aren't you scared? A stalker's life isn't sugar.

Honestly? I'm scared. But you gotta live. Back there, beyond the cordon, to earn this kind of money you'd have to slave away for years or steal. And I don't want that. Maybe some other guys from our village will agree, we'll go together. Then we can go deeper into the Zone.
Why didn't you attach yourself to someone experienced?

Nah. They told me how experienced stalkers use rookies. Like for checking the road. I don't want that. Maybe not right away, but I'll study anomalies and mutants. And there'll be money and artifacts. At least I'll only depend on myself. And I can always leave for the mainland. No rush. It's a shame I lost a year on that service... Like I erased it. Not even a memory left.
Memory, yeah! Ah! I found a photo album once, a demobilization one.
Yeah, memory is important. I should know... Good luck, Sanya.
Thanks. Good luck to you too. Maybe we'll see each other again.

Yeah? What kind of album? I had a buddy in the platoon, he made a really good album. There were photos of me and other guys in it. But he died, not so long ago. They sent them to clean out a sewer. A major from headquarters flew in and gave the order. That's when me and Vovchik split. Just to be safe. Well, and Seryoga, as I heard, never came back from there.
I found that album in the sewer at Agroprom.
Can I take a look? Maybe it's Seryoga's?
Let's see. If it's still in one piece, I'll bring it. Alright, see you later.
Thanks... Good luck to you too.
How are you doing? Alright? Well, good...
Yeah, everything's fine. You still hanging around here?
Yeah, getting used to it slowly. I look around during the day, settle in here for the night. I usually get back by midnight. It's scary to wander at night, but it's quiet and peaceful here.
I brought you that demobilization album as I promised.
Alright, got it. Well, stay healthy, soldier.
Yeah, stay healthy yourself, stalker.
Yeah! Yes, it's Seryoga's. Here I am with him, see? And this one's from boot camp - here's Kostyan with our dog, with Beer. You really helped me out! Can I keep it?
So where's the beer?
Beer? Ah! You mean the photo? That's the dog's name - "Beer". When you call him, everyone's heart rejoices: "Beer - come here!"... So what? At least a couple photos?
"Beer"? Funny... Alright, keep it, I don't need this album anyway. I need to find my own memory.
Thanks, friend. Take some ammo at least... that's all I have.
Hello, friend. I've already gotten some artifacts! What about you?

Greetings! How's life? I see the Zone has roughed you up pretty bad.
Shall we get acquainted?
My name is Ivantsov. Rank - Colonel. I'm General Voronin's deputy for operational matters. Let me explain - operational means deputy for direct supervision of Duty's main business: forceful cleanup of Zone spawns and all elements disrupting the established order! Clear?
What should I call you?
Marked One. I'm looking for Strelok or Ghost. Haven't heard of them?

Marked One? Hmm... There were rumors about Strelok at one time, though that was long ago - more than six months back. And Ghost showed up recently, seems like he headed to Yantar. The scientist, Vasilyev, offered him well-paid work, as far as I know. That's about all... I know.
Marked One, why so gloomy? Did you find what you were looking for, or still searching?
Marked One! It's you... There was a rumor - you've already combed through the whole Zone? You're an interesting person. I'll keep you in mind, if something comes up.
And you collect rumors too, Colonel?
Everything interests me. Sometimes there's more truth in those rumors than in official papers.
Marked One, good thing you came. I was just thinking about you... Since you take on all kinds of jobs. There's one assignment, not too difficult, but important!
Not difficult, but important... Something gives me bad feelings about this.
Nothing special. I heard you're heading toward Army Warehouses? Eh?
Hmm... Seems like nothing can be hidden from anyone here! So - what's the job?

We have one group at the Warehouses right now. Need to tell them the assignment is cancelled and they should act according to code twenty-nine. Say that thirteen and eight are out of the game. Well? Doesn't seem complicated?
And who should I tell? What nonsense, eight, twenty, three - fifteen. Like children, honestly...

This is important! You need to tell Major Cherepanov. He should be with the group at the southern hamlet near the warehouses. And the numbers mean what they mean. You'd better not think too hard about such things - you'll be safer. Deliver the message quickly and come straight back with a report. Well, how about it? Do you remember what to say?
Uh... Code twenty-nine, thirteen and eight are out. Something like that.

Exactly! Alright, go do it! Wait, don't do it yet! There's another thing: our general was looking for a volunteer. He has one delicate little assignment, also at Army Warehouses. If you're interested, go see him. Only I didn't tell you this. Got it?
Exactly! Alright, go do it!
You still here? Time doesn't wait! The matter is very urgent.
How are things? Everything alright?
Hello, Marked One.
Marked One, holy hell... Alive?!
You bet! I'll outlive all of you... What's this all about, suddenly?

Where have you been all this time? I wanted to throw you some work, but someone said they saw you head to Radar. A week goes by without you, then two already. We figured that was it... We even discussed - hopefully it was quick, without suffering, and not like the other inhabitants there. But you're alive... Damn! How did you manage to last two weeks there?

Two weeks? Damn! For me it was like one day. I can't understand anything myself, I thought it was just something with my PDA, or my watch was off, but then I look - Bar is empty, like a lot of time really passed. Where's your general? How do I get to the storage room?
Well here's the problem, stalker. There's nothing left in your storage room. I understand they freed it up... completely.
What?! What does this mean?! Everything I earned! All gone to hell?

Without going into details... yes. Many fell under the corrupting influence of greed. The Zone reshaped them in its own way. Unfortunately, our general was among them. Now it seems like I'm in command here. So come to me.
Yeah... who would have thought. About the storage room. Can I still leave loot here?

Uh, Marked One, look around more carefully! What do you see? Or, let's say more precisely, what do you NOT see? Few real fighters left. So now there's no way to ensure one hundred percent guarantees for the safety of any valuables. So, sorry...
And where am I supposed to go now?
I heard someone at the bar takes things now. Not for free, of course...
I need to check my stash here one last time. Can I?
Such a non-believer. Go, look.

Two weeks? Damn! For me it was like one day. I can't understand anything myself, I thought it was just something with my PDA, or my watch was off, but then I look - Bar is empty, like a lot of time really passed. Where's your general?

Without going into details... Many fell under the corrupting influence of greed. The Zone reshaped them in its own way. Unfortunately, our general was among them. Now it seems like I'm in command here. So come to me.
Yeah... who could have thought. By the way, since your leadership changed here, and as you put it, those who fell under the influence of greed scattered, can I leave loot with you for storage?

Uh, Marked One, look around more carefully! What do you see? Or, let's say more precisely, what do you NOT see? Few real fighters left. So now there's no way to guarantee the safety of other people's property. If only our own stuff doesn't get stolen...
And where should I store loot now, maybe you can advise?
I heard someone at the bar takes things now. Ask Barkeep.
Greetings. What brings you here?
How are things? Everything alright?
I talked to that major of yours...
Did you deliver the order? Any details?
Well, what details... I told him your children's counting rhyme. He told me another one. Something about sevens.
Well, no special details... I delivered what I was told, and he said he understood everything and rattled off other numbers in response. Seven and seventy-five... I think.
Be more specific. What exact numbers did Major Cherepanov give you? How we finish this business depends on it.
Seventy-five? Are you sure? This is important! And how we finish our business depends on it.
Uh... Seven for sure. And then... Seventy-seven, maybe... Or no?! Something with seventy - definitely. But what came after... slipped my mind.
Uh... Seven it was. And then... Something with seventy - definitely. But what exactly... slipped my mind.
Seventy-six? Seventy-two?
Why are you getting so worked up, Marked One? Try to remember! Not seventy-two? Maybe seventy-six?
Right! Exactly! Seventy-two! I even thought about a certain double-barrel...
Uh... seems like it was still seventy-five after all.

Fine. I understand not to expect much from an ordinary stalker. Good. Let's consider the assignment successfully completed. Here, take some supplies from me. If needed - can I count on you in the future?

Hmm... very strange if so. This code is only used in case of... well, that's not important. Good. Let's consider the assignment successfully completed, even though there's some nonsense with the response. You're confusing something, stalker... Though it's understandable for you, with your head problems. Here, take some supplies from me. If needed - can I count on you in the future?
We'll see. How the chips fall. Thanks for the supplies though.
We'll see. How the chips fall.
Oh! You're the Marked One? Didn't think I'd see you...
Yeah, I thought too that... Well, let's not talk about sad things.
Did you want something or just passing by?
Didn't expect to see you with... the boys here. Just came to say hello. You've come pretty far though.
No farther than others. Alright, if you don't have business with me, then get going, I was just about to have some tea.
You again, Marked One? What did you want?
Don't think I'm prying into your secrets, just got curious: why did you move here from the Valley?

Curious, damn him. The prosecutors were curious too, how papa Borov kept getting away from raids... Ah, what secrets are there, think with your head. Stalkers rushed north when word spread that the brain burner at Radar stopped working. Everyone thought they'd be hauling artifacts by the cartload from the center of the Zone, but hell, nothing doing. We're hanging around here pointlessly. Stalkers still go in that direction more or less, but damn few come back - maybe two or three a day, and those are mostly without loot and all beaten up somehow. Or maybe we chose a bad spot here, are there any bypass routes, eh, don't you know, Marked One?

Seems like there's only one road from here to the Forest. And there, beyond the bridge, by the way, your "colleagues" also set up a post. They watch to make sure no stalkers accidentally strain themselves under the weight of loot. Help them get rid of excess...

Colleagues? You talkin' about Bold's crew? Then it'd be more accurate to say - competitors. That bastard didn't wanna go under Borov, doesn't respect the authorities, and generally doesn't honor the thieves' code. Wanted to drag him to a sit-down, to sort out all issues properly, but he sent my boys back on their asses when they brought him my message, even took their guns and generally mocked them like some last punk. Should waste the bastard, but quietly, so it doesn't trace back to us. I heard some serious people stand over him too. And so what, plenty of lawless scum wanders around the Zone... Someone slashed a throat with a razor over suddenly arising personal dislike, and that's it. What do you say, Marked One, don't you wanna do a good deed? I bet you yourself constantly suffer losses from these twerps?
Well, sure, that's true, but I already told you: I don't do wet work.

Yeah, yeah, you said that. Alright, I'll find my own way to deal with this bastard. He won't be showing off much longer.\nAnd you know what... You're gonna head back through the forest from Limansk later, right? Drop by Bold if you don't mind, and tell him Borov offers one last time to settle our differences peacefully. Either he sends a parla... parme... fuck... parliamentarian here, or let him get ready to try on a wooden mackintosh. If you act as an ambassador of good will with an answer yourself, that's even better. I don't trust Bold's gang. I'll give you a decent bonus, don't worry, you know me.
Just deliver a message and come back with an answer if there is one? I can do that, why not.
Well, good on you. Just don't forget. I'll wait for an answer three days, then I'll start stirring up trouble. Alright, shake hands and get going, I still gotta think about where to get grub now.
I'll be back in three days for sure. By the way, isn't Veins your supply chief? And where is he anyway, I haven't seen him here? I might've traded something with him.
Veins went to shit, our paths diverged. So forget about trades.
About your request to deliver a message to Bold...
Well? What's the word?
The proposal... uh... was rejected... uh... in a rude manner. And I was also told that your people shouldn't appear nearby anymore, or they'll be wasted. That's almost a direct quote.

The answer is in this box. As far as I know, there's a very needed artifact inside and a note from Bold. Generally, it all looks like he agreed to settle your differences peacefully. Details, I think, are laid out in the note.

The answer is in this box. As far as I know, there's a very needed artifact inside and a note from Bold. But... I'd open it very carefully if I were you. I don't have concrete evidence, and I don't want to badmouth Bold, but the whole story about sending a package seemed suspicious to me.

We had a little squabble with Bold, so much that he's not breathing anymore. I mean completely. Turns out your original proposal about his... hmm... elimination was carried out unplanned. That's how it happened.
Nothing yet. Just wanted to say that I'm about to head to Red Forest. There'll be news soon.

Well, that's it. Pushkin finished writing, Gagarin finished flying, and this punk... I got no beef with you, Marked One, you did your job. Take this decent artifact as payment, one scrawny guy "shared" it. Says it's extra for him, ha-ha!\nWell, good luck to you, wanderer.

What, really? Sent an artifact, you say? Strange, but alright. I'll look later... without prying eyes. You did everything clean, Marked One. Take your payment, one scrawny guy "shared" it.\nWell, good luck to you, wanderer.

Your gut works well, seems like. What's this "very needed artifact" bullshit?! There's clearly some fuckery here... We had one snitch attach himself to us recently, I'll give him this little box to open. And you're a real beauty, Marked One, did everything proper. Take your payment, one scrawny guy "shared" it.\nYeah, this should interest you. I had the boys figure out approaches to Bold's place. They mined the bridge, you probably know. But disabling them is easy as pie. Kolsha, sharp head, managed to get close and spy how the gatekeeper at the bridge did it when he was letting a stalker through. He pretends to press some buttons there, but actually switches an inconspicuous lever with his foot in the ventilation recess at the base of the console. Real sneaky type.\nWell, good luck to you, wanderer.

Fo' real? Now that's what I call performance, Marked One. Well, may the earth be glass wool to him, as they say, and all that. Take this decent artifact as payment, one scrawny guy "shared" it. Says it's extra for him, ha-ha!\nYeah, this should interest you. I had the boys figure out approaches to Bold's place. They mined the bridge, you probably know. So if the mines are still armed, disabling them is easy as pie. Kolsha, sharp head, managed to get close and spy how the gatekeeper at the bridge did it when he was letting a stalker through. He pretends to press some buttons there, but actually switches an inconspicuous lever with his foot in the ventilation recess at the base of the console. Real sneaky type.\nWell, good luck to you, wanderer.
Much obliged.

Borov from Limansk wants to send a message through me to Bold in Red Forest. If possible, I should also deliver the return answer. Seems like a trivial matter at first glance, considering I have three whole days to complete it.
In the thick of bandit showdowns
Good luck to the suit! Ah... it's you. What was your handle again? Marked One, right? Look where you ended up. Usually only bros hang out here.
All familiar faces around Limansk. I remember you and your crew were gonna tear claws far from Borov's authority. So, how is it? Breathing freely now?
Why you grinnin'? You know that bastard came here too. Someone should put him on a knife already. Maybe I wouldn't become the boss instead of him, but I'd sure move up.
You're coming around too often. Trying to join the crew? Nah, I'm kidding, kidding... Otherwise look, we took out almost all the small fry...
Listen, why'd you guys fo' real set up shop right next to Borov's people? What's the point of pushing elbows here? Should've moved somewhere else.
Oh, these vagrant problems again.

It's his gang that came here, my bros have been hanging around here for a long time. But you're right though, there's nothing to catch here anymore. We even figured out where to set up a new place, but it's all pointless for now. We managed to heat up some loot from your colleagues here, see. Great stash it'll be if we can unload the goods to dealers near the perimeter. But we still gotta haul it there somehow. Carrying it on our backs is really tough, and stashing it somewhere here and dragging it piece by piece is sketchy. Borov's snitches will sniff it out, then we might end up with nothing but our bare asses... You're a smart guy, know all kinds of stalker tricks. Got any advice?
Nah, you'll figure something out yourselves. Or you won't. I don't really give a shit.
Hold on there. Why so prickly? I'm not asking just like that. Help out - we'll settle up. I got interesting info from the eggheads. Definitely gonna be worth your while.
Yeah? Well then catch this idea: get an exoskeleton. It's like a special suit. Lets any weakling carry tons of heavy stuff once he puts it on. Now tell me your interesting info.

We grabbed an egghead with the boys recently. One was walking all the way from District Center, imagine that? Like, gonna restock supplies at Mikhalych's. Yeah, we know those supplies - they're called booze. Anyway, there was really nothing to take from him, was gonna stock up on credit, so we decided to check what's in his tablet. And there's a real story about a whole klondike of artifacts written there, I tell ya. All chewed out in detail, what and how, with all their scientific bullshit. But the thing is... It's in such a place that we won't go check it out, no question. But you're different. For experienced stalkers like you, that's easy as pie.
Uh-huh. Look how he's singing like a nightingale! Is this klondike at the Chernobyl plant or what? Maybe you'll even point out a shortcut there?

Uh... so you already figured it out? Or just randomly hit the... sky? Here's the deal: I'll explain everything about this topic if you bring me and the boys an exoskeleton, the one you just mentioned. Brand new, unfucked with, and it's gotta suit us spades. We won't take anything from the "reds", that's beneath us, got it? I heard Borov's torpedoes dressed up in those little suits. Maybe you can get one from someone else in the brotherhood. You figure it out. So, good deal? Just think how much you'll lift there, from this klondike. For a tip like this, even two exos wouldn't be too much, eh?
Whoa whoa! Slow down! I'll try to hustle one somehow, so be it. Really wanna touch one of the Zone's most famous legends. If all this isn't bullshit, of course...

Whoa, hit the brakes! Stop loading me like some last sucker. Some people never learn. Watched too many American movies or greed's blowing your roof off... Ah, what's the point of feeding you our stalker sayings...
So, how's it with the exo?
Got it. Had to haul plenty of heavy stuff myself, but I'm used to that by now. Here. Now tell me about the klondike, and make sure it's detailed.
Still empty-handed.

Now you delivered, eh! No, fo' real, you brought us such a score? You're a solid guy in life, no question! So listen up, I'll explain about the klondike like to family.\nThat science guy turned out to be talkative. Just acted smart at first, but we quickly straightened his brains out. Turns out the nerds didn't just wander to District Center for nothing. Like, it's convenient to observe remote corners of the Zone from there. So they were tracking with their instruments what's happening all the way at the plant itself. Says they recently detected a massive anomaly there, com-pa-ra-ble by some numbers to... anyway, forgot how he put it, but the gist is: where they burned through this anomaly, there should be a shitload of rare artifacts. They never saw anything like it before, so they figured this was that very klondike all stalkers drool over. They even have an idea that it can like wander from place to place, that's why it's so hard to find. But for now it's there and will stay at that spot for some time. Look here, I'll mark it on your PDA. There. How to get to the station itself, I got no fucking clue. But you probably know the whole deal, right?
Yeah... should've expected that. All that's left is the small matter - getting to the plant.
Ah, great, great, bro! How you doing?
Get the fuck outta here! Not in the mood for you right now.
Don't lean on the voice. Not impressive.
Vagrant problems

To haul all the stolen goods for sale, Rasp needs a bandit exoskeleton in excellent condition. For this he promises to give a lead on what's supposedly an artifact klondike located at the plant. He learned about it from some scientist that Rasp's accomplices "mugged".
Borov, I got an unusual request for you. I saw several of your fighters in exoskeletons. How could I get my hands on one?

Considering your services to the brotherhood, Marked One, you'll get an exo... if we agree on the price. But I'll say right away: don't expect new, fresh-from-the-box armor. We're not "Bolshevichka" here, everything's made on a knee, same way it's fixed.

Ha! Now you delivered - wants an exoskeleton, he says! What a performer! Nah, not an option right now. We got a showdown brewing here, and these little suits are needed for our own persuasiveness. Once we sort everything out, then we can discuss it.
Yeah, that's understandable, no complaints about that. Name your price.
Yeah, your bruisers do look impressive in them. Then I'll wait for news on this topic.

The price is as unusual as your request. You'll have to work a bit as supply chief.\nWe're really tight with grub right now. So many mouths grazing on such a small patch, you can see for yourself. It's far from here to the good spots, and Mikhalych can't supply everyone with everything they need right away, though he promises to start bringing more supplies soon. But we wanna eat now. While Veins didn't turn rat, I didn't have to worry about this, but now...\nShort story, we need to stretch until Mikhalych figures out deliveries. Get us 25 rations and the same number of water cans, and we'll be square.

First, so the brotherhood doesn't bitch about losing such a rare trinket, you'll throw a grand in bucks into the common fund. Second, you'll work a bit as supply chief.\nWe're really tight with grub right now. So many mouths grazing on such a small patch, you can see for yourself. It's far from here to the good spots, and Mikhalych can't supply everyone with everything they need right away, though he promises to start bringing more supplies soon. But we wanna eat now. While Veins didn't turn rat, I didn't have to worry about this, but now...\nShort story, we need to stretch until Mikhalych figures out deliveries. Get us 25 whole, unopened rations and the same number of water cans, and we'll be square.
Yeah, I thought the price would just be in RU or artifacts at worst, but here... Alright, I'll try to collect that much food and haul it to you.
Borov agrees to give away one of the exoskeletons belonging to his gang if I help solve their food crisis and bring 25 unopened rations and the same number of energy drink cans to Limansk.
I wanna talk about the exo again.
What else is there to chew over? Brought the grub and drinks?
What else is there to chew over? Brought the grub and drinks? And the money?
Here's the chow, and here's the drinks. Take it.
Here's the chow, and here's the drinks. Take it. And this is a check for a grand.
Not yet. Just decided to check how you're doing here. Who knows... maybe you don't need anything brought anymore.

Everything's solid, good on you. The boys already started catching rats, but now we'll last until the next food caravan, for sure. One less headache. Listen, Marked One, don't you wanna join us? I'd make you a squad leader right away. Ah whatever, I know you won't go, don't stress. Pack up your exoskeleton, you earned it.
Bold, I got an unusual request for you. You're like an authority and all that. Can you get me a bandit exoskeleton? Just don't ask what for, deal?

Everyone's got their schemes, I understand. If you need it, you need it. It's a rare thing, you could even say prestigious. You won't get one through dealers or factions. You need connections with the right people here...

Fuck! Well, you sure asked for something. There ain't even ten of those in the whole Zone. None of the brotherhood ever seen these exos, but... I got a line on one authority, I'll try to push it through. Come back later. Keep in mind, you'll owe me.
Listen, let's skip these preludes. Can you help or not? If you can, name the price. If not, I'm leaving.
Like anyone gives anything in the Zone for free. Got ya, I'll drop by another time.

Sometimes I think they made the wrong guy Bold. Alright, since you're so sharp, let's get to business.\nYou'll get your exoskeleton, and I won't even charge you for it. Don't think I forgot your participation in our little deals, gratitude ain't foreign to us. But I'll still ask for a favor in return.\nLast night a big pack of mutants rushed through the bridge to Limansk. Almost all died blowing up on mines. And fuck 'em, we remined it in the morning. But the snag is we had to use up all our remaining stock on that. Need to restock. Last time we got a whole crate of MONs from the soldiers at Swamp. Through a middleman, of course, it ain't our style to deal direct. I'm offering you to be that middleman. If you got ins with other soldiers, you can get a mine crate from them, but better head to Swamp, they got proven "goods". So, deal?

Sometimes I think they made the wrong guy Bold. Alright, since you're so sharp, let's get to business.\nYou'll get your exoskeleton. It'll cost you a grand, just for delivery. And besides that, I'll ask for a small favor first.\nLast night a big pack of mutants rushed through the bridge to Limansk. Almost all died blowing up on mines. And fuck 'em, we remined it in the morning. But the snag is we had to use up all our remaining stock on that. Need to restock. Last time we got a whole crate of MONs from the soldiers at Swamp. Through a middleman, of course, it ain't our style to deal direct. I'm offering you to be that middleman. If you got ins with other soldiers, you can get a mine crate from them, but better head to Swamp, they got proven "goods". So, deal?
Got myself in deep with this exoskeleton. Everything as usual... What? Ah! Yeah, I'm saying, we got a deal.
Bold is ready to help get a bandit exoskeleton in exchange for a crate of mines, which should be traded from soldiers, either at Swamp or somewhere else.
Greetings! Need a crate of mines, "MON-50". Shall we make a deal?

Holy shit! Who you planning to blow up with those? Doesn't matter really, who. We're tight on mines right now. Mutants lately are like they ate henbane. Almost every day they trample mine barriers, and sappers renew them just as regularly. So they're under strict inventory for now. Maybe if things calm down, I can get some. Come back in a week or so.

Holy shit! Who you planning to blow up with those? Not ours at least? Watch yourself! Anyway, I'll trade a mine crate for two crates of... Heh-heh! Vodka, vodka, what else?! If you agree, come back in an hour, they'll bring it by then.
Oh, I see... Got it.
Agreed. Like I have a choice to buy them at the supermarket around the corner.
I came for the mines.
You're early. Don't wear a watch or what?
There's the crate waiting for you. I'm expecting twice twenty bottles of "official" vodka. How's your math?
Imagine that, I don't. Recently. Alright, I'll come back later.
Perfect order. You got a cart? Otherwise I can't figure how you'll haul all this.
Uh... seems like not so much. Wait a bit, I'll be quick.
Found the solution! I'll conscript a couple soldiers, they'll haul it where I say. How you think you're gonna lug this crate yourself?
Damn, it's heavy!
Greetings, comrade captain! Need a crate of mines, "MON-50". Got any lying around?
Business-like guy! Serious matters ain't solved like that. How about fifty-fifty? Got something to pour?
You bet! Always got something for a good man.
My bad, didn't think... I'll run get some vodka and come back.
Then let's go. As they say, here's to us and fuck them!
Strong is Soviet power! Could use some food...
What "food"? Pour the second one.
The first shot hasn't even reached me yet... Alright, alright, I'm quiet. To your health, captain!

That's more like it. Alright, now we can talk business.\nI got mines. We don't really need them, but the supply guys send them every month. What do they care? Required is required. But what do you need them for?
Well, it's... Need to reliably cover one place from mutants.

That's awfully wasteful. You'll never have enough mines for mutants. Alright, don't wanna tell the truth, don't. I don't pry into other people's secrets. Then here's my word: for a crate of MONs with proper electric detonators and other sapper gear, I want three grand.
How much? No other way? Maybe you'll take vodka?

Ah, you devil, decided to press on a sore spot? Well... vodka works too. It's deadly boring here, you understand? And like this, knock back a shot, everything's not so gloomy. Alright, if you haul two crates of vodka to us, you'll get your mines.
Two crates? Oh, fuck... Need to figure out which way's cheaper.
Our deal about the mines still on?
What, is an officer's word empty sound to you? Bring me forty bottles of vodka or three grand in green, you get a mine crate right there.
Very good. Brought vodka, unloading it.
Very good. Brought money. Take it and sign.
Just wanted to clarify. What if an inspector's coming, or an order came to mine everything to hell, or something else...
Yeah, everything's straight. Take the crate. Can't imagine how you'll haul it. But that's not my problem anymore.
Damn, it's heavy!
Came to check about the exoskeleton. Did you manage to get it?
Did you doubt it? Everything's sweet. What about the mines? Made a deal with the soldiers?
Did you doubt it? Everything's sweet. What about the mines? Made a deal with the soldiers? And you didn't forget about the money, I hope?
If only you knew how much this crate weighs. Barely hauled it. Now... carefully... setting it down. Here's the mines and detonators for them, everything proper.
If only you knew how much this crate weighs. Barely hauled it. Now... carefully... setting it down. Here's the mines and detonators for them, everything proper. And here's your check for a grand.
I wanted to make sure the exo was delivered first. Who knows, you said yourself it's a rare thing. Anyway, I'll be back soon...

Sweet! This'll last us a long time now. Take your little suit. A bit beaten up, I'll warn you right away. Look, here and here. Don't hold it against me, that's how it was. If anything, take it to the local repair guys, they'll fix everything in no time.
Somehow I was already mentally prepared not to see the latest fashion straight from the best designers...
Ah, you again... Got business or just "see you later"?
Well hello again. I see you're flying back and forth like clockwork...
You too. Don't sit still either. Why here?

DUTY is always where it's needed! And where there's no DUTY, there's no need to be! And I don't advise asking questions and sticking your nose in other people's business. Who knows, you know yourself: say something careless, get something solid back... Don't sulk now. Look at you, huffing. I have orders. You delivered them yourself, remember?
What orders? Ah! You mean the children's rhymes...
Yeah. Those are codes. Who knows - understands.\nYeah! By the way. You're looking for Strelok, as I remember? Or something like that? Am I wrong?
Well... In principle, yes. Only I'm not really hopeful anymore.

That's wrong! Nothing works without hope, I'm telling you for sure. So listen! One of our patrols encountered a strange anomaly. Strange in the sense that there's no harm from it, but no practical use either... Seems like. Anyway, as we understood - in this anomaly you can see another time in this place. We never figured out - whether it's just a "vision" in your head, or a person really "flies" to the past and back...
Yeah? And why do I need this?
Here's why... Anyway, one of those who got into this anomaly says he saw three people carrying a fourth. And one of them addressed another as "Strelok"! Get it?
So what? Big deal, he saw Strelok. Who knows what and to whom appeared.
In principle, you're right, of course. We just talked with him, without details. You have your own interest in Strelok, as I understand. That's why I told you.
Greetings. How are you? Your head? Well alright, none of my business... What did you want?
Good day. Is that you? Still dwelling in the Zone? I've had some rest. And I'm back here again.
Hello. I see you've recovered already. Eh, hard to believe there's another life somewhere.

I can't believe it myself now. It was like a dream... Now here again - zombies, monsters, grim characters with weapons... And by the way, Marked One, I'm in your debt now, if it wasn't for you, I don't even know.

Come on, maybe you'll bail me out sometime. There's plenty of characters here. Different ones. Speaking of characters - I met someone at the Warehouses. Seems like one of yours. Sakharov asked me to escort you there. How about it?
To the Warehouses? That's a whole day's walk. And they say it's a nightmare what's happening on the road! Who else is going?
Main fighter - you. I'm backup. I see you got yourself a gun?

Just the two of us? I'm not much of a shooter... Sakharov insisted I drag this shaft with me. But I'm more scared of it than monsters - what if I shoot off something of my own? Anyway, I'd rather stay behind, quietly... Main thing is you get me through Wild Territory, just to Bar, and I'll get there myself and make arrangements with whoever I need. When do we go?
Let's go right now. No point dragging it out. I'll get you through the "wild", of course, and at Bar you'll find guides yourself.
Wait a bit. Let's move when I prepare my gear.
Agreed, I'll follow you. Hope the mutants don't eat us.
Alright. I'll be here meanwhile. Come when you're ready.
Don't worry, let's move.
Going through Wild Territory? When?
What? Are we going further or what?
Don't fall behind.
Are we there yet?
Yeah. When you cross into Bar, go left. You'll reach Army Warehouses on the road. There's a Freedom outpost right there, they'll tell you how to get to their base.
Well, thanks. You go on, Marked One. I'll rest here a bit and move on.
Don't wait, I'll be fine.
This really is Vasilyev... I can't believe it!
Look closer. It's doubtful somehow. I was told this nutcase appeared here long ago, way before you, Professor Vasilyev and Ghost headed to the lab.
Yeah, it's him for sure! There's the birthmark on his cheek. Definitely.
I don't understand anything then.
Yeah, me neither. I'll try to get him talking, maybe something will clear up. Thanks for bringing me, I'll see what can be done.
Well, go ahead. If anything, maybe I'll drop by again in a few days. You can tell me how it goes.
Alright. Deal. Yeah, by the way, Sakharov wanted to give you something. To thank you for something. When you're at Yantar - drop by to see him.
Uh-huh.
Hi. I'm dealing with Vasilyev for now, no time to talk.
What? Are we going further or what?
Oh! Hi! Long time no see. How are you? Heading to the Center for the ultimate artifact?
Hi to you too. I'm still looking for a way to get my memory back. So I have to travel all over the Zone. What are you doing here? Not at the center yet?
Had that idea. But... Decided to see how it is in general. Lots of people rushed there, but nobody came back. Makes you suspicious. If nobody shows up in another week, we'll try a different solution.
Well then. Alright. Sit tight. I'll go about my business.
Haven't you heard yet? Seems like some kind of plague is coming from Pripyat!
Plague? Mutants or what? Nobody said anything. How do you know?
The people who rushed to Pripyat right after the shutdown seem to be sitting around, can't even move them with a stick. Nobody's coming back.
Well... Who knows! People are tired, resting. Not everyone's got a broom up their ass like you. So...

I talked to... a scientist. He said the "Brain Scorcher" wasn't working for nothing. It was stopping some kind of radiation that affects people so they don't want anything at all. They fall into apathy. And this radiation keeps getting stronger. If the "Scorcher" isn't turned on again - it'll cover the whole Zone. Then we'll all just sit and smile. And watch monsters eat us...
No wonder I see, don't even have strength to stand. Yeah. And we were happy that Ivar shut down this brain boiler. Now we gotta turn it back on? Will it work? What about the people?
Got a couple ideas. I'll check them out.
A couple ideas is good. But concrete actions would be better.
Hi. How's it going? Good?
Yeah, seems like it. How are you guys?
How? Like this. Not warm, not cold. Just something inside. Ah well, it'll pass!
Haven't you heard yet? Seems like some kind of plague is coming from Pripyat!
Seems normal... But somehow heavy. And no people with full loot from the center. Though... Whatever... Eh-h-h-h...
Ugh. What? Something's not right with me...
Yeah, it's understandable. Plague - it hits everyone. I feel sick and nauseous inside too. But gotta get things done...
Yeah, you're like a live wire.
Yeah. I got info that there's an underground here somewhere where you can power up the brain burner. You know about anything like that?

Underground... A lab, maybe? There's some kind down the corridor to the north. We wanted to scout what's there and how, but there was no power at the coded entrance, and blowing it up is dangerous - everything'll collapse to hell.
What if there was power? You know the code?
Code? Why? There's a code breaker. I traded for it from a specialist. Only it won't turn on anymore. Either the battery died or some wire came loose.
Hmm. Mind lending it for a while? I'll run to Bar, maybe we can fix it.
You... Alright. Just tell me if anything works out with the "Scorcher". Don't wanna turn into a zombie...
Yeah, I'll tell you.
Uh... It's you... Should lie down. And you're like a meteor.
Hey there, Marked One. What brings you here? Like everyone else - looking for the artifact klondike?
Stay healthy yourself. I have to look for myself. So the thread led me here. What about you? Found the "klondike"?
Yeah, we wanted to at first. But... Some doubt arose. Nobody came back after all. Suspicious. Decided not to rush things for now. We'll wait.
Got it. Well, take care. I'll go.
Looks like it hit you guys too? Covered by apathy...
What? What are you talking about?
The people who rushed to Pripyat right after the shutdown seem to be sitting around, can't even move them with a stick. Nobody's coming back.
Well... Who knows! People are tired, resting. Not everyone's got a broom up their ass like you. So...

I talked to... a scientist. He said the "Brain Scorcher" wasn't working for nothing. It was stopping some kind of radiation that affects people so they don't want anything at all. They fall into apathy. And this radiation keeps getting stronger. If the "Scorcher" isn't turned on again - it'll cover the whole Zone. Then we'll all just sit and smile. And watch monsters eat us...
No wonder I see, don't even have strength to stand. Yeah. And we were happy that Ivar shut down this brain boiler. Now we gotta turn it back on? Will it work? What about the people?
Got a couple ideas. I'll check them out.
You better warn people if something happens.
Oh. Hi. What? Still running around, running around...
Need to, so... How are you guys?
Need to... But I don't need anything. Peace. That's nice.
What?! The people who rushed to Pripyat right after the shutdown seem to be sitting around, can't even move them with a stick. Nobody's coming back.
Yeah, we're doing... okay. Slowly. Got food. Waiting for stalkers to come with loot.
Uh... You. You were just here? Or was that yesterday? Something's wrong with my head, it's like cast iron.
No wonder. You should get to Bar or something. Though it'll probably hit there soon too. I'm starting to run out of steam too...
You're like lightning. Back and forth, back and forth... Makes my head spin.
Yeah. I got info that there's an underground here somewhere where you can power up the brain burner. You know about anything like that?

Underground... A lab, maybe? There's some kind down the corridor to the north. We wanted to scout what's there and how, but there was no power at the coded entrance, and blowing it up is dangerous - everything'll collapse to hell.
What if there was power? You know the code?
Code? Why? There's a code breaker. I traded for it from a specialist. Only it won't turn on anymore. Either the battery died or some wire came loose.
Hmm. Mind lending it for a while? I'll run to Bar, maybe we can fix it.
You... Alright. Just tell me if anything works out with the "Scorcher". Don't wanna turn into a zombie...
Yeah, I'll tell you.
Fuck. Heavy. Should leave, but legs won't move...
Hi. Just passing by or dropping in on us? Heading to the center for the ultimate artifact? We met before. Marked One, right?
Hi to you too. Yeah, that's me. Looking for a way to get my memory back. So I have to travel all over the Zone. What are you doing here? Not at the center yet?
Had that idea. But... Decided to see how it is in general. Lots of people rushed there, but nobody came back. Makes you suspicious. If nobody shows up in another week, we'll try a different solution.
Well then. Alright. Sit tight. I'll go about my business.
Haven't you heard yet? Seems like some kind of plague is coming from Pripyat!
Plague? Mutants or what? Nobody said anything. How do you know?
The people who rushed to Pripyat right after the shutdown seem to be sitting around, can't even move them with a stick. Nobody's coming back.
Well... Who knows! People are tired, resting. Not everyone's got a broom up their ass like you. So...

I talked to... a scientist. He said the "Brain Scorcher" wasn't working for nothing. It was stopping some kind of radiation that affects people so they don't want anything at all. They fall into apathy. And this radiation keeps getting stronger. If the "Scorcher" isn't turned on again - it'll cover the whole Zone. Then we'll all just sit and smile. And watch monsters eat us...
No wonder I see, don't even have strength to stand. Yeah. And we were happy that Ivar shut down this brain boiler. Now we gotta turn it back on? Will it work? What about the people?
Got a couple ideas. I'll check them out.
A couple ideas is good. But a concrete plan would be better.
Hi. How's it going? Good?
Yeah, seems like it. How are you guys?
Us? How to put it. Seems fine, but also... Hard to tell.
Not all good! The people who rushed to Pripyat right after the shutdown seem to be sitting around, can't even move them with a stick. Nobody's coming back.
Seems normal... But somehow heavy. And no people with full loot from the center. Though... Whatever... Eh-h-h-h...
Ugh. What? Something's not right with me...
Yeah, it's understandable. Plague - it hits everyone. I feel sick and nauseous inside too. But gotta get things done...
Yeah, you're like a live wire.
Yeah. I got info that there's an underground here somewhere where you can power up the brain burner. You know about anything like that?

Underground... A lab, maybe? There's some kind down the corridor to the north. We wanted to scout what's there and how, but there was no power at the coded entrance, and blowing it up is dangerous - everything'll collapse to hell.
What if there was power? You know the code?
Code? Why? There's a code breaker. I traded for it from a specialist. Only it won't turn on anymore. Either the battery died or some wire came loose.
Hmm. Mind lending it for a while? I'll run to Bar, maybe we can fix it.
You... I could lend it. But I paid good money for it... So... I won't give it for free. You're an experienced guy, so I'll trade it for a "Dummy" artifact. Not damaged. So no flies buzzing. Deal?
Hmm. Not damaged? Alright. Here.
Don't have one on me...
Good. That's fine. Here, take it. Just tell me if anything works out with the "Scorcher". Don't wanna turn into a zombie...
Alright. I'll tell you.
Uh... It's you... Should lie down. With a river, and quiet...
You'll have plenty of time to lie around. I brought an undamaged "Dummy".
That's for sure... And why we're fussing around, I don't understand myself.
We hustle and bustle, but for what? To make money? But what for? We'll all be there anyway...
I got this decoder that's not working, take a look?
Hmm... Right. Well, I'll take a look. You'll owe me, you understand...
I understand. And what exactly will I owe?
I'll see. If it's not too complicated, then one thing, but if something's really wrong - different story. Anyway, come back tomorrow. I think everything will be clear by then.
Well... Alright.
So, did you manage with the decoder?
Yeah, turned out to be a trifle really. It'll cost you a couple second-level artifacts. Deal?
Hmm, alright. Here you go. You say it's a trifle, but you want good artifacts?
Don't have any on me. I'll check my stash.
A trifle is a trifle, but I killed time looking for the problem. Plus - life is hard... You know yourself. \nHere, take the device.
You shouldn't kill time, but manage it. Well alright. Thanks.
I got some documents here, will you take a look?

Where do you keep getting these from? What's all this stuff smeared with?! Such nastiness... You should've dried them or something. Alright, when I'm free - I'll look. I'm busy right now.\nYou'll owe me. Just got my hands dirty, damn...
Big deal, he got dirty! Sometimes you crawl knee-deep in s... filth all day... Be thankful nobody used these papers for hygiene procedures. As for "owing", we'll figure something out.

Big deal, he got dirty! Sometimes you crawl knee-deep in s... filth all day... Be thankful nobody used these papers for hygiene procedures. As for "owing", didn't you mix something up, eh, Docent? Or did you already forget how I collected money for your brother?
Why are you getting worked up? I said I'll look, but later. Come back tomorrow or in a couple days.
Yeah, sorry, I... Anyway, I'll look at everything, but later, okay? Come back tomorrow or in a couple days.

No-no! None of this "tomorrow". I know you - you'll flip through for five minutes, then act like you slaved away all day without rest. Look right here. At least just to know: is this junk or something useful.

So persistent... Alright. Wait here. Hmm... strange, recently some guy tried to sell me very similar papers. But I only glanced through them diagonally and sent the hustler packing - there was nothing of interest to me there. So...
Really strange. Where could he have found similar documents?! Well, doesn't matter. So, what's in there?

Be quiet for a bit, you're interfering... Anyway, here's the topic. There are some drainage systems for flooded underground areas. As I understand, these are powerful pumps that are quite probably still in working condition. They're activated in some underground communications hub. There's also office correspondence regarding a duty post at the laboratory... Can't make out the index, everything's smeared here. Does this tell you anything? Anyway, I'd need to study this more thoughtfully... So for more specific information - a third-level artifact from you. No, probably even two artifacts. And they must be in good condition, those pay more. You understand, there are few people at Bar now, income has really dropped.

Be quiet for a bit, you're interfering... Anyway, here's the topic. There are some drainage systems for flooded underground areas. As I understand, these are powerful pumps that are quite probably still in working condition. They're activated in some underground communications hub. There's also office correspondence regarding a duty post at the laboratory... Can't make out the index, everything's smeared here. Looks like X-12, yeah definitely, here's the number - 12. Does this tell you anything? Anyway, I'd need to study this more thoughtfully, but if you really need it, no problem, I can bother with it.

Be quiet for a bit, you're interfering... Anyway, here's the topic. There are some drainage systems for flooded underground areas. As I understand, these are powerful pumps that are quite probably still in working condition. They're activated in some underground communications hub. There's also office correspondence regarding a duty post at the laboratory... Can't make out the index, everything's smeared here. Does this tell you anything? Anyway, I'd need to study this more thoughtfully, but if you really need it, no problem, I can bother with it.

Pumps that turn on who knows where and, most importantly, why... Some duty post... Seems to me this is all unnecessary, useless information. At least for now. Hold off with the artifacts for now, businessman. Maybe another time.
I need it. Pumps that turn on who knows where and, most importantly, why... We'll talk about that another time maybe. But tell me more about the post. How do I get there?
I need it. I'm not interested in the post, that's unnecessary now. But I'd like to learn more about the tunnels and pumps.

You know what, Marked One? I got a bit ahead of myself saying I was ready to bother with finding the info you need. Right now I don't have time. Got plenty of my own headaches, and here others try to pile on more. No offense, but let's return to this conversation later, okay?

Wait. So, this isn't it... Ah, here's the beginning. So listen: the room you need, according to the plan, is on the lower level of the laboratory. From the room with the freight elevator, go down the service stairs all the way, you'll get to a small hall from which a long corridor begins. On the right you'll see a door with a code lock - that's where you need to go. Interestingly, here in the correspondence they even give the code, if it's still valid of course. Write it down: 513390. Anything else you're interested in?

You know what, Marked One? I got a bit ahead of myself saying I was ready to bother with finding the info you need. Right now I don't have time. Got plenty of my own headaches, and here others try to pile on more. No offense, but let's return to this conversation later, okay? And please, prepare payment for my services in advance - a third-level artifact. No, probably even two artifacts. And they must be in good condition, those pay more. You understand, there are few people at Bar these days, income has really dropped, and I desperately need money right now.
Well... fine. It's not exactly urgent for me. I'll come back later.
No, I found out the main thing. Well done! Consider you've already worked off part of the debt. Alright, I'm moving on with my business. Take care.
Well, that's quite a price tag. I understand everything, of course, but charging like that... Though, what am I gonna do, pickle them?! Alright, I'll come back later with artifacts.
Listen, Docent, got a million-dollar deal...
Yeah? I've got one too actually. Not a million, of course, less, but still a significant sum.
Uh... Well, you go first then.

I got a serious problem on my hands. Well, not me personally, but my younger brother, Genka. He's not here, not in the Zone, of course. Lives in the States, been there a couple years now. Anyway, he sent me a message by email the other day. Duty has satellite internet, if you didn't know. They charge a lot, but you can use it once a month. So my brother writes that he got himself into trouble... amateur hacker. I knew he was into cracking, but I thought it was just fooling around, youth stuff. So he hacked some corporate network, but left traces and got caught by the cops. They're already building a case and it looks like they might lock up Genka for ten years, maybe more.
I sympathize, of course, but how can I help?

With money. You see, a good lawyer there charges a hell of a lot for services, but it's usually worth it. Plus need to post bail so they'll release him on recognizance. I've shaken down all my stashes, Genka had some saved up too, but we're still short ten grand. Will you help, Marked One? I'll pay it all back in time or work it off. You often need something found, some code picked, or whatever. Don't know who else to turn to, everyone rushed to the center... Might as well go look for artifacts myself.
Wow! That's really big money. You're lucky, I have the needed sum. And even on me, in bearer checks. So be it, I'll help your idiot brother, but you now owe me big time, remember that.

Yeah, really got myself into it... I'm not exactly poor myself, but I can't pull together such a sum right away, but... Fuck it, money isn't happiness - there's a reason they say that, right? I'll try to collect ten grand. Won't hide it, I'll need something from you too, and pretty soon at that.
Thanks a million, Marked One! You saved me! Honestly, I'll do anything for you now, just say the word!
Thanks, Marked One! You'd really oblige me, I'll do anything for you if you can help.

You can do something right now. I need information about a certain duty post at laboratory X-12. Was such a room mentioned in the papers I brought you? Maybe something came up in a PDA or other sources?
Yeah, you won't get away with just "thanks", be sure of that. Alright, I'll try to handle all the business as soon as possible. Wait.

Sounds familiar... Wait a bit, I'll run a search on the laptop - I keep a summary list of useful gathered info there...\nMm... Right, got it! Now, let me find the right papers...\nAh, here it is. From the room with the freight elevator, go down the service stairs all the way, you'll get to a small hall from which a long corridor begins. On the right you'll see a door with a code lock - that's where you need to go. Interestingly, here in the office correspondence they even give the code, if it's still valid of course. Write it down: 513390.

Don't recall... Wait a bit, I'll run a search on the laptop - I keep a summary list of useful gathered info there...\nMm... no, nothing. Sorry, Marked One, search came up empty. I understand you've already been to X-12 and couldn't find this duty post, or simply don't know what to look for, right? Nodding? Then I'd advise you to go down to that lab again and check if there are any interesting papers lying around. You're good at that. Maybe you'll find some lead. Or stumble upon the right place by accident.
Excellent! Consider you've already worked off part of the debt. Alright, I'm moving on with my business. Take care.
Yeah... my investment isn't paying off yet, Docent. Well, seems like I have no choice - I'll have to drag myself to that creepy place again.

Docent is trying to collect money to get his brother out of trouble, who faces prison on the mainland. He's short 10 thousand dollars. If I help find this sum, Docent will be obligated to me "till death" and I can easily use his talents for any of my affairs. And I'll probably still need his talents. At least to figure out the duty post at laboratory X-12, where I need to get based on Sakharov's tip.
Got good news for your brother, genius.
Really? You collected the necessary sum and you're ready to just give it to me like that? I... I don't even know what... how...

Hard to believe that not everyone around is a mercenary bastard, right? Here are the checks, they're bearer bonds, a grand denomination each, exactly ten pieces. And remember - you now owe me big time.
Oh! It's you, Marked One! What brings you here?
Hey! Vergas, great to see you! And I have a question for you: what are you doing here?
What do you mean?! Heard they shut down the "Brain Scorcher"? Now you can walk all the way to the station!
To the station? Yeah, right. You better tell me, haven't you seen a stalker here - they call him Ghost? I was told he should be waiting for me somewhere around here.

I got here with him. He said that now, with the "Scorcher" turned off, we can try to get all the way to the Monolith. And this Monolith, it's a thing that can do everything! Or almost everything. You just need to wish really hard. So I convinced Ghost to take me along - I want to make a wish too.
You too? Alright, and where's this elusive Ghost now?
He got some important message, grabbed his legs and ran off. Told me to wait here for a few days. This was at night. At first I thought maybe he had a bad dream.

Well I'll be damned! Do you know why he came to Radar at all? And how did you end up with him, I don't get it? I'll never believe Ghost just showed up at Cordon to personally escort you to the Monolith.

He came to Cordon because he had business with me. Ghost wanted me to repair something for him - a decoder. He was in a real hurry. Probably that's why he decided to take me along, so I could work on it during the trip. I did what I could.\nAnyway, he was trying to get into a bunker that's nearby. Ghost went there, to the door into the underground. Turned out the code lock had no power. He brought the device back to me for refinishing, the contacts were poorly soldered, which made it cut out sometimes. I already fixed that. Only Ghost didn't wait for me to finish the job - he split at night. Well, I already told you about that.
Something tells me Ghost never planned to drag you to the station and only needed you for one purpose.
Well, what's done is done... Since I came, can't leave without him.
You say it had no power there... Give me that device, I'll go take a look. If you don't mind.

I don't mind. Here it is. Only Ghost already went there. Useless. He wasted good artifacts for it...\nIt's simple to use. Need to connect it, turn it on. Then try four-digit combinations. There are two columns of lights. If lights come on in the left column, that means that many digits are in the combination, but not in the right place. If lights come on in both left and right, that means that many digits are in the combination and they're in the right place. But to figure out which digits and in what place, you need to deduce logically... Though after eight tries it auto-resets... But as soon as all the lights come on, you need to turn it off and without removing the device, enter that combination. Got it? Without disconnecting the device, enter the combination. And only then disconnect it.
Sounds complicated...
What can you do. Consider it repaired right on my knee. Had to simplify some things. But it works, and that's the main thing.
Alright, I'll try. I'll take a walk over there. Maybe I'll get lucky...
Hello again! How's it going?
Slowly. And you're still here?
Waiting for Ghost. I think he'll be back in a few days. Or not.
Hello again! How's it going?
Still waiting for Ghost? He's sitting at Yantar and doesn't even think about you. So you should head back to Cordon with someone.
You're probably right, I should head home.
Listen, you really just walked here like that - in a sweater?
What's the big deal? You can't go anywhere without a special suit. You can see for yourself...
Well, what about here, now? Everyone I've seen doesn't get out of protective armor, suits and such.

I got old, sweating in a suit, and relieving yourself in it - what a pain in the ass. Put it in a box for now. Good suit, new, scientific, but don't need it now, when I do - I'll put it on. And you can breathe here without a mask it seems.
Hmm... Maybe you're right. Where'd you get the suit? Ghost hook you up?
Nah. I bought it from Sakharov. We stopped by Yantar on the way. There was some sick guy lying there. Ghost knew him. So we visited. Then came here. Why are you asking about the suit?
Nah. I bought it from Sakharov. We stopped by Yantar on the way. Why are you asking about the suit?
Just thought - how are you with repairs? Would you work? And maybe I can get some supplies from you, medicine, say? I'd pay...

My hands know their business, but I don't have tools or materials. So sorry... I have medicine. I knew where I was going, brought extra with me, my health, you understand - need to look ahead and take more medicine. I'll think about whether it's worth sharing...

I see. Your health is more valuable than others', that's understandable. \nBut I'm actually surprised why you left home at your age? Others are one thing, but you're not young to go running after the boys at the first call... You could've sat by the stove at Cordon and known no troubles. And here with that same suit it's nothing but hassle - put it on, take it off, put it on again. At your ag... a-hem. Well, you get it.
I sit and think myself... why did I suddenly do this. Then I learned I wasn't the only one, many rushed north. Turns out they turned off the "Scorcher".
Well they turned it off and turned it off, what's it to you? Is Ghost your brother or relative that you'd run after him?

I don't know... I don't understand myself. Really, after some emission it was like a call in my head, like someone called... And for a moment it seemed to me it was so good there, that I had to see it. And then I heard that call in my head more than once. Probably senile, ringing in my ears from pressure, so I imagine things. And now where do I go? Can't go there, and can't crawl back alone. I'll wait for Ghost.
Alright, I get it. Well, take care... Tell Ghost I stopped by if he comes back.
You mentioned trading for vodka?

Huh? Me? When?
Ah! Yeah. Right. You see, I'm feeling down, waiting and waiting... And I had a drink and... There.
I seem to stock up fully when I leave Mikhalych's, but no - doesn't even last two days... If you got some - come on, let's trade.
I'll give two cans for a bottle. Or artifacts, these electric ones. They show up here often. For three bottles I'll give first level, for seven second level, well for fifteen - I'll give you a capsule... There.
You'll drink yourself to death at this rate...
Nah, doesn't work, damn thing... Just dulls me a bit. Like I forget myself - and my hands don't shake, and there's no chill in my heart like usual. THEY are nearby... So? Got any on you?
Got a bottle here, trading for cans.
Three bottles, I'll take an artifact.
Got seven bottles, give me an artifact.
Here's vodka, 15 pieces, give me the capsule.
Hmm, got some, but need it myself, maybe later.
Ah! There she is, my darling... For the cans, not expired it seems... Need more - just ask...
Yeah-yeah, I got a simple little artifact. "Sparkler" here...
Oh! Little bottles... And here's a good artifact, "Flash"... Wanted to keep it for myself - ah well...
Wow! That'll last a long time now. Here's the capsule, good thing you're taking it, it radiates like hell...
I'll stock up on more bottles, then come back.
I got this strange thing, looks like a capsule, take a look.

Let me see, let me see... What the hell are you thinking?! Finally decided to finish off Sidorovich. Dragging all kinds of crap here. This thing reeks of radiation from a mile away. Get lost with your junk.
I'm gone, I'm gone... got all worked up.
I got this strange thing, looks like a capsule, take a look.
Let me see, let me see... Marked One, this might be a capsule. But I'm seeing this thing for the first time and won't stick it in my machine. What could come out of it?
What a mess, and where do I go with it now...
Professor, I managed to get an unusual capsule.

Show me... Well yes, well yes. Second-class shell. You see, Marked One, opening such a capsule in field conditions is currently not possible - the energy costs of this process are too high. This carries significant risks for our camp's safety. You understand we work in complete autonomy and have no additional energy sources besides basic diesel generators.

Show me... Well yes, well yes. Second-class shell. You see, Marked One, opening such a capsule in field conditions is quite energy-intensive. Fortunately, just yesterday we received a new generator, which though formally listed as backup, can quite well be used... slightly not as intended.
So there's really nothing that can be done?
Tell me straight: will you undertake to open this capsule?

I think you'd hardly be satisfied with sending this sample to our institute outside the Zone, would you? On the other hand, we're expecting soon approval of a request to deliver a backup generator here, which could be used, among other things, for some... specific needs.
If you entrust us with such a rare specimen, then absolutely.
In short, all that's left is to wait. Got it. I'll come back later then.
Professor, I want to open this capsule. Second-class shell - I think that's what you called it.

Yes-yes! Happy to help you. Moreover, honestly speaking, I'm interested myself... out of pure scientific curiosity, of course. Not every day we get to deal with such rare specimens. Only you know, Marked One, we have strict accounting for everything, including energy consumption. Have to dance around auditors, explaining above-normal consumption, and some people require... a special approach. Well, you understand. And delivering fuel for generators here is quite expensive. So please help us too. I think a third-level artifact in good condition is fair payment for our costs.
You know, my dear fellow, the installation is busy for now, let's try a bit later.
Well... as you say. Will this one do?
Yeah, professor, unfortunately I don't have such a thing.
Of course! Please, come back tomorrow, same time. I think everything will be ready by then.
Very unfortunate... We can't afford charity for now.
Well, how did it go? What came out of that capsule?
Need to wait a bit more, the coating is quite resistant. Come back later.
Managed to open it, here's your artifact. These formations are called "Pendulums". Very, very rare specimen. Perhaps you'll donate it to science?
Alright, I'll check back...
Stepanych, I wanted to ask you something...
Ask away, don't be shy. And sit down, hunchback drink.
You've been walking the forests for a long time, I see you have a modern gun. Doesn't such an old hunter have a good proven rifle? One with good accuracy.
The boys gave me this shooter, and threw in a whole crate of shot for it. There's such a rifle, but who to hunt with it? And cartridges for it became expensive. So it hangs on the wall at home.
What kind of rifle?
Good rifle. Still my father's, "Mosinka", with optics.
Yeah, good barrel... So maybe you'll give it up, why should it gather house dust for nothing. A good barrel should serve, not hang on the wall. How about it?
That's true, you speak right. Only this... I can't decide right away what to take from you for it.
Maybe bring some artifact or do what's needed. You tell me, old man.

Here's such an adventure. One old customer of mine asked me to make him a good cloak. I quickly got the hides for it, but on the way back a pack of blind dogs attacked me. They're such a pain. So I climbed on a rock. Threw off my backpack, and it landed in "Witch's Jelly". The hides got ruined. Now I'm embarrassed before that man. So bring me three finished hides, two will go for the cloak, and I'll keep one as spare. Then we'll discuss this matter.
Three hides?! Alright, Stepanych, you'll have your hides.
Hides, son, that's just for the rifle.
What do I need this stick without a sight for?
That's true. Only the sight is quite rare, can't get it anymore, they don't make them anymore.
I see, old man. What kind of sight do you want?
I, an old man, don't need much. A good artifact, and you'll have the sight. I'll even throw in some cartridges, since I'm giving away the rifle, I don't need them anymore.
Deal, I'll bring both hides and an artifact. Just don't forget about the rifle.
I won't forget about that. You go get the hides and artifact, and I'll go home, maybe I'll be back tomorrow.
I'll try not to take long. Take care, Stepanych.
No, old man, you're asking too much, keep the rifle yourself.
Stepanych, remind me what I promised you for the "Mosinka" with sight.
Three finished hides, and a good artifact.
I brought both hides and artifact, everything as agreed. Show me the rifle.
Well you young ones are always rushing and rushing. Take it, son, the "Mosinka" and sight, and for respecting an old man, here's some cartridges too. I don't need them now.
And for that - special thanks. Stay healthy, Stepanych.
Wait, Stepanych.
Stepanych promised a Mosin rifle with scope for three finished hides and a third-level artifact
Need a rare spare part.
What's got into you?
I need... a giant's paw, urgently.
I need... a controller hand, urgently.
I need... a poltergeist eye, urgently.

Look at you getting all worked up! Urgently! You know how hard it is to take down such a creature?! Brave guys are one or two, the rest already - took to their heels. On the mainland you can get serious money for such a "spare part".
Well... If we're talking money, then how much?
