Let's say... If you figure it out, in general... Alright! Just for you and just today! Attraction of unprecedented generosity: a grand! Can you handle it?
A thousand green for a piece of stinking meat?! You didn't mix anything up?!
No, dear. A check for a grand from you. No haggling. No? Then go shoot some monsters, I'll trade with great pleasure. So, what is it?
You... hold onto it for now, maybe I'll come back soon with the needed sum.
I'll hold it. But not long! I got a couple enthusiasts for this business, just don't feel like walking anywhere right now...
Alright, here's the check.
Yeah, I undersold, however. But a man said - a man did! Take this, not the freshest of course, but still quite in condition.
Rotten piece for a grand in green! Virtue, your...
What are you dissatisfied with?! I only have fresh stuff for trade.

A scientist from Swamp asked me to install a device in Limansk in exchange for running my fingerprints through the database on the mainland. Need to place it as high as possible (when installed in the right place the device will signal successful activation), data will be received after an emission. Processing and analysis will also take time. About three to four days total
Listen, maybe I can help with something?

Ivan Sergeich sometimes needs "Fruit Punch" anomaly substance for experiments. Bring a couple jars, I'll throw in something useful - food and medicine. Just don't haul it by the bucket. Won't take more than two jars at a time. Some people got into the habit...
Alright, give me the jars, if I come across it - I'll fill them.
I can't right now, a bit later. Okay?
Here, careful, it's glass...
I'll try not to break your glassware.
Ivantsov asks to bring at least eleven hard drives from computers from the laboratory under Borov's base in Dark Valley
Why were you looking for me? Or just missed me?
A little birdie told me you're planning to go to the old laboratory that's at Borov's former base, looking for traces of your Strelok. Right?
People these days... Barely discussed it and the whole area already knows.\nSuppose I am, what's it to you?
We're interested in information from the computers that should have been left there.
Bring you computers? And who is this "we"?

Who - you don't need to know. Don't need to drag the computers themselves, extract the hard drives from them, that's where all the information is stored. And they don't weigh much - maximum half a kilo. Uh... You know what a hard drive is? It's a thing like this:
I think I've seen them before. Anything else?

Good. I know there are many computers there and the information on them is partially duplicated. Smart people here figured that eleven drives of any kind would be enough to collect the entire data array. Remember? Eleven - no less. Or should I write it down for you?
Very funny... And your jokes are cop-like. You wouldn't happen to be one of the "former", would you?
Cop or not cop, what's the difference to you, let's get to business. I'll tell our guys in the Valley not to interfere with you. This is for the road and... try to come back.

I see everyone's become caring. I know your care. You're all clean, and you, Marked One, run to the ass-end of the world, find, bring or kill finally... And we'll wait here. You come back - good, don't - well, fuck you. So I'll tell you the same - if it works out, I'll bring it, if not, then not.
Getting worked up... Tone down your arrogance. Or you might not leave this basement. That's all, you're free.
I brought the drives from the underground. As agreed, count them.
What a sight you are, Marked One... Yeah, looks like they're in the right quantity. Well done.
Maybe you'll give me a medal too? Take them and I'm gone.
A medal... I'll think about it. I'll give the drives to Docent, let him dig around. I'll signal if anything interesting comes up.
Study away, I'm going to rest.
Ivantsov asks to find one Pavel Zubr at Army Warehouses. Need to try to learn about an old door in the tunnel at Freedom's base
You're fast. Found something in those computer memories?

Found it, found a lot. Can't digest it all at once. There'll be another job for you...\nI need you to go to these freethinkers' base and find this Pavel Zubr guy. He's their entertainer - invented "Duty roulette" for the reckless and gullible.
There is such a guy, had to deal with him. And what - ask him, find out or..?
And what - ask him, find out or..?
Find others, I've had enough of laboratories.

No "or" anything... I'm interested in the coded door in the collapsed tunnel. There's information that the Freedom brotherhood is really worried about what's behind those doors. And this joker is responsible for guarding it. So you go to him and try - quietly there! - to find out: what kind of door, where it leads and... in general. The more you learn, the sooner we'll get answers to some questions that will also interest you, I think.

Again "we"?! And why did you decide this would interest me. Maybe I already don't give a damn about everyone and everything. Did such a thought ever occur to you? Maybe I've long been on my own, Marked One - the Marked. And what difference does it make - whether they kill me here or there.
But I heard the complete opposite here, that you decided to save humanity. So maybe this is exactly the place you need to go?
Just don't tell me you suddenly decided to help me for this reason.

Fine, let's approach this from another angle. On those drives you brought from the underground in the Valley, there's information about other underground laboratories, their interconnections, emergency exits to the surface and so on. It turns out there's a possibility to enter them from the surface, bypassing the currently active sections of the Zone. And you won't have to wander through Radar again.
Why do I need this? There is and there is. Why are you all clinging to me? First Sidorovich, then Barkeep, Sakharov, now you.
And you still haven't figured it out yourself? I, honestly, haven't fully figured you out either. But I know one thing for sure, that you're exactly the one the Zone will let into its very core.
We're having a long conversation. I better go to the warehouses.
Listen, Pavlo! What's that armored door in the tunnel?
What's it to you? Door is door... Less you know - better you sleep.
I've seen many such doors already. So I'm curious. Don't you know where it leads?
Maybe I know, maybe I don't. You... would... bring a couple bottles to keep the conversation going. That way, it might come back faster - what, why and where.
Just a couple bottles, no problem. Wait.
I'm about the door?
What did we agree on there?
This sweet thing here - take it.

Since you treated me right, I'll tell you something. That door leads somewhere into the catacombs. Into the underground... Our guys never opened it - Lukash forbade it. They say there's shitloads of monsters in there and other nasty stuff! We take turns standing guard here, making sure no evil shit crawls out of there. And from time to time something bangs and knocks from inside... And howls! Sometimes it gives you the creeps... Especially at night. If it was up to me, I'd blow this whole fucking tunnel remnant to hell so you couldn't even see this door!
So why don't you blow it up then, what's the big deal.
It's not that simple, pal.
And Lukash, what about him? Does he know something? Why did he forbid opening it? Maybe I should ask him?

I heard bits and pieces that this door was blocked by the military back in the day. But some people at the top still have some interest here. Recently their representative was pretty direct about it: we're only tolerated here as guards of this very passage. That's how things are... So forget about it. And better not bother Lukash with questions about why and what for. Those who doubted the correctness of his orders aren't doubting anything anymore, their bones are lying all over the Zone, white and clean...
What kind of representative, where can I find him? Maybe he knows something?
I won't tell you that. And I only overheard that conversation by accident from my guard post, just when I had to take a piss.
Does this representative come here often?

I don't know, I've only seen him a couple times and from a distance at that. The brass rarely comes here. But this time we had... an incident. A couple-three weeks ago, the lights on the code lock panel suddenly started blinking. I reported it to Lukash, he got real worked up, chewed me out with profanity, though I never understood what for. And the next day, that's when they had this conversation here, in the tunnel. Something's not clean here, oh something's not clean.
A couple-three weeks ago... interesting. Alright, I'll go.
So maybe one for the road... little roulette?
Is that some kind of joke?
I'm here about those doors at the warehouses.
So you're ready, or is it "find someone else" again?

I had a chat with that schemer. He didn't tell me anything special. Says the door leads to some underground area, that sometimes monsters break out from there. The Freedomers guard it on Lukash's orders, but he himself doesn't know why. Naturally, I didn't bother Lukash with such... trifles. Otherwise we wouldn't be talking right now.
All of this is already known to me. Or are you holding something back?

What would be the point? Where this door leads, only Lukash might know, and even then, I'm not sure. Zubr said the Freedomers never went down there. Though recently they had a small incident, the code lock showed "signs of life". Lukash, as Pavlo says, got very agitated.
So you say they never went down this one... But they went to the underground at Radar for some reason...
You know about that too?

I know about it, but I can't get an answer. According to my information, the door at the warehouses was non-functional, just like the one at Radar. But after someone, maybe even you, visited one of the Radar laboratories, the code lock activated.
That's how it turned out. Maybe I activated something there, maybe someone else did.
No desire to check where this door leads?
If it's the place I'm thinking of, then I'll try, let's see what happens. If, of course, the Freedomers in that tunnel don't waste me.
Try to make sure they don't waste you. The code for that door should be 86573, if Docent didn't mess up. And this is for the road.
See ya... cop. Maybe I'll be back.
Hey there, Pavlo! Need to talk.
We can always talk, especially with some good snacks, we could have a real nice sit-down.
That's for later. This is serious business... I want to try to crack open that damn door.
You gone crazy?! Making fireworks here. Lukash and his goons will turn us into sieves and feed the minced meat to the dogs.
I'll do it quietly. I have the code for this door.
Code... from where?! Who gave it? You sure?
Sure or not sure - we'll find out when we try. And who gave it - better you don't know.
Marked One, you understand what'll happen to you and me if they catch us.
So think of something so they don't catch us. Pavlo, I really need this, try to help.
Well, alright. I have one idea... We'll throw a little party. Everyone will come running for free drinks and snacks, guards included. Only... it'll cost something.
I'm used to that by now. Tell me, how much and what?

Quick on the uptake. I need to figure out who can drink how much, to make sure. Short version, I think... ten bottles of vodka should be enough for us, well, and the same amount of canned food. If needed, we'll roll a joint to round things out. And for me, for being clever, an artifact, level three. Like winnings from roulette, and it'll give us an excuse for the party too.
You'll get your reward for being clever, and snacks with drinks.
Hey Pavlo, how's the game, any winnings?
You came here to grin like an idiot or... on business.
On business, on business. I gathered everything as we agreed.
And the artifact?
You'll get your artifact when you fulfill your part of the deal.
Don't trust me... Well, that's right. I think by night the guys will be pretty wasted, so come around, nobody will bother you.
Don't trust me... Well, that's right. I think if we start drinking in the evening, by night the guys will be pretty wasted, so come around, nobody will bother you.
By night... well that's clear.
How are the guys, ready?
Good party turned out, soulful. Now they'll start howling songs, you'll be able to hear it at Radar. You brought the artifact?
Will this one work?
I had one, just a sec.
Not really great, but as they say - when there's no fish... So are you really going to crawl in there?
Did you doubt it? I've got issues... with my head, everyone knows that.
You don't seem too happy to see me.
Why would you say that, quite the opposite. How did it go?
The code worked, found myself in the Radar lab. I won't describe the lab's charms.
That's good. Means the data from the disks can be trusted.
And if I hadn't returned, how would you have resolved your doubts?
Believe me, Marked One, with you or without you, we would have solved this task.
Sounds familiar... The price of a stalker's hide is less than the price of a dog's tail.

We'll still talk about your price. What else interests me though. When Voronin sent you to waste those guys at Yantar, didn't he say why the hell... they went so far that they got caught under the emission?
Sakharov explained that at certain times the emitter's effect is safe for passing through the factory territory. Maybe they mistimed it? Or...
Exactly, or... So, Sakharov. Good, we'll think about it. You're free for now, if I need you, I'll let you know. Take some ammo, it'll come in handy.
And that's it? Hmm...
Hey there, science! Got your message and rushed over as soon as I could. Lay it on me, what's the news?

Haven't even caught your breath properly yet, and you're already ready to get down to business - I respect that. Well then, I won't beat around the bush either. Remember our last conversation? You asked whether I know how to distinguish a "natural" artifact, born by the Zone, from an artificial one, "cooked", to use stalker terminology.

Yeah, there was something like that. Though it's not entirely clear to me what the hell's the point of distinguishing them at all. Or, to use scientific terminology, what's the practical benefit of such knowledge?

Wise guy! What if I tell you that "natural" artifacts have, let's call it, strong affinity to the anomalies that spawned them, and can store residual traces of electromagnetic disturbances caused by...
Hold on, stop! You scientists always try to make our stalker brothers feel like insects. Ever try speaking simpler?

Oh, well, alright. An anomaly, when "birthing" an artifact, leaves its trace on it, characteristic specifically to that type of anomaly. This trace, though it fades gradually, can nevertheless persist for quite a long time if the object remains at rest. Even if the parent anomaly disappeared after an emission, collapsed from external interference, or simply faded over time, its trace on the artifact can continue to emit intensively across a fairly wide dia... uh, sorry. Generally, a situation where the anomaly is gone but its trace remains is more the norm than the exception. How are you following my train of thought so far, Marked One?
I'm following, I'm following. And what does this have to do with distinguishing "natural" artifacts from "unnatural" ones? You're saying that this trace is absent on "cooked" artifacts, right?

You've grasped the very essence, exactly! Though of course, my scientific conscience doesn't allow me to make such a categorical conclusion. I'd choose a more careful formulation - the trace is either absent, or has a different nature and cannot be detected by current means. Why is this? I don't even have a working hypothesis yet, but the fact remains.
Wait, wait. Detected by means, you said...

Aha, now we've come to the main point. To the practical benefit, as you put it. You're surely aware of the existence of portable anomaly detectors. These devices are manufactured on the mainland, in classified research institutes, though simple contraptions have even been mastered by local craftsmen. Ivan Sergeyevich managed to secure several of the most advanced models currently available for our needs, and I, according to the latest data obtained, including what you brought, reconfigured one of these devices so it reacts not to anomalies, but to the traces left by them.
So it turns out... turns out you managed to create an artifact detector, right? And it works?

Well, create is putting it too strongly. I merely, I repeat, reconfigured an existing model. But essentially - correct. This is the first experimental prototype of an artifact detector. "Natural" artifacts, don't forget. And whether it works - that's what I want to ask you to determine through field testing.
So you want to give me this device, like, for field trials? And what should I do with it? How does it even work?

Listen and remember. The device is charged and fully ready for operation. Due to the frequency scanning changes, the battery drains like crazy, but it should last 5 days guaranteed. The detector should be placed as far as possible from those stalker belts of yours - you carry artifacts on them under voltage, and that creates strong interference on the working frequencies. A backpack, for obvious reasons, also won't work. The ideal option is a separate spacious pocket on tactical gear, roughly at shoulder level. Uh... but you don't have one like that. That's a problem. Listen, I know the military can trade excellent tactical gear with lots of compartments and pockets. I heard that on the Cordon there's a certain Major Kuznetsov on duty, he supposedly gets along with stalkers. Maybe you could try to make a deal with them, eh? I really wouldn't want to look for another executor, since we've already worked together and my trust in you is complete.

Listen and remember. The device is charged and fully ready for operation. Due to the frequency scanning changes, the battery drains like crazy, but it should last 5 days guaranteed. The detector should be placed as far as possible from those stalker belts of yours - you carry artifacts on them under voltage, and that creates strong interference on the working frequencies. A backpack, for obvious reasons, also won't work. The ideal option is a separate spacious pocket on tactical gear, roughly at shoulder level. Like this one of yours - perfect! And then everything's simple. You head out on a hunt... or whatever you call an expedition for artifacts, and listen carefully for whether the device starts making audio signals.
You're serious about the pockets right now? Mhm... I can see in your eyes that you're serious. Alright, I'll meet you halfway. You've really intrigued me. Wait here, I'll be quick.
Damn it! So much hassle over some pocket. No, Gluzov, sorry, but I don't have time for such nonsense. No offense.

And if it starts, then there's an artifact nearby? So it'll beep non-stop, since I constantly carry artifacts with me. Well, suppose I go empty-handed. But what if I stop at a stalker camp for the night and someone there has an artifact in their backpack? What if I visit Sidorovich? He probably has a whole warehouse for them... No, this is some kind of bullshit.

Marked One, do you really think I would suggest you test the device under such conditions? If you were listening carefully, you surely noticed my words about how the trace on an artifact can persist for a long time as long as the object is at rest. So, by "at rest" I didn't mean that the artifact lies motionless on the ground, but that its pristine energy balance isn't disturbed by external interference. To make it clearer: say you found a jellyfish, picked it up, and you get zapped by something on the noggin, like electricity. Sound familiar, right? This is the external manifestation of a disrupted energy circuit. You could say, a rupture in the shell. Along with the energy discharge, the trace fades too. Curiously, by the way, such a reaction is caused specifically by interaction with the human body. Zone spawn, anomalies, or, say, inanimate physical objects don't cause a similar effect when in contact with artifacts. There's no such effect with artificially obtained artifacts either, since they're initially energetically neutral, so humans can touch them without fear of getting shocked.
Oh, wow! So the detector will only beep on "natural" artifacts that haven't been touched by humans yet? That's a completely different story! And how far can it detect an artifact?

Approximately within a 30-meter radius. The closer to the detected object, the more intense the audio signal will be. For the completeness of the experiment, I want you to find with my device 3 level-1 artifacts, 2 level-2 artifacts, and also any artifact capsule, and bring these finds to me. Yes, and don't you dare use them, the artifacts must be in perfect condition. Agree, not the most difficult task, right? Just walk around the Zone, do your business, just don't forget to listen to the detector.

Well, on paper it's certainly not difficult, and your interest in all this is clear to me. If things are as you describe, then the inventor of such a device needn't worry about his future career. Honor, respect and all that. But what do I get? After all, I'm the one who'll have to risk my life again. Those same capsules don't just lie around on the road, you have to venture deep into the Zone for them.

A fair question. We have some off-budget funds for various occasions. I think I can convince Ivan Sergeyevich to allocate a certain sum for your reward. I suspect dollars are useless to you in the Zone, right? But with this money we can order some unique weapon for you through Demian from the mainland, he has the right connections. Will that work?
Yeah, money doesn't particularly interest me, but a good gun could come in very handy. We've sorted that out. If that's everything, then I'm ready to shake on it.

There's one more little thing... You see, Marked One, the thing is that in a week there'll be a very prestigious scientific conference in Kiev. It took Ivan Sergeyevich great effort to convince the leadership to send me there from our institute. As an advance, so to speak. I'll have to give a presentation there on my... our research with you. A presentation of the first experimental artifact detector is also planned... well, you understand.

Ah, that's what it is. So you've already decided everything in advance, planned it all out, just one tiny detail left - convince some sucker stalker to quickly, in a week, finish all the necessary tests, right?

Honestly, I need to manage it in 5 days max. I still need to double-check all the data and prepare... Uh... I mean I want to say that I don't consider you a sucker at all and I'm very grateful for everything you've already done. But understand - such a chance comes once in a lifetime. I just couldn't pass it up, but I was afraid to tell you everything straight away. I thought, what if you, learning about such urgency, wouldn't even listen to me further. And I really have no one else to turn to... Please, Marked One, help me one last time.

Well, alright. I'll see it through to the end since I'm already mixed up in all this. Just make sure, Gluzov, that your presentation definitely mentions the name of your main consultant - mine. Just kidding. I don't even remember my name anyway...

In five days?! Are you out of your mind, guy? Sometimes you wander the Zone all day and don't find a single artifact, and you need 6 pieces, including a capsule. No way, forget it! Figure it out yourself, if you're so smart... going to a conference, look at that.

Here, thank you! You can't even imagine how much this means to me! Here, take the detector. I'll be eagerly awaiting your return. By the way, I'm aware of your memory problems, people told me... I have one idea where they might be able to help you, but we'll talk about that later, okay?
Alright. I'm already used to the fact that nobody in the Zone will even tell you the time for free. See you, Gluzov.

Gluzov asked me to conduct field tests of an artifact detector for him. Using the device provided, I need to find 3 level-1 artifacts, 2 level-2 artifacts, and any capsule, then deliver all this to the graduate student. Using the finds is forbidden, they must be in perfect condition. Considering that the customer will soon have to leave the Zone, no more than 5 days is allotted for everything.
Here, got new tactical gear from the military. Now we're good?

Excellent, perfect! Shall we continue the briefing? As I already said, the detector is charged and fully ready for operation. The battery is guaranteed to last at least 5 days. You put the device in this upper pocket of the tactical gear, and then everything's simple. You head out on a hunt... or whatever you call an expedition for artifacts, and listen carefully for whether the device starts making audio signals.
Hey, Gluzov! News - not news, but I want to tell you something.
Yes? Did something happen?
Ha, you went pale! Relax, science, the job's done.
No, just nothing to cheer about yet. But I decided to drop by since I happened to be nearby. Just to confirm that I remember everything, the deal stands.
You could say that. I changed my mind about doing this job, I've got troubles up to my eyeballs, sorry. I'm returning your device. I hope you have enough time to hire someone else for this work.
Done? Aw, well done! Give me the detector quickly, and put the artifacts right here.
I understand. Please hurry, there's not much time left.
I didn't expect this from you, Marked One... I don't even know what to say. What am I supposed to do now?! Alright, go, I need to collect my thoughts.
Why are you getting all worked up? Here, everything's accounted for...
Uh... seems like everything was in the backpack, did I lay it out?! Don't go anywhere, I'll be right back!
So-so... what do we have in the device's memory? Aha... that's correct... yes, all artifacts are normal. Amazing...
Hey, Gluzov, are you even here? What are you muttering under your breath?
What? Oh... I just had to make sure right away... anyway, you did excellently, Marked One! I knew I could count on you. The detector worked properly, were there any problems?

There's always plenty of problems! From hordes of beasts wanting to dine on me, to chafed blisters - they slipped me crappy boots again... Hmm, but the detector was in perfect order, everything according to instructions. Alright, now let's move on to your promises, if you don't mind.
Of course, of course! Look what they brought for you - looks impressive, right? I'm no expert in these matters, but Demian was just clicking his tongue enviously when they delivered your package.
Yea-ah... fine piece of equipment, no question. You also mentioned that you know where they might help me restore my memory.

Yea-ah... fine piece of equipment, no question. But... Let's better give this gun to Demian as a gift, and get me something from your scientific department, something practical. And you also mentioned that you know where they might help me restore my memory.

Yea-ah... fine piece of equipment, no question. But... To be honest, I was hoping you'd leave me this detector of yours. It's a very useful thing in the stalker trade.\nAnd also, let me remind you, you mentioned that you know where they might help me restore my memory.

Rather - I suppose. If everything goes smoothly at the conference, and I manage to make the right impression on the right people, I think we can arrange... a special service for you. Later, when there's news, I'll find a way to send you word. I can only say in advance that it might cost big money. So in your place I'd worry ahead of time about preparing for serious financial expenses.

I thought you'd like this gun... Give it back then. And what should I offer you instead? I think I know! A friend recently shared with me a method of obtaining a most curious, extremely rare artifact "Jumper". Enhanced athletic abilities of the wearer, as easily understood from the name, are only one manifestation of its properties. Rumor has it that with its help you can also overcome complex anomalies like "Labyrinth". I haven't checked it myself, of course, but I think you'd find it interesting.\nAs for help with memory restoration... If everything goes smoothly at the conference, and I manage to make the right impression on the right people, I think we can arrange... a special service for you. Later, when there's news, I'll find a way to send you word. I can only say in advance that it might cost big money. So in your place I'd worry ahead of time about preparing for serious financial expenses.

I thought you'd like this gun... Give it back then. And the detector... Sorry, but I can't leave it with you. The thing is, it will be part of my presentation at the conference. Material evidence, if you will. But, you know... I could send you not just the same device in about a week, but a new, improved model. I was working on this prototype in parallel, so it's almost ready. They'll deliver it to Pakhom's warehouse, and he'll let you know. You could test it, and then scribble a review, sending it to me through the same Pakhom. Does such an option work?\nAs for help with memory restoration... If everything goes smoothly at the conference, and I manage to make the right impression on the right people, I think we can arrange... a special service for you. Later, when there's news, I'll find a way to send you word. I can only say in advance that it might cost big money. So in your place I'd worry ahead of time about preparing for serious financial expenses.
That's some help - you still have to pay through the nose for it! I'll think about whether I even need such a "service". But thanks anyway for participating.

That's some help - you still have to pay through the nose for it! I'll think about whether I even need such a "service". But thanks anyway for participating. And for the recipe too. Definitely useful.

That's some help - you still have to pay through the nose for it! I'll think about whether I even need such a "service". But thanks anyway for participating. And I like your offer about the improved detector. We'll settle on that.

Thank you for everything! What would I do without you... Looks like it's time to say goodbye, a helicopter should arrive soon, and I still need to pack my things. I don't think I'll return to the Zone. At least not in the foreseeable future. Well, stay healthy, Marked One! And wait for word.
You stay well too, Gluzov. Good luck at the conference!
Rushed over at your call, Pakhom, about the package from Gluzov. I hope this is what I think it is?
How should I know what you're thinking? I was told to give you this device and explain how to use it.
Excellent! I've been waiting for it for a long time. I was starting to doubt whether Gluzov forgot about me...
As you can see, the guy keeps his word. So, wait, now I'll find the accompanying letter and read the instructions...
So, maybe just give me the letter, and I'll figure it out myself?
It's not addressed to you personally. There's something written here for me, and Ivan Sergeyevich, and Demian, and other guys. Besides, you and I need to clarify one more point afterward.
Alright, as you say. Then read it.

The "EDA - M2" detector uses the so-called "similarity principle" in its operation, which consists of comparing the structure of the scanned object with available samples. For this, a special substance is used, manufactured to order at a defense enterprise near Kiev, and consisting of microscopic particles of anomalous formations brought from the Zone. This substance is placed in a replaceable cartridge, from which it enters... Well, such details are unlikely to interest you. The main thing you should understand is that the substance in these cartridges is consumed during detector activation, and when it runs out, the device will stop working. You can track how full the cartridge is using this scale. Let's continue.\nUnlike the previous model, this device is equipped with a screen that displays all detected artifacts, which significantly simplifies their search. Each class of artifacts has its own color marker. Moreover, the detector now reacts not only to natural artifacts, but also to those of artificial origin, and not lying in containers, backpacks and other items that shield them from scanning. To start the detector's active mode, you should take it in your hands and press the "ON" button. For passive mode operation, it's enough to place the device in a tactical gear pocket. In this case, like the first model, the device will start making an audio signal, indicating the detection of an artifact nearby.
Oh, how! Well, everything seems clear. And that point you wanted to clarify afterward concerns how to revive a detector that's run out of that substance, am I right?

Smart pioneer. As you've already understood, replacement cartridges for this detector, or rather, the substance in them - costs extremely expensive. We can't afford to spend funds on this, but... There are always options. For example, process a payment under a different category. This requires strong justification, but you seem to already know what can interest us. I think in exchange for the cartridge replacement service, a part from some rare mutant would work. I'll be more specific when you actually come with this problem. Questions?
Bloodsuckers have no questions. Just kidding. Got it, no... No?
I'd like to replace the cartridge in the artifact detector.
I knew you'd show up about this soon, so I ordered one in advance. As I warned, for this service I'll ask you to get a part from a rare mutant. Right now our scientific brotherhood needs:
I have such a part, take it.
Your scientific brotherhood will have to wait while I go hunting.
Yeah, just what we need. Put the detector here.
How long do I have to wait?
It'll be ready in about ten minutes. Just don't stomp around here, I need to concentrate. The work isn't complicated, but it's meticulous.
Alright, I'll take a walk for now.
How's it going with the detector, did you replace the cartridge?
Yes, here you go. Come again.
What an impatient person. I said - in ten minutes. And how much time has passed, can you count?
Thank you. Definitely.
Greetings. I have a question. I know that you military guys are supposed to have tons of spare components for gear and equipment. I'm interested in armor plates. Can we make a deal?
Hmm... What do you need them for, soldier? They're hardly likely to fit your suit. And I'm not sure they haven't been completely cleaned out from the warehouse already.

It's not for me. There's this skilled guy who does equipment repairs for stalkers. He has a big order burning from Duty. Says he's short of plates to fix three more suits, minimum. So is there still an option to get them?

An order from Duty? I've heard of them. They're listed among our "sympathizers". Here's the deal. I won't promise you plates, but I'll give the order to bring three used body armor sets here in an hour. I'll give them for 5 bottles each. Your master can then pick off what he needs from them. But there's one condition.\nFurther north from our post, on a hill, wild boars have made themselves at home. This neighborhood extremely unnerves my boys. Deal with the mutant problem, and you'll get your armor. Do you have a stalker PDA? Let me mark the lair on the map. So, deal?

An order from Duty? I've heard of them. They're listed among our "sympathizers". Here's the deal. I won't promise you plates, but I'll give the order to bring three used body armor sets here in an hour. I'll give them for 5 bottles each. Your master can then pick off what he needs from them. But there's one condition.\nTo the south of this place, on a hill and in the lowland adjacent to the perimeter fence, wild boars have made themselves at home. This neighborhood extremely unnerves me. Deal with the mutant problem, and you'll get your armor. Do you have a stalker PDA? Let me mark the lair on the map. So, deal?
Come back in an hour, but first deal with the boars. Have five bottles of vodka for each armor set. Fine, this arrangement works for me.
How about those body armor sets? Have they been delivered?
Yeah, I have them. Did you do what I asked?
You came too early. Come back later.
The boar lair is cleared out. You can go check for yourself.
I'm just about to do that. First I wanted to make sure everything's ready for the "deal of the century".
Alright. What should I do with myself in the meantime?!

I'll take your word for it anyway. No stomping, no grunting, no other commotion from that direction, so everything's in order.\nLet's get down to business now. Everything as agreed: 5 bottles for one armor set. You taking them?
Here's the thing... Basically, I only need one armor set. A thousand apologies. Here's the vodka.
It turned out that I only need two armor sets. Don't be mad. I'm putting down half a case of the clear stuff, according to the price list.
Yes, I'm taking all three. Here's your "firewater".
Damn, totally forgot about the vodka. I'll be right back.
As you wish, it's your business. Keep in mind, I'm not going to haul them back and forth. Here's your armor set. We're done with this.
As you wish, it's your business. Keep in mind, I'm not going to haul them back and forth. Here are your armor sets. We're done with this.
Excellent. Take your body armor sets.
